Reviews.Content: This is my first camera nad it works great!  For the price and ease of use, it is great! The included software is good and powerful and very easy to use.  I have connected this both wired and wirelessly and it works great.  THe camera works good and the angle and IR night vision works good as well.  I only wish they could be used for an outdoor camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Ron
Reviews.Content: I was somewhat put off this camera from the reviews stating how hard it was to install.  I had it up and running in no time.  I have it outside under my eave/overhang out of the weather and it works perfectly.  The infrared I was really pleasantly surprised the distance you could see in the dark.  I can view the camera from my touchpad at work and use the Vitamin D program (free) to record anyone crossing a line in my yard.  Works great.  I purchased the camera for $63 shipped and feel like I got a steal.  I will be replacing this camera w/ the true outdoor Foscam if it ever goes on sale and put this camera in the house.  If your on the fence I would definitely recommend purchasing.

Reviews.Title: Sound does not really work
Reviews.Author: Shannon  V Cimaglio "svlmg"
Reviews.Content: The set up was not easy and the 2 way sound does not work very well.The picture is great.I won't send it back but I'm not using as much as I'd like due to the lack of ease of monitoring with it from my phone.

Reviews.Title: "Good enough" camera with easy setup
Reviews.Author: Brandon
Reviews.Content: I bought two of this model for use as a baby monitor and to help keep an eye on the kids' room when I'm in another part of the house. So far I'm very pleased with the purchase. The picture's a little grainy, but you can't expect the world out of an affordable day/night camera that produces a 640x480 video feed. It's not going to make you feel like you're watching "Paranormal Activity", but it will help you keep an eye on what matters to you.PROs:* Easy setup and included software supports both PC *and* Mac* Full camera control from the web browser* Night mode produces a very clear picture* Audio monitoring is perfect for a baby monitor* Quiet motor for pan and tilt allows for silent operation in the nursery or kids' room* Preset locations if you need to quickly look in different parts of the roomCONs:* IR LEDs put of a visible red glow at night - it kind of creeped out my kids at first* Power light is a bright LED on the back of the housing. I had to cover it with electrical tape to keep it from lighting up the wall behind it.* The "click" of the IR cut filter is pretty loud when it switches from day to night mode. My kids noticed this right away when turning their room light on or off.* The camera takes a little over 30 seconds to reboot after just about any settings change. Quite annoying!INFO:* Requires direct wired connection for initial setup before you can activate wireless* Audio is a little scratchy - don't expect high-quality audio recordingsI downloaded IP Cam Viewer Free so I can monitor both cameras at once from my phone. It almost looks like a security system setup you see on TV. You have to pay for an upgrade to the application in order to receive/send audio, but it's a useful little tool if you just want to do a quick check-in. There are many available apps for both Android and iOS that you can use to monitor the camera.Unlike others here, I did not need to call customer support to set up the cameras. Mine were shipped with the latest firmware (actually later than the firmware advertised on their website) and full initial setup took about 10 minutes per camera and then about 30 minutes of tweaking the preset locations, image settings, etc. after placing it in its permanent location.4.5 stars (rounded up to 5)

Reviews.Title: Amazing camera, requires some ability to work with computers / network, or ability to watch youtube videos / read comments
Reviews.Author: Gadget Lover "I love hi-tech gadgets"
Reviews.Content: Update - Seems I have been screwed by Foscam warranty service.At the direction of Foscam US, I mailed ObservEye (one of their official Foscam warranty providers) a defective Foscam FI8190W, with insurance and tracking, to your address in Monroe on 7/3/13. It was picked up by their employees at 7/15/13, per USPS tracking # 1311 0670 0000 6457 6216. Since then I have heard nothing from their company about my warranty service.I have called multiple times to follow up, sent multiple emails using the "contact us" form on their site, and their agents just say they will get back to me. Nothing so far at all, it's been 3 months. It appears they have now removed their phone number from their public website as well.A very shoddy way to do business.******************************************original review below*************I recently purchased one of these cameras during a lightning sale, and it worked so well that I purchased 4 more, for a total of 5 cameras for a couple of properties I own.  These are bar none the most amazing, best cameras I have ever used.  I have used closed circuit cameras, various earlier generation brand cameras (including a finicky Linksys cam that worked 50% of the time and cost twice as much).The resolution of the cameras are amazing. I am able to watch from PC, iPhone / iPad, and my Android devices, anywhere, with near 100% reliability. As long as you have data, it should work flawlessly.  Just amazing.However, since these cameras rely on your home wireleness network working well, as well as a small amount of effort to set up a dynamic DNS (I used no-ip.com for free and it works great) so you can view the cameras outside your home - DO NOT BUY / INSTALL these cameras if you are: stupid, lazy, have no idea what WIFI is, what an IP Address is, OR even knew what the admin page of your router is.  Many of the complaints here are due to people lacking some basic understanding / expertise around home networks / ip addresses.  IF you fall into this group of people, either HIRE a TRUSTED person to do it for you (a close friend / family member who knows more about computers than you do), or outsource this to the Geek Squad (as much as I hate them).Here are the steps I followed to install the cameras:1. DO NOT install the software from the CD. I can find no good reason to do so.  Instead, I plugged the camera into my router via ethernet cable, and plugged in the power cord.  1.a  Once the camera is booted and on the network via ethernet, log into your router admin page (eg 192.168.0.1) or something like that - and look up the IP address of the camera (eg. 192.168.0.101)2. On your browser - type in the IP address of the camera (eg: 192.168.0.101)  2.a  This will bring up the camera view / set up page.  It will ask for a user / password.  The default is "admin" for user, with password field blank.3. Once you get past the log in page, depending on the firmware, it will show the video immediately. You can pan, tilt, and scan (no zoom).  You can also go to the settings page (Device management) and set the various parameters for your network.  3.a  Turn on wireless settings if you are going to use this on wifi (most people will, since these cameras are going to be in remote locations away from a router / switch).  3.b  set up users and passwords (recommended to add password to Admin, and create additional users for "operators" who can't change camera settings).  Note - once you change password, the camera will reboot, and ask you for the password immediately!!  Don't forget the passwords!!  3.c  set up a unique HTTP Port (I recommend a single value 8000 - 8999).  If you don't know what this is, please consult a friend who knows about port forwarding, or google it, watch Youtube videos, etc., about the camera set up.  3.c.1  Once you have set up a unique HTTP port, the camera will reboot.  When you log back to the camera, you MUST add the port to the IP address - eg:  192.168.0.101:8000  .  Without the PORT # to the IP address, you WILL NOT find the camera!!!  I suspect a lot of people trying to set this up don't do this right and then come here and complain about the camera, when it's their own fault.4.  Go to No-ip.com, create an account, set up an alias (eg.  myaddress.no-ip.org) that you will be using from outside the home to watch the camera.  This is 100% free and works great.  I recommend a small donation to no-ip.com if you like to thank them for their service.  4.a  Once this is done, go to the DDNS service settings of your camera and enter it there.  Camera will reboot and show either the DDNS settings were successful or failed.5. Once wireless is turned on the camera, disconnect the ethernet cable.  5.a  Log into the router, and look up the wireless IP Address (denoted by foscaxxxx_1 in the device name)  5.b  log into the wirelss IP address with the PORT # - eg: 192.168.0.102:8080 (not the ethernet IP Address!!)6. If you are successful thus far, then set a static IP address for your Foscam to guarantee reliability  6.a Using a linksys router, I set my static IP for the wireless FOScam as 192.168.0.199, for example.  6.b  After this is done (saved the settings on router, etc), turn off the camera, router, and then turn everything back on to allow the static IP address to take effect.  6.c Log into the router to check that the static IP address is working.  Test by going to the static IP on your browser - eg:  192.168.0.199:8000, and log into the camera to make sure it is working.7. If everything looks good thus far, then log into the no-ip address to make sure everything works:  7.a  Log into  myaddress.no-ip.org:8000 (your alias and your port #) to make sure everything works. It should if you understand and have followed my directions above.8. Voila - done, enjoy!!!Some additional notes:1. Internet Explorer sucks, don't use it (I have IE 9 and the active X control kept crashing my IE).2. Install Chrome, and use it.  To do so, use the "Server Push Mode" and everything works great.  Use Chrome for everything if you can, ditch Internet Explorer (saying this as I have to use IE for work and I grudgingly do so).3. If you own an iPhone / iPad, the free Cam Viewer app works great for this device.  Many other cam apps work also.If you were able to follow the very SIMPLE (yes simple) directions above, and get it to work, kudos.  If what you read was gibberish, DO NOT buy this camera, or hire someone to install the camera for you!!!One thing to keep in minde - who ever installs the camera for you with the network settings can view your camera if they want, any time, any where!!  So if you do this, make sure you make them teach you how to log into the camera ADMIN page, and change the passwords for the admin user, and any other users that are set up, so only you can log in and view the camera.This is pretty simple stuff, if you have any desire to learn about basic home networking, can watch some Youtube videos that go through this stuff, read some online forums, or just can RTFM!!!This camera is amazing.  I highly recommend it, but only if you're not stupid or lazy.

Reviews.Title: Everything I expected and more!
Reviews.Author: G. Denny
Reviews.Content: When I bought this I read a ton of reviews and went back and forth about whether to purchase or not. When it came up as a lightning deal I jumped. This is an awesome product that does everything I want and more. The people having problems with setup are baffling because I followed the directions exactly and it worked. I read reviews that said not to use the installation CD that comes with it but I thought I'd try that first to see what the issues were. I plugged in the camera and plugged it into my router with the supplied ethernet cable. I popped the CD in the drive, navigated to IPCamSetup.exe and ran it. It immediately found the IP of the Camera and prompted me to login. The default username and password are in the manual. After I logged in, I selected which browser I wanted to use and POOF it's connected and the picture appears. This took maybe 3 minutes. The amount of control you have is amazing. From vertical and horizontal patrol to scheduling recording times to motion sensing, sound sensing, 2 way audio, email alerts... the list goes on and on. After it was setup as hard wired, I followed the directions to set it up wirelessly by going to the device manager and selecting the wireless LAN settings tab. (as the instructions tell you) Clicked scan (as the directions said) and it found the SSID of my router. (as the instructions said it would) I simply entered the share key and submit. The camera rebooted and once again... POOF, it's now working wirelessly. I mounted it on my front porch with the included mounting bracket and the entire ordeal took 10 minutes tops.I understand that some may have a different setup than I do, but that doesn't mean the product is junk. Initial install was on windows XP SP2 and subsequently I installed it on a windows 7 machine. I also found the greatest app for my iPhone and iPad. It's the FoscamPro app and it's $5.99 but well worth it. It does absolutely everything you would want it to do. I have mine set to alert/record on motion. You can set the sensitivity and it's setup to email me and record the video to my dropbox folder so I can see the video remotely as well as monitor the camera. UPS delivered a package for me and it alerted me when they reached the front step. I used the 2 way audio and told them to leave it inside the porch area. How cool is that?I'm buying more of these. I only wish they were water/weatherproof so I could mount them outside as well.This is a really good product, fake reviews or not!

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, using as baby monitor
Reviews.Author: 00AlanJ
Reviews.Content: I spent a while trying to find a wireless ip camera to use as a baby monitor; the foscam 8910W seemed to have all the features I was looking for and tons of great reviews. They don't lie! This thing is great.We have 2 iphones and an ipad, we use foscam pro to access the cameras from those devices (universal app). It gives full control of the pan and tilt and other settings on with the camera. It also transmits audio and allows you to talk through the camera; it doesn't have a great speaker, but our 2 year old seems to understand us well enough when talking through it. The app cost a few bucks (more than what I spend on most apps) but I knew how much a video baby monitoring system cost and we were still way under the cost of that route. As a side note, the app is a resource hog and will drain your battery. It will run in the background transmitting audio if you have it enabled. This really hasn't been an issue for me, it bugs my wife but she lets the app run forever.The setup can be a little frustrating. Some things that help, assign it a static IP address so that if the router resets, it won't assign a different ip. We use port 8090 instead of 80; it seems to improve the reliability of our internet and its safer if you decide to set up port forwarding. I haven't gone through that step yet, but will get to it at some point. Follow the directions and it should go well. Be sure to give at least a minute (60 sec) if you are trying to have it list available networks.The infrared is excellent, very clear in our baby's room. The glow of the red lights around the camera do not seem to bother her or prevent her from falling asleep. It is 10 times better than any baby monitoring system my friends use. As soon as I show them the clarity of the picture, they want to know exactly where to buy cause their sold. Happy monitoring!<Edit>I set up the port forwarding a week ago through my router - much easier than I expected it to be. On the port forwarding page on your router setup, you need to enter the port that it will be incoming on and type in the static ip address you have assigned to the camera. I used a random password generator to maximize the security of the password and changed it prior to setting up the port forwarding (hopefully this will increase the security). This now allows me to check in during nap time to see whats going on and we can move the camera to the main floor while away so we can check in on the house.Really loving this camera, no it is not HD, but for our needs its great. I have now told several people about this camera who have purchased one for themselves including a friend whose wife just had a baby, a brother who has a one year old, and my parents who occasionally watch that one year old. All of them have had a similar positive experience.

Reviews.Title: Worked great right out of the box!
Reviews.Author: B. Parker "Parker"
Reviews.Content: I read that these could be dificult and time consuming to set up, but I had mine configured in under 15 minutes.  I then moved it (from wired to the router) to it's wireless destination as a baby monitor. The daytime color and nighttime IR quality is much better than I expected.  The framerate isn't great so don't expect high quality for people walking about in front of the camera, but for monitoring the baby's crib it works great and cost much less than other baby video monitors.I plan to get two more to monitor my front and back doors, using a software based DVR on my home PC.

Reviews.Title: Great camera... beware of packaging
Reviews.Author: Texas Mommy "Texas Mommy"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to use as a video monitor for our toddler (and have used as a security camera for the house when we travel).  It is easy to use and control from a computer, but we have found several other apps for our smart phones that work just as well at 3am.  The only issue we did have was getting it set up.  The disc that came with the product was cracked and damaged and did not work.  Easy enough to resolve as they have the software available online.  The view itself is great and love the night vision view as well.  My only complaint is that we will probably have to mount it to get the best view of the tot bc it does not move low enough from the spot we have it sitting currently... not a camera issue, but a small room with lots of furniture issue.  Over all, it is a great camera and has many uses!

Reviews.Title: Pretty good camera for the price, built in web software junk
Reviews.Author: Jamie
Reviews.Content: The camera itself works pretty well, but the web based software is junk.  It has very few configuration options in the web interface and the access options are limited.  It works, but I would suggest other options for viewing the camera.  Foscam's iPhone and iPad applications are FAR better than the built in web server's capabilities.  I'd also recommend using DVR software like the free "iSpy" to do recording with.  Overall, pretty happy with the camera's quality and performance.

Reviews.Title: CANT BELIEVE THE FEATURES! WOW!
Reviews.Author: hakkdup3 "DFD"
Reviews.Content: Excellent product.suggest watching you tube video "How to Setup & Configure Foscam FI8910W Wireless IP Camera".HERE'S THE LINK:[...]The video helped tremendously and I was up and running within an hour.There is a Part 2 & 3 video for setting up DNS. WARNING!! If you do not understand Computer Terminology ,then I suggest you get someone who does to install it for you.Otherwise, the camera is a bargain for under a hundred dollars. I can view my house anytime of the day or night and hear whats going on also from anywhere in the world. I can also 2-way talk which is really cool.The nightvision is very clear and bright.I also like the motion activation. When I first set the camera up,it was emailing me every 2 minutes with pictures of my cats wondering around.So needless to say,I had to adjust the degree of camera angle to "not" point to close to the floor. I can also view my house and control the camera on my smartphone. Download the app "foscam lite" to do this. YUP,, 5 stars for this camera...indeed!

Reviews.Title: Third cameras a charm hopefully as baby camera!!!
Reviews.Author: The Englishman
Reviews.Content: We bought this camera for use as an alternative baby camera monitor for use with our Ipods and Ipads and Pcs so we could monitor the baby from everywhere.  The camera itself is a great concept, its easy to install the basics for this purpose and get it up and running.  Wi-Fi is a piece of cake to setup and the assembly is just plugging in and screwing he antenna in and mounting where desired.The infrared aspect of this camera is crucial because babies need dark rooms to sleep in and "night vision" of other cameras always leaves a lot to be desired.  One tip is that you must have a very dark room with no bright spots for this to activate the IR lamps and so black outs on windows is a must.  The image is very clear though once activated.  Very happy with this aspect.The controls on this are a snap to use and very responsive and you can aim it anywhere and invert the image and controls etc incase you have it mounted upside down on the ceiling like we do.For actual monitoring we use Live Cam Pro from the iTunes app store on the Ipods and Ipads and the camera has instructions for a web based utility for use on Pc's.  Live Cam Pro is a great App to use.So you ask, having said all that, why 2 stars **.  Well there have been some problems with the cameras.  We are actually on our third replacement camera.  They are a great concept with great features but they are still very buggy even the latest version as of this review and customer service is a bit of a bear.  Here's some of the problems we have had with them.The audio is not great, there is a constant feedback humming which occurs on all devices, Ipods, Ipads and Pcs.  We spoke to Foscam about this and replaced the camera but the new one had the exact same problem and actually so does this third camera so I am not sure what they are achieving by having me get the camera replaced.  So the audio is not usable unfortunately especially when your trying to hear small subtle noises from a dozing baby.  Don't even consider the talk back feature as it results in an unstoppable squelch.The bigger problem was that the cameras were constantly rebooting themselves like there was a power outage.  I put them on different circuits and even connected it to a UPS battery backup to ensure it wasn't a power glitch here and it wasn't.  Half the time after reboots, it would have a new IP address which required reconfiguring the apps on a daily basis (sometimes in the middle of the night when baby is crying).  This requires you turning your pc on in the middle of the night to use the camera app to find the new IP address of the camera.  The other problem was that I would have to pan the camera etc to reposition back to where it was watching the baby before and this woke up the baby.  Sometimes on a reboot the camera would become stuck in the up position clicking trying to to go more up and I would have to enter the nursery to power cycle it to stop this and the clicking also wakes the baby.The biggest problem though was customer service.  There answer was always return the camera.  Now after 60 days from the initial purchase, you have to pay for shipping every time which has to be traceable like UPS and hence about $12.  So your paying $12 a pop for this.  Secondly I had to buy a replacement camera before returning the original camera so that I had a camera at all times and the replacement camera was more expensive.  Now you would think Foscam would refund the cost of the replacement camera, but no they refunded $11 less than the cost of the original camera resulting on me being another $23 out so I am $35 total out for every replacement.  Add that into your purchase price!!!  Subsequent to the replacements which still had the same problems, I did my own research and found some solutions myself which if Foscam had bothered to tell me would have saved them the replacement and me $35 a pop.  (audio still no good unfortunately and I have the latest rehash of the camera)So here I am with camera #3 hoping third times a charm but for much more than the original purchase price.  If I wasn't already invested in this camera (ITunes apps purchase etc) I would wish to have gone with a different camera or at least a different company.Good luck.Update 12/9/12:Well third time is not a charm.  After a month of "ok" use it has started resetting itself constantly like all the rest of the cameras.  This means I have to keep switching on my laptop to use the IP tool to see what the new IP address is of the camera before I can use it on the iPad and iPod.  A real pain at bedtime.  I don't feel like wasting more money returning this for an obviously defective product line.  Very dissappointed.  Given my experiences with these cameras and the unscrupulous customer service, I would be very wary of the good reviews this has received as possibly self written etc.

Reviews.Title: Average but well priced
Reviews.Author: the dude "Festivus"
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews, I thought I would give this a shot.  I can't help but compare it to the Sharx SCNC2607 because I also own that.  I primarily use these as toddler cams.  The Foscam graphical user interface is not that great.  In fact, it requires significant reductions in IE security to run the Active X controls.  I am viewing it on my desktop with either Chrome or Firefox and it works reasonably well.  The ability to move the camera is a nice feature but there is no zoom function. The audio is completely useless.  There is tremendous feedback.  The Sharx is a much more expensive camera but has very good audio and a zoom feature.  The IR on both is very good.  For the price (roughly a third of the Sharx) it is a reasonable purchase.

Reviews.Title: solid camera so far, good price
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: We got this to use as a baby monitor because we could use a web browser, tablet app, or iPhone app to monitor the camera (with audio) and save close to $100 over anything decent in the video baby monitor world, and get a bigger screen while we're at it. I don't regret that so far.PROS:Set up was easier than some reviews led me to believe. From a Mac OS perspective, the included CD only had a very simple utility that finds the IP address of the camera. There are plenty of other ways for the computer-savvy to find that address as well. Plug the camera into your router, type that IP into your web browser and you get full controls. From there, you can enable the wireless, turn on the motion alarm, etc.- The quality is surprisingly good. I generally leave it at the 320px resolution because the motion is smoother.- When the camera moves and tilts, it's very quiet. Since like I said we're using it for a baby monitor, that's important.- There are numerous iOS and Android apps out there. Even searching "Foscam" in the store will bring up plenty of results.- I haven't had to deal with support yet, but Foscam's website has a lot of good information in their user forums. It's a popular enough camera that there are a lot of other forums out there with people talking about them and working through issues.CONS:I can't get audio to work through a web browser, unless you're using Windows with Internet Explorer. This is due to Foscam (for some reason) using Videolan's lapsed web plugins which I just can't get to work. Streaming the camera directly from Videolan's open-source VLC app will give you sound though on Mac, Windows, or Linux. Since I don't normally need to use the controls for the camera, I usually just stream it that way. I also downloaded a couple iOS apps that have both sound and controls.- There is a delay with audio of about a second. How you feel about that probably depends on how you're going to use the camera.Overall, I haven't had it for too awfully long but my impression is very good.

Reviews.Title: Good basic IP camera, software is junk
Reviews.Author: Brent V
Reviews.Content: This is a good camera if you just need minimal functionality.  If you need a high definition picture or optical zoom, look elsewhere.  But you do get some good basics -- pan and tilt, night vision, and secured wireless.  I found it pretty simple to set up but then again, I'm a "computer person."  Just specify the port you want it to use and open that port up on your router's firewall.I took away one star because of the software that comes with it.  You will have no need for the software if you just want to periodically access the feed from a web browser.  But you need software for alerts, motion detection, and recording.  And the packaged software is so difficult to use.  It can only record to local hard drives (no external drives, SD cards, or network drives).  You can only view the videos in the software.  Media players will not play them back.  You can't set up any automatic recording deletion (like delete after two weeks).  You can't set up any continuous recording -- only motion based ones.  And the user interface is just confusing and not very friendly.  You will probably want to go out and download 3rd-party software.  There are plenty of paid and free alternatives (I use the open-source "iSpy" application).

Reviews.Title: Good cam, very bad account managment
Reviews.Author: Darksamus
Reviews.Content: This is my first ip cam and so far its not bad. I've created two accounts so that my wife and I can log it to view it. What I notice that it will allow you to log in as any name you want with out a password! If foscam can't fix this ASAP, I might have to create my own secured website and redirect the camera traffic through it.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: jgarza
Reviews.Content: My wife wanted a video baby monitor, but I was unhappy with the quality and price of video baby monitors. I purchased this camera and it is amazing. The video quality is awesome and we can view it from our iPhones and iPads (free Apps available). This was the best choice by a long shot. However, I can see how setup can be difficult if you have never configured devices over a home wireless network.

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Joy Gates
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use as a baby monitor after reading previous customer reviews (and a lower cost option than Y-cam and other baby monitor cameras).  The wi-fi set up was easy.  I was up and going in no time.  I had a little trouble setting up 3G mainly because I'm not familiar with port forwarding and creating host sites for dynamic IP.  I eventually got it set up after searching the web for my router's settings and Foscam web support links.  I use my iphone and ipad to monitor the baby and the SunshineApps Baby Monitor app.  I turned off the alerts since they beep sometimes without the baby making the noise and the sound is on for me to hear anyway.  SunshineApps also has a NetCam2Go app where you can use the two way audio but doesn't have the alerts. This app would have suited me since I don't care for the alerts. Wish I had this camera with my first child!

Reviews.Title: Works Beautifully
Reviews.Author: Dad2014
Reviews.Content: We bought this IP camera as a baby monitor and also to monitor our babysitters.  It works beautifully.  Download the $5.99 App in the Apple Store and you can view your camera remotely.  The name of the App is Foscam Pro made by Logic Consulting LLC.Works great with macs too.  I actually used my mac to set it up.  Pop the CD in and look for the Mac OSX folder and follow the instructions.  Basically, you drag and drop the IP Camera Tool app into your Applications Folder.  The IP Camera Tool will scan your network and look for the camera and will show you the camera's IP address.  You then use that IP Address to configure your iPhone/iPad app.  Note that when the camera is unplugged it picks up a new IP Address (have not figured out how to give it a static IP address yet).  You use that IP address to configure the App and you can monitor your baby and your babysitter whether you are in a different room in the house or out and about running errands around town.The camera has a built in mic so you can hear the baby remotely through your iPhone/iPad (quality is decent).  Much like the Angel Care baby monitor.  The camera also has a built-in speaker.  So you can speak to your iPhone/iPad and it can relay the sound to the camera (if you want it to).  Both features are just nice to haves and are not the greatest strength of this product.  This product's greatest strength is the ability to see your baby/babysitter regardless of where you are.Remote viewing works over AT&T;'s 3G network.UPDATE - 8/23/2012I've added two additional cameras in my system for a total of 3.  The Foscam Pro app works beautifully.  I can see all 3 cameras at the same time on my iPhone and iPad.  And if you have an Apple TV, you can AirPlay (mirror) your iPhone/iPad display on your big screen TV in the living room and see all cameras at once (if you have an iPhone 4S and the 3rd generation iPad).  The price, performance and the fact that everything works well within the Apple ecosystem makes this IP Camera a true gem.  Definetely a highly recommended product.

Reviews.Title: great camera with lousy install software
Reviews.Author: Panak
Reviews.Content: this took several more hours than i had planned to get it going.  The "IP Camera Link" app glitched on install, then did not operate correctly (double clicking the path to the camera opens in Microsoft Word instead of IE ???!!!).  Quick start instructions were poorly written and next to worthless.  I plowed through multiple online FAQ's to find the answer and workaround for a security problem to the unsigned ActiveX certificate (why do lazy and careless software developers think it is okay to waste hours of my life?)After finally getting the ActiveX thing to go, then open the ports on my wireless router and my broadband router, the camera finally works well and looks great.  Remote operation is intuitive and easy - the IR mode for night vision is surprisingly good.  Daytime color and picture quality is also good, and autogain works well.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price but FPS is too low for me
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Amazon doesn't show me as a verified buyer of this product because I bought a two pack kit with the 9dB antennas included. Look for that product and you will see that I did own this product because I posted the same review for it. I just know that more people buy the single camera and I wanted them to find my review. I hope this helps with your decision making!For the price of these cameras, they work pretty well. I didn't have any issues setting them up but I am an IT professional (bachelor's degree in CIT) and I am very familiar with networking. I thought the included instructions were good enough to allow most people to set these up without assistance but if you have trouble, there are many how-to articles that can be easily found online. The cameras have a very solid construction. I bought two of these in a set with the larger 9dB antennas included. I ended up not using the larger antennas - well because they are far larger than I expected them to be (probably 8-9 inches long). I have a ~1,300 square foot home and didn't have any issues with signal when using the standard antennas that are about 1/3 the size of the larger ones. The two way audio on the cameras was only OK. It seemed to be better for listening than talking through the camera - which was fine for me because one of the cameras was intended use was just for a baby monitor. The audio didn't work so well though when the IR was on. The IR lights must generate a signal interference that is picked up by the mic on the camera because when the IR was on, there was a constant noise when listening through the camera. The image quality over all was excellent in both day and night modes. The only issue I had was the IR is activated automatically by a photo sensor that detects the amount of ambient light present in the room. You can manually (through software)turn this off when it comes on automatically but I was not able to turn it on if the photo sensor detected too much light in the room and hadn't turned it on for you. This bothered me because at the in between level of the photo sensor turning on the IR mode for low light operation versus daylight operation, I was sure that I could have gotten a better image if I could have manually turned it on sooner. The biggest problem for me with these cameras was the FPS. This camera uses MJPEG for video compression. This method of compression is not efficient at all and creates very large file sizes. In order to view the feed remotely, this large file size has to be transmitted. I am not for sure if the large file sizes are truly the cause of the very low FPS I got on both cameras or if it was some other limitation but I am pretty certain that I wasn't getting the expected 15 FPS (VGA - 640x480 resolution) or the 30 FPS (QVGA - 320x240 resolution). I didn't have a way to measure my actual FPS but my video feeds were very jerky and more like time elapsed still images (which is actually what MJPEG is). I would guess that I was getting at best 1/2 the FPS that was advertised. I suspect that the transmittal of the large video size was also affecting the sound quality because so much bandwidth was consumed by the video that little was left for audio. These cameras also only work on up to wireless G networks that have a max 54Mpbs throughput. With all this said, even though I have rated these with 4 stars, I am returning them. I am replacing them with the Foscam FI8608W IP cams. These are the newer model in this lineup. They support H.264 video compression, which can reduce video file size by up to 80% over MJPEG. The FI8608W model also has wireless N support (600Mbps), a memory card slot that supports up to 32GB cards for recording, and it has a faster processor. I expect all of this to provide me with a significant improvement in both video, audio, and recording. The FI8608W models are ~$45 more though but I think that is justifiable with the enhancements. I forgot to mention, something that I wondered about the FI8910W model when I was thinking about ordering them was about the software for remote viewing. It is very functional and you can create three types of log on accounts for people that you want to allow to view/operate the cameras. You can have administrators, operators, and viewers. Admins can do anything. Operators can view the cameras and use the PTZ functions to adjust where the camera points. Viewers can just log in and see what the camera is currently pointing at. The software for the FI8910W does easily integrate with up to 9 cameras. The app IP Cam Viewer ($3.99 on the Apple App Store) from Robert Chou which is mentioned by several other reviewers really does work well for accessing the cameras.UPDATE:As I originally stated, I replaced these cameras with the FI8608W camers. I purchased them off from Amazon.com as well - so you can find my review of that camera online as well. Please read about my experience with the 8608 cameras before making your decision. The hardware for the 8608 is improved but the software was broken with the new firmware and web GUI interface. Depending on what you value as important, the 8910 model may be the better option for you.

Reviews.Title: Still has plenty of bugs to work out
Reviews.Author: Greg Stoff "sdaf"
Reviews.Content: I'm not a network engineer, but I'm close and after spending 7+ hours working on the installation of this camera, I'm returning it.  I eventually got most of the feature set to work but the few features that are not working properly are deal killers for me.  If you want to use this inside one network (camera and viewing application) it works fine cabled.  It turns out there are a few different versions of this camera, all with the same part number (FI8910W), and mine happens to be one of the versions that has known problems with IR-CUT and wireless operations.  The user interfaces (both application and via web browser) are "good enough" but not definitely not where they could be.If you are buying this camera to function as a baby monitor, it will work fine.  Anything more than that though (e.g. remote monitoring through internet using Android phone, motion detection recording and alerts, etc.), and it's clunky at best in my opinion.If you're wondering, I spent many hours on the Foscam forum and searching internet for solutions to the hurdles I hit during setup.  Bottom line, I'm returning this camera.  If you're not very comfortable with things like port forwarding, DDNS, setting up static IP addresses, and firmware updates, this camera's setup is not for you.  I'm guessing most IP cameras are like this and the whole genre of IP cameras is not there yet for the general user population.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for using as a Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I tried the D-link before this due to the D-link being Wireless-N compatible and the Foscam being only Wireless-G. Using this as a Baby monitor I was worried about video lag. Turned out the D-link had a severe lag when using the d-link app and seemed very buggy so I got the foscam. Lag is very little ( same as any baby monitor 1-2 sec) and it has pan and tilt which comes in handy. Very happy with this product.Wish I would of gotten this one when my son was born instead of a Baby Monitor that was overpriced just because it was labeled a baby monitor. Much better picture quality and features for the price.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W - Nice IP CAM
Reviews.Author: dbphotos
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these now plus 2 Panasonic BL-C230A's. Each has its strengths.The advantages of the Foscam are:1-Great range of motion - 270 degrees L and R.2-Decent IR night vision out to 25 feet or so. Works in complete darkness.3-Microphone feature so you can talk (and listen) through its speakers. Panasonic can only listen-no mike.4-Relatively easy setup.5-Good prices available.Disadvantages of the Foscam:1-No internal memory to store images/video. Panasonic can store 400 or more frames of motion triggered frames to its internal memory for playback any time via cellphone, computer, etc. Only options with the Foscam are emailing the images or uploading them to an FTP site (the Panasonic also allows these 2 options). If you have multiple cameras, uploading these streams can put a serious hit on your broadband performance.2-No provided free DNS service for dynamic IP users. You have to purchase a yearly subscription to dyndns.com in order to keep your dynamic IP address changes up to date automatically - a must if you are accessing the camera remotely and do not want to keep a computer running at the camera site. Panasonic provides its own free DNS service with its cameras. Either DNS service works fine, but Panasonic's is free and comes with the camera.3-Although the settings options available on the Foscam are adequate, the options you can set on Panasonic are much more extensive (especailly with respect to alarm trigger settings). Of course, this can make the Panasonic a little more daunting to set up for novice users.Conclusions: I like both cameras, but for security where night vision and range of motion are important, for my applications, the Foscam wins.

Reviews.Title: The cat just sleeps
Reviews.Author: Matt
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera since I really wanted to see what the cat is up to while my fiancee and I are at work.As expected, it seems like he just sleeps.$110 on Amazon got me wifi, pan/tilt and IR night vision.The unit shipped with an install disc(tossed) AC Adaptor, ethernet cord, power cord and mounting bracket. The unit has ethernet, wifi, power and audio in/out jacks(3.5mm.)Install was quick and easy. Plug the ethernet into my router and once I found the IP I was on the admin page. No disc required. Connecting to my wifi was a little funny, at first it didn't find my network. I think it may have been something to do with all the wireless access points near me. It eventually did after refreshing one more time and I was connected without wires.The web interface is pretty simplistic. Admin options, set a password, FTP upload etc. It serves its purpose and is fine.The picture quality is great. Its way better than my 8 year old Logitech webcam. Surprisingly the inferred works great too. It turns on automatically. The pan and tilt moves somewhat jerkingly but functions just fine. To make up for that it's super quiet. I can't even hear it when it moves. The image quality...pretty darn good!The audio doesn't work on my mac. They say install the VLC plug-in. Wrong, search some more, people are reporting the VLC plug-in does not work. I found this to be the case. I can get the audio to stream over VLC itself, but not two-way as advertised. I guess I'll try the two way audio from work on my PC.The cam works great with pretty well with webcamXP. Put in the IP and your credentials and the devices is added to your camera pool. The only issue I have found is you cannot inverse the pan/tilt controls which would come in handy as my camera is mounted upside down.Now of course to get this viewable from the web you will need to setup the correct port mappings to your device.Overall I'm happy with this device. I kind of wish it had a zoom but for the price It's supoer neat! I hope the Mr. Derp doesn't mind me checking up on him!

Reviews.Title: Surprise Surprise! This cam is actually good.
Reviews.Author: Hanzilla
Reviews.Content: I'm pretty surprised on this wireless cam, I previously bought a cam from lorex which I thought was ok and cost more but felt I over spend for what I purchased, then I found this awesome cam on Amazon which at first wasn't sure because of the price since it was so inexpensive but when I received it the Foscam blew away that lorex cam. I bought this cam to watch and record the filthy people that don't clean up after their dogs on my front yard and since I got this cam no dog pooh!I make sure I move it around with several ways, such as my google tv, iPad, windows 7 net book, and MacBook auto or manuel so people know its real, night vision is in color and with enough lighting you don't need infrared on. You can use almost any 3rd party surveillance software but you have to pay for the software if you want the most important features like record and or to listen in.Setup was confusing at first, I had to figure that the cam needs to be connected to the router and cam needs wifi activated through the software that they give you, once that's done you can disconnect cat5 cable and place it where you want it. I used a wireless modem jack for the setup to wifi and my Windows 7 netbook since my Macbook's dvd drive isn't working.This is a great budget cam and depending on the software it can make this cam user friendly, just setup is the first hurdle but once you get passed that your pretty much good to go and watch your home from literally any where in the world. Once I get a smart phone I'll link it to that as well.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: TRDTech
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera because my friend showed me what his camera could do. He has the older FI18918W model and i wanted to add security cameras to my house. I ended up getting this model since it is the newest model with a new IR-cut filter. Setting up the camera for wired and wireless was pretty easy but getting access from outside of your network was a little confusing. DYNDNS and port forwarding were foreign to me and i had to google a lot of stuff to set that part up. You need to sign up for DYNDNS.ORG (14 day free trial) then cancel before the 14 days and you get to keep and use 1 domain name for free. Functions of this camera is good for the price. I would even pay a little more if they would increase the camera resolution. Night vision and motion sensor with email notification is awesome. Email notifications also include 5-6 snapshots of when motion was detected. My friend with the older model saw my camera video and said that the colors are better than the older model so he ordered 2 new cameras. I liked mine so much that i ordered another camera also. Great bang for the buck!

Reviews.Title: Great little wireless IP camera
Reviews.Author: Siucity
Reviews.Content: I have a few wireless IP cameras, and so far this Foscam FI8910W is working really well.  I have it placed by the window looking out the front of the house.  Since I have it on the inside, I've turned off its IR so at night there's no reflection of the IR.  I have a patio light on so it works just fine with that at night.These cameras are relatively easy to set up if you're network savvy.  The setup process goes something like this:1. plug the camera into your wired network and power on2. log into your router to see what IP address it picked up3. type in that IP in your browser4. type "admin" for username and leave the password field blank to log in5. make your necessary configuration changes (add password, configure wireless, etc.) and save6. once configured, unplug wired connection, power-cycle the camera, make sure it's accessible wirelessly, then place camera in desired locationThe configuration process is about 5 minutes for me.  I spend more time trying to figure out where I want to place the camera for maximum coverage.  If I need another camera, I wouldn't hesitate buying this same camera again.

Reviews.Title: The new hotness
Reviews.Author: Smoky Blue
Reviews.Content: I have a Logitech Alert camera system and like it, but the Logitech's website is often down or slow, so trying to view my cam on my iPhone is sometimes problematic. So, after some research I picked up a Foscam F18910W. Love it! Streaming over the internet is way faster than the Logitech Alert and has many more features. It's worked flawlessly with my WiFi setup on an Airport Extreme router.Pros:* Streaming over the internet is fast -- use a web browser or mobile app* Tilt/Pan functions work great* There are a lot of good iPhone apps that work with the camera* Setup was pretty simple* User management is easy* It has IR lights and an IR filter for viewing at night* 2 way speakers allow you to hear audio from the camera and talk through the cam's speakersCons:× The web interface is functional but really, really ugly -- avoid if you can. Use an app instead.× The web interface is supposed to work with IE and Firefox, but the Firefox interface is somewhat broken.× I went to the foscam website to see if there were any firmware updates -- they forced me to give them my email address with the disclaimer that I am agreeing to receive marketing materials as well as firmware download instructions. This really _really_ annoyed me and is why they lost 1 star. Not cool Foscam. There is no reason for you not to provide a direct download link. After signing up for the spam emails only _then_ did I find out there were no firmeware upgrades. I almost took off 2 stars for that crap.× There are a lot of iPhone apps that work with the camera, but surprisingly Foscam doesn't make one. Not a huge deal as there are some really good iOS apps that can do the job. I'd prefer if Foscam would provide the software though.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic from iPhone
Reviews.Author: Fred Flinstone "Fred"
Reviews.Content: Shortly after I bought this, my opinion changed. A new app came out call Foscam Pro. Not Foscam Surveillance Pro. I got this so I could watch my home from my iPhone while away from home. The new Foscam Pro app lets me watch, record video, listen to audio, and talk through the camera. Foscam Pro is the only app that lets me talk through it. I can calm my son, talk to the Fedex guy, and much more. Very satisfied now. The app is great [...]

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM 8910 is worth the extra money
Reviews.Author: J. Liu
Reviews.Content: I being trying not to buy another Foscam for the past two weeks,  I had a FI 8918W before, and it works very well, the WIFI transmission is very good, frame rate is very good.  The only negative is the price, it's higher than other foscam-like camera, so when I needed a another WIFI ip cam, I set out to buy look at other options.  I tried two other ip cam, one is the lowest price.  This one the wifi range is probably one fifth of the Foscam, and the web interface is problematic, sometime I can connect to the GUI, but sometimes I have to power down the camera  to re-connect.  So that one went back.I bought a second one from the same company, but with IR-Cut feature, but this one also suffer the same problem with short range of WIFI, and the web interface is also sporatic, at few instances, i had to power down and restart before I can manage or view it again.The biggest problem with these two camera, is when viewing thru WIFI, the frame rate is about 2 frames per seconds, so when you pan or tile or when the subject moving, it's like watching a comic strip very bad lag.When I ping those two cameras it get 50% or higher lost packets.So, then I finally broke down and open my wallet for the 8910W from ebay, sorry Amazon, you did not have the PRIME on the item I needed at the time.  The new camera came in with nicer looking exterior shell, very quite when panning/tilting.  The range is equally good  as 8918, and reach much further than the other two previous camera.  I can monitor both WIFI cameras and both frame rate are acceptable, i say 10-15 per second.  The color is much better with 8910 due to the ir-cut filter, so if you want accurate color, this is the one to get.The only thing I can hope for is lower price on these cam so I can get a few more!

Reviews.Title: Great camera - but not IE9 compatible
Reviews.Author: FLcyclist
Reviews.Content: Great camera with decent images at night in low light.  Great quality for the price too -- crisp color images during daytime.  Setup can be an issue - this model crashes PC if using IE 8 or 9.  Resorted to using Chrome without an issue, but limited menu of camera features.  Nice to be able to pan/tilt camera from iPhone or PC while on travel and the motion alarm that sends an email whenever movement detected is sweet! Had no problem with Foscam customer service -- took under 2 hours to configure and connect.

Reviews.Title: Better than previous F18918W, but...
Reviews.Author: Etienne
Reviews.Content: This is a very good product, with an excellent price/performance ratio. The image (colors) are much more accurate that the previous F18918W, thanks to the IR cut filter.But, there's a minor downside : this cam doesn't tilt as much as the other one (I would say about 100° rather than 120). So if you want to point it downside, the previous one is better. This is not a malfunction, as I ordered several ones, and all have the same characteristics. I think this is a software limitation, because if yI move the cam gently by hand, I notice the it can tilt much further. One more thing : be aware that the dyndns services are not free anymore.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, Great Value
Reviews.Author: akakpaws "akakpaws"
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this camera.  It provides a very good image day and night.  The windows app provides extensive control of the unit and it is very responsive to control inputs over wifi or the Live Cam Pro App for Ipad.  The IR mode provides a surprisingly good image in total darkness. I did have some difficulty getting things going online and on the IPad app.  I am not real familiar with a lot of the procedures and terminology  required for online access setup.  So it took me a few days to get things going.  It was a learning experience for me.  I had a couple of setbacks when I rebooted the camera.  As I understand it the camera generates a new address each time it reboots, which then requires updating the original setup.  So I am trying to avoid rebooting.  Otherwise I am very satisfied with this purchase.  It is great to be able to monitor things at home from anyplace I can access the internet!

Reviews.Title: NOT WORTH THE EFFORT!!
Reviews.Author: Stephen J. Nardi
Reviews.Content: The camera itself is well made and works well in a LAN network. If you just want to use them to view places within your network, the wireless feature does the job. BUT, if you want to use multiple cameras over the internet---forget it. The software won't support more than one camera via your static IP address. So in order to use the multi-camera function, you must get a dyn/dns host address($20/yr) do port forwarding etc. The setup is maddening. The instructions are very poorly written and there is NO support unless you buy the cameras form Foscam U.S. However,Foscam US will give you support for $60 plus more for each additional camera. I'm sending them back asap and luckily I'm only out the 9 hours I spent screwing around with them! They are just too maddening and not worth the effort.Update: I finally got several of these cameras set up via Dyndns service. They worked fine for a few days. Then each camera refused to connect at different times. I had to access each camera thru the LAN network and re-program the dyndns and upnp functions in order to be able to access the camera on Dyndns. The whole reason for buying these cameras was to be able to remotely view my house while I'm away. Doesn't work when you have to physically have to be in your network in order to fix each camera seperately as it fails. I'm stuck with 6 of them and they're worthless to me. Don't even think of buying Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Works great but set up could be easier
Reviews.Author: Richard Rodriguez "pacifictreat"
Reviews.Content: Took a week to set up this camera because there are variables for each router you will be using to port forward. The instructions Foscam provides are adequate if you have a normal router. In my opinion the Uverse router is not normal because it makes you take extra steps other routers do not. So after days of research I finally figured it out and the camera now works great. When time allows I will update my set up procedure.

Reviews.Title: Perfect!
Reviews.Author: Cumerin
Reviews.Content: Paid for itself withing two weeks! It does everything except zoom. Use IE to access audio. Remote accessible by Laptop, Ipad and smartphones.

Reviews.Title: Great for the price
Reviews.Author: Jane
Reviews.Content: The reviews warning about technological difficulties are correct - if you're not ready to have a few frustrating nights wrangling your router's settings, get another camera.  If you're a tech-pro or patient, this camera is great.  I use it to keep an eye on our place, and it's easy to control from a mobile phone.  The infra-red works great.  The wide angle combined with the pan/tilt gives you a massive view.  Does what I bought it to do!

Reviews.Title: Easy setup - great features!
Reviews.Author: LinuxGuy
Reviews.Content: This camera is very easy to set-up - in a matter of minutes you can get it online and functional.I want to point out a few of the features that I found to be very useful.Once setup on your local network (LAN), you can access it from many devices (I have successfully accessed it from a chromebook, a Kindle, an iPhone, an iPad, a Debian Linux pc, and several Windows 7 laptops.)  You can control pan and tilt from your PC (or other device) as well as change the administrative settings (with a username/password.)The device can, on alert, send images to e-mail accounts or if you set up a FTP location, to a folder on a FTP drive.  The alert can be on motion and/or sound.  I have tried all of these options with success.  I have found for me that the e-mail on alert is best to my liking.  You get an alert and a picture as soon as a motion or sound triggers it.Another feature that takes a little more technical skill to set up is the ability to access the camera from any location on the internet.  The setup on the camera is fairly easily but on your router, you will need to modify settings to allow the camera to be accessible through the internet.  In normal operations, your router would block these type of access attempts as a security measure.  You can selectively allow allow open ports to access the camera and keep your LAN secure.  There are decent instructions in the manual that makes this setup easier.  I also tried this function and it works great as well.  It is very nice to be able to look over your house when you are away from home.The infrared works very well also for night pictures.The picture resolution is as stated in the specifications.  If you want a higher resolution image, you should look at the more expensive version of this camera.Last point is that there are several free apps on the apple store for the FOSCAM that allows you to view up to 8 cameras.  If you have an iPhone or iPad, these making viewing multiple cameras very nice and an improvement over using a browser.I have had the camera for about 6 weeks - I am pleased with the operations and functionality.  If this is your first use of an IP camera, this would be a good choice and great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: I'm impressed.  Lots of bang for buck, 5 stars
Reviews.Author: Stealthy like a cat
Reviews.Content: Just received this item today and I'm very happy with its capabilities especially for the price.In addition to the required stuff, they include a CAT5 cable and even a nice wall/ceiling mount.I like the SR-71 matte black finish, seems to be designed and built well.  The pan/scan capability is smooth and excellent.It took me just shy of 2 hours to get everything 100% setup, config over wire first then connect to protected WIFI, setup static IP with non-80 port, forwarded port in the router, setup DDNS, install and setup iPhone app to connect from outside the firewall, setup/test alarm schedule plus email notifications and image upload.It's got a great menu... whatever you want to setup, it's in there.  Whatever information you want, including logs of each time the unit noticed a sound, it's there too.If I had one wish for this cam, it would be a higher image resolution (as in 1080p).  I would also expect such a thing to be more expensive.I also have a Tenvis on the way, it will be interesting to see how these two guys work together software-wise.

Reviews.Title: Despite previous firmware issues, a good experience so far.
Reviews.Author: ExplodingEvo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera about a month ago for use with an iSpy server for home security. I was a little wary due to the reviews, but now I'm ready to declare, I like this camera and it's been working for me so far. Bought almost 2 months ago.This camera runs 24/7 and it has provided faultless service. I have received notifications regarding firmware updates but have not installed them yet. I'm currently on firmware:  11.37.2.52. I'll have to check the forums to see if there are any issues with the updates.Never forward things like this over the internet. You should always remote in using an encrypted connection before connecting to the camera, whether it's a VPN on your router or using Teamviewer to get on a computer at home, then viewing the camera. The lack of security is not worth the convenience.I was already using iSpy before I purchased this camera so I have not bothered with whatever software/monitoring/alerting it has. I have used the web interface locally and had no problem getting the sound to work to listen.I would like to put this outside under a porch, but not sure how it'll hold up, I guess the only issue it could face would be due to humidity? That and thieves or vandals, I read that if you have it behind glass, the IR doesn't work. Lame.One major problem is that I am now addicted to looking at my house when I'm gone. I constantly want to pull things up and check the cameras (even though I have alerts set). It's too much fun to play with the camera and move it around... it could really affect my work if I get more of these cameras.I'll update if there are any issues with the camera in the near future, but I give it a thumbs up. I noticed there was a new version of this camera, but I have the one in the picture, I'd like to paint it up and make it look like the minion from Despicable Me.

Reviews.Title: Every parent should have this
Reviews.Author: P. Roth
Reviews.Content: I can't count how many times a day we use this camera. Being able to watch your child from anywhere - home or away, is fantastic, reassuring and super helpful.We access the camera from our smartphones, tablets and computers. Most the time we don't have audio turned on, but having the capability is helpful. We can also remote-control the camera, and although it's swivels almost silently, we tend to limit it because our child often notices.The infrared capability is top notch, allowing us to clearly see what's going on in the room even when it's pitch black. Naturally, the image isn't as great as in daylight but definitely acceptable. An HD camera would be cool (this one is only 480p or so), but I'm wondering how much bandwidth that would need. May not always be feasible when accessing from afar on a cell or slow wifi connection.Setting up the IP address internally is pretty easy. Setting up outside access is a little trickier (I used no-ip.org) and perhaps confusing to some since the camera effectively has two different addresses. Foscam should have a server DNS service to make this a bit easier.Bottomline: Forget the one-trick pony babycams you buy in stores. The IP cam is the way to go because you always have a device handy on which to view the video stream (any smart phone, tablet, or computer).

Reviews.Title: Horrible
Reviews.Author: kevin kenney
Reviews.Content: Ok so if you want to get this camera set up you will call India and they will get it set up no problem. I try to open the camera on my iPhone and it maybe shows up 50% of the time and when it does it's slow to no motion! It's horrible.

Reviews.Title: Old Technology
Reviews.Author: Jackov O'ltreidz
Reviews.Content: Archaic feel compared with the new things out there. Nightmare if you have to work across Mac and PC platforms and not secure at all.

Reviews.Title: Broke in 2 months
Reviews.Author: Catherine Penix
Reviews.Content: My husband and I bought this for our trip to France. We left our baby with my mom and this camera enabled us to see him while we were all the way in France! Great, but when we returned and I planned to use for a baby monitor, it stopped working!

Reviews.Title: eas to set up
Reviews.Author: Peter Saunders
Reviews.Content: I have been using the Foscam for about a week now.  It has been very easy to set up for remote control and I have found a number of iPhone apps to use for it as well. The Foscam iPhone app is not very good and so you will need to buy a paid version from a 3rd party.  I bought the Surveilance PRO app and it is excellent.  I recommend the product.

Reviews.Title: these things are a waste.
Reviews.Author: rich
Reviews.Content: what good is a camera that always resets and points at the sky. very big waste of money.. would like my money back for this crap.picture is dull and grainy. spend more to get more. the picture reminds me of when i used to have the very first camera phone the photos looked like crap. thats what this cam produces. dont waste your time and money

Reviews.Title: Crappy camera
Reviews.Author: the_picky_amazon_mom "SC"
Reviews.Content: The camera would go offline all the time. I would have to unplug power and plug it back in to get it to work and sometimes it wouldnt even come back so I would wait and after few hours I would see it come back online. Totally useless camera if it does that! I would not recommend it.

Reviews.Title: using as baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Donna Cockcroft
Reviews.Content: Ordered this to use as a baby monitor. It works great. Love that I can move it and listen in from the app on my phone or computer.

Reviews.Title: faulty camera, do NOT buy
Reviews.Author: beanrocks "xbean"
Reviews.Content: I bought from homedepot and luckily I returned it in time. I first thought I got a lemon but I realize I am not alone after reading the most helpful review here.

Reviews.Title: Freezes and reboots when pointed outdoors.
Reviews.Author: David Gutierrez
Reviews.Content: Freezes and reboots when pointed outdoors. Foscam support was useless! Hopefully they will fix this issue soon. Blah blah blah

Reviews.Title: Most of the functions work while plugged in...
Reviews.Author: Peter Walker
Reviews.Content: Most of the functions work while plugged in to the network. Once you configure it wireless. The camera stop responding and must refresh camera and clear cache out continuously when you wish to view via webpage. This happens in Chrome, FireFox and Safari. Tried upgrades and then tried to go back to the first firmware.... you get what you pay for.

Reviews.Title: Parts Missing
Reviews.Author: R. Henley "mobetah"
Reviews.Content: Upon receiving the item, I noticed that the power cord and Ethernet cable were both missing.  The camera appeared to be a returned item.  At this point, was not sure whether to contact Amazon or Foscam.  Tried emailing and calling Foscam on several occasions to get the part, however this was a nightmare.  Not only did the people on the phone not speak English very well, they had a very hard time comprehending.  I eventually got the parts 2 weeks later, however so much for paying extra for expedited shipping

Reviews.Title: It is good, despite obvious issues
Reviews.Author: Ron V "ron_v"
Reviews.Content: I was very hesitant in getting this camera because of the rating distribution it gets.This camera has many features, more than I initially expected. It also has some obvious bugs that were not addressed properly.Depending on your networking knowledge, it might be difficult to set-up. This is not a product defect, but the reality of networking equipment landscape. The manual might not be sufficient for you to solve all your problem. However, if you have good networking knowledge and you know how to login to your router, you should be fine.Image quality of this camera is only acceptable; there is no more details to be seen when you zoom in (e.g. compared to point-and-shoot or smartphone).It has Infrared lights that can turn-on at night. This is invisible to the human eye, best for security applications.It has a web interface and can be operated/monitored from a smartphone. The former could use much polishing. On a smartphone, it is close to ideal.The camera can alert you on sound or motion detection. It can also register with (free) no-ip service for actual DNS resolution, i.e. you have a real fixed web address despite getting only dynamic IP address.You can install it straight or upside down and get about 270 degrees of swivel and correctly aligned image.These are the issues I found with this camera:* Certain image can cause the camera to crash and restart.* Web interface has multiple issues: + right/left/up/down sometimes are 'sticky', will continue moving too much; yet other times don't do anything. + loosing image sometimes.* Presets are not returned to accurately.* Image details are blurry at night (with IR)

Reviews.Title: Freezes up and drops signal too much.
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: Camera worked fine for 3-4 days then started freezing up and dropping signal.  Was so bad I could not use it and I returned it for credit.

Reviews.Title: Faulty sensors, otherwise good products
Reviews.Author: FX4
Reviews.Content: I purchased 5 Foscam IP cameras last year, and they are affected by the faulty sensor issue extensively published by other customers.However, I just read the response from Foscam willing to replace these products. I just contacted FOSCAM-US customer service, and was told to send them an email, and that within 24 hrs I would get replacements.. Sounds too good to be true, but if that's the case, I will be willing to review the rating and give it 4-5 star.I like these products, but the malfunction of these sensor renders these cameras useless at times.Also, their power supply is very weak at best, already had to replace two of them.Otherwise, very good products for the price.Will see what type of response I get from FOSCAM..I am not requesting money back, just want to get good working products without these faulty sensors..

Reviews.Title: Great IP cam for the price
Reviews.Author: grem55
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. 640x480 satisfactory resolution. Indoor! IR glare makes shooting from inside window impossible. It does what it claims to very well

Reviews.Title: Tech support
Reviews.Author: T. Broeski
Reviews.Content: Unit would not connect to Wifi. 2 hours total with tech support over two days.  Hard to understand overseas persons.  They really try hard to help.  Final assessment defective camera.  Returned for replacement.  Will see how that goes.

Reviews.Title: Did not work
Reviews.Author: henry lee good
Reviews.Content: Sent it back could not geet it to work???what can i say it did not work?sounds good but did not work!!

Reviews.Title: Wireless just does not work.
Reviews.Author: Churk Leung
Reviews.Content: Opened the box and watched the video that came with it spoken by a aweful accent 1/2 Chinese / 1/2 British and fully not understandable. Fortunately I am able to figure out what I need through reading the forums. From the looks of it, I am not the only frustrated person who can not get the wireless to connect. I have 3 access point, one on each floor of my house, and this camera can not connect to any of them. Forum suggest get on my knees and pray to what ever god I worship and hope it works. Unfortunately I don't pray to any god, therefore it didn't work. Long story short, I got a dud and I am in good company. So I am returning it.Specifics on my wireless if anyone is looking in the future and curious if their hardware is compatible.I have a Verizon N router that can with my FIOS.I also have a Cisco E4200, 2.4Ghz in mixed mode, and WAP2, and 5.4Ghz in N-mode olnly and WAP2.I also have an Asus AC66U, same setup as the E4200.While it is hard wired into the router, it is able to get an IP and I can see video. But when I setup the wireless, it never gotten an IP and never connected to any router. And unplugging the Ethernet cable rendered this camera useless.

Reviews.Title: not good ... power addapter quit working in a couple of months ....
Reviews.Author: DesertIce "DesertIce"
Reviews.Content: This camera quit on me in 2 months after installation..... I tried to troubleshoot the problem and used my AVO meter to test the voltage on the adapter outlet.... nothing..... seems that the adapter died in this short time... too bad :(  DO NOT BUY @!@@

Reviews.Title: Excellent product.
Reviews.Author: John M. Seger
Reviews.Content: Camera is everything that it is described as. Foscam has one of the better ip cameras. Directions are very clear and support is excellent. Picture is great. Nice camera.

Reviews.Title: It works good.
Reviews.Author: J. Aman "flippy"
Reviews.Content: I've not had any problems.  The Blue Iris software can be frustrating at times, but the camera has worked without an issue.

Reviews.Title: Faulty
Reviews.Author: telstar
Reviews.Content: I have had this camera less than two months and it just keeps rebooting itself, it seems to be a common problem. I wish I had read these reviews before I bought it.

Reviews.Title: My second one and I love it.
Reviews.Author: RP1957
Reviews.Content: This is my second one. The first has been working great for almost 2 years now and so I decided to add another to my network. Took a bit of doing to configure my router and the camera properly, but now I can view/control  both cameras from my iPhone... home or away.

Reviews.Title: The product is okay. BUT DON'T buy from warehousedeals
Reviews.Author: june
Reviews.Content: Do not buy used ones because the admin password is changed and the reset button cannot reset that. Just bought new one and it is good.

Reviews.Title: Spy on my doggies
Reviews.Author: Corrie James
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to spy my doggies!  It's small, compact and is feature rich!  It shows a crisp picture, I'm actually blown away at how crisp it is.  I downloaded an app on my iphone which allows me to watch away from home (and even talk to my doggies) and I love it! I would highly recommend this!  Setup can be confusing to non-technical folks but if you read and follow the instructions you should be fine.  The hardest part is configuring your network router (should you need to).

Reviews.Title: Works but it's plagued by software issues and bad support/documentation.
Reviews.Author: David G
Reviews.Content: Typical clone product.After much effort I don't have a reliable security system.  External and internal software crashes or is not compatible with the latest Mac OSX software as suggested.  I have no problems with any other software on my computer.  Some blame goes to bad external. security software for the Mac.Amazon called me with concern about the number of items that I return.  I try to take the blame.  But some items just don't work well.  Amazon is a great company.  Some products just aren't up to par.I will order a name product and if I have the same problems I'll come back and make appropriate comments.PROS:1. Cheaper than the name brand products.2. Good picture quality during the day or at night.CONS:1. No proper item details and specifications. The extension is around 8 feet and it includes a wall/stand mount so don't by accessories as suggested by Amazon or user comments which are ill advised and wrong.2. Firmware is not up to date.  The upgrade is not easy for a non-techy person.3. Provided software doesn't work well.  Can't monitor externally even though I have good bandwidth.  IP locator crashes.4. Incompatible with external monitoring software.  In all fairness most of the issues could be with them.5. Black color is cheaper but uglier (I should blame myself)6. Amateur support video from Foscam website7. Bad documentation.  No good quick start guide.

Reviews.Title: Never worked wireless
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: Good luck with support in another country. After many phone calls, they said I had a defective camera.  I had to pay to send it back.  It wasn't my fault they sent me a defect, why should I pay?  Then the 2nd was didn't work either.  They just wanted to keep changing setting after setting, sop noting else that you had working wireless would work.  After several phone calls, just gave up!  Had to change all the setting back so that my Wii, ipad and other devices would work again.

Reviews.Title: Constant freezes; unusuable
Reviews.Author: R. Morris
Reviews.Content: I had to return this camera because it suffered from the same defect that a lot of previous reviewers had noted. In my case, if I point it outside, even with brightness turned down very low on the camera's settings, the camera's firmware crashes, making a manual reboot necessary and not capturing any images during that time. This is obviously a problem since that is precisely why I bought the camera, and I don't want to have to constantly worry that pointing it at the wrong kind of scene might cause it to malfunction (and what if I'm away from home and can't reboot it to "fix" the problem temporarily?). I had a similar problem with a D-Link camera that I bought, and I'm still looking for a suitable camera that doesn't have this problem. I thought I would be lucky with this one; I was not.
