It was also unable to connect to my WiFi (and I don't even have spaces or odd characters in my SSID or password), so I was stuck using Ethernet.The small subset of this camera's features that I was able to explore seem in line with other cameras at similar pricepoints: optional recording on motion detecting, ability to e-mail images or upload to FTP server, and so on. Unfortunately, because of the major problem I just mentioned, I didn't get to test these features much. It also seems to be missing the ability to record actual video instead of a series of JPEGs, but that also seems pretty common with less expensive cameras like this.

Reviews.Title: Pans around room uncontrolled.
Reviews.Author: J. Watts "AFW"
Reviews.Content: This camera worked great for about 3.5 weeks then the camera out of the blue started panning around the room uncontrolled.  It was another few weeks before my husband was back in town to try to fix it.  He is a tier two electrical engineer that specializes in computers could not fix the issue. After reading other reviews, this is common and known problem by Foscam. We have tried all the "recommended" ways to fix this issue without any success.The only way to keep it from panning the room is to break the camera so it will stop moving.We were about ready to purchase 7 more Foscams but extremely glad we did not or we would have really been out some serious money.If someone comes up with a fix later that works for us, I will change my rating. But as of now, it feels like we held $80 above a flame and burned our money. What a waste.

Reviews.Title: WAY TO HARD TO SETUP
Reviews.Author: Jana Martinez
Reviews.Content: We tried for two days to set this camera up.  We finally had to pay someone to come in & set it up.  It still freezes.  It won't save record times.  I can't get it to connect to my phone.  Not user friendly!

Reviews.Title: This camera sucks
Reviews.Author: Thai
Reviews.Content: I can't get the email notification to work. I can't get the motion sensor to work. Nobody in support has a clue. The picture quality sucks. All I can do is remote into it and view around. Not worth money. I heard this is just the same camera from China like all the rest that look similar.

Reviews.Title: difficult device
Reviews.Author: martha bridges
Reviews.Content: the foscam was very difficult to connect to much information to get the camera to work. no one in my house had the patient to work with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Logan T.
Reviews.Content: For the price- it's great.For what you may be expecting... it's not so great.The lens absorbs too much light during the day, sometimes shutting down the camera all togetherThe range is great, and controls are slower than my other cameras, along with feedback-delays are big.still - fun little toy

Reviews.Title: Great baby cam!
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey D. Bennett
Reviews.Content: Works great as a baby room cam with your iPhone or iPad.  This model come to me by recommendation.  The range of motion down could be better

Reviews.Title: Best babycam ever!
Reviews.Author: AlwaysBuyingFromAmazon
Reviews.Content: We have three of these networked in our house. One over each of our twins' cribs. Although they were a real pain to set up, they were well worth the effort. We can check on our babies from anywhere and the night-vision is great.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: Mr Blacksheep
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to keep an eye on my place when I'm away from home.  It does take a little knowledge of computer network setup to make a quick install but the installation guide that comes with it does a pretty good job of walking you through set up if you have never done it before.  I can now check in on my place from my iphone or ipad anytime. It also allows you to listen to the sound around it and speak through the camera if you have a fast enough connection when monitoring.  The software included takes a little to learn but works well once set up.  I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Love it
Reviews.Author: kdog
Reviews.Content: Works great is exactly what they say it is handy easy to set up for your Mobil device pretty good pic

Reviews.Title: Camera freezes when used outside.
Reviews.Author: Thomas F. Smith
Reviews.Content: The camera works fine in the house, but if you try it outside, it will freeze and reboot over and over.  Foscam claims they fixed this problem in November 2013, but I got my camera in Feb 2014 and the issue still exists.

Reviews.Title: As with out door camera.
Reviews.Author: Carson & Judy Liebenow
Reviews.Content: As with  Foscam FI8919W Outdoor Pan and Tilt Wireless IP Camera.  This camera isn't worth the time or money spent.  I have 2 other camera's with Nexia Home but I can't pan or tilt.  I wanted some camera's so I could look around my home while we are out on the road.  This clearly isn't a good choice.  Shortly after we left home I tried to look at my 2 indoor and 2 outdoor camera's and they were offline.  I looked at my nexia camera's and could see them so it wasn't my wifi problem it was the camera's.  I will try foscam when I get home to see if they can fix it or give me my money back.

Reviews.Title: Worthless... Wireless connection - impossible
Reviews.Author: Bud
Reviews.Content: Called tech support, waited 30 minutes for a rep, only to be dismayed at the language barrier and inability to get my wireless connection up and running. The cam only works wired directly to the modem. NOT what I bought it for.

Reviews.Title: It worked fine initially for 2-3 days then started moving on its own !!!!!
Reviews.Author: androlover
Reviews.Content: It worked fine initially for 2-3 days then started moving on its own !!!!!I found on forums that many people having the same problem and it in fact get worse day by day rebooting constantly.It worked fine initially which surprises me why it started acting up later on... I regret the return but I had no choice.Other good things were, PTZ, movement, image clarity wide angle, night vision, wireless (never tried though)

Reviews.Title: works okay, but has some unfavorable characteristics
Reviews.Author: DealBreaker
Reviews.Content: The setup was very easy, and the image quality is good.  However it frequently produces a "clicking" sound whenever a shadow passes through its viewing area, or the room's light transitions.  I believe this sound is the IR filter turning on and off.  The filter helps the image quality, but the noise is unacceptable for us, since we use it as a baby monitor.  I've also found myself having to reboot it almost daily, as its wifi connection seems to fail frequently.  After a reboot, it's fine.  I've had better luck with the less expensive Wansview camera, although it's more difficult to set up.

Reviews.Title: average
Reviews.Author: Marvin Tiamzon
Reviews.Content: average camera, there are other brands that have the same features at lower prices.. easyn has same features at lower price.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value, but takes time to set up
Reviews.Author: Raye R
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera has exceeded my expectations. It does an amazing job for the price. I'm using it for a security camera and it the image quality is fine for that purpose. I'm still exploring the features.Four stars instead of five because it took me 4 evenings to get it set up, connected to wireless router, and set up port forwarding so I can see it from outside my home network. I'm technically competent, but not an IT professional. This is the first time I've logged into my wireless router since I set it up probably 8 years ago. To be fair, I lost one whole evening because I missed checking the port forwarding "enable" box on my router. Doh!I could have done this job entirely by referring to the product manual, which is actually pretty good. It is terse, you need to read and look at the illustrations carefully. Most of my problems were from misreading. (Like not noticing the check in the "enable" box. Still kicking myself over that one!)I had a hard time with the wireless setup, because I misread the instructions. So I went to the Foscam website for wireless setup [...], and read that the product does not work with 802.11/n wireless routing protocol.  Which is what my wireless router and everything that connects to it uses. I am happy to report that this is dead wrong. The camera works fine with 802.11/n protocol.If you read the reviews, the place people get stuck is at port forwarding. That was my biggest challenge too. I was lucky that I have a Linksys wireless router and the product manual has screenshots that exactly match my router setup screens. If you have a different router I see that Foscam has instructions for many popular brands at:[...]Here are some specific details to my installation, which may help those with similar systems. Our ISP is Time Warner. We have a cable modem hooked up to an old Linksys wireless router. Time Warner does not block ports. (At least in CA, as far as I can tell.) I did not have to set up port forwarding on my cable modem, I found some on-line instructions about double port forwarding that were a red herring. I don't think it is necessary or possible to set up port forwarding on a cable modem. I did have to set up port forwarding on my wireless router.I used the free Foscam DDNS with no problems. There is a label on the bottom of the camera with an IP address that you can access from any browser or phone. You have to follow the manual instructions to enable it, and set up a static IP. But it worked well for me. I did not need to buy a domain name from DynDDS or other third party. I can access and control the camera from any PC and from my smart phone. Pretty cool.Something I love about this camera is that when it is configured properly you can just unplug it and move it anywhere within the range of the wireless router. Want to watch the kids? The dog? The garage? No problem.Next steps for me are to figure out motion detector alarms and how to record video, preferably off site. And I haven't gotten audio working yet.I will buy another of these cameras. Possibly several. And I will recommend it to my friends.And I expect to help each of them configure the thing.

Reviews.Title: Simple and Easy
Reviews.Author: T. Nielsen "Techie Tom"
Reviews.Content: I gave this product a five star review because of how easy this was to setup.I had this webcam fully setup and installed (non-wall mounted) in about 30 minutes.I am using this product in the bedroom shared by my 2 1/2 year old and 9 month sons.The infrared night vision feature works great!  The red IR lights are very dim so as not to disturb the room.The camera is VERY quiet when using the pan and tilt features (no zoom).  You cannot hear it at all so it will not disturb anyone in the room.  There is a small click sound (hardly noticeable) when turning the IR filter on/off.The network activity lights can also be turned off to keep the amount of disruption this camera could cause for night sleeping to a minimum.I would definitely recommend this camera for nurseries or as a home security camera as well.There are settings to allow automatic left/right or up/down panning (either or, not both at the same time) for monitoring the area.This is a very good camera for the price and I intend to purchase more.

Reviews.Title: best purchase ever
Reviews.Author: coco
Reviews.Content: have to be honest did not set it up myself I asked my brother to do it, but now at work I use my ipad to watch my yorkie everydaythank you foscam

Reviews.Title: it works... most of the time
Reviews.Author: Mark Fassett
Reviews.Content: I've kept it up to date with firmware/etc, but it still seems to lose connections fairly often.  Not sure if it's the model or my network, though my other non-foscam cams seem to be more stable.I'm in the market for a couple more cameras but I'm going to try a different brand.

Reviews.Title: impossible to get it  to work...
Reviews.Author: Kenny
Reviews.Content: unless you are a techies.  to hook this up you have to know computer and its lingo. definitely not user friendly.  I wanted it to work so bad but I couldn't to it.

Reviews.Title: works great....if you get it to work
Reviews.Author: Karttez
Reviews.Content: Good camera when i get it to work. I purchased this item as a nanny cam, to view from work (remotely from my iphone or computer). It does not work!!!! After 3 days and numerous phone calls to foscam customer support, im still unable to see cam from my iphone. Customer support fixes the problem, but the fix only lasts hours. Very frustrating. Now i have to pay shipping costs to return it. SMH.Oh, there is no need to purchase an additional swivel kit. CAmera comes with kit.

Reviews.Title: OK As Long As you Use Internet Explorer
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I was excited to get my new Foscam FI8910W wireless camera.  Upon opening the box I was pleased with the look and feel of the hardware.  I plugged it in and was able to successfully configure the network interfaces.  The picture was OK and perfectly acceptable considering that it is VGA resolution with a CMOS image sensor.  If the software was a nice as the hardware (again...considering the price for the hardware comment) I would have rated the camera 5 stars.  The problem came when I tried to really use the camera with my browser of choice (Firefox).I found the camera to work acceptably well with Internet Explorer.  The web interface for IE uses ActiveX for displaying the video.  It was pretty snappy and the video was OK.  When I tried the "server push" interface which is intended for use with other browsers  the camera "bombed"  Even though the computer and camera were plugged into the same 100MB network switch the user interface kept freezing up.  I tried this with multiple computers including a 3ghz quad core windows 7 box but the results were the same.  Sometimes when panning stopped the image would retain motion blur from the last frame sent (I think that they use MJPG downloads for video).  The "killer problem" with this device is that after  a short period of use, the video stops working all together and there is an icon of a  "broken document with an X " where the video should be.  Once this happens the device has to be rebooted to get it to work again.  I tried it on several computers with the same results so the problem was definitely with the camera.I contacted Foscam support and their technician logged onto my computer remotely and when I showed her the problem she said that the only way to fix it was to run the camera at 320X240 resolution or to use internet explorer.I really wish that this had worked out for me because I still like the camera design and ergonomics.  Sadly, I just boxed it up and returned it because I don't, won't, and can't run Internet explorer.  Furthermore even if I could run IE  I can't count on everyone who will onto this camera to do the same.So...if you are the sole user of the device and always use internet explorer I could recommend this camera.  Otherwise, don't buy it.

Reviews.Title: Works well for indoor use, terrible for outdoor daytime use.
Reviews.Author: James L
Reviews.Content: I purchased this despite the very well documented issue with complex scenes, hoping that I'd receive a working version.After first setting it up the evening I received the camera I was pleased to see it working well inside my home and excited to test the night-vision via the infrared LED illumination. Over-night the camera worked well and I had a new-found insight into the nocturnal life of our cat (bathing, sleeping, occasionally running like crazy).The next morning, before work, I setup the camera to point out of a front window as I wanted to monitor the mailbox and various deliveries throughout the day. Once at work I connected to the camera to see what was going and was confused to find that I'd get a few frames of video and then lose connection. I initially blamed this on my phone and the WiFi signal at the office, as when I got home in the evening the camera was working perfectly again.It wasn't until the next day that I was able to observe the camera first-hand running during daylight. When the camera was facing the interior of the house it worked fine, but as soon as it was panned to point out the window it would immediately freeze. I was able to easily repeat this by holding the camera and manually pointing it out the window. Every time the bushes and grass came into shot the camera would freeze displaying a black frame. If the camera was quickly pointed away from the window it would recover and start streaming video, and once pointed back outside it would immediately lock up again.The only way I was able to operate the camera while pointing out of the front-window was to reduce the resolution down from 640x480 to 320x240. Once the resolution was reduced the camera worked perfectly, but the resolution was now so low it was impossible to identify anyone via the footage.When not freezing due to complex scenes the camera and it's PTZ mechanism worked well. When pointed out the window it failed dramatically.This camera didn't work for my intended use, I've now re-purposed it for use monitoring the interior of our home during the day and night. In this role it works perfectly.All-in-all this camera works well if you play to it's strengths.PROs:- Cheap- Wireless- Pan-Tilt-Zoom functionality- Two-way audioCONs:- Completely freezes and reboots when displaying complex scenes- Quite noisy image- MJPEG is a horribly inefficient compression method which uses way more bandwidth than needed.The only reason I gave this three stars instead of less is that when running inside the home it works as expected.

Reviews.Title: Cameras are okay BUT service and support are HORRIBLE
Reviews.Author: Sandy S "Sandy S"
Reviews.Content: I have ordered 8 of these particular cameras and 1 Foscam FI8919W Wireless Outdoor and my feedback/review here is based on my TOTAL experience with a) the cameras b) Amazon, and c) FoscamI'll start out by saying that I bought the Foscam cameras based on the reviews that I found on Amazon; I have not tried any other cameras so I can't really compare against other manufacturers. Based on this, I feel that the cameras are of good quality for the price you can get them for here on Amazon. I have seen the same cameras priced much higher elsewhere, so I'm glad I bought my F18910W's on amazon.com.The cameras come with a disk that installs a couple of different software utilities ... one of which is: Foscam IP Camera - I spent well over 2 hours trying to get this software to work  and finally emailed support - they were absolutely no help at all and told me I should use Blue Iris software (which is a $49.00 program that they sell). The Foscam IP Camera software does not even come with any documentation or help files. After trying to find anything of relevance on the forums and YouTube, etc. ... I gave up and purchased the Blue Iris software (more on that on my Blue Iris review).I did have a hardware problem with one out of the nine cameras and Amazon took care of this immediately upon receiving my email regarding the problem. I LOVE amazon.com ... they never fail to take care of any issues i have with anything.Now let me give you a little advice; don't make the same mistake that I made ... I was using one of the Foscam FI8910W to monitor my front yard/street. Because it was not an outdoor camera i had it inside just pointed out the window. Well, at night the IR (infrared) lights reflect off the window and the view is awful (extremely distorted). So I decided I would order the FI8919W outdoor camera. HERE'S WHERE I MADE MY MISTAKE ... I was given a coupon code that gave me a 10% off discount if i ordered the camera from the foscam.ca site, which I did, and I saved $16.50 off of the $165.00 price. WHAT A MISTAKE that was ... ordering from the Foscam.ca site. I checked the status of the order every day and it kept showing 'Processing' ... after a week I phoned them and was told the camera had already shipped and i should be getting tracking info shortly. Another day went by ... same thing ... phoned them and was told the camera shipped but still no tracking info. Then I emailed them and was told that the camera had not shipped and it was backordered. I told them I was furious at being mislead and to cancel my order. Within a half hour I received confirmation that they 'had just shipped' the order. I told them I needed this camera days ago and to expedite it ... they said 'too late' can't do anything about it now. O.M.GAAAAWD!!!!  What a horrible company.  I only wish I would have ordered this camera directly from amazon.com as I would have received it within two days (I ordered it on Jan 29th and according to the tracking it will not be here until Feb 13th). I am so disgusted with this company that I will never deal with them directly again ... and I wish i could find a comparable product just so I don't have to support their company again in the future.  Their tech support is horrible, their user guides are non-existent, and they intentionally mislead me.So in the end, let me say ... the cameras are okay; amazon.com is awesome as always; foscam.ca is the most unprofessional company I've ever dealt with.  In the end, if you buy their cameras you might want to check out their configuration videos at:foscam.us  and search for  mjpeg-setup-videos

Reviews.Title: Excellent value!!!
Reviews.Author: BisdakSaUSA
Reviews.Content: The latest model (FI8910W) is easy to install and connect to the home network. Just use the installation disc that comes with it. If you hate reading instruction manuals like I do, instructional videos by "AwkwardHamster" on YouTube will help tremendously--he provides excellent step-by-step instructions that even the ordinary tech noob can follow successfully. I got mine up and running, and connected to my network as well as my iPhone & iPad in less than 30 mins (it helps if you watch the videos ahead of time).Also, for iPhone/iPad users, I highly recommend downloading "FoscamPro" (a paid app). It is THE BEST app to use for this unit (not owned / affiliated by/with same company). Comes with audio support that normally is a paid in-app service when you get the free IP cam apps. A breeze to use!I bought my first foscam last Thursday and received it the following day! Ultrafast shipping! I'm so happy with its performance that I just ordered my second one today, and can't wait to set it up!Two thumbs way up!!!

Reviews.Title: Absolutely the best camera for it's price
Reviews.Author: James J. Yanacek
Reviews.Content: I purchased a D-Link DCS-5010L cloud camera several months ago basically because it advertises easy setup. That was true but the camera itself, the controlling software and the images are poor and are clunky and disappointing . My mom is 93 and lives in an apartment by herself. My siblings I alternate weeks taking care of her but we can't be there 24/7. She has fallen several times and can't get up on her own. I needed a reliable way to check on her at any time. The D-Link just wasn't a good choice.Because it had such high reviews, I bought the Foscam FI8910W in spite of complaints about the difficulty of installation. The software configuration of the Foscam does appear daunting and confusing. It was definitely more time-consuming and difficult than the D-Link, but I downloaded their videos so I could follow it step-by-step and pause and go back when necessary. In the end it is definitely worth the extra effort.Right out of the box the Foscam is obviously a much higher quality product, right down to the construction of the power supply and cord. Everything needed to install the camera is included in the box including the Ethernet cable needed to connect the camera to your WiFi router during initial configuration. When it is finally installed, the Foscam images and control software are light-years ahead of the D-Link. The D-Link made annoying clicking noises when panning and can only move a few degrees at a time. The Foscam panning movement is smooth and silent and is continuous as long as you wish. Thoughtfully, the Foscam software engineers included buttons to flip and mirror the images if you want to install the camera upside down on the ceiling. For the money, you just can't buy better than this.

Reviews.Title: Does not need a software to run this camera nor need to buy an ap to see on mobile devices
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed of the support I received and the camera do exactly what I need it to do. The sound is crisp the night vision is good enough to see what I need to see and the reaction time on the pan and tilt is fine on my device and online.Highly recommend it for the price you pay you get more!

Reviews.Title: Nice camera, terrible software
Reviews.Author: Charles Winebrinner
Reviews.Content: Beware the buggy Web UI and the potential security issues.  The camera itself seems pretty solid, but because of current and past issues with the Web UI (e.g., the ability to bypass authentication in previous versions), I recommend not making your camera publicly accessible (i.e., don't use port forwarding on your router to allow direct access from the Internet).  I personally use the SSH tunneling feature of JuiceSSH on my Android device to connect to it.  This requires more set up and probably isn't something that the average user is going to be able to easily accomplish, but, again, please be cautious about allowing direct access to devices like this from the Internet, especially if it is in your home.

Reviews.Title: WIFI NOT WORKING
Reviews.Author: Proceso Canlas
Reviews.Content: I purchase this camera because of the description that it has the capability for WIFI connection 802.11 bgn,but  was very dissapointed when I tried to use its WIFI function since it doesnt work at all! Works fine when it's connected via ethernet cable to the router. Tried to troubleshoot the problem for 2 weeks reading all comments from forum and its website, but was still unsuccessfull in connecting. The problem is it wont even detect my WIFI at home or any WIFI in the area. Even my router ( Apple Extreme) will not detect the device. Tried several approach from changing from changing my router's signal boradcast only 802.11 b,g only to assigning a static IP for the device, etc. I finally gave up and just assume that this cam doesnt have WIFI capability and was advertised incorrectly.

Reviews.Title: Good picture and sound for right price
Reviews.Author: The Kid
Reviews.Content: Bought to allow for remote monitoring of house.  Works great, good picture but no zoom which would have been nice.  Really good night vision as well but if you are looking for something inconspicuous this isn't it. Light ring around camera is infra red LEDs with shine red and are obvious, not an issue in my case.  Not too difficult to setup for remote viewing.  A little issues with initial setup but nothing major.  Would recommend.

Reviews.Title: Piece of junk
Reviews.Author: the savvy shopper
Reviews.Content: Took me over 1 hr to get to see the camera on the network connected to my Airport Extreme... and I've done previously advanced network and PC configurations. This camera would be absent from the network and the IP camera tool (which was unavailable for download on Foscam website) until I rebooted the camera several times.Then the browser interface is clumsy and you need yet other software in order to record video from this cam.This looks like a Chinese bare bone IP camera that could serve well people who already have a set up and the proper software but for the general public it provides a frustrating experience.

Reviews.Title: Good quality camera very hard to set-up
Reviews.Author: Neelum Sharma
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera after returning the summer infant wifi camera. The picture quality and panning ability of this camera is fantastic! The reason I'm giving this camera 4 stars is because it can take a whole day to set-up and configure the camera. I think you have to be technically savvy to get this camera going.

Reviews.Title: Two Way Audio For Mac!
Reviews.Author: Margaret B. Hamper
Reviews.Content: I definitely recommend this product, works wonderfully and easy set-up--especially for Mac users having a hard time finding an ip cam with two-way audio.There's no two-way audio for mac UNLESS you download a program through the app store for your phone and macbook--then it works wonderfully! I recommend uFoscam for macbook and FoscamPro for iOS. They're each under $10 and definitely worth it! Better than the in-browser stuff Foscam offers anyway!Enjoy!(P.S. I took off one star because Foscam doesn't offer two-way audio for Mac and I had to get third-party software to get the two way audio. Still love the camera though!)

Reviews.Title: Get What You Pay For
Reviews.Author: Norman Kingsley-sauer
Reviews.Content: Image quality is "meh" over wired connection, and a bit worse on wireless no matter how close it is to the access point. Night cam works fine and movement is pretty quiet but the cam can't serve up video at its full resolution and audio at the same time without stuttering - at least not over wireless. I haven't tested it wired with audio.The firmware download is a needless pain in the neck where you have to give them your email address and then - I kid you not - they email you links to the individual firmware files. As far as I can tell you will have to re-hit the registration link every time you want to check to see if there is a new version. Would not recommend this to anyone that wants audio or a reasonable UI.

Reviews.Title: Awesome - check your qos, and watch YouTube.
Reviews.Author: Frank Delmas
Reviews.Content: Giving a 5 star rating because the product exceeded my expectations, which is tough, being an it professional for 16 years.For those debating purchasing an IP cam, or are not satisfied with its quality after setting it up, make sure you have as good as a network setup as you can afford.  When it comes to IP video, most of the time, it's not the hardware, rather the qos of the network fueling the hardware.For corporate video conferencing, good qos means high end routers, gigabit switch ports, dedicated high bandwidth comm circuits, video/voice traffic isolation, and even data compression.  All of this costing at least 1k per month, depending on the level desired and budget.Now, Since these options aren't typically available for the home, we're limited to what our Internet service providers offer.  Mostly being that of increased Internet bandwidth.  For optimum, it's 'ultra', and for fios, it's 'quantum'.  For me, for just an extra $6 per month, my Internet speed service was essentially doubled, which is a no brainier.  Also look into static ip services, and higher end modems or routers if offered by your ISP.I also keep my IP cam hard wired, which contributes to higher connectivity stability and performance.  When wireless, there are several new things to consider for qos, so be weary of problems specific to the IP cam's wireless connectivity vs. hard wired.For those having issues even getting it up and running, or for those who want to research instalation steps before your IP cam even arives, which is what I did, search for your ip cam model in YouTube.  You will find several videos that walk you through the initial setup for local viewing and separate videos for advanced setup for remote viewing on your wireless devices.Just some general notes:Make sure you have installed the latest firmware before settin up remote access.Heavily password protect your ipcam and router before settin up remote access.Setup the IP cam with a static ip address(i.e. don't let it use DHCP settin.Don't setup the ip cam on port 80, use a different port.Inbound audio works very well., but for baby monitoring, I will depend upon a separate audio specific monitor for when I'm sleeping.Feedback is received if a remote device plays back inbound audio when near the IP cam.  Which is expected.  Move the remote device away from the IP cam mic.Viewing concurrency works well (I.e. multiple remote viewers at the same time.). I tested two.

Reviews.Title: Great support but not so good product - Updated!
Reviews.Author: Steve Larsen
Reviews.Content: The online support people are awesome.  They walked through getting this installed with patience and professionalism.  However, they can't make a product work if the electrical connection (or the wall wart power supply) just keeps loosing power.  It would go red, power up, work for a few minutes, then the unit would go dead.  We'd jiggle the cord a bit, plug and unplug the power, it would come back on, work for 5-10 minutes, then go off again.  This happened again and again.  Finally gave up and will have to send it back.UPDATE:  I just learned that this item cannot be returned. Deadline for that was January 13.  So, I am now out $76 on a product that is clearly defective - it won't power on.  Buyer beware!  If it does not work out of the box, send it back immediately or you will be stuck with it.  I'm out $76.

Reviews.Title: Nice cameras and simpler operation - but ...
Reviews.Author: SA Developer
Reviews.Content: The camera hardware and built in software are above average for cameras in the price range.After testing the built in software I don't really need the additional software from Blue Iris, but the camera listing did not make it clear that the built in software already had most of the same functions. The functions//features from Blue Iris are just better and handle more cameras simultaneously.Now for my MAJOR gripe. There are bugs in the built in software / firmware. The manual is abysmal! The mistakes are glaring and it required 2.5 hours of trail and error configuring, hard resets and testing to get it to work. Two and a half hours I will never get back, but it was the level of aggravation it caused that is burned into my memory especially when this could have been simply fixed by QA testing and proper documentation.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera but not for the faint hearted
Reviews.Author: sue loin
Reviews.Content: I bought three F18910W cameras.  As others have said, it is not a 1-2-3 set up.  But I weighed my options of going for the $199 Dropcam, which I bought my daughter and hers was easy to setup or saving $130 and going for the Foscam.  Since I needed three of them, I figured I would save $390 and besides, I like learning new things with tech so I decided to go for this one.Some differences of Drop Cam and Foscam.1. Drop Cam easy to set up vs. Foscam - let's just say its challenging2. Drop Cam is smaller and does not rotate - Foscam not only rotates around the whole room but when you access the camera from  your iPhone, just by touching the video and swiping your finger you can move the camera remotely.3. Drop Cam is set up from their website.  My daughter just popped the CD in and it took her directly to the website to finish setting up her cameras.  - Foscam runs off a CD.  Now this is where some information would help for those who are trying to set this camera up.Setup -The setup instructions say to plug the camera in power then the router.  Did this but had trouble opening the exe file and having it pick up the camera. Once it finally did pick up the camera it shows you the IP address of your camera. ex: HTTP://192.168.1.25 and then I sat there wondering what to do since the setup instructions shows a picture of an interface popping open.  This did not happen.  Called Foscam and was told my wait was 25 minutes.  While waiting I figured I would try to type this address into a browser.  At first it only worked in I.E but then I got it opened in Firefox.  Once in there you can change the camera name and your password.  Then I was told to change ports so there is no conflicts.  Now I am working on the alerts.  When I go to set up the Alerts and click on the choice to have motion detection and press submit , I come up with "400 Bad Request Can't parse request"  I am still working on this problem and will update this review when I figure out what that problem is.Now let's look at the software.  You will have to update the firmware first then the software second.  I am using an iPhone 4 and an iPad 2 for the software.  I downloaded both the free programs they have and both of them work fine on the iPhone but not so consistent on the iPad. I have iOS 6.1.3 on both.  Not sure if it's because I have little room left on the iPad and more on the iPhone but there is more inconsistency on the iPad. I will be upgrading to iOS 7 with more storage so I will update this review.------------------------------Update 1/29/14Called Foscam for support twice.  Both times the service was very professional and polite.  The first one, definitely from India was very hard to understand but he had the patience to stay with me an hour on the phone.  I allowed him to take control of my computer and he also could not get my camera to set the alarms.  He asked if he could do it from his computer and I gave him permission.  He was able to set the alarm from his computer so he said it was definitely something on my computer.  So then I had to get the other cameras programmed to send me email alerts and after disabling all my antivirus software and K-9 patrol, it still didn't work.  Then found out that in order to set the alarms, you have to click on the "Schedule" and then click on "set All" then it worked.  So I am not sure if it was a combination of things or if just this one thing made the difference.I had updated my firmware and software but this support person said they just release another update a couple days ago.  This seemed to make a difference.  I was able to use the ipCamera.exe file then click on the camera's IP address and the browser did open.I noticed that other posters stated that the support person makes you sign onto Amazon to rate them.  Well, this is how they work.  After you get done with the problem the support person must be instructed to ask where you bought the camera.  If you say Amazon and they are still in control of your PC, they literally try to sign onto Amazon for you and lead you through the process. I notice he went directly to my browser and typed in Amazon then attempted to go to the review site.  Since I do not have Amazon sign on automatically he asked me to sign on.  I politely and firmly told him that I would do it when I had time.  So saying all that, and without any pressure from any support person, I would still give this camera a 4-star rating for both the camera and the support they gave me.The second camera couldn't be seen on my network so I called Foscam support and it took him about 5 minutes to figure out what was wrong.  Wait time was not as long as I had feared.  Embarrassingly, I typed in the wrong password to my router.  Of course, I thought it was right but I must have left something out.  This is just a note in case someone else doesn't see their camera on the network and they think that the password is correct.The third camera wouldn't even start.  Again the support person took control of my PC and attempted to get the camera going by restarting and resetting it.  Nothing happened.  He immediately said to return the camera and they would replace it.  So I am working on that now. BTW, this one asked to rate them on Amazon and I told him I would do it later and he just let it go.  Never tried to sign onto Amazon for me.Foscam gives clear pics in the dark and clear pictures in the light.  I love being able to remotely move the camera around from my phone and I would recommend this camera.  I think that Foscam must have read the reviews and are making great strides in trying to upgrade consumers experiences._________________Update 1/30/14One camera was defective.  I had a choice to return it direct to Foscam but I would have to pay the shipping since I did not purchase it from their site or return it to Amazon.  I am returning it and asking for a replacement because I am very pleased with the other two camera's.Just a note on the software:  I found the free Foscam software to work just fine with my camera's.  There was a suggestion to try the Foscam Blue Iris Pro.  If you want to try that software you can download a trial version off CNet. [...].

Reviews.Title: Foscam NVISION FI89101
Reviews.Author: LIndsey Lyles
Reviews.Content: Just recieving my FIRST of any kind of webcam/security cam. My first thoughts is that the camera is really nice, clean look! however I spent the first two hours trying to figure out how to install my self and find the camera IP address...Then another hour on the phone with tech support.About an hour or so we finally diagnosed the camera to have bad hardware from the factory. So, my first camera will be returned and hopefully camera two wont have this or any other issue.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Purchase
Reviews.Author: Rex Jones
Reviews.Content: I got this cam just to play with, it's a lot of fun, but it is slow and low def for any real looking around. I am looking at some other options for my serious back yard animal watching and I may go with a full system. I do like the cheap tilt and pan for playing though, but I want something with 30 frames per second.

Reviews.Title: Disappointment
Reviews.Author: mesco
Reviews.Content: If you've purchased the FI9821W, don't purchase this item, it was a let down. Aside from the obvious differences in resolution and MJPG v H.264 this is a real problem child. Yes, it can run at at a high 20~30 fps (max setting), but good luck getting it to work at the optimized state. It reboots itself CONSTANTLY when I'm viewing it remotely (yes I've read that you can reduce framerate but A) REALLY should I have to reduce the quality of what the advertised framerate is? and B) The remote app I use doesn't allow for framerate adjustment at the app/camera level). I initially returned the first one I purchased thinking it was defective because of the constant reboots, but nope after a bit more research it's a terrible product defect that the manufacturer is well aware of and hasn't fixed. Before you assume I haven't done my homework, yes I have the latest firmware, UI, etc. But it just really isn't a great product. I would recommend purchasing the FI9821W BUT then Foscam still wins because you purchase their more expensive product. Anyway you cut this, don't purchase the FI8910W.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Carlos
Reviews.Content: good camera...good features..nice night vision...and have a good picture quality....The tech support is very good.I'm using this camera for my home security as well as to monitor my baby.

Reviews.Title: Great security camera
Reviews.Author: Larry Hines
Reviews.Content: I use this for monitoring the outside of the house when we are away. It works perfectly. It is rather simple to set up, but you must be familiar how to forward ports on your internet.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera AND technical Support
Reviews.Author: Mom2three
Reviews.Content: This thing is the future of video baby monitors!!! Seriously, why would you pay almost $300 when you can get a Foscam for under $100 and the picture is a million times better!!I was nervous to install this because of the mixed reviews. I am a stay at home mom with very little computer knowledge. If you read the manual exactly as it says, you will have no problem setting this up on your laptop with "local viewing". The hard part is when it comes to the "port entry" (wtf is that?) and setting it up to view from "remote setting" aka: on your phone or computer anywhere outside your router's wifi.I called tech support when I hit the hard stuff and they are great. They just do it for you in a matter of minutes!!! Done and done!  I called twice and the longest I had to wait was 8 minutes.Although there are a number of free "IP camera viewer" apps for iPhone, I chose to spent the $5.99 on Foscam Pro app. The reviews on the free apps were sketchy. The Foscam Pro app is easy and worth the extra few dollars. Now  I can see and talk to my toddlers from my phone--something I've always wanted to do!This camera is wonderful and the technical support at Foscam is extremely helpful. Leo helped me do the remote install for this camera and he did a "screen share" so that he could do it for me. It works great and I was very impressed with the customer service. Thank you Foscam!

Reviews.Title: Trying to setup Mail for Alerts and keep getting error:illegal params
Reviews.Author: Srinivas Vadrevu
Reviews.Content: 12/29/2014 update: With supports help, was able to move past the illegal params issue.needed to update firmware and restart the camera.I am now able to connect to the camera via Wifi and from the internet.Using a 3rd party app, i am now able to see my camera and online i am able to connect to is using Chrome and Safari.Realized that login to the camera is not secure!!!http!!! if that was https i would have greatly appreciated.The camera response time is poor when trying to control it from the internet - home internet connection is at 50mbps - so that is not it.At an alert level of 5 i am still getting false movement alarms.I guess I will keep the camera and will change the ratings to 3.Good luck to all of you!!!-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------Calling the help number now...Need to reset my Camera and try again... oh by the way, also need to upgrade my Firmware!!!If you not computer savy, don't buy this!Hope the next steps resolve the issue... stay tuned!

Reviews.Title: After three months of usage - I can't recommend it
Reviews.Author: SURFSNOW
Reviews.Content: Product sounds promising, but there are several issues I ran into that are showstoppers:1)  Reboots.  Unti seems to lose internet connection and/or reboot often, it then goes into search mode.  This issue is pointed out in a lot of the reviews.  The search mode "wandering" can be overcome by setting a position on start up, but that brings up the next issue.2)  Night vision.  There is now way to turn off night vision permanently.  You can turn it off, but the default is set to "on" when the unit reboots, which is often.  Why is this an issue?  I used the camera for keeping an eye on the yard via an inside window - so the night vision coming on would create a glare and render the unit useless.  Emails to support (which were responded to quickly) revealed that they can't fix this issue, so beware if you have thoughts of using it to monitor your yard via a window at night.3)  Bad JPEGs.  Unit is now creating pictures that are unreadable on my mac and iPhone.  This happens about 20% of the time.I wish the unit worked for me, but unfortunately I cannot recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera--Easy Setup
Reviews.Author: Bells
Reviews.Content: This is my 2nd Foscam and I love both of them.  The software is a little lame, but when used with Blue Iris it's perfect.  The setup was simple, the wireless range is great, and the night-vision is surprisingly good on this newer model.  I don't know why so many people have trouble with the setup, but mine was a cake walk.  I intend on adding more cameras and they will be Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Works Well, Does Pretty Much What I Need
Reviews.Author: ALCITR "ALCITR"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to be able to monitor a second home. I don't think the quick start guide is as good as the instructions on the included disc. Once it was all setup the wifi works great. I am able to move it to different parts of the house and plug it back in and it connects again without issue. I can log in from any internet connection to pan the camera and see what it sees.I have not setup the email notification yet. It would be perfect if it did zoom a bit but for the price it is a great purchase.

Reviews.Title: it is cheap but quality is great!
Reviews.Author: chin-hsiang ko
Reviews.Content: I almost bought a $300 baby monitor, but instead I thought to give this product a try.It works so well. I'm not that technical, but the instruction is easy to understand.I also installed the "surveillance pro" on my iphone. It works perfectly.For this price, I highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: Good camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Phillip Olexa
Reviews.Content: I dunno why they don't have any cheap PTZ cameras with 1080p video when there are tons of cheap 1080p webcams out there, but this one works reasonably well for the price.  I bought this as a nursery camera.  I don't think you could use this very well as a baby monitor because the audio quality really sucks, but the video is decent.  This is an MJPEG camera which won't look as smooth as an H.264 camera, but, it is a pretty solid camera, and keeps a connection well.

Reviews.Title: Tons of features, no need to relay through a vendor's web site
Reviews.Author: Jeantet Fields
Reviews.Content: Synopsis: I love these cameras because they're feature-rich, they work exactly as expected, and most of all they allow me to access them without having to go through a vendor's web site.  I intend to get a few more, and I just did recommend this camera to a friend.The biggest issue for me is that I do not want to be tied to a manufacturer's website. Let me explain: most IP cameras require you to log in to the manufacturers website, give them a ton of personal info, and *they* relay the camera images to you. For the sake of emphasis, this means you trust the manufacturer to relay personal video images out of your network through their web site. You are implicitly trusting them with live video feeds of your family and property, and worse- access to a device inside your network. That represents an enormous amount of trust that in my opinion has not been earned.  I figure a company with thousands of people's video feeds is a juicy target for hackers, while as an individual I am not.  Of course the reason these company-website relays exist is that it's easy for a layperson to implement.  You need to manually set up the Foscam and you have to know how to set up port forwarding in your own router.  If that's not for you, read no further.The Foscam cameras have an install CD, which I did not use; instead, I followed another reviewer's advice and set up the camera manually.  It took me less than 10 minutes.1. Plug the camera into an ethernet jack on your router and let it get an IP via DHCP2. Log into the router, get the camera's IP address from "attached devices"3. Use that IP to log into the camera using a browser (user: admin  pass: *blank* )4. Give the camera a static IP, set up a non-standard port  (camera reboots when you apply this)5. Set up WiFi  (camera reboots when you apply this)6. Go back into your router and set up port forwarding (which means your wan IP:port-number forwards to your camera)7. TaDaaa! it just works with any browser.  If you're slick you can use the following syntax to bookmark your camera: http://user:pass@IPaddress:PortNumber and not even have to deal with logging in each time (Microsoft disabled that syntax on IE... so use any other, more functional browser)8. As a basic security approach, I recommend you remove the default username (admin) entirely, and set up new users and passwords - this dramatically reduce your susceptibility to brute force attacks.The features are great: remote pan and tilt, IR light on and off, you can configure the camera to send emails to multiple addresses when it picks up movement and/or sound (sensitivity adjustable) and it can also send images via FTP.A very highly ranked review (that I voted helpful) expressed concern over a known hardware flaw with all Foscam cameras, but I have not encountered any problems with the 3 cameras I bought.  There's a decent iPhone app, which is perhaps a bit too simple but it's functional.  Lastly, if you're thinking of setting up the camera in a window so you can watch the front of your home (as I did), I recommend you consider the black camera instead of the white one, because I often see the reflection of the white camera in the window that I'm trying to see through. I don't know that the black one would be any better, I just know that I get a significant reflection with the white cameras :)Technically speaking, I'm a bit disappointed with the max 640x480 resolution, but to be honest, for the price, you can't beat it, and the image is very decent.  I'm also impressed with the auto-aperture range of these cameras.  That said, I do think my next one will be the significantly costlier HD version, although I wonder if the larger image size will have a negative effect on the refresh-rate over the WAN.

Reviews.Title: Foscam wireless network camera
Reviews.Author: D. Carr
Reviews.Content: I gave it four stars because it performs very well for its price.  I previously used a very similar Trendnet camera for several years.  Before that a Panasonic.  I mount them outside (against instructions, of course) in the heat (Phoenix) but under the patio roof.  The extreme temps may shorten the cameras' lives but they work fine for years.The Foscam's color is better than the Trendnet so now my backyard tree leaves look green in sunlight, rather than gray.  Still gray, of course, in infrared light. The infrared illumination and imaging works very well on this camera. The mounting hardware is improved. But putting the "working" light on the back of the camera makes it useless once the camera is installed overhead.I use the free Foscam domain address for internet access and that has been trouble-free.  Now that I have a smart phone I particularly enjoy the ability to check on my house anytime, anywhere.  I have the camera send me regular photos via email.  The photo "motion triggering" has not worked as well for me as the Trendnet did. I have to investigate that further.I really like this camera but advise anyone who isn't knowledgeable about wireless setups (IPs, etc.) that you may need help with installation. Or maybe some time on the phone with the Foscam people - I didn't call them but others online claim they're very helpful. Absolutely use a fixed IP address on your intranet.

Reviews.Title: Great learning tool, unreliable product
Reviews.Author: Sun Wee
Reviews.Content: I bought this because I didn't want to spend alot on a network camera till I learned more. This is a good learning tool. Within three days an IP address from Taiwan had hacked in and accessed the camera. The NSA isn't alone in spying. You need to upgrade the firmwire immediately and lock down your router's firewall. Don't give this camera any access to the internet unless you need to view remotely. I used port forwarding on the router and got it to work remotely. The motion alerts worked.  I got it to send pic to e-mail though it wouldn't work with my ISP's SMTP server. I got it to FTP pics to a local server. I got the camera to work with zoneminder software fairly well. The camera will lockup if there is too much motion with a bright detailed view like a bright sunny day. I guess this is really an indoor camera. I can find a use for this camera, but I'll be buying something better to monitor activity around the house.

Reviews.Title: It's good and it's one of the best
Reviews.Author: reda
Reviews.Content: It's good and it's one of the best, easy to handle and, it has good resolution and good pictures. However it does not detect voices very well

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!!!!
Reviews.Author: Joni
Reviews.Content: I love this camera!! I use it to check on my Grandchildren when they are sleeping or in another room from me. It could be a clearer picture but it does a good job. You can even take a snapshot from your phone and share it. You may even be able to take a video. I need to read up on that. You can pay $2.99 a year for audio, but you get one minute free without a subsciption. You can monitor your house also, when your not home! I wont be without these cameras!

Reviews.Title: More than I expected
Reviews.Author: Kurt S
Reviews.Content: I picked up two of the cameras to monitor my new puppy for fun.  I got one from Amazon and the other directly from Foxcam (they had a sweet one day deal).  I'm pretty savvy with the technical network stuff and had no problems.  I made of couple of simple mistakes along the way during setup, but figured out where I went wrong pretty quickly.  I found the written instructions (read them after I had everything working) were very clear and would be useful to someone without much technical skill.I set my camera up for remote monitoring.  To do so you do need to be ready to log into your home router and make some configuration additions (1) create static IP's and (2) assign port numbers to those IP's.  Remote monitoring works surprisingly well.  I hard wired one camera directly to my router, its too far from the wireless router to get a consisten signal.  The second camera I connected wirelessly.  There are no performance differences.  If you have a good enough wireless signal, that's the way to go.The camera image is clear and the colors seem reasonably accurate.  One camera is mounted inside monitoring the inside, the other under a large eave monitoring the outside.  The eave is big enough that the camera won't get wet.  So far its working fine even though its and inside camera.I did experience the famous buffer overflow / endless reboot problem.  My outside camera is aimed at trees with high detail.  Its the high detail that blows up the camera.  I contacted Foxcam and they now have a software fix.  Foxcam RMA's my camera and within less than two weeks I had the camera back and now it works perfectly.  Problem solved.  I recommend the camera's for simple monitoring.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Vs Tenvis
Reviews.Author: T. Loposser
Reviews.Content: In short buy the Tenvis or a EasyN, this model has a well known flaw and reboots repeatedly so much so I ended up sending it back and getting another Tenvis instead.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Customer Service
Reviews.Author: Sophie "SB"
Reviews.Content: Had the camera for over 6 months.  The image is great, we really appreciate the ability to access it from anywhere in the world.I recently experienced a problem when I changed my network's password.  I did not think of the camera and lost access.... I called Foscam's customer service, and Marshall was able to access my computer via a software called "team viewer".  He proceeded to reset my camera and re configure it to my network.Outstanding support when I needed it!Highly recommend this amazing product.

Reviews.Title: Picture is not good. Adapter is faulty. Usps didn't deliver.
Reviews.Author: Toros Uner
Reviews.Content: I got it from amazon and usps did not deliver. Package got lost and they made me drive 2 hours for pick up locations. Still nothing. Anyway. I contacted amazon and they resend another one and this time I got it. Just remember:USPS DOES NOT HAVE REDELIVERY OPTION. I talked to the USPS delivery guys and all of them said, redelivery is a lie and they NEVER redeliver. You might consider paying few more bucks and get it via different carrier.Anyway. I got it and installed. Works well with no problems after I re-soldered the adapter socket and replace the charger. Unit itself works but adapter and female socket were faulty. I didn't want to waste my time and ask for reship.Pros: Cheap. Does what they claim. Every feature that company claims exist and you can do lots of things. Best thing no-ip DDNS that comes as default option.Cons: Adapter is broken. Quality is bad. Like old time cellphone cameras. 10 feet, you are not gonna tell whom you are looking at. Sluggish.Also I needed update the firmwares and had many problems with GUI (web interface). After downgrading the firmware I managed to make it work properly.Ask questions, I will be able to answer here.

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: My husband had the idea to buy one of these as a baby monitor and it was a great decision. It was easy to set up and works perfectly in our son's room. We can see him from our computers or our phones at any time. The quality of the picture is excellent, even in the dark, and it picks up sound very well. I'm so glad we bought one of these instead of an actual baby monitor and we can use it after we're through with it as a baby monitor as a security camera for our house.

Reviews.Title: no good camera
Reviews.Author: Dean Forgey "dean forgey"
Reviews.Content: this camera came with no software and will not work. P would not suggest buying it for any reason. no way.

Reviews.Title: Not able to stand up to day to day use without constant restarts.
Reviews.Author: Sworks4ken
Reviews.Content: Low resolution, needs to be restarted regularly, sending this unit back. Pan and tilt feature worked fine. Hardware installed easily. Able to view and control footage on mobile and desktop devices. Control interface is not attractive but it works. There are lots of device management preferences to adjust if you want to...

Reviews.Title: Does not work on 802.11n wireless
Reviews.Author: HPLsauce
Reviews.Content: Contrary to product description, does not work on 802.11n wireless network.  Tested on an old b/g router and it worked, but I'm not going to keep an extra wireless network running just for this when it was supposed to work on -n.

Reviews.Title: Great home camera
Reviews.Author: L. Powell "geekgoddess"
Reviews.Content: This is a great in home video surveillance camera.  I liked it so much I purchased another one!  Now I can see my dogs anywhere as I can view these through a computer, an iPad tablet or my android phone.  They were fairly easy to setup and install but be warned that I am a computer tech by trade.  I did need to setup port-forwarding on my router to get them to work on the internet.My only complaint is that they don't seem to like special characters in the password settings.  I've gotten it to work but it took a little doing.  numbers and regular text work great.The infrared is automatic and the pan, tilt and zoom works good.I really can't say anything bad about these.  If your new to home surveillance you can't beat these for the price.

Reviews.Title: Nice product, only 1 of 2 cameras works
Reviews.Author: Antonio Noriega
Reviews.Content: I buy two cameras, 1 is working really good, the 2nd camera stop working after 1 week.  I contact support and tell me to do a hard reset of the camera, works for a few hours and stop working again.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: B. Moore
Reviews.Content: These cameras are great and I use them all over the place. I previously tried to use the cheaper knock of brands, but ended up having problems and regretting that decision.  I have now replaced all of my cameras with the Foscam brand and have never been happier.We use these to monitor our house, my parent's house, and now my grandmother's house.  The audio is loud and clear, night vision distance is good, and the IR-Cut filter is great at rendering accurate color.If you want to use these externally you need to be technical.  You will need to be comfortable changing settings to your router and using a Dynamic DNS service.  Also, please make sure you change the default password when they arrive.  That way no one else can tap into your camera.  If you don't have the technical still I would not recommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Camera returned because it died within 48 hours.
Reviews.Author: Jon
Reviews.Content: The picture quality and ease of setup was very nice. I also liked the ability to turn off the infrared lights. However the camera quit working after less than 48 hours. Several attempts to reset the camera were unsuccessful. Camera has been returned and purchased Tenvis cameras with same features minus the infrared switch for half the price.

Reviews.Title: great camera a bit tedious to set up
Reviews.Author: marjala
Reviews.Content: I just got this configured today after 4 grueling hours of trying to. I am a new person to installing a security cam and this was nothing like the other one I installed a couple of months ago.  YOU MUST follow the steps exactly to get this camera to work wirelessly.  If you have the installation CD download it and follow the directions.  Their is an IP camera finder that after you have your camera plugged into your wireless router and powered on it will tell you the local ip address that was assigned on your wireless router.  Be sure you know how to access your web interface for your router before starting anything so you can verify and see what is going on thru the whole process.  All the router to assign the IP address for the router then type that address into your web browser and see the camera's web interface.  Mine was 192.168.1.112 initially.  Make sure you can see the camera software at that address.  Then  make sure you know your wireless network user id and password.  While in the camera software go to the wireless setup and check the box that says "to use wirelessly" then "scan" to find your wireless internet id highlight it and put in your password.  I also had to click on the box that said tkp and AES to make sure the camera would work with my router.  Once you do that the camera will reboot, it will move up to the right then to the left then back to center, there is a window on the web interface that counts down from 30 (seconds). AFTER the camera stops moving count to 10 and disconnect the Ethernet cable from the back of the camera and then WAIT for up to a minute. Before the camera reboots again you get a message  box on the web browser about installing something from Szchen China.  Say ok and then the camera will reboot when it is done cycling from up to right to left you should see the green light on the back of the camera flashes rapidly.  You also will notice the ip address on your router is now a different number and that the MAC id has also changed.  Check and see if you have video and if you do Yay you saved 3 hours of tedious repetitive booting and rebooting.  Now if after you enter your wireless information as I indicated above and waited for the camera to reboot then count to 10 seconds then remove the Ethernet cable I can't remember if took the power plug out of the back of the camera or not to get the camera to boot up again and finalize being wireless.  The best advise is go online to Foscam and print out the support info they have.  The basics are get video with the Ethernet cable still connected, then get the wireless configured then if you have a DNS service you can configure a static IP on the wireless router, then come back to the camera's web ip browser and configure the same static DHCP address as on your wireless router.  Make sure you also  do the port forwarding on the wireless router and the camera's ip software. I found it was a lot of trial and error hence it took me so long.  I made sure I backed up the camera's settings so I hopefully I will never have to do from scratch again.  I LOVE the features of the camera.  You can shut off the IR so you can point the camera out of a window and have a porch light on and still see what's going on by a door.  If you use the IR behind a window you end up with a bright white globe and really can not seeing anything.  Also this does have audio that you can also turn off.  Also setting up user accounts for people to access the webcam from the www is easy and you can limit their access to changing device settings by putting them on visitor status.  Very please overall!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Beware the Installation...
Reviews.Author: Ellen M. Gander
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these a couple of years ago to monitor the comings and going whilst we were on vacation.  The cameras themselves are top-notch. Clear picture, good movement, etc.  The problem is with the setup, hence the low rating.  These things are an unbelievable bear to set up. Nothing should be this difficult.  It is entirely possible that in the two years since my purchase, Foscam has improved the setup instructions -they must have or you'd see people drop kicking these things into the street on a regular basis.  I am in IT, I has read that these were difficult to set up, I figured that meant for the lay-person.  Guess again.  At my wits end, I called one of my IT buddies up, told him I was in over my head and asked for his help.  He came over and spent hours, many hours over multiple sessions getting these set up and even then, I don't think it's quite right, but it works, mostly, so I'm not messing with it.  I actually came to Amazon today to look not buying different cameras because these have proven to be so frustrating.  While I was here, I decided to write this review.  These are great cameras. The installation is a hellish nightmare.  Caveat emptor.

Reviews.Title: Worst purchase EVER!
Reviews.Author: Jessica Villanueva
Reviews.Content: Worst product I've purchased. Out of the box the camera was doomed to fail. Plugging the camera into the router the camera flashed red and not green like the instructions say. Followed the instructions and ensured that the firewall, MAC filter and anti-virus were all disabled. Attempted to do several hard resets to the camera with no avail.After an hour of debugging, I was able to get the camera to change from a flashing red light to a solid red light. Was able to attach it to my network but for only a few seconds. The camera never readjusted nor re-aligned as it described in the instructions. The network connection would only flicker as it wasn't able to fully connect to my router. I completely reset router settings - twice hoping to clear out any settings that I may have changed.I contacted the Foscam customer service and that was experience was similar to asking a 5 year old questions about Alegbra! Requested a refund after owning it for 4 hours!

Reviews.Title: Acceptable but could be better.
Reviews.Author: Stephen Parker
Reviews.Content: These cameras function well enough to serve the intended purpose, however the units reset themselves frequently (I purchased two). When switching between night vision mode and normal lighting is most often when this occurs. Past this rather significant flaw, the cameras work reasonably well. I have found an open source recording software that works well, and an Android app that is able to monitor and control the cameras very well.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to setup and not truly outdoor resistant
Reviews.Author: coaster
Reviews.Content: Were difficult to setup had it not been for previous owners having posted online. Was not able to setup on a MAC at all so I used a PC. Non of the MAC tools worked. I wanted a 'true outdoor' camera but these are not truly outdoor. I have to keep them inside on a side table by the windows and therefore my view is limited. In this type of use, they keep adjusting themselves with the outdoor light changes and I have to keep readjusting the lenses. What this means is that when the light changes outside, it takes motion photos because it detects light changes and shadows. Then, it goes back to where the light source is and takes photos of the sky instead of remaining where I want it. I work with computers (for a living) and understand networking, ports, etc. so for someone with little or no knowledge, they should get something more user-friendly or get help from a friend. I am going to try to get some more advance setting to adjust the timing on photos and also see if I can finally get a free dns name so I can get a true remote view. At this point, all I have is still photos sent by email vs the ability to see live video from a mobile device. If I figure that out, I'll try to repost.

Reviews.Title: incompatible with  max OS X 10.6 or later & iphone
Reviews.Author: Dr. B. Santos "I appreciate honest advertising."
Reviews.Content: Sadly the manufacturer feels the need to lie about compatibility. If you have a mac, beware. I am told there is no way to send/receive audio with our desktop operating system, Mac OS X. Apparently 10.6 versions or later are not compatible with the plugin needed for the audio. Unfortunately I only learned this after paying a tech to setup the camera (over 2 hours which I paid for after investing 2 hours of my own time setting it up as directed and it failing to work wirelessly). The video comes through but isn't high quality.When viewed on an iphone, audio apparently isn't an option. It's impossible to hit the correct arrow consistently to pan the camera in the desired direction. If you zoom in on the controls, you then can't see much of the video. It's a dumb flaw.I'm sad I wasted my money, and far more importantly, my time on this dishonest company's crappy camera. Booooooooo.On a positive note, is has a pleasant texture.

Reviews.Title: loving it.
Reviews.Author: GangnamOppa
Reviews.Content: I'm using it as home security camera and so far I have 4 of it.Out of the most foscam indoor cameras and other brands, this one is truly outstanding.Only problem is night vision behind windows but there is way to go around it.

Reviews.Title: fundamentally flawed - no security
Reviews.Author: todd simpson
Reviews.Content: fundamentally flawed - no security.  all settings are stored in plain text including passwords.  https is not supported at all.  image quality was marginal at best.  it's been returned and i will steer clear of all foscam products in the future.

Reviews.Title: Works great, but audio is missing, Customer Support is non-existing.
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey Eagen
Reviews.Content: I'm able to monitor the house from anywhere, although, I haven't gotten the audio to work and the customer support at Foscam isn't very good; they kept hanging up and ignoring me.  Otherwise, the product does what I wanted it to do.

Reviews.Title: Lack of quality control, and Foscam FI8910W lasted only a year and few months.
Reviews.Author: D. Narv
Reviews.Content: The 1st one I received I had to exchange it with amazon because it had defects with the sound and tilt. The 2nd camera worked well for a while, but now is garbage. It does not connect to WiFi nor via Ethernet. 8910W. The camera is still within the warranty period (bought on August 2012) and I will try to exchange it with Foscam, hopefully the exchange process is smooth and not a nightmare like other reviewers have mentioned. I'll update my review once I get an exchange. I also have another 2 foscam different models, but now I have no idea how long each one will last.

Reviews.Title: This is the greatest!!
Reviews.Author: Igna Evets
Reviews.Content: This is the greatest!! It took me a long time to figure out how to set up the two routers.. but the trick is make sure the router from your provider is in a  pass through mode to your wireless router then all works great!!! This is actually one of two that I have and it acts as my security camera. Motion and sound detection instantly emails me photos of whats going on in my shop when I am not there. I have even caught a couple of people stealing items.. I can also have it set up to where I can watch at anytime from my cell phone or from my computer anywhere in the world.. Cant say enough..

Reviews.Title: Not reliable enough for surveillance
Reviews.Author: xxturbowesxx
Reviews.Content: Such a hassle for not much reward.First off the FPS on wifi would never go much above 5fps which wont even pick up people walking.The Wifi range is silly to the point of being useless.. my laptop has 3out of 4 bars and the camera will barely connect.THEN it will disconnect.. and have little to no reliability. I was very frustrated to and ended up moving the camera 5 feet from the router and it still disconnects multiple times a day for no reason(and wont reconnect). I also updated the latest firmware and got 1 extra fps and the same amount of disconnects.This thing is a $80 project.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the money
Reviews.Author: DS
Reviews.Content: Have been using this camera for a few months now. Customer service was great in setting the camera up. Love the PTZ features and the image quality is decent enough. The IR works great up to about 15 feet or so. However, the IR lights cycle like crazy when the lighting is marginal and it produces a noisy click each time. It can be turned on/off manualy. The mic works well enough but the speaker quit working after only a few weeks. There is a 2 year warranty so I will be again testing customer service. I will try and update after my experience.

Reviews.Title: Lacks Manufacture's Quality Control and Technical Service
Reviews.Author: Terry
Reviews.Content: Okay, the one star rating is partially my fault because I took a chance and bought this product 'used'. However, the Foscam caption said "Works perfect" and "Like new" which was totally false. Problem #1: The camera base would not sit flat due to a protrusion of the the screw thread connector. #2: The thumbscrew connecting the stand to the camera base was too short, hence useless. #3 I attempted to contact Foscam support to resolve the problem and was greeted with " You are 9th in line, estimated wait time 20 minutes." After a 5 minute wait, the exact same "20 minute" message was repeated...I hung up. Although the camera was shipped directly from Foscam, the good news is I purchased and returned the Foscam camera through Amazon for a full and quick refund.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA FOR THE PRICE!
Reviews.Author: Nitpicker
Reviews.Content: Excellent quality camera.  Both night and day images are very clear.  Installation into your local network is pretty straight forward and simple. Setting up the camera for viewing over the internet requires using a dynamic dns account and also requires a pretty good knowledge of setting up a static IP and port forwarding on your modem/router.  After setup is complete, I personally use what I consider the best android IP camera app, IP CAM VIEWER by Robert Chou.  This superb app along with this camera provides the flexibility to turn the IR lights on/off, along with motion detection, audio, contrast, brightness, etc.  I also recommend the Blue Iris software to provide monitoring and recording on a computer.  Also a superb application.For this price, I highly recommend this Foscam camera.  I bought 3 of these and set up cell phone video monitoring for my sons.Final tip, make sure to change/add a password to the admin user for security purposes, otherwise your system will not be completely secure.

Reviews.Title: WERMS likes this foscam camera
Reviews.Author: WERMS
Reviews.Content: The Web Enabled Remote Monitoring Service likes this camera because it is packed with features at a low price and it works very well with WERMS.The advanced features include good night vision without blasting LEDs, a ring to focus for every installation, a large pan and tit range (300p/200t degrees), a straight-forward and responsive interface user, and a long power cable (approx. 10 ft).  We like the camera offerings from TRENDnet also, but foscam has really done a good job with the quiet pan/tilt servo motors and compensating night vision LEDs.  Image quality is good if extreme lighting conditions are avoided.An App is not required for live viewing which is a big advantage compared to the TRENDnet cameras.  The motion detection (alarm) functions get three stars, and unfortunately, the FTP transfers are limited to a smaller 320x240 resolution compared to 640x480 like most other cameras.  This foscam camera is still a great value.This camera has the same issues reported by many users with regards to just about all Internet cameras.  The wireless range may not meet your expectations.
