Setup for live viewing from remote locations can be challenging for some, which is not a problem unique to foscam cameras.  DDNS and Static IP setup including port-forwarding requires some technical skills, and multi-camera installations require discipline during setup,Purchase this camera, connect up with a storage solution like WERMS, and you will see what you've been missing.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: Carson
Reviews.Content: We have this set up to monitor our house. Image quality isnt the best but you can identify individuals on it and it has motion detection, the IR works great too. Also a perfect tool for checking on the dogs when we arent home

Reviews.Title: Opinion: Nightmare to set up for mac users
Reviews.Author: Recent Examinee
Reviews.Content: The following is an opinion based on experience with this item.For Mac UsersPros:  Camera works.  Decent resolution.Cons:  Nightmare to set up for Mac users.  I called Foscam tech support and was on the phone with an "expert" for over an hour.  The tech support specialist was barely able to get it to work.  He encountered multiple issues.  The firewall on my router had to be disabled for the camera to work properly.Additional software is required to record video on your laptop.  You cannot record remotely.Setup for Mac users is very cumbersome.  You may have to purchase additional software depending on what you want to do.Setup may be easy for PC users, but not for Mac users.  Expect to spend some time setting up this device.  You may be on the phone with tech support for a long time.

Reviews.Title: Good for surveillance, questionable for baby monitor
Reviews.Author: B. Baker
Reviews.Content: If you want a good, simple surveillance camera this is the one for you.  The install was easy and quick.  However, if you are looking to use this as a baby monitor (as I am), there might be better products out there depending on your brand of computer/phone/mobile device.  I have all Apple products and there is an issue with this particular brand of camera's audio feature and Apple products.  I did days of research and finally ended up buying an app that would support the camera and the audio for this system.  The app was only about $4, but I wasn't expecting to have to shell out money to have something work as advertised.My one complaint with the actual device itself is that it does not have a zoom feature--again, if this is used as a baby monitor, that would be a nice feature.  You can set up a username and password to protect your privacy--always a concern these days.

Reviews.Title: CAnt install it
Reviews.Author: Joe
Reviews.Content: The product is nice but not easy to install wish I knew the trick spent all day all night , no view,

Reviews.Title: poor instructions
Reviews.Author: George R Belt
Reviews.Content: Never did get it set up to work with my wireless router. Instructions are poor, sometimes nonsensical. Unable to access it via the iPhone, which was the only reason for buying it.

Reviews.Title: Not worth the money.
Reviews.Author: BEN NY "Upstate Ben"
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for a couple of months now and today it finally went totally dead. It hasn't worked as advertised from day one. I was having to unplug and reset every few days to get a picture. The wireless worked fine when only a few feet from the router so I purchased the optional antenna and no better. This morning the picture was in shades of green and yellow; this afternoon it is total black. I have rebooted, reset and still nothing. I have seen a lot of good reviews, maybe I just got a lemon. It was $70 wasted and my confidence in Foscam is zero. Buyer Beware!

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Zippy
Reviews.Content: Bought this along with the Linksys camera.These things are absolutely worthless and do not function well at all.... good luck

Reviews.Title: Hidden Costs and Poor Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Paul Loofburrow
Reviews.Content: Overall, not worth the trouble. I returned this camera for two reasons:Foscam Tech Support was not able to figure out how to make this camera work on my home network even after two calls.To use this camera you will need to create a DNS host account and understand how to configure port forwarding on your router. The DNS host service, recommended by the Foscam installation, requires a $25 dollar annual fee. While there are other alternatives out there, I find it a bit disingenuous to say there are no hidden fees when the user guide directs you to a service that is not free.Also, be aware that the setup for this camera is not for the average person. The setup is significantly more complex than installing a modem, printer/scanner or an external hard drive. Foscam does provide a DVD that walks you through the process step by step. But configurations they walk you through are generic and are not likely to match your home network in many cases. You will have to reconcile the differences between your setup and the setup on the DVD. In my case, even the Foscam Tech Support people were not able to do this.

Reviews.Title: Crashes constantly!
Reviews.Author: Jeff
Reviews.Content: So this product is a remote controlled webcam.  It also happens to have lots and lots of features.  But, first and foremost, it is supposed to be a remote controlled webcam.  Since I can't pan or tilt without the webcam crashing, which restarts and resets the camera, then this is basically a plastic orb with lots and lots of features.Beware and move on.  Surprising to see such poor software on a production device from Foscam.== EDIT ==Appears that others have this problem.  Do a Google search for "foscam reset dsp".  Some are saying that Foscam cameras will reset if the amount of detail and light is too great for the camera to handle.

Reviews.Title: Customer service is non-existant
Reviews.Author: sashat313
Reviews.Content: My husband and I had this camera on our baby registry at the suggestion of a good friend. Since no one ended up purchasing it for us, we logged on to Amazon to buy it ourselves. As luck would have it, the camera was out of stock. Since our baby was due within weeks we did not have time to waste and decided to buy it directly from the manufacturer. BIG MISTAKE!My husband tried everything he could to get this camera to work, but we kept getting a blinking red light. We even waited in the long lines at Comcast to exchange our old router for a new router/modem combo in the hopes that was the issue. Granted neither my husband nor I are software developers, but we didn't think we needed to be just to get this camera to work. Needless to say we called the technical support number several times to try and troubleshoot. After we were dumped into voice mail, my husband resorted to e-mail.We first received a response from a support team member named Raheel who told us that "a blinking red light usually means the camera is not receiving proper power and either there is a hardware issue on the camera's main board or a power supply failure, however from personal experience I do believe you will need an RMA replacement for the camera unfortunately. If you have a green LED light on the power supply is it solid in color when you plug it in or does it also blink?" My husband replied that there was no green light - just the blinking red light, and no lights on the LAN cable.We then received another reply from another support team member named Edward who asked "Is the green led solid in color or does it blink?" My husband again told this gentleman we did not have a green light at all, just a blinking red light.That is where all replies from this company ended. Clearly it was obvious to Foscam that their product was broken and needed to be returned, yet no one made any attempt to resolve the issue. Our daughter arrived a week later. Having not heard back from anyone and not having the money to shell out for a new video camera, we ended up with a cheap radio monitor.I wish I had seen the reviews of the problems everyone else had had with this camera before we bought this. Now we are stuck with $100 camera we can't use. The camera is still under warranty, but the manufacturer is in China and there is no information on how to fix or return the camera. I am assuming the cost to ship it to China and back is more than the camera itself. It's so frustrating!!! Do yourself a favor and make sure to buy this from Amazon if you buy it at all. AT LEAST THEY TAKE CARE OF THEIR CUSTOMERS!!!

Reviews.Title: Was good, until it died
Reviews.Author: Philip Hilton
Reviews.Content: We were happy with this as a baby monitor. It worked as expected......until it died 12 days after the return window expired. Now it just reboots every 30 seconds (approx) in an endless cycle. A quick firmware update in that 30 second window did not help. Resetting the device did not help either. Feeling pretty ripped off over here.

Reviews.Title: Tech support for 3hrs a Circus
Reviews.Author: Walter D Hauck
Reviews.Content: I called tech support since the camera would respond to the software:After 20 minutes I was told the cable included with the camera was defective and I SHOULD GO OUT AND BUY ANOTHER CABLE..After explaining thy should replace cable I was told to snd them an Email requesting cable and to inclue contact number so they could call and arrange to send cable.Next two technicians had unhooking and re hooking the cable (that really not defective) to my computer and to my router .. I was going from room to room attaching and  reattaching for 1.5 hours..Finally they said the camera was defective and outlined a time consuming and bizarre procedure to return the camera. When I mention I had purchased via my return problem was solved.Thank god I purchased via AMAZON

Reviews.Title: Be prepared to Need support
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Well, okay.  I finally got some of it to work, and I can now take a look around my living room even when I am not home.  But I still haven't figured out how to get alerts or how to activate motion detection.  The manual's screens don't look like mine and the directions require you to know a lot about IP addresses, setting static ones, dealing with ports, and so on.  I think if their support is good, I may eventually get ALL the features to work.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, when it doesn't reset itself
Reviews.Author: jbsnet "these bleeds?"
Reviews.Content: First. I highly recommend you read R. Tickle's excellent review of this product. It is spot on.Now to my review. Camara works great when it works. WIFI is very solid considering I have it all the way out in a detacted garage. Of course I have an ASUS AC66U wireless router/blowtorch, so that helps :)I have it set to send my snap shots via email when movement is detected in my garage (thugs in my neighborhood like to kick in doors to garages) and this works great... if not filling up my inbox... which I just delete. I have the sensitivity set to the weakest setting, which curbs the false reads.Anyway, it has worked great for about 2 months after which the camera appears to have developed a reset glitch. Every 3-4 days, the camera will pan from the saved position toward the ceiling of my garage... well, that's no good.I've checked for new firmware in a hopes Foscam might have addressed this issue. No Dice. I'm on their latest, so there is nothing I can do there.Instead I have to going into the web based settings and pan the camera back to the desired position. I save the position, but it never saves.... again, a firmware issue.So, while it works, this is not a "set it ad forget it" device. I will replace with a stationary unit, perhaps the Foscam Foscam FI8904W.Thanks

Reviews.Title: Horrible Interface
Reviews.Author: J. Smith
Reviews.Content: Could not ever get this to set up to work remotely.  Works ok at home but wanted it primarily for when I'm away from home.  DLink has a much better mobil interface, requires me to do very little to get the camera up an running.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera for the price and features
Reviews.Author: Martino
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera and decided to finally write a review.  I now have two cameras (one black and one white) that I purchased when they were on sale for 69 dollars.The setup is easy if you are viewing the cameras on your home internet but a little more difficult if you want to be able to view them away from home (ie a smart phone, Ipad or another computer).I will not get into the setup as I think it is explained on these different reviews.  However, if you have problems, there are various YouTube videos that will guide you in the right direction.  Having said that, it is intimidating to get it to work right, but once you do, it is quite rewarding.  The problem is really just dealing with stuff that you do not do on a daily basis; such as port forwarding, setting up a free IP provider, etc.  I spent some time before I finally was able to get it right.  The setup video that comes with the camera helps but there are some better YouTube videos out there.To test to see if you have it right, you should download some free apps and then use your 3g or 4g on your smart phone or Ipad, etc. to see if it works, otherwise you will just be seeing the camera on your home network on those devices.What is amazing to me is that you get a nice clear color picture from this camera; you are able to rotate it remotely; take pictures; record video and set up an alarm to take pictures at various times if the camera recognizes a visitor or intruder. It also has sound and I can talk to someone and hear them with audio enabled. Really unbelievable features for a reasonably priced camera.You can set up the alarm for the camera to work at certain times of the day right from the included software.  Many times I leave for work in the morning and when I arrive at my office, I have about five pictures that arrive by email showing my vehicle leaving the house.  If someone comes to the house and I am at the office, I will receive an emails showing pictures of them arriving.  The camera also has an option to snoop for sound which triggers the alarm.  If you have your computer on, it will beep if you so choose.My camera works out of my window and so it limits my ability to see at night with infrared. However, I also have one in the basement and the camera automatically adjust to the dark and I can see everything in total darkness.I am hoping to set up an outdoor camera in the future, but right now I am extremely please with the price, features and quality of these cameras.  Great buy in my opinion.

Reviews.Title: Exceed my expectation
Reviews.Author: L. Yang "Dragon"
Reviews.Content: All features advertised work well. Many reviewers have done a great job. I followed Tickle's step-by-step instruction and the installation was a breeze.In order to do the remote monitoring outside your house, you have to configure your router to allow you to get into your home network. The port forwarding setting is a task which varies from router to router. You will have to be a little network savvy in order to get this setting up. For example, I have a TrendNet router. The manual did not explain how to perform the port forwarding. I searched on internet and found an instruction which did not make 100% sense. I had to make a small guess and made it work.The best feature of this product is that, once the feature is turned on, it will email you your IP address if your network provider changes your IP address. During my recent trip to Asia, my IP address was changed 4 times. I could access my home network with new IP address. If there would be a hacker to my home network, he/she could not get in after IP address is changed. This makes me feel much better to open up my home network a bit. Still, as soon as I got home, I deactivate the port forwarding setting in my router just to be safe.The motion detection works well when I set the sensitivity to 5. I have a lamp which is turned on and off by a timer. The motion detection detected the light change and emailed me a series of photos. This is a good assurance feature. I get to see the photo twice a day even there was non event to let me know the Foscam is working hard to watch my house for me. When I got home after the trip, I triggered the motion detection. I was pleasantly informed via my email that my home was invaded with my pictures in there.The resolution of the camera is not very high. However, I had to set the resolution even lower in order to view it via my DSL which has limited upload speed. So, practically, I am limited by my internet connection. This makes me think about switching to other internet provider.I highly recommend this camera. Yet, you need to know how to set up your router to take a full advantage of it.

Reviews.Title: So far very good
Reviews.Author: Juan Osorno
Reviews.Content: I just got this camera today (around 11am) and immediately proceeded to install it. I did not have any problems getting to work on a wired connection. It was very simple and straight forward.I did have some difficulty installing it to work wirelessly. I called customer service and they asked me to download a small program so they could control my computer. I watched the whole process while they were working and it took them about 2 minutes to install. I also asked them to help me install it so I could see it from anywhere in the world as long as I have wifi. They installed it very quickly and now the camera is working wirelessly and through a wifi connection. I have checked both connections.I can see the video feed from my windows PC, Apple laptop, Apple iPad and Apple iPhone.Very happy with the video quality. I have not seen what it can do at night yet. I will check it tonight.I am planning to buy more cameras from this manufacturer. Tech Support was quick and good.

Reviews.Title: Returned due to a manufacturer defect
Reviews.Author: B. Dziki
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera at first. It had a very clear image and the panning was very smooth. But I had issues with it locking up and rebooting when I installed it outside. I spent a lot of time fixing what I though was an issue with my network. I replaced the Ethernet cable 3 times, updated my Ethernet switch, tried wireless, etc. After some researching I discovered it is an issue with the DSP firmware, that is not user upgradable. This camera, along with other models with the same MPEG sensor, will get over whelmed and lock up when there is bright sunlight, or lots of motion. The manufacturer will fix the issue, if you send it back. But since it was with in my 30 days of purchase, it was easier for me to send it back and buy another camera brand.

Reviews.Title: Audio DOES NOT WORK with Mac according to Foscam Tech Support
Reviews.Author: kchercmech "Bo"
Reviews.Content: The downloadable 'updated' manual from the Foscam site says that installing "UFoscam.app" will allow for 2-way audio support. Every review I have read about this app says this is not the case. I would love to review that program, but if it does not work for the dozens of persons who did buy it, I am not going to spend $7 to buy it. I can review the audio function when using this camera right out of the box however; audio is NON-EXISTENT. When you click on "audio" the video cuts out and says I need to install VLC player as a plugin to use the audio function. The problem? I already exclusively use VLC as my default player. In other words, the audio DOES NOT WORK on a Mac unless you use a crash-happy browser like IE. **When I used PC my IE would crash daily. Maybe they fixed that since 2011.**The camera Pros:Love it. It is small but provides excellent bright day, cloudy day, and absolute blacked out night video. At night, the inside of my house is so dark, thanks to my blacked out window treatments, that my Rotty bumps into things. This camera sees it all!  Also, when the camera pans and tilts there is ZERO sound. I even stuck my ear next to the camera while on the "patrol" setting and could not hear the motor working. Excellent for covert and clandestine surveillance. The patrol setting is a function where the camera will automatically pan (or tilt) from one directional stop all the way to the other in both axis'.Cons:No Audio. Not only cannot I not use the audio IN function (to my MBP), I cannot use the audio out either (to the camera from my MBP). So, as a baby monitor, this is useless unless all you want is a camera. I know that some will retort and say "Just use IE and the audio will work" - NO. This camera is advertised as working with Mozilla, Safari, Mac, IPod, Ipad, and Iphone. There is nothing on the Foscam site (except for angry customer reviews) that even hint that the audio is only supported if you use a Microsoft product. So in other words, this fails to meet even a slight aspect of the mark advertised - hence the 3-stars.I originally bought FI8905W cameras that crashed every few minutes following the first day of use then they stopped working all together - they got returned quickly. As this is only the 2nd day of use for this camera - only time will tell if this is better than the FI8905W's. I really hope so!***UPDATE***A tech support individual named "Zohaib" from Foscam emailed me today (only 2 days after submitting a support request - that was really fast) about not being able to get the audio to work while running Mozilla on a 10.8 Mac. His solution had NOTHING to do with Mozilla Firefox OR Mac. Their "help" only contained instructions on how to get it to work on Microsoft IE on Win 7 & 8. I do not think they even read the support email requests - they just respond by copying and pasting a random response probably from a grab bag of sorts. Maybe they throw darts at a board containing multiple solutions. Not happy Bob, not Happy.I would return it because it is being sold under a completely false pretense of working with a Mac; however, the camera works great as a camera and it is the cheapest one I have been able to find. So, I will have to resign myself as voting 'for' their product in the current configuration and with the gross negligence in their marketing department by letting them keep my money - to my dismay. Because of their inability to even read my tech support request, I have downgraded my 3-star review to a 2 star review. Customer service should always play a very important role in any company's mission.

Reviews.Title: My second IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Herk Driver
Reviews.Content: Use them at home to monitor doors andout side areas.  The instalation and internet hook up instructions are much improved over earlier models.  if your Wi-Fi router has an 'push button' set up feature., then this is the one for you. Great daylight and IR image for stills and video streaming.

Reviews.Title: Plug and play, couldn't be easier.
Reviews.Author: Alpha User
Reviews.Content: Was able to plug in both cameras and get them set up in minutes. Purchased an iPad/iPhone app and had everything set in place in about 15 minutes.I haven't setup outside access yet, since they are currently being used a child monitors.Camera picture and range of motion are excellent. Will look to add more cameras for actual security in the future.Excellent value and easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Great Product. Works As Expected.
Reviews.Author: Jen
Reviews.Content: I decided to write a review simply because there are so many other reviews indicating that the positive reviews are falsely written.Like others have written, the set up was a bit complicated. I am a mac user and do not have a disc drive on my computer so I had to use the videos posted on Foscam's support website. The first three videos were very easy to follow and provided clear step by step instructions. The last video on port forwarding did not apply to the equipment I was using so I had to use their online written directions. Unfortunately, even following the steps I was unable to get the port forwarding to run correctly and I had to call in to the customer service department for support. The hold time was excessive (over 30min) but after I finally got a representative on the phone, he was able to very quickly (less than 10 min) remote into my computer and get things up and running. He even provided me with assistance in getting the email alerts and my iphone app up and running.Overall I am very satisfied with the camera and its features. The video quality, even with the night vision, is great. The two way audio also works well. I have not had any issues with the sound quality as others have mentioned. It is plenty loud without the use of an added microphone.I am using the iphone/ipad app called Foscam Pro. It did cost 5.99 but is worth the price. There is a slight delay in the audio and video but still acceptable compared to other cameras I have used in the past. While watching video the app will stay open for continuous monitoring. It also continues to run in the background while using other applications so you can continue to hear sound while doing other things.I am currently using the camera as a baby monitor and couldn't be happier.I would recommend this product to anyone.Update: I just set up a second camera. It appears that they have updated their support website since I set up the last camera. I ended up doing a YouTube search for the set up videos instead of reading thru the manuals that are now available on their site for the mac installation.Setting up the second camera went WAY faster than the first since I already knew what I was doing. I did still have to call into support to get help with port forwarding. I did not have any hold time and the representative was able to remote into my computer and get things set up in less than 10min. He also provided me with the information to update my iphone/ipad app Foscam Pro so that I can monitor both cameras.The representative did ask me if I was happy with his support and if so to write an amazon review indicating such.

Reviews.Title: As expected.
Reviews.Author: Romme
Reviews.Content: This IP camera functioned as advertised except for the 2way audio. 2way audio is not the best quality,but for the price I can live with that. Everything else is up to par. Images are surprisingly clear. The mobile phone web interface controls needs some refinements with the directional controls but again a minor issue. Overall I am very happy with the purchase and will purchase another.

Reviews.Title: Problems with new versions
Reviews.Author: iLikeWaffles
Reviews.Content: I have 2 of these. The new one I just received has a blurry image and reboots when pointed outside in bright light.This is a common problem among the newer versions. Check their forum.My 6 month old camera is working fine.Foscam quality is mediocre at best. Look elsewhere like Dericam.

Reviews.Title: Ok camera TERRIBLE software
Reviews.Author: FD
Reviews.Content: This is the kind of product that makes me never want to buy consumer electronics again.  I write software for a living, so I know good or bad software when I see it.  These guys have done a TERRIBLE job with the software.  For example, want to change the admin password on your camera?  Better not, you'll get locked out and have to reset the camera to factory default settings, and redo all your settings.  Want to get the camera setup on your home network?  oh, dynamic IP address has to be manually enabled... but you get full instructions on how to hack around in subnet masks, so don't worry! ugh.  want to login to the camera with your browser?  oh, don't push THAT login button... it's only for internet explorer... use this OTHER special login button for other browsers.  Want to update the time and timezone on your camera?  No problem! Use the time sync via internet feature.  Oh by the way, that sets it wrong and you have to manually tick a box to do daylight savings... and then specify how much daylight savings you want, 0, 30 60, 90, or 120 minutes worth... no im not joking.  The software on this thing ruins the experience and they need to fire whoever wrote this crap and hire some better people.

Reviews.Title: A Solid Quality Product
Reviews.Author: Denise
Reviews.Content: We chose this product after researching like products for both its reasonable price and ease of operation.  My wife had some trouble with the initial installation (a bit of a learning curve with a new laptop added to the trouble). She called their customer service and received prompt and quality assistance.  The camera is easy to operate from our laptop computer anywhere we travel, and we travel extensively.  We use it to monitor our cat's caretaker when we have to leave him at home.  We would recommend this camera to anyone seeking a solid quality remote monitoring product for a reasonable price.

Reviews.Title: Good camera REDICULOUS setup
Reviews.Author: Jchild
Reviews.Content: The camera is great but the set up took be NO JOKE from 1:30pm until just now at 7:20pm. I had was on the phone with customer support for hours trying to get it to work. The great thing is though the foscam customer support can remotely take over your computer and do it but they had a really hard time getting mine to work.

Reviews.Title: Works ok, but won't record audio via IP
Reviews.Author: Cameron Scott French
Reviews.Content: I have two fo these cameras, but after trying unsuccessfully to record audio AND video, I found out that the only way to record Audio is to have the camera plugged directly into a computer via USB. If I'd have known that, I would never have bought them.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for my needs
Reviews.Author: Supermanick007
Reviews.Content: Ordered two of these cameras a few weeks ago.  Using them pretty much as "nanny cams."  The Wi-fi set up was very easy. However, the port forwarding was a little complex for me. I'm pretty computer literate but it took me a while to find the right how to guide on line on how to set up port forwarding specific to my router company and computer (Mac).  Once I truly sat down with it I did figure it out and can now view the cam feeds from my iPhone.  Very happy so far with the quality of the images and overall performance of the cameras. The audio can be a little jumpy sometimes but it serves its purpose for instant communication.  I've shown the results to a few co-workers on my iPhone and several will be purchasing the cameras as well.

Reviews.Title: A good web cam
Reviews.Author: Oreo
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to watch my dog when I'm in office. The quality is ok, good enough to see what my dog is doing. Once set up, it is very easy to use.But, the set up took me a long time though I think it was the problem of my router. Later on I called Foscam support and they offered remote setup which is really nice! They helped me figured is out. They should state this support in their manual. However, I waited 16min before some representative helped me.Overall, if you do not need very high quality webcam, this is a good choice. And you can ask for remote help which makes life easier.

Reviews.Title: Great "Baby Monitor" and "Security Cam"
Reviews.Author: Frank J. Ruiz Jr. "Karmic Buddha"
Reviews.Content: I bought this to use as a baby monitor for my 16 month old son.I was skeptical of its quality and durability because of the low price.We've had this bad boy for weeks on end now, it's always running and hasn't skipped a bit. It integrated really easy into my home network, and its completely compatible with our Iphones, Macbooks, Ipads etc.The IR is amazing, the speakers for two way are top notch. It mounted to my wall with ease as well. I can check in on my son when I'm at work, and see, hear and talk to my wife and son while they are in his room playing.Its a must buy for any parent!

Reviews.Title: great esp with tech support
Reviews.Author: Lynn S. Berkowitz
Reviews.Content: Purchased 2 cameras and really like that I can view from anywhere (not just at home).  The setup is a little tricky but foscam offers great tech support and they can set it up pretty quickly and easily.  I set it up the first time myself which took way too long so the 2nd time, I just called in and they did it for me.  tech support is very friendly and helpful!

Reviews.Title: DIY Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Ricardo Valdes
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to be used as a baby monitor. Even though I my job entails me operating a CCTV system of almost 500 cameras, I have actually never set one up. So I bought this camera well before the baby was due so I could play with it and see how to set it up and operate it.For the most part, it is exactly what I wanted. The picture is clear, but obviously not HD quality (I could not justify spending an extra $100 for the FI9821W which does 720P, when the video monitor end of this set-up is a non-retina screen iPod touch or our android phones). However it is very usable for our intended use.For night viewing, you will need to use the IR lighting on the camera, which does put the camera in "Black & white" mode. Any camera that uses IR for night time viewing will do this.The instructions that come with the camera (10 page, 3” X 5” booklet) are about as worthless as possible. Instead of calling Foscam, I used the instructions on this website: [...] so that made things MUCH easier.I also am not using the “Blue Iris” program to access the camera. Once you figure out the IP address of the camera you access the camera through a web browser, there is an on screen interface you can use.  It is about a 1 second delay from moving the camera (via web interface) to the camera actually moving. I know the camera works with Chrome and IE.  With Chrome you can basically move the camera, and that is about it. With IE, you can configure the camera just about any way you want, including setting up various log-in’s and what access they have to the camera. The access levels are “Admin”, which gives that person complete control over everything the camera is capable of. “Second level is “User,” which allows someone to control the camera (but not change settings). The last is “Guest,” which only allows someone to see the video feed. Each user has their own sign-in and password that someone with “Admin” privileges can set.The bad thing is the camera has “reset” it self about once every 3 weeks. When this happens, the camera goes back to the factory default home position and sets the IR filter to “auto” (IR comes on when the light levels are low). It has not wiped any of the preset positions I set, or any of the users.On the home WiFi, we are getting about 45 Frames per second day time, and 60 at night with the IR. If we access the camera with our cell phones (using LTE cell data, not wifi) we get 20 FPS day time and 25 FPS at night.Overall I am happy with the camera, and would suggest it as a baby monitor.I did knock a star off for the random resets, and the lack of abilities you have with Crome

Reviews.Title: Foscam falls short
Reviews.Author: A. Gordon "Computer Geek"
Reviews.Content: At first I thought this was a great product, but it falls short, way short.Pros:- Well built- Great picture- Price- Built-in DDNS- The very bad broken English and mispronouncements in the video, on the CD, were very entertaining.Cons:- Although email is set up and tested and email alert set for motion detection, I do not get an alert when motion is detected, even though it shows motion detection in the log.- Most functionality is lost without Windows IE and active-x control.  No ability to record video without it.  I failed to get it working with active-x via two different PC's, even though the active-x control is installed.  The FAQ wants you to basically drop all security you have against malicious active-x, which is something you don't want to do.- The only means to upload an image is with FTP, yet another major security risk. Some sort of cloud based storage compatibility would have been nice.- The preset function never worked.All I have right now is a camera I can log in to at the house or remotely, via non-IE browsers, and move it around live.  With none of the functionalities listed above, this is pretty much useless to me.

Reviews.Title: Not compatible on Mac's for audio
Reviews.Author: Ryan Scott, PhD
Reviews.Content: They state that it is Mac Compatible. However, audio is not well supported.  Customer support told me straight up that the audio doesn't work on Macs, and there was a work around that didn't work.  Basically, if you want to observe on a Mac, you'll have no audio.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, easy set up
Reviews.Author: perl
Reviews.Content: After I bought this camera, I was so concerned that the setup might be so incredibly complicated so I read many reviews and discussion on the foscam forum. However, I got my self even more confused so I decided just to follow the instructions provided in the enclosed booklet.  I have an Apple Extreme Airport and a Macbook.  It turned out to be quite easy at the end.  I followed their instructions using ip camera tool and set up the wireless connection.  I then used the ip camera tool to change the port # and used the airport utility to port-forward the camera.  Bingo! I found the camera on the web.  I deducted 1 star because Foscam doesn't provide a decent iphone app.

Reviews.Title: Good, moderately-priced wireless IP cam
Reviews.Author: Brian Talley
Reviews.Content: Pros:o Quieto Good pictureo Infrared works wello Easy setup/configurationo iPad app (FoscamPro) works very well - good controlsCons:o Image resolution could be better (640x480 is a little low in this day and age)o Speaker on the camera is a little quietAnyone looking for a wireless camera they can easily access with their computer or Apple or android device, this is a good option. I plan to buy a few more Foscam cameras.

Reviews.Title: I'm Amazed
Reviews.Author: J. Donaldson "Cal-diver"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12loadSwf_Core(swfLocation, swfWidth, swfHeight, flashVersion, bgColor, swfParams, flashParams, embedAttributes); return false; } function cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { return _cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12loadSwf(movieID, playerVersion); } // ]]> var cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12RollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12RollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81TY3LJm8gS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; var cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay = document.getElementById('cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplayImageId'); if (cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay) { cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay.onmouseover = function() { cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81TY3LJm8gS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; } cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay.onmouseout = function() { cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12preplay.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/81TY3LJm8gS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12currentClick) { return cv_mo2NAKLNYTU6N12currentClick(); } } } Length:: 2:35 MinsI'm amazed at how good this product is for the money.I tried for days to snap a photo of whatever animals in our rear yard were tearing up the soil. Our yard is flat but then drops off into a small canyon where we know there are mountain lions, and deer regularly come into the yard during the day. But some other creature is making a mess of the lawn (besides the gophers that is). I used my DSLR camera but had to leave the light on in the yard for that to take photos. I took 900 photos over three nights, one per minute, but caught nothing. I thought about getting an IR camera but expected them to be well into the multiple hundred dollars. This one surprised me.I received the Foscam F18910W today, took it out of the box, connected it to the router and it came right up working. The documentation gives quite a few steps to get it working but much of it was automatic on my computer. It didn't take more than a couple of minutes to get the WiFi working too. It also showed up on my iPod Touch browser easily as soon as I entered the IP address of the camera. My setup time from box to working on the WiFi was less than 10 minutes but then I'm tech savvy.Tonight I set the camera up on a small tripod under the covered patio and aimed it at the area I wanted to watch all night. I'm quite pleased that the IR lights up the area quite well. I can easily see 30 feet of the back yard clearly.For a camera with built in WiFi, that can be tilted and panned from the computer, that lights up the yard at night on the video, I'm quite pleased.Of course it would be nice to have HD video but the 0.3MP image is quite enough for us to see what animals come into the yard.The only problem I had was when I tried to record the video on my desktop computer the recorded files were not in the designated folder. It took me a couple of hours to get it working with the help of some Google searches. The problem was solved by running the 32 bit version of IE on my 64 bit system. Strange and a bit of a pain but at least it works.I have it configured to alarm when something moves in the yard, and to send me email with photos when it does. Fortunately there is no wind tonight so it won't be sending me photos all night long.The feature I wish it had would be if I could limit the horizontal scan. That is: there is a button to have the camera do a Horizontal Patrol but it swings from end to end, an arc of something like 270 degrees. I would like to limit both ends so it only swings about 150 degrees. But I can't find any controls for that desirable feature.I expect soon we'll know what animal is tearing up our yard.8/30/13 We discovered it has been a raccoon tearing up our grass. I'll add a short video.I'm very pleased with the operation of the camera. It has not dropped the WiFi connection after 3 days. It also automatically switches from IR to non-IR as the sun comes up and visa-versa at night.UPDATE 9/11/2013This camera did exactly what we needed it to do. We were able to watch video of 4 skunks and a raccoon being caught in the traps placed by a professional trapper over a five night period. However I did find some bugs.1) The alarm feature has a time setting to disable alarms during the periods selected. It never worked for me. I would get alarms no matter how I set up that time control. The alarms would send me email, with photos, day or night even though I tried to disable daytime alarms. I got so many alarms that I had to disable them.2) Alarms would be triggered by the wind blowing the trees and bushes which is understood. But even on a calm night with the alarm sensitivity set to 7 or 8 it completely missed the large raccoon 8 to 10' from the camera.3) I think there is supposed to be a feature to capture video when an alarm goes off. I was capturing video 24/7 so that may override the alarm video feature. But in any case it never recorded a video on an alarm.4) I set the date and time in the camera but all video files, showing the date and time within the video frame, were totally wrong in date and time. Not even this decade.Otherwise it did the trick. If I had it to do over again I'd buy the HD version so I could see more detail.

Reviews.Title: very pleased
Reviews.Author: damageless
Reviews.Content: I'm very pleased with this product. Has worked excellent for about 4 months or more months now. The infrared (or red light) is not bright enough to be a nuisance.

Reviews.Title: not that great
Reviews.Author: Jamie Doehne
Reviews.Content: set up was difficult. still isn't the way we want it. tech support is awful. Technicians were rude! Great concept but not quite there yet.

Reviews.Title: Perfect For A Baby Monior
Reviews.Author: C. Lowe
Reviews.Content: Hands down the best IP camera on the market for using as a baby monitor.  I use CamViewer for IP Webcams app by John McKerrell on my iPhone and it works great.  For the price it can't be beat, particularly for use as a baby monitor.  Definitely WAY better than the actual "baby monitor" cams out there for 3 times the price.  Difficult to set up, but worth it - I think that the security software that Foscam offers is probably a good investment if you can afford it, especially if you plan to add cameras later (which I now do plan to do).

Reviews.Title: Quality didn't seem worth the money
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I bought several of these while they were on sale.  I felt like I was getting a deal when I bought then.  Once I got them though I wasn't very happy.  I felt the video quality was very lackluster.  I was able to sell them to someone else.

Reviews.Title: ISP Port forwarding issues (Foscam FI8910W)
Reviews.Author: Chou Young "Value Quality"
Reviews.Content: If your intended purpose is to view the camera’s video on your internal wireless network, this camera is fine. It is very easy to install and to accomplish such a task.  The Foscam website has good instruction videos.However, if you want to access the camera from the internet when you are away from home, it will be difficult to nearly impossible to accomplish.  Direct streaming via HTTP for remote access requires “port forwarding.”  After spending a week trying, I gave up.  I do not believe it is the fault of Foscam, I think this problem exists with all IP cameras requiring port forwarding for direct streaming. I highly suspect that my ISP (Comcast) has control of all my ports.  I called Comcast many times; they have mysteriously hanged up my phone during several of these sessions, exactly when I asked them about the ports.I called Foscam three times; their technicians were courteous and willing to help.  From their end’s examination, my port forwarding setting is set up correctly.  They tried and I also tried, using my phone’s mobile network, to remotely access my camera – but without success.Regarding the software – the ip camera tool is very difficult to set up for recording on your hard drive.  It appears to be recording using avi file format, but if you go to the path where you saved the file, nothing existed.  I am using IE8, and the live video only can be viewed on 32-bit, not with a 64-bit IE8 browser.  Google’s Chrome also works, and actually it is easier to take a snap shot from there.Another issue I discovered, regarding the ip camera tool, is that I was unable to successfully add another Foscam on the multi-device setting, so I can view both my cameras on the same page.The only internet access that I managed to make work is using the FTP setting on the camera.  The host website I use is Mangocam.  However, with this method you cannot control the camera, so there is no pan and tilt.  Also, the frame rate is poor.  The free subscription on Mangocam is one camera with 1fps.  You can also schedule video recordings with the free subscription, which works pretty good. Higher frame rates are available with paid subscriptions.I would like to know which ISPs will allow the customers to control some of the ports for personal IP camera monitoring purposes.  It seems that security cameras now the day are everywhere. I assumed it would be a breeze to connect an IP camera to my existing ISP broadband connection.  But I was shocked to discover that many ISPs will not allow this function.

Reviews.Title: works great....long term?
Reviews.Author: M. Groves
Reviews.Content: This is the 2nd camera I have bought.  First one worked great (after three hour set up) for about one year.  Then it would no longer connect to internet.  I bought a second one and connected it no problem (only ten minutes this time!) and it is working great so far (one week).  On the positive side I emailed tech support at Foscam to see if they could troubleshoot the problem on the first came and they emailed me back within one day...amazing.  The pictures are great and the motion capture/email a photo option is awesome for when you are not home.  i would recommend watching the awkwardhamster how to setup your camera video on youtube and throw out the instruction manual that comes with the camera.  The video makes it super easy.

Reviews.Title: Better than F18918W
Reviews.Author: Deal Maker "Alex"
Reviews.Content: This camera functions better than the F18918W but only by a slight margin. I would not purchase another. I'm not overwhelmed with Foscam at this point in time.

Reviews.Title: Amazing device and great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Anirban Adhikari
Reviews.Content: Today is the first day I am using it and excited how great this is as a baby monitor! Now I can watch my son from anywhere on iphone at anytime-:) I had some trouble connecting the camera to Wifi but Derrick from their tech support was extremely helpful and he logged on to my computer remotely and had it all setup.This is definitely far more useful than the regular baby monitor which is more expensive than this.

Reviews.Title: Works well, easy to setup, quality is right for the price
Reviews.Author: Ray Rauch
Reviews.Content: For the money this is fantastic.  I was able to easily set it up (minutes) and it works well.  You really need to use Internet Explorer to get the most from it (recording)  I haven't been able to find 3rd party software that works with it.  It would be nice if there were support outside of the browser capabilities but again for what it costs it's worked well and has a lot of cool features. (scanning, recording, nightvision)

Reviews.Title: For the price, works very well!
Reviews.Author: M. Mills
Reviews.Content: I now own two of these cameras, having purchased a second one during a recent lightning deal. For the price, I don't think this camera can be beat. Works very well as a baby (well, in our case, toddler) monitor. We have one in our youngest son's bedroom, and another in the living room. Even when our oldest son (15) is babysitting, it is very reassuring to be able to check in on them from anywhere using our phones (Galaxy Note II on Verizon, in our case.)On the software side, we use the Pro version of "IP Cam Viewer" in the Android Market. I've configured two widgets (per camera) on our phones: One widget that uses the local WiFi in the house, and another widget for remote access over our phone's data plan. So if we are at home and want to check that the little one is still asleep, we use the WiFi configuration (which uses a local IP address.) For remote access when away from home, we have our own domain name and dynamic DNS service. However, this is not required - Foscam includes their own dynamic DNS service for free, so you can reach your camera remotely over the internet without using an IP address (which may change, depending on your ISP.) Also, for remote access over the internet, you need to configure port forwarding on your router, which is straightforward to do.Very much recommended!

Reviews.Title: Our preferred baby-cam paired with iOS viewing device
Reviews.Author: Joshua D. Murrah
Reviews.Content: We bought this after trying out a few baby cams for our newbown... what we found is that most baby cams are cheaply built, are feature poor and the last one we had actually crippled our 2.4GHz wifi.The night vision is really cool, pan/tilt works great, and it is very feature rich with things such as mirror/flip if you have to mount it upside-down such as we had to.The interface is a really neat web UI directly on the camera... you'd be well advised to plug it on via ethernet to program it, then move it to wifi afterward.Ours has been rock steady, no issues to report.  We like to use it on our iPhones/iPad with the FoscamPro paid software available on the apple store.  You'll get several hours of viewing time, but it'll wear out your phone rapidly, similar to watching a movie or such, the iPad will go for a LONG time tho.Recommended!!

Reviews.Title: A great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: KC
Reviews.Content: This has been a great way to watch our little one. The IR view is perfect at night. The image is by no means HD, and there's no zoom feature, but for the price I don't mind at all.

Reviews.Title: Good picture. No audio unless using Explorer
Reviews.Author: grinder
Reviews.Content: The setup was relatively easy. If you've had any experience programming your router you shouldn't have any problems. I followed the instructions and set up the service with DynDNS and everything worked as expected. (I did have one small hiccup. Although I did not see any mention of this in the printed or online manual, there is evidently a max number of characters that can be used for a password. I exceeded that limit and had to do a factory reset of the camera and enter new passwords.) I will say this, despite their instructions, I was not able to get audio to work in Firefox. I tried both 32bit and 64 bit versions of VLC, but kept getting the same error while logged into the camera. I searched high and low for a solution, but after reading numerous forum posts from around the web, determined that it won't work. Audio does work with Internet Explorer, though, via ActiveX. As a matter of fact, the camera interface is much nicer via the ActiveX plugin. So, if you want to hear through the camera (and the sound quality is poor), you'll have to use Internet Explorer (the horror). As for me, I'd rather not ever use IE and audio is not important, so I'm fine with Firefox. That said, the Foscam folks need to get to work and do a better job of creating a nice interface for Firefox or Chrome.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W - PT - Black
Reviews.Author: b.squared
Reviews.Content: I ordered the Foscam for a little added security.  I wanted something that I could view remotely from my desktop at work and my iPhone4.  I had done quite a bit of searching around for a solid IP camera before I settled on this.  I had looked at d-link, tenvis, wanscam, and others.  However, none of those had the number of views that Foscam had or the number of helpful setup tips.  Soo after long deliberation I decided this was reasonable to get even after I had some concerns related to reviews and security.  To break it down further -What I like:+Price+Size of the camera (It is not an extremely large camera by any means.  Good to keep "hidden" in a tight location)+IR cut (Adds a more realistic color.  Not washed out.  Take a look at AwkwardHamster's youtube video comparing other foscam models)+Accessing the camera remotely (It's good once you get pass the setup portion, which I explain in my comments)+Picture quality - Good (Don't expect it to be the sharpest quality.  You are not going to see a hair on the ground 5 feet away.  If you are expecting long distance use with this camera don't expect amazing quality images)+Wide variety of settingsWhat I didn't like:-Power cord (~3ft, who does that?)-Reviews, a bit off topic but I want to make a comment about all of them.  Now I didn't like that so many reviews on Amazon start off by saying "I couldn't get my camera to connect so I contacted 'insert name here' from Foscam.  They connected the cameras in no time and were extremely helpful'.  At the time of this review 703 similar statements.  Now I find this somewhat fishy that 703 comments are similar.  It seems to me that it is a modified template for comments.  I can't say whether these statements are true or not but just keep it in mind that some if not all may be false comments.  Just my 2 cents.-Minimal information on remote DNS providers.  DNS provider - used to access camera outside of your home network.-Security encryption.  From what I have read in other comments this camera has no security when you try and remotely access this camera.  If you attempt to access it remotely your username/password is sent in "Plain Text".  This means if you use public wifi your password can be "sniffed" out.  Now this might of concern to some and others it's no big deal.  So I suggest for some to do more research on how to access your camera securely.  I personally plan on setting up the camera for viewing through a VPN (virtual private network).  I haven't done it yet but the goal is to purchase a router that has VPN capability and install tomato or dd-wrt.Stuck between like/don't like:>Camera setup.  This is a tough one.  Many people say turn away from this camera unless you have a degree in computer science because it is almost impossible to setup.  This is not necessarily true if you find the right steps online.  I didn't follow the owners manual for the setup or use the CD the camera came with.  I followed one reviewers steps and I got the camera up and running in no time.Camera Setup:I followed "R. Tickle's" instructions from March 29, 2012 to set the camera up.  Here is what he used with slight modifications and explanations that may make it easier for some.1) Do NOT install the software on the CD.  The CD is used to try and find the camera.  On my first attempt to access my camera I did toss the CD in and install the software, but unfortunately I was left with a blank text box with no camera IP.  The manual said I should reinstall the software so I did.  That didn't work so I decided to find it using my router web login explained below.2) Connect the camera by Cat-5 wire to your router.  My camera came with a coiled up cat-5 cable.  You shouldn't have to go searching for one.3) Login to your router (via browser, for linksys it is 192.168.1.1) and find the IP address assigned to your camera.  This should be fairly easy to do especially if you have the Linksys smart router.  Navigate to your connected devices and copy the cameras IP address.4) Login to the camera at that IP address (via browser) and IMMEDIATELY turn OFF the DHCP.  Copy and Paste the IP address for the camera into a new blank tab and hit enter.  This should take you to the foscam page that shows activex, server push mode, and mobile phone.  If you use IE select activex, firefox/chrome use server push mode.  Selecting one of those will give you a pop-up for username/password.  The default username/password is : Username-admin, there is no password.  Once you get in you can navigate to "Basic Network Settings"  and uncheck DHCP.5) Give your camera a fixed IP address on your network and fill in the subnet mask with what you normally use.  This step is pretty simple.  You can assign your camera an IP address.  I used the IP it was initially assigned except I changed the last three numbers xxx.xxx.x.151.  Next you want to fill in the subnet mask, which can be found in your router settings or I believe it mostly is 255.255.255.0 (per google search of course).  Enter in your gateway IP and DNS server IP (you will use the same IP address for both of these.  you can find this IP address from your router login page in maybe a "local networks" tab it should be the IP address of your router).  The last thing you can fill in is the HTTP port.  Select a four digit number such as "5252".  Remember this because it will be used to setup port forwarding.  Now hit SUBMIT and wait for the camera to reboot.  Now that you have your IP address for your camera nailed down you may wish to go into your router and assign the IP camera a static IP address.  This ensures another device will not accidentally take your foscam IP address.6) Fill in the SSID, encryption type, and share key used by your wireless network.  Hit SUBMIT, this will reboot the camera.  Now you you can unplug the camera from your router.  ***NOTE*** I have found that once you enable wireless on the camera it may take some time to actually connect to your wifi network.  So if you reboot your camera be patient (more than 1 minute patient).  Watch the camera for the green LED to have a steady and consistent blink.  Any hesitation in blinking means it has not connected yet.7) Re-login to the camera at the new fixed IP address to verify that everything's working and your settings have stayed.8) Login to your router and set a port-forwarding entry to map to the fixed IP address and HTTP port you gave your camera.  You will also have to enter in the device IP address, the one you just gave the camera.9) Now in order to access the camera remotely you will need a DDNS service.  Foscam now recommends "no-ip" for free DNS instead of dydns.  Do a google search for it.  Create an account.  Foscam has their own service free for 3 years but after that you will have to pony up some money.  No-ip is free but and has one downfall, every 30 days you will need to say you will keep the DNS assigned to you.  I haven't had the service for more than 30 days, but from what I have found online you receive an email and have to navigate to a link that is in the email.  I guess this is the price you pay for a free service.10) Go back to your camera settings.  Select DDNS Service Settings then Select third party DDNS drop down and find no-ip.  Enter your username and password.  This is the information you used on the no-ip site to create an account.  Finally you will want to enter in the ddns host.  This is what you set up to be your camera website/host.  Example:  mycamera01(dot)no-ip(dot)biz.  Sorry about the dots, trying to avoid having information blocked.  Now click SUBMIT and wait for the camera to reboot.11) Now try and access your camera using your new host.  You can try this from 3G/4G to make sure you can connect outside your home network.  Open browser tab and enter in all the host information.  Using my example: mycamera01(dot)no-ip(dot)biz:5252.  If you notice I entered  :5252  after the host name.  This is because we changed it earlier in step 5.12) You now should be able to connect remotely.  Since the hard part is done go and change your username and password to the camera if you haven't done that yet.I hope these steps help lower the frustration of setting up this camera.My final comment!!IP Camera APPS. I mentioned earlier that I had an iPhone and wanted to access the cameras for remote viewing.  After much searching I decided to download "LiveCams Pro" right now $3.99 in the appstore.  I selected it after seeing others recommend it and seeing all the cameras they support.  I may or may not want a different camera manufacturer such as d-link and the app supports them.  However, this is not the only app available, Foscam has an app (not free) that you can download.  From what I have found it works well but other than that I haven't had experience with it.I will update with my opinion of the camera as time goes on.  Feel free to check back in a few months.

Reviews.Title: Looks great but instructions to create the interest connect option leave much to be desired.
Reviews.Author: Robert M., Williams
Reviews.Content: I ordered this product because it appeared to just the thing I was looking for. As it turned out, I have a camera that works wirelessly within my net work but does nothing else. I have spent many hours rereading instructions, watching videos narrated by a Japanese gal who is doing her best but it just doesn't come through for me (To her, a router is a "rooter"....being a plumber, I should know how to open gateways on a rooter but, here I am ).I would appear that my only alternative is to spend an additional 40 bucks to have a technical guru figure this thing out. On a positive note, the camera takes excellent resolution video. It wouldbe great if I could see it on my iPhone!

Reviews.Title: It's OK, but there must be something better... please.
Reviews.Author: Patrick Rigney
Reviews.Content: I now own four of these cameras, of which one has proven defective out of the box and needs to be replaced, so right from the start, let me issue this warning:AMAZON DOES NOT ACCEPT RETURNS ON THIS ITEM. If you receive a defective unit, YOU get to pay to ship it to Foscam and wait 3-4 weeks (according to their web site) for them to ship you a replacement.Now let's talk about the rest...As a stand-alone IP camera, this seems to be a pretty good item. Many reviewers have mentioned that the setup is a bit technical. I happen to have a background in network engineering, so for me, no big deal, but I can very clearly see how other reviewers would have trouble setting this thing up. It takes a bit of work, even for someone like me, and even after configuring multiple of these cameras on my simple home network.If you will be using the cameras on a secured WiFi network, don't expect a high frame rate. The encryption necessary appears to really slow the camera down, so not only does the frame rate drop precipitously, but the camera's response to PTZ commands gets pretty sluggish. I get around 3-4 FPS in WPA2/Personal with AES encryption.Once you get everything set up, it works OK. Other reviewers have pointed out that some features work only in Internet Explorer (on Windows), not Firefox or Chrome. The camera works fine for me in server push mode on Chrome and Firefox, and the user interface is indeed reduced, but only trivially so (minor features like an On-Screen Display can't be enabled).The camera settings are fairly straightforward, but I did discover early what others have also noted: use a fixed IP address. The camera's DHCP capability is a bit hit-and-miss, especially on WiFi. Also be aware that there is no password for the default admin login, so you MUST fix this in the settings, because combined with another default setting, it may leave your camera as a potential security hole in your network--the default dynamic DNS setting is ON, and automatically sets up a simple name in the myfoscam.org domain, so your camera is easily discovered and accessed. Go through each setting, and turn off any features you don't need, including uPNP and Dynamic DNS, unless you understand what they are, why you need to enable them, and how to secure them if enabled. And set a password on admin!A few other reviewers commented that in order to see the camera outside of their own network, they need to sign up for some kind of service, for which there are often fees. That's generally true of any network camera, not a Foscam-specific issue.The defective camera is an interesting beast. It works for a while, but two other nearby cameras (same model, all configured for WiFi) go offline whenever it's powered up--it takes the WiFi network out.  A third camera some distance away has no problem. A little RF analysis shows that the camera is splattering badly--lots of noise all over the band whenever the transmitter is on. Clearly it's got some ills internally, as it also reboots randomly. Again, it's like this out of the box, and I get to pay to ship it to Foscam for a replacement and wait three or so weeks to see if its replacement does any better.All in all, if you get a working unit, and you are able to set it up properly, it will do what you want. I can't call this a high quality item, just based on the feel of the product (plasticy-cheap), the clunkiness of the software and firmware (ugly/techy but gets the job done if you can read between the lines), and the questionable support/return policy for DOA product.

Reviews.Title: super
Reviews.Author: Mark Twane
Reviews.Content: I love the ethernet connection.I use the free IP Cam android app.If you don't want to fool with port forwarding to see your cam remotely, set up PPTP VPN on your home pc, then connect through VPN and access your camera "locally" (like 192.168.1.x, or whatever IP address your camera has on your home network) even when you are away from home. For more security, but quite a bit more complex to set up, use OpenVPN (free).

Reviews.Title: Excellent value for the price
Reviews.Author: Joel Martin
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera as a baby monitor and I am using it with "IP CamViewer Pro" on Android and "Baby Monitor HD" on iOS and it is wellsupported by both. Camera setup was easy and just required attachingit to a physical network port. There is no need to use the includedsetup disk; just look at your router DHCP client list and browseto the assigned IP address.The pan/tilt control works great and is quiet. On the downside,changes in lighting conditions cause the camera to emit a audibleclick. I assume this is a relay controlling the infrared lights. Indusk-like lighting the camera sometimes clicks every couple of minutesas it tries to find the right lighting setting.The microphone picks up sound well. On the other hand, the speaker featuredoesn't work very well (choppy sound) but its unclear whether it is a problem withthe applications I am using of the camera itself.But overall this camera works much better than the other WiFi cameraI have that costs three times as much. It's great value for the price.

Reviews.Title: 6 months in and infra-red lights are starting to fail
Reviews.Author: P. Turner "flyinghat"
Reviews.Content: I thought this was a great product - (a little quirky on the software front for Mac) but generally decent enough.Now, 6 months later I'm not so sure. Only 2 of the infra-red lights work when the device is plugged in, the rest intermittently - which also might explain why I've been getting so many false positive motion alarms even on low sensitivity.Going to try for a replacement with Foscam seeing as its under warranty.

Reviews.Title: UI issues with wireless setup.
Reviews.Author: B. Pfeffer
Reviews.Content: Trying set up the device to use the wireless network and ran in to an issue.  If your wireless password contains two periods in a row anywhere in it, the device will not accept it and the error message is meaningless.  After waiting on hold for ever, spent an hour on the phone with support (from India and I could barely understand the person due to a very heavy accent) and I am not even sure they understood what the issue was or if it ever even got logged as a bug to be fixed.In order to use the device over wireless, I had to change my wireless password on the router and on all of my wireless devices (all of which worked with the original password).  This was a huge pain and is really unacceptable.Another support issue was with the firmware update information.  At one point in the process of trying to confirm that I had the latest firmware, I got an automated email from sales@foscam.us that indicated that my firmware version was current at .49.  After some more digging I found a place that showed my firmware was not current and that .51 was the current version.  Two different places in their support system gave me two different answers.From my experience so far, once I got everything working I am happy with it but support was bad enough to be non-existent if I didn't already know what I was doing.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: J. Soukup
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to use as a baby monitor for my newborn son.  It's now a year later and I can say I am 100% happy with this camera and highly recommend it.  We use it on our iPad with the Foscam Pro application - this application is only a couple $$ and it's worth it.  My mother-in-law is able to log in through her browser as well and watch her grandson sleeping or playing in his room.  The resolution is more than adequate and I always have a clear picture whether it's nighttime or during the day.  The IR functionality works perfect.  I was actually amazed that I could see as good in the dark as I could.  I even went into the room to make sure it was pitch dark.  The ability to pan around the room and have two way audio makes it even better.  Once you have this camera set up you will love it.So the cons.  I'm a techie and the set-up of this camera took quite a bit of research, going through forums, and watching videos.  I have AT&T; and at the time there wasn't much documentation on how to set this up for my specific router so I had to go through trial and error.  A year later I'm sure there's better documentation available then there was for me.  You need to know what you're doing as you have to go into the configuration of your router and make modifications.  For viewing your camera away from home use [...] - it's free.  As long as you have the patience to set this camera up or know someone who will set it up for you, it's absolutely worth it.  Remember, Google is your friend.

Reviews.Title: Not everything works.
Reviews.Author: bill schmitz
Reviews.Content: This was an AMAZON Warehouse Deal $10 off because of open box. After setting it up by the numbers the wireless camera does not work, it only works with a cat 5 cable plugged in. The camera does not work with two way audio either. The Mic on the camera works but the speaker does not. Not even with an exterior speaker plugged in.  This camera is inside my front porch and it would have been nice to have 2 way audio. The audio was tested with four different PC's with the same outcome. When I try to talk to the camera all I get is a broken reverberated squeal. The video works well on all four PC's. This is a learning experience- don't buy open box electronics!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Would be 5 stars if connection didn't drop or reconnected quicker
Reviews.Author: Timothy W. Macinta "Tim"
Reviews.Content: This camera packs a lot of features for the price.  The night vision and pan and tilt features alone would make it a huge leap up from the last time I shopped around for wireless cameras, about 5 years ago.The one serious drawback that drops this down from 5 stars to 3 for me, and might make it useless for other use cases, is that the connection drops out frequently and the power then needs to be reset for it to be usable again within a practical time frame.  Dropping the connection in and of itself may or may not be the camera's fault.  I do have it set up at the opposite end of the house from my router and a few other devices drop off my wireless network sometimes too.  However, of those other devices which do lose their connection, they seem to detect this quickly and automatically reconnect within a few minutes.  The Foscam camera will stay disconnected for hours.  The camera definitely drops its connection much more frequently than any of my other devices (and many of my devices don't drop it at all), and it should really try to reconnect on its own much more quickly.Resetting the power does cause the camera to reconnect to the network, so it is still of use to me since I am using it as a baby monitor and am therefore home and able to reset it when needed.  I imagine this wouldn't work so well if you wanted to use it as a security camera when away from home.  But for me, I've decided that the night vision and price make it worth the hassle of resetting.  I've come up with a few workarounds to ease the pain.First, I bought this remote controlled power switch so that I could turn the camera on and off from another room and not need to open the door and wake the baby:Woods 32555 Outdoor Remote Control Outlet Converter KitB001Q9EFUKSecond, the camera seems to cut out less when I simply view a snapshot image rather than leave the video feed running.  I wonder if a lag in the video feed might cause the server on the camera to get backed up to the point where something dies.  The snapshot is available at the URL "/snapshot.cgi" on your camera's website.Third, in conjunction with using an image snapshot instead of the video feed, I have also installed and use the "Tab Auto Reload" Firefox add-on.  I then put the snapshot in its own Firefox window and set it to automatically reload every 10 seconds.  That has been good enough so far and should presumably be less demanding on the camera's web server.

Reviews.Title: Looks cool, performs lousy
Reviews.Author: Bob T.
Reviews.Content: The only good things I will say are:  It looks cool.  It has very good low-light (black and white) operation.  It's easy to install, except for the audio.  It's cheap.Bad things:  Even though it advertises a 300,000 (640x480) pixel resolution, the actual resolution is probably about 76,800 (320x240) so the picture looks very fuzzy when you display it at 640x480 size.  I suspect that the base image is only 320x240, and that software is used to increase the pixels without actually increasing the optical resolution.  (It's just like using digital zoom on a digital camera as opposed to optical zoom.)There are no built-in recording options, so all you can do is look at it in real time.  Options are almost nonexistent which is probably why setup is so simple.  I sent mine back.My review is based on my experiences I have with 13 other network cameras I have of various types.

Reviews.Title: excellent service
Reviews.Author: Boom
Reviews.Content: we bought this camera online. had some problems setting it up.  we called the foscam company for assistance.  we received great assistance.  we were able to connect and get online within minutes.  So far, we are really pleased with our purchase and service.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Mac Butterfass
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, really like that it work wirelessly.  The instructions however, are a challenge, they are not quite right.  You have to have a good working knowledge of computers to get this camera fully functional.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera
Reviews.Author: M. Sanders
Reviews.Content: Great for indoor use.Beautiful pictures and the audio functions work flawlessly.This model has the bugs all worked out.You won't read lines on a face or even a license plate with this camera, but from close up to 15' you'll get recognizable pictures. If you need to see details farther out than 10-15' look for a different camera.

Reviews.Title: Christina from Foscam is amazing
Reviews.Author: Bruce Jaffe
Reviews.Content: In no time at all, Christina was able to configure my device so that I could access remotely.  She is a gem.The best feature of the camera thus far is the ability to access via any device worldwide, as well as the ability for the camera to capture video in low light conditions.I highly recommend the Foscam unit.  Beware of fakes all over the internet.  Go with the real thing as the service is just as good as the camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, excellent value
Reviews.Author: James E. Baker "James Baker"
Reviews.Content: I received this camera as a gift from my wife. We wanted to be able to check in on our puppy while we are at work (nerds, I know!).  This camera is under $100 and has so many features! I get a clear feed on my laptop, iPad and iPhone!  I can control the direction the camera point remotely. It has "night vision" which is cool (if not creepy). It is wireless so we can hook it up anywhere somewhat near an electrical outlet. The only two improvements that may be available in other models would be a zoom lens and full HD quality. But I do not need those features myself.TWO IMPORTANT NOTES:1) Setting up this camera for remote access on the internet can be DIFFICULT. It requires you to do advanced setting on your home router that you probably are not comfortable with. I would recommend doing a Google search for Foscam + your router's brand/make. You will find specific instructions out there (maybe even in a video format) that will show you exactly what settings you need to change. If your ISP assigns you a dynamic IP, you will also need to sign up for a service like No-IP.com provides. So, again, that's more "pain in the butt" setup for you.
