Once you get past the setup, the thing works GREAT!2) If you are using an iPad/iPhone to view the video feed, download the app "FoscamPro".  It cost maybe $5 but it is SO much better than trying to watch via Safari. That $5 price does get you the app on both your iPad and iPhone if you have both.Overall, I really like what I am getting from this camera and would definitely buy another if we need it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera!
Reviews.Author: Laurence L Ostrow
Reviews.Content: I have to say after doing a lot of research on wireless IP cameras, I finally chose this one and am quite pleased with it and all of the features.  This is my first IP camera and bought it mainly to watch the interior of my home while I'm away.  Setting it up was a bit tricky.  The included CD disc is a bit worthless as it does not install anything on your computer, you must find the file you want then load it.  I have found that you really don't need the disc to setup your camera.  What you do need is a good understanding of your routers menus and interface and port forwarding.  To use this as a wireless camera and to remotely access it via the internet or a smartphone or tablet app, you need to set up the IP address of the camera and the router followed by the port assigned to the camera, which is done manually via your routers setup.  After many hours of tinkering, I finally got everything working with the internet and the foscam app for my android devices.  Setting up the email alerts was easy once I figured out that I had to reset camera to factory defaults, start over and then setup email.  Foscam support says that Gmail is not supported but it is and works fine with this model.  After all of the learning curves, this is a great camera and I will be buying a few more.Pros:Good pictureLow light settings work very goodRemote accessCons:Very tricky to set up at firstAudio is sketchy

Reviews.Title: Perfect for what I needed - ...and I'm very picky
Reviews.Author: JM "Jason"
Reviews.Content: This thing was a bit of a bear to get set-up on port forwarding (so you can control it from anywhere).  Here's the "easy" way, which are the exact notes I took when the engineer next door helped me set it up:Set up the camera like it says with the software.  (easy - anyone can do it)Purchase the $30/year DNS service it suggests (It says you don't have to, but I can't figure out how not to use DNS.com)Add Port Forwarding on your router (Google the IP address and admin password, then just type IP in your browser)Camera - says Indoor, but we'll see how long it lasts outdoor because the IR can't see thru glass, and I want it to watch my driveway.  I put it under the eve so hopefully it lasts until we sell the house.  I have to move and don't want to leave this place sit empty without cameras.  Leaving my router, and taking all my computers.  Leaving 3 cameras as sentries.GREAT audio and video and snapshots, email alerts, auto-recording (makes a AVI file under your documents).  Neighbor bought hi-end outdoor one that does same thing for about $500, and this one was $89-ish?

Reviews.Title: Good for local network.
Reviews.Author: Steven E Winterbottom
Reviews.Content: I bought this product to watch my pets while we were on vacation.  Our daughter was looking after them while we gone and my wife just wanted to see them while we were away.  Neither I nor my friends could make this work on my 2wire using MSN Explorer on an AT&T; network.  I tried calling Foscam but was always put on hold.  After waiting 2 hours for a total of four phone calls I finally gave up.  Product works good on my in-house local network but does not work over the internet that was not what I bought it for.

Reviews.Title: Works well once you figure out the tech part of it.
Reviews.Author: Kheng Din Phun
Reviews.Content: Features are good.You do need some fire wall security and "porting" know how to get this to work.  It was frustrating because even the techs I called had problem trying to get remote access to work.  I own a motorola cable modem that wasn't set up to allow ports to be opened without calling for motorola.  Even then, I didn't pay for motorola to help me--But strangely, the ports opened after I decided to give it one last look through.  I'm not even sure what I did  differently.  But it now works.  I think it's easier to set it up with other routers.The manual directions could be better.  Foscam's support could be smarter.I guess one less star for not making it easier to set up by the average Joe,

Reviews.Title: Foscam using MAC OS
Reviews.Author: Thoma A. Vinson "0-Dark:30"
Reviews.Content: When running the IP Camera Tool2-for Mac.zip a pop up window appears after double clicking your IP address.  Entering "admin" for user and leaving password blank did not work.  Foscam site suggested pushing RESET button on bottom of camera with a pin for 35sec while powered up.  This works!!  Hope this saves MAC users a half day in troubleshooting.

Reviews.Title: Nice surveillance for reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Ram"
Reviews.Content: Nice camera to view clear picture in 360 degree angle, Audio feature is additional advantage with this camera. Price is reasonable.

Reviews.Title: Better than I expected
Reviews.Author: Hankster
Reviews.Content: The set up was not quite as easy as I hoped but with online videos and FAQ areas on the website I got it going in about 2 hours.  I did update the software before I set up the camera itself. I don't have a static IP address so found their link to a free provider very useful as it allows you to set up a web address to look at your camera over the web from most browsers.  The only issue I have with that method is that there is quite a lag in time and jerkiness when something is moving.  Otherwise, the picture quality is quite good.  The viewing area is great as the camera rotates so much and can even be controlled over the web.  I set it up to look out a window and then rotate it into my room to check for flooding, etc. while I am away.  If you don't want to send or receive sound you can cut off the plugs on a cheap set of airline headphones and insert them into the audio ports as there are no "buttons" on screen to turn on and off audio.  So overall, for the price it is exactly what I wanted.

Reviews.Title: Great for monitoring - VERY HARD to install
Reviews.Author: Jennifer W.
Reviews.Content: I like the camera. It allows me to monitor the goings on in my house.  It pans and tilts and the night vision is good as well.  The only headache it caused me was installation.  It was not easy - and I am computer literate.  I spent three hours trying to set it up to no avail.  I finaly broke down and called the help line (in india).  Aside from communication issues with the rep, I allowed him remote access to my computer and he had it up and running in about 20 minutes.  Dont have the sound capabilites installed yet and I sure that will take another call to india.

Reviews.Title: Works Great
Reviews.Author: Geekout2
Reviews.Content: I read some negative reviews on this camera and was a little concerned about buying it.  Setup was not for the faint of heart.  I had to update the firmware out of the box.  This process was a little confusing and finding the correct files could have been simpler.  Afterwards, I had trouble finding it on the network.  This could have just been me.  I had initially wanted to use this wirelessly, but that didn't pan out.  I had enabled wireless during the setup and then tried to use it hardwired and this caused some conflicts on the network.  Once I got everything sorted out and set up with a little troubleshooting.  I then signed up for a free ip, at no-ip.  Since the, it has worked great.  It freezes occasionally, but after a reboot it works fine.  Overall, I am very happy with this camera and considering buying more.

Reviews.Title: Works, doesn't work
Reviews.Author: Oppie7802
Reviews.Content: I bought two of these.  I attempted to set up one of them but had issues with not being able to view it on the internet; all I got was the 'image icon' on the screen.  I had a friend (IT guy) come help but he could not getting set up either.  I sent foscam an email and got little help with a statement about the router signal exceeding 50ft.  I bought two 9dbi antennas and that didn't help.  Because it took so long to 'TRY' to set them up, I can not return them for a full refund.  Bottom line... it should not be that complicated to set up, I am not completely computer illiterate but could not figure out how to get these to work.  I never called technical support because I work all day.

Reviews.Title: foscam is the best! excellent customer service!! A++++
Reviews.Author: Madeley
Reviews.Content: Just received this camera and attempted to set it up myself. its very easy to understant the instructions but i had a problem when i got to the router setup as i was unsure where to find the settings for this .i called the customer service and after a few minutes sandra took over and set everything up!! Even though i have not played with the camera yet i highly recommend it over any other camera out there. I already have a baby monitor cam and the picture does not even compare to what i can see with the foscam on my ipad. i will update more after i have had time to go through the features but i can tell i am just going to LOVE everything about this cam!

Reviews.Title: Wonderful Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Laura
Reviews.Content: When we found out we were expecting our first child, we had one requirement for a baby monitor: to be compatible with our iPhones/iPad.  We loved the idea of having a video monitor but hated that with all of the traditional video "baby monitors" you needed to use their included viewing screens and they were so expensive!  The Foscam Camera and app have worked absolutely perfectly!  It was easy to install and performs great!  It's great to have to added features of being able to record video with it, turn the infrared on/off depending on the time of day, use the microphone option to talk to our baby when not in the room, change the viewing angle remotely, and use the convenience of our Apple devices, as they are always with us anyways.  Another option that it has but we haven't used yet is that the camera can be accessed remotely through the internet on any computer anywhere.  My husband will be deployed soon, and I just love the idea that he will still be able to check on his little boy sleeping no matter where in the world he may be.  If you are looking for a great baby monitor, this is definitely it!

Reviews.Title: Simple install, not the best resolution
Reviews.Author: IT Guy
Reviews.Content: I used this for a security camera at one of my job sites to catch any suspicious activity.  There were several opportunities to catch the people who would break in but the picture quality was never quite good enough to positively identify the facial features.  Also, I would improve the pan option so you can actually set your motion parameters rather than it pan the entire 180 degrees.  Overall, for the price of the camera, the quality is good enough.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: keipk
Reviews.Content: For the price, this is a great product. Yes, you do have to be able to make changes to your network if you want to access it from the web, but there are several articles that describe how to do this. The video and audio quality are very good. The only thing this camera lacks is a zoom capability, which of course, would make it cost more. I would buy a Foscam again and I would recommend them to others.

Reviews.Title: The Best IP PTZ Cam I've Owned
Reviews.Author: R. Cross "LVWolfman"
Reviews.Content: I bought my FI8910W almost a year ago (July of 2012) and it was my second one of the type.  The first was a Foscam clone with the same features as this for about 1/3rd less.  Quality of video is similar but setup on the Foscam is easier.In almost a year, it has never failed and I've never had to contact support.  I view my cameras on the Mac, Windows 8, iPad, iPhone and Android tablet using free or very low cost software.I'm here today not just to leave this review but to buy another one.  I use them for security cameras and to monitor my 86 year old mother-in-law who lives alone four miles away.  I'd gotten used to being able to check on her.  We just moved her to another house and I haven't moved the camera yet.  This morning I found that she didn't answer an automated phone call I set up to remind her to give her dog his epilepsy pill.  So I called her only to get a busy signal.  So I drove over to find the phone knocked off the hook and her reading a book.  If I'd had the camera set up again, one click would have reassured me that she was OK.These cameras a great for that use.  If you need razor sharp HD recording for evidence in criminal cases, no... nothing in this price range will suit.  But if you want to have a reliable way of checking on a room, this is very hard to beat.The best feature is the night-vision.  The infra-red LEDS do a great job if lighting up a wall over 20 feet away.  In fact, it is difficult for me to distinguish between interior night vision and daytime video in one of the rooms (there's no much color in the room.)

Reviews.Title: Motion Alarm email does not work
Reviews.Author: USDIrish
Reviews.Content: I have emailed more than 20 times with their customer support, and they will not even review the setting screen shots they requested.I have set up the camera correctly. When the camera boots up, it sends me an email telling me that the camera has reset and is back up. So I know the email settings are correct. The camera software does note when motion is detected, as can be seen from the device status tab. But it will NOT send an email informing me of the alarm, neither motion nor sound alarms.I even returned the camera and the new one exhibits the same flaw.As this is a crucial feature, I have to give the camera no more than two stars.Try again, Foscam.

Reviews.Title: great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Brian Gehle
Reviews.Content: bought this camera as a baby monitor and have been using it to keep an eye on our dog while we are out and to check in on house until our little one arrives. It works great on our smart phones and kindle fire. Set up was definitely a bit of a trick so have some one that can help you if your not good with networking.  All features seem to work as advertised. The pan and night vision are great. I do recommend this product as inexpensive home monitor.

Reviews.Title: I have 4 and will buy more
Reviews.Author: JoeFromPA
Reviews.Content: This is great if you need to keep an eye on your home, cars, kids, pets, etc.The camera takes some time to set up but if you follow the directions and you have set up a WiFi router in the past, you should be able to configure this IP camera.  Just make sure you connect the IP camera to your router with a Ethernet cable.  Once you have it configured, you can configure the camera to use your home WiFi.I love the alarm feature.  You can set up a motion detection alarm where the IP camera will snap 5 pictures of the viewing area and send them to your email for review.  This is great if you are traveling and you are only interested in looking at your IP camera when there is someone moving around your home when they aren't supposed to be!!Also, if you want the ability to monitor your IP cameras from outside of your home WiFi you will need pay close attention to the setup instructions.  You will also need to enable Port Forwarding on your WiFi router.  It is not rocket science and if you haven't done it before check out your manufactures' web site and look up Port forwarding.  It is a breeze to setup once you have an understanding on how it works.Pros: Inexpensive, easy to set up basic features, tons of featuresCons:  Could be tricky to set up if you don’t have a basic understanding of WiFi routersLove them!

Reviews.Title: A LITTLE ROBOT
Reviews.Author: Annette Hamilton
Reviews.Content: it is very nice i really like it the way it rotates all around and up and down. that is great

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W Camera
Reviews.Author: sailorman
Reviews.Content: Great camera with great technical support.  Andrew did a great job setting everything up and getting me up and running using my iphone to connect to the cameras remotely.  Could not be more satisfied with the unit and with the service.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: JAMES WAITE
Reviews.Content: Received my Foscam camera in the mail yesterday.  I got it set up on my network and it works great!  I was having trouble getting access remotely so I called the customer service dept at Foscam.  Barely any wait and boy did they get me set up quickly.  I am very happy witht the camera and the support I received from Foscam.  Highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: So far an excellent product
Reviews.Author: MobileUser "MobileUser"
Reviews.Content: Wasn't expecting much for the price, but build quality is good and web features are excellent.  Pan/tilt has a very wide range which I didn't expect, and picture quality is excellent.  Very fast response through the web, much better features than the Panasonic models I had for 4x the price (the Foscam sends multi-pics in one email, sends external IP via email, external DNS works without separate web setup, etc.).  I haven't tried low-light yet, but so far all the features have been great.  Took off 1 star as the ActiveX control freezes my PC, but I can successfully use the server/mobile version fine and make config changes remotely using those.  At this price point I am very impressed so far with the product.

Reviews.Title: impressive in some ways disappointing in others
Reviews.Author: Paul Harshman
Reviews.Content: the camera has an outstanding daytime picture with great color. at night when the IR turns on, the picture is still very good with washed out colors one expects in a camera of this price range. the disappointments are as follows: the antenna sucks. I currently have 4 FI8910W's and none of them perform as well as the older FI8908W because of antenna issues...... foscam needs to upgrade current production and retrofit existing cameras with a better external antenna to help with the problem, the second issue is that the camera performance  can vary due to which way the wall wort (power adapter) is plugged into the wall receptacle ........

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer service provided by Scott.
Reviews.Author: DMP
Reviews.Content: Customer support was very knowledgeable, remoted in and easily set up the camera. Very convenient. The email alert feature is a positive.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: Dominic
Reviews.Content: You don't have to spend $200 for a baby monitor. This Foscam works well for my baby monitor, I use it everyday, my wife look at him via this Foscam from home and I spy on my son from my work. The installation is pretty easy. They provide all instruction in the manual that came with the product. I have been using for a month now and I have no issue. I will probably buy a HD line for the next one.

Reviews.Title: Buyer Beware - Check the Hardware Version when it arrives to see if it has Wireless N or WPA2 Encryption Capability.
Reviews.Author: routerjock
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying that I own 2 of these cameras in white already. I have never had any big issues that took any real amount of troubleshooting. For $70 a camera, I have found real value in these models. That is until the last camera that I purchased.I have these perched in my window sills, so there is a bit of reflection from the white camera, and I noticed that it was alot less with the black model so I bit.  The last month I have went through the RMA process with Foscam and after hours of troubleshooting finally a return of the camera back to Amazon.I hope this review will help others in similar situation.  The value in these cameras (for me) was the ability for them to do Wireless N and WPA2 Encryption. Both the product page and the box packaging advertise both of these features. For the first 2 white cameras, they did indeed support them, but for the last black camera, I was having major issues getting the thing up and working properly.That is when Foscam Support informed me that there were 2 versions of the camera being sold, with 2 different Hardware Architectures supporting 2 different Firmwares.  The older of the two not supporting wireless N or WPA2 encryption.To check this, if you look on the bottom of the camera, there should be 2 stickers with MAC ID's. The smaller sticker is for the wireless. If it is VNT it is the older wireless G hardware. If it is FR it is the newer wireless N.This might not be an important feature for some, but for me I would have to run my network in G wireless mode which would effectively bring the speed down for all my wirelss clients.The bottom line is that Foscam should not be selling old Hardware as the Newer stuff.  Was this a one time mistake or is this widespread is my question.  I hope my experience is the exception and not the norm.  Check those stickers.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Product and Customer Service
Reviews.Author: FearFact
Reviews.Content: Very Easy Setup, I was helped by Andrew. No technical knowledge at all to setup camera, as was done by tech support for me (I called in, they setup the camera via teamviewer). I am happy on to have a wireless camera installed and at a very good price.I will most likely by a 2nd camera to use. Recommended and I spent hours researching which camera to buy on Amazon.Looking forward to future products of Foscam.

Reviews.Title: It is just OK...Has Value but not a Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Frank "zzfranczz"
Reviews.Content: I got this to replace my baby monitor.  The audio is terrible and there is significant lag (Running on a separate N wireless network) between real time and the video playback.  I would say it is 95% stable and you have to worry about the camera being operable since it can and does crash or lose connection from time to time.  I use the internet connection using the service that the MFG recommends.  It is easy to set up and works well.  Again significant lag and that affects the controls and the operating the camera.  This can cause the camera to lose connection and this is where most of my issues have been.  The audio over the internet is worse than terrible due to the lag.The video quality is decent I would not call it excellent quality.  You can tell that it is better than my baby video monitor.I would buy this item again for a security camera or monitor but not a baby monitor for a baby under two.  The camera has value and it is from my research one of the better cameras.  I give it the 3 stars cause of the issues and not being able to depend on it as a replacement for my baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: WiFi is dead
Reviews.Author: deemin "deemin"
Reviews.Content: These units don't cost much, and they have decent video and good features for the money.  The config tool is not great, limited initial setup, had to follow the opposite of the  instructions to access the camera with IE.  The WiFi was working for a week, then stopped.  All settings checked, it's the unit itself.  Decided to use wired Ethernet as that works fine.  Decided to not send it back, contact support, etc., It's too much time to do so and easier to use a wired Ethernet connection at this point.  Regarding the setup tool, it is what it is:  limited.  It's not at the level of an airport express airport utility for example.

Reviews.Title: Good-ish camera, poor everything else
Reviews.Author: Caleb
Reviews.Content: Don't let anyone tell you this is not a good camera.  The picture is what I would expect and the controls (when logged in over IP) work great.  That is where this stops being a great camera.  The installation software that you can set up to record when the camera senses motion is insanely confusing, and no combination of varied settings can even get the software to find my camera.If you want this camera to do what you want (other than send you 500 emails a day if you are actually able to set up a DYDNS account with a compatible email) you have to buy another software suite.  I already spent $80 on the camera and software it comes with.  On the Foscam site, instead of links to in-depth tutorials on proper setup, they simply have links to buy Blue Iris.This is a crock.  Do not buy this camera because of the price, it is not worth it.  There are many other options for cameras that will work out of the box and don't take a week of frustration to set up properly, only to fail when the wifi stops working or your DYDNS expires, or you get booted from your email server because of your insane amount of incoming email.

Reviews.Title: Bought for using as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: IndiansDJ
Reviews.Content: After researching all of the various baby video monitors out there, I landed on this one.  While this isn't marketed specifically as a Baby Monitor, it has all the bells and whistles that the other ones have, with a lower price.Pros:- Great rotation of the camera. Able to view many angles.- Night vision works great.- Wifi connection.- Two - way audio- Web access is awesome. I can check my camera on my iPhone, iPad, @ work. I can also setup user names and passwords for friends and family to view the camera from their home.- Lots of 3rd party apps to choose from on your iPhone.Cons:- Easy to setup through Ethernet, easy to setup on local network. Wifi setup was slightly difficult. Web access was also on the difficult side. If you don't have the correct security settings on your router, you may have to keep resetting the camera to get it to connect. This take some time every time you have to disconnect/reset/reconnect. There is a lot of great documentation on the internet about how to set this up, so I didn't have to call tech support. Someone who doesn't know much about routers or setting up networks might find this process to be a little on the hard side.- No zoom.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W
Reviews.Author: RT "MB"
Reviews.Content: I finally got my Foscam yesterday and was super excited to set it up. I had some trouble with port forwarding and called the 1-800 number on the quick guide. A rep named Peter answered and without wasting time with unnecessary questions, he right away jumped into action by remote logging into my pc and seting up the whole system in 10 -15 min. He also wrote notes for me which I could later use to setup my Ipad to remotely monitor. I must say, this is one the best customer service experience I ever had !!Coming to the camera itself, this is my first security cam and I am pretty happy with the way its working so far. Wish it had zoom option. but, I guess I can live with out it. I did not yet get a chance to try out all the features it offers, like email pics/videos.

Reviews.Title: Support from Foscam (Calvin)
Reviews.Author: John Hollis
Reviews.Content: My new Fi8910W would re-boot when pointed at something in bright sunlight.  Foscam support was available by phone with a 2 minute wait.  After the initial screening questions the suggestions were do not use an extension cord, its is not an outdoor camera (true, it is not built for outdoor weather, but the web browser tool does have an 'outdoor' setting for viewing outdoors), your router must broadcast its SSID, and this will work only on wireless.  After this, Calvin took control of my system, changed my router to broadcast SSID and the camera worked.  He was helpful and courteous.  He was a pleasure to work with. He even took my browser to Amazon so I could do a feedback.The reason the SSID change fixed the problem was that it was getting dark and the IR cut filter no longer was being invoked and the camera was not re-booting.What finally fixed the problem was I simply rotated the lense 1/8 of a turn.  This must have loosened something (perhaps the mechanical IR cut filter) and the camera started working fine.I am now very pleased with its function, clarity and for keeping watch for critters in my garden the vivid colors are very helpful.  This camera is much better for viewing outdoors than prior Foscam camers without the IR cut filters.

Reviews.Title: Spend more money and get something better
Reviews.Author: Bateman
Reviews.Content: We purchased this for our children's room as baby monitors are far more expensive and generally not as good in quality as a traditional security camera. I will start by saying the design is seriously flawed. There is virtually no way to mount discreetly (the mountings they give you are hideous and bulky and depending on where you want to put the camera, still useless).As for set up, thankfully my husband got it all working but it did take him a fair amount of time (and he works in an IT department!). I would wager unless you are technically inclined, this would be a nightmare!I find the feed rather slow/delayed at times which can be frustrating. It's not 'the end of the world' but it's still annoying. I also don't enjoy how many times I need to 'refresh' my browser when this is on. It times out after 'x' amount of MINUTES, so I need to go back into it and refresh it to get the feed back. THE biggest issue however, which is why I would NOT recommend this to anyone, is how many times the camera needs to be 'reset' (simply by unplugging it and plugging it back in). I find that annoying in itself that there isn't a 'reset' ON the camera, and you are forced to locate the plug and do it that way. When you want to sign in to view, an 'unable to connect' screen comes up and you need to go into the room, and unplug it and plug it back in - which makes the unit pointless since we want to view our children's room WITHOUT going in! We need to 'reset' it just about daily and it's very random as to when it will happen so I would NEVER use this for actual security purpose or you could lose out on valuable surveillance just because of it's poor quality.I also don't like the fact (as far as I know) there is no app from Foscam for a smartphone. You need to use a 3rd party app which seems highly insecure to me so I log in through the internet on my phone which then disables the camera's adjustment functions so unless the camera is set up exactly the way you want to see it, you're stuck staring at whatever it happens to be pointed at.All in all, not thrilled. I don't completely hate it but the more I have it, the more I dislike it. We've only had it maybe 6 months and it seems to heat up quite a bit and the 'reset' needs to take place more and more often. I would recommend saving up and buying something from a more reputable company with higher quality standards.

Reviews.Title: Check with other equipment in your house
Reviews.Author: Hiran Wirekoon
Reviews.Content: I would have given this a 5 star. The quality of the video is great and it is easy to install. However, my challenge is that it interfered with my garage remote. So when I have this on my garage remote does not work as it interfers with the signal of that.Just be aware of that but if not the product is easy to install and worked very well with a really nice clear quality picture.

Reviews.Title: Poor Wireless Connection
Reviews.Author: Wilton A. Little "da Bear"
Reviews.Content: When this connects it works fine, but the internet connection is hit and miss and the network connection might work. Mainly I am frustrated with the works sometimes and not at others. I work in IT so I know how to set this up with my LAN and Wireless router.

Reviews.Title: Tick, tick, tick
Reviews.Author: Jody
Reviews.Content: The camera makes a very annoying ticking sound!It is also very difficult to install. I finally got it done after 4 hours and the help of a friend.

Reviews.Title: Setup Tip: Each camera has two unique addresses
Reviews.Author: P. Sorrells
Reviews.Content: Quite pleased with the cameras, but access to the camera wasn't working until I realized that when you switch from wired to wireless, the IP address of the camera changes.Here's what I learned:Attach the camera to your home network via the wired connector and the address that shows up in your router/modem's setup will be "X". Enable wireless access, disconnect the wired connection, look in your router/modem's setup and there's another address ("Y"). This is the one you need to use if you plan to access these things remotely via their wireless interface.You may be saying "Well, duh," but everything that you attach to your network shows up in the router/modem's setup and in my case there was no information provided that let me determine which address belonged to which device, so I didn't notice the change/new address at first.Bottom line is that it would be best to write down all the addresses shown in your router/modem's setup and, as you add each camera, write down the new address that appears when you attach it wired, and then the new address that shows up when you switch it to wireless access. This last address is the one you will use when you open the ports on your modem/router to allow remote access.I recall reading complaints about the noise that the camera makes when it turns on the IR LEDs, and it does, indeed, click quite loudly. When I first started using mine, it would automatically turn on the IR when the sun set, which is not what I wanted (mine are looking out windows for daytime monitoring, and the IR just bounces off the glass and blinds the camera), but once I started using the Android version of IP Cam Viewer by Robert Chou and manually shut off the IR, they now stay off. Cool.Resolution isn't great, but it seems most IP video cameras are 640x480 (unless you're willing to spend a lot more money). Still good enough to monitor the condition of my lawn while I'm on vacation.

Reviews.Title: An Interference Nightmare
Reviews.Author: aquarius
Reviews.Content: This camera was difficult to configure through the network. After spending 2 hours I got it to work wirelessy with my router using a DMZ port. I ended up purchasing an app to view the camera remotley since it was impossible to use the "free" service.One day my wife came home and the garage door was open. She called the police and the police swept the house, no one was inside, nothing was disturbed. I moved the camera to the garage to monitor when and if the garage door would open again.Next morning I couldn't open my garage door at all from inside the garage using my transmitter. I unplugged the camera and was instanlty able to control the garage door again. I ran an emissions scan on this device and it is 7 dB over FCC Class B at multiple frequencies!!! The spectrum is so noisy it overloaded the analyzer during quasi peak measurements.I would not reccomend this device or other Foscam devices made in China based on their lack of FCC compliance.

Reviews.Title: Good feature set, but mediocre implementation
Reviews.Author: Dave Mulder
Reviews.Content: Pros: automatic IR filter, motion detection, email alerts, dynamic DNS.Cons: images in lowlight are too blurry to be useful, motion detection alert emails contain 6 snapshots but none of the images are useful (too early or too late), reboots itself several times a week.I started using it as a stand-alone security/surveillance device it. It has all the features I wanted, and it did work okay, but the features didn't work all that well.  Now I am using it just as a wireless IP camera with another computer doing the motion detection, which works much better, but now the FI8910W reboots itself several times a week, and sometimes swivels to an odd angle, making it useless until I manually adjust it.

Reviews.Title: Good camera
Reviews.Author: David
Reviews.Content: good camera but a little hard to install, especially the port forwarding function. Have to call customer service for help. They are helpful but long wait.

Reviews.Title: foalin camera
Reviews.Author: Tracy
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 Foscam outdoor waterproof cameras (model FI8906W) to monitor my mare that's due to foal.  Shopping for cameras is very confusing!  Since my employer uses Foscam for his security cameras and is satisfied with their performance, I called Foscam.  Edward was very helpful in selecting the camera that would do the job for me, but not be super expensive.  Basically, he didn't sell me a camera that would be more than I needed just to make a sale!  The cameras are very easy to set up to monitor within your own network.  I'm not very computer literate, and I was able to do it myself!  I was even able to set up my wi-fi to handle them so I didn't have to run an ethernet cable all the way to the barn!  However, I did have difficulty setting up the cameras to view remotely.  That's my computer illiteracy coming into play!  I called Foscam's technical support, and Ryan helped me set up remote access in a very short time.  He made it look much easier than it really is for your average person with little computer experience!I don't normally submit reviews because products and their services today aren't what they used to be.  However, Foscam is excellent! I'm very happy with my product and the support service they provided!  I wouldn't hesitate to purchase another product from them, and I will recommend them to anyone who is looking for a security camera!

Reviews.Title: Working great so far
Reviews.Author: aophil
Reviews.Content: We bought this as an alternative to the much more expensive baby cameras available for twice the price.  We set this up in the nursery using this mount (Pedco Ultra Clamp Assembly 360 Swivel Mount for Cameras and Optic Devices) to attach it directly to the side of the crib.  We use an old iPhone as the dedicated screen.  I downloaded and paid for an app called "FoscamPro" that utilizes all the features of the camera, such as two way audio.The set-up features of the app allow you to access the camera over the LAN, which facilitates much faster operation, less delay, and higher update rates.  It also works over the internet using your IP address (but you have to be able to set up port forwarding).  One nice feature is that the camera comes with its own dedicated URL valid for 3 years, which means you don't need to have a static IP.I've played around with some of the other features, like motion detection, email notification, and uploading directly to FTP.  I set up my Windows Home Server with an FTP client, and played with the settings in the camera until I got it to upload files directly to a directory on the home server.So far, this camera has worked exactly as advertised and was totally worth the money.  However, you need to be a little bit tech savvy to really take advantage of all the features.

Reviews.Title: Fine for security camera, questionable for a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Dave Baxter
Reviews.Content: I know I know I know it's not a baby monitor, but I'm not the only one with this idea. Being the geek that I am, I decided that an IP camera was all I needed to monitor my sleeping angel from anywhere.  For that purpose it does work, but has some pretty significant flaws.The camera does what it boasts, night vision, audio, etc. but it does so quite loudly and intermittently.  When it switches between normal and infrared, there's a significant clicking noise.  Right around dusk, when it can't determine the best mode, it seems to toggle back and forth until the light levels drop enough for infrared to stay on.  Great, but by this time my infant child is wide awake and staring directly at the camera.  Not fun.The other interesting quirk could be either the camera or the mobile app... not sure.  On irregular intervals, I log into view the camera from my phone and it will flip into "scan" mode and pan the room top to bottom, left to right.  Not a huge deal as it's easy to get it refocused, but it's a bit of a hassle.I've also noticed, as have others, a significant clicking from the audio output.  From what I've read it has to do with the shielding, but none of the solutions I've found online seem to help any.  Since we have the white noise machine going, audio isn't critical, but it would be nice to have the available features function as they should.All things considered, we still use the camera, but I don't know that I'd make the same decision knowing what I know now.

Reviews.Title: The new one I purchase works just fine
Reviews.Author: Dean Liming
Reviews.Content: The new one I purchase from Amazon is working just fine.  But the one I bought December 5, 2012 stopped working; will not turn and no picture.  I called company and they told me to contact Amazon which I did and they said on their website that they only have a 30 day return.  The box says that it has a two year Warranty so I called the company and they said to email sales@foscam.com which I did and it been three days and I still have not heard anything from them. I have bought 4 of their non-rotating cameras and have not had any trouble with them. Foscam just sent me a RAM to return it to be fixed.  They are a good company and have always treated me fair.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price...but even better service!
Reviews.Author: J-Girl
Reviews.Content: I bought the camera awhile back and set up was..not easy but not too hard. Then one day I had power outage and lost my router. Headache after headache trying to get things going again - no fault of anyone but myself (I think I fried my brain when I fried the router). Finally I got desperate and called Foscam tech support.In a word..OUTSTANDING! I spoke with Ron Jacob who took right over and had me up and running in MINUTES. My biggest regreet - not calling sooner. Thanks to Foscam for a good product and especially thanks to Ron Jacob for outstanding support.

Reviews.Title: Maybe not a wifi 'n' product after all.
Reviews.Author: Florida "merbine"
Reviews.Content: First, I've owned the (now cheaper) F18918W for a year or so and it does pretty good for its price.  I wondered why this 18910W, with lower model number, would be more pricey and have some better reviews, so I bought one.  A few caveats:  the Amazon page advertising says:  "Built to last with solid construction, wireless 802.11 N, IR-cut filter and 2-year warranty."  But at another place it says wifi b/g.  So which is true?  On my multi-router network, it will NOT run on the 'n' only router, but will run on the older b/g router in another area of the house, wirelessly.  If I turn the 'n' only to 'mixed' b/g/n  then this camera communicates.  So, I'd say the  "wifi n" is false advertising.  The box it came in also said "wireless n".  In other areas,  I'd agree with others that its color is probably better than the 18918W.  But the clarity appears the same or not as clear, subjectively speaking.  Its sound doesn't appear to be any more static-free, unfortunately.  It has a cleaner, simpler web interface.  Surprisingly loud little built-in speaker. Good mic level, but audio artifacts seem to plague Foscam.  Audio is understandable, but the noises can be tiring if trying to monitor a child or someone for safety.  Setup is not difficult but I avoided their disk, and set it up on cable first.  Just remember there are  two different MAC addresses: one for wireless and one for wired, so if you are assigning ip addresses from your router by MAC address...  This camera also was 'preloaded' with a dynamic domain service similar to dyndns.org (which is no longer free) and it began "contacting headquarters"  a little too fast for my comfort.  Already a little paranoid about the little executable files you have to download and accept in order to view/hear this camera, when the Chinese espionage in this country is rampant enough, so I deactivated (i hope) their free service which helps those who don't have another option to find their home's ip address while traveling because some provider like ATT takes your  DSL's static ip address away without warning so they can later try to collect $15 per month for this 'luxury' but I digress.  I'm just leery of some corporation or country being the 'mother ship' that handles this privacy issue.  My final thought:  stick with the less expensive 18918W since neither appears to differ that much.  I'll try contacting HQ to see why the contradictory 'n'  verbiage.

Reviews.Title: Ok, but calls home on internet.
Reviews.Author: MattT
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera because it claims to have two-way audio support. I have 5 other network camerasfrom trendnet, panasonic, and dlink so I figured this would be easy.The features are not nearly as extensive as the panasonic cameras but this falls into the 'cheap'catagory so I guess that is expected.---Privacy problems.This webcam accesses the internet every minute without permission and you can not turn it off as far as I can tell.Your webcam will automatically set up "Manufacturer's DDNS" (ie they are tracking all theircameras).ddns.myfoscam.org01:46:07.928172 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 1101:47:08.649235 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 1101:48:09.214181 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 1101:49:10.004308 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 1101:50:10.643388 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 1101:51:11.384625 IP x.x.x.x:xxx > 173.230.150.191.8082: UDP, length 11If you try to set ddns.myfoscam.org to another IP locally so it can not call home this thing CRASHES and REBOOTS continiously and is unusable.If you set the webcam gateway and dns to something that is unreachable it will continuously spew arp packets on your network trying to call home.If you firewall port 53 to it can not do dns queries it will continuously spew DNS packets on your network---Android App.They have one. There are no instructions and it requires you to login to use the app but they dont give youthe login info to do it !If you can search enough to figure out how to get the app running, if you dont get all the parameters correct when setting up a camera the app just crashes. The app appears to be designed for phones not tablets and scales badly when run on and nexus 7.

Reviews.Title: Works well, but be aware it DOES NOT support 802.11 N
Reviews.Author: D. Martin
Reviews.Content: Be aware that the description is very misleading about 802.11 N support.. this camera DOES NOT support it.The product works well otherwise.

Reviews.Title: Great camera/baby monitor and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Grape ape
Reviews.Content: I bought this to work as a baby monitor with my iPhone and iPad. I read a lot of reviews that said it worked well, but it was very difficult to set up. I decided to give it a try, and I am glad i did. The images it produce are great. I was pleasantly surprised at how easy it was to setup. I've never done anything like this and had to google a few technical words, but I had it completely set up in about an hour. The hardest part about the whole thing was remembering how to log in to my router. So if you have a brain in your head and can use google you shouldn't have a problem setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera, HORRIBLE Customer Service.
Reviews.Author: chris
Reviews.Content: Bought the Foscam FI8910W camera to work as a baby monitoring/security camera several months ago and it was worked great. I especially like the fact that I can control the camera with either my iPhone or iPad. Overall I have been very satisfied with the camera and its featuers. The setup is a bit technical, and I still have not been able to get the camera to transmit the feed when not connected to the same wireless network, but I assume that is due more to a lack of time on my part than the camera's fault.One thing I do have to mention however is how horrible Foscam customer service has been. As stated, I initially bought this camera as a baby monitor and security camera for my daughter. As she has gotten older it has become more viable to mount the camera up on the wall so as to get better coverage of her room so that I can check on her when she's playing. To my surprise, when i went back to mount the camera with the included mounting bracket, I find out that the included mount did not securely fasten the camera to the wall mount, which allows the camera to rotate freely on the horizontal axis. This makes the wall mount virtually unusable. If I wanted to mount the camera on a vertical wall, the camera swings around freely so that the heaviest part of the camera is closet to the ground, thus making the camera's Pan and Tilt functions useless.After going to Foscams website I realize that the mount they included with the camera works ONLY with the FI8918W cameras, and does not seem to fit the FI8910W. Further evidence can be found on Foscam's website in that if you buy a 2-camera bundle of the FI8910W cameras, the bundle includes a completely different wall mount than the one that came with the camera I bought, which shows that they have obviously already found, and corrected this problem with new purchases. Thinking of course that this should be an easy fix, I emailed Foscam to notify them of the problem with the included mount, in hopes that I could get a replacement sent out that would work with my camera.Here is the emailed reply:we can send you a new standard wall mount.you will have to pay for the universal mounting bracket.Best Regards,XXXXXXXX.Abysmal customer service.Camera - 4.5 stars; Customer service - 0 stars.

Reviews.Title: I loved it for 50 days, then, it died...!
Reviews.Author: Sir Einstein A. Guzman "Sir Einstein"
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for monitoring my newborn. I'd been using it flawlessly from feb/15/2013 until yesterday, april 5, when it suddenly died, for no reason. It stopped working, no matter what i did. I live in Venezuela, so I can't just return it. I have to find the way to repair it and pay for it. I will try with a different DC Adapter to see if thit was what failed (i hope so). I wrote to foscam yesterday, I hope they at least refund me my 100 $ or send me a new one.

Reviews.Title: eh, it's ok
Reviews.Author: Lara
Reviews.Content: * resolution of this camera is not great* software that comes with camera is very poor.  You'll have to find something else.* documentation that comes with camera is very poor, but the engrish makes it fun to read.* If your internet provider is on IPv6, you won't be able to access your camera directly from the web.  Forget the outdated instructions about port forwarding.

Reviews.Title: My First IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Jeff Darcy
Reviews.Content: I have to say this camera is almost perfect.  I had never set up anything like this other than a wireless network.  The included software worked fine for me.  Between that and a few Youtube setup videos it wasn't all that difficult.  I bought this to use as a baby monitor and I use my iPhone to view remotely.The infrared quality indoors is great.The one minor issue I have is the wireless interference.  I have noticed a constant hiss/crackle when using it over wifi, which becomes rather annoying.  Plug in the ethernet cable and it goes away.  It's a minor issue for me but it makes me lean towards just running an ethernet cable.  (this could be an issue with other wireless devices in the house)Overall I definitely recommend this camera as an alternative to expensive video baby monitors.

Reviews.Title: Very good IP camera for the price
Reviews.Author: jcgoobee "jcgoobee"
Reviews.Content: I got this camera and had everything up and running (including software installation and hardware mounting outdoor) within an hour.Here's what I did.1. Connect the camera to the network switch (or router) through network wire first, power it up2. Wait 5 minutes, before loading the IP camera tool from the CD-ROM, and it will give you the assigned IP address for the camera3. Connect to the IP address from the web browser to perform configuration4. Configure wireless with static IP address (or DHCP if you like). If you don't assign a static internal IP address to it, once your lease is up, you will need to re-run the tool to get the new IP address again, but it's not a big deal5. Once wireless part is done, unplug the ethernet cord, and the IP tool should tell you the new IP address since it's connected wirelessly.6. Now, you can put it anywhere as far as your wireless signal can reachGood: Easy to setup, already got the latest firmware pre-installed, picture quality is quite good, the plastic mounting bracket is good for installing outdoorNot too good: The start up time is not that fast. It would rotate the camera head all around before it stabilizes. Also, restart of the device is needed for many settings changes to take effect, then you'll have to wait a few minutes for its to reboot. Arh!!!!Bad:  Nothing. Hey, what else can you complain for this price?Conclusion: I like this camera, and probably get another one (or two) for my other parts of my house. I have had it installed by the garage so I can monitor my home when I'm away. Remote control takes some time to get used to but it's not too bad. Make sure that you sign up with dyndns.org so you can "find" your camera easily in the internet.  I didn't give it a 5 star due to the annoying reboot frequency and boot up time. Other than that, I'm pretty happy in general.I hope it helps. Please rate and comment.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and does the job
Reviews.Author: Gerald Nelson
Reviews.Content: I cant say I am not pleased with this little guy. I especially enjoy the fact that it's very small and light. Was away for a few days and I was able to see my bedroom and living room just by rotating the camera, it's all about angles and finding the best one to cover as much ground as you can with one unit. If you have a larger area to cover you might need a couple of this bad boys but they will certainly do the job.I didn't give it 5 stars because I think the software is a bit cumbersome and can be better, specially when used from a phone. It does work well on the IPad.

Reviews.Title: Granny Cam Delivers Peace of Mind
Reviews.Author: D. Likely
Reviews.Content: My mother's gerontologist said it was time for a companion when I'm not at home.  We disagreed, and I find the Foscam a perfect interim step.  It is wireless, has good picture quality, delivers a 360 degree view and has two-way audio.  There's a six-second delay on the audio so I don't like it for two-way communication, but I can hear everything that's going on.  I turn on the monitor as soon as I get to work and can keep tabs on things at home while at my desk.

Reviews.Title: Know what you're getting
Reviews.Author: Jason
Reviews.Content: As other reviews stated, camera is not easy to set up. Once installed, audio does not work on my Mac and I cannot move the camera as advertised on my iphone. I need to move the camera from my computer and monitor it on my mobil device. Not very convenient. The iphone/ipad apps (including foscam apps) available are not very good and seem to be lacking refinement. Camera works ok and video quality seems acceptable.

Reviews.Title: Great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Josh Bayer
Reviews.Content: I bought this as a Black Friday special to use as a supplement to our traditional baby monitor. We were always curious as to what our daughter was doing in her bed when we left the room. The camera works great in my opinion. The night vision works pretty good. For the $70 I bought it for it works probably better than those expensive baby video monitors that cost $200. I have an iPhone and find that the FoscamPro app works really well with this camera.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support Overview
Reviews.Author: Shaki Commissariat "supernutcase"
Reviews.Content: The Foscam FI8910W is a good camera BUT the tech support is atrocious. I had the displeasure of dealing with one of their techs today who was rude beyonds words.  The tech's name was Harry Foster (Fake name). I believe that their tech support is in India. It was quite obvious that this person was not very knowledgeable about networking but his rude attitude is what alarmed me the most. Needless to say that my port-forwarding issue did not get resolved and the tech blamed the camera as being defective and asked me to return it.I don't think I will be calling the Foscam tech support anytime soon......nor buying another Foscam camera.

Reviews.Title: Works great :)
Reviews.Author: R. Evans "RE"
Reviews.Content: Although this camera does NOT perform at the same level Foscam touts it to be, it's still a very good IP-camera setup nonetheless. I've had two of these camera's in place for just over a year now and have been very happy with them. I use them at my home with one covering the front entrance and the second one covering the rear porch/yard area. Both camera's perform well for both day and night operation. Unlike older model camera's, these have an infrared filter that moves into place when it gets dark. Daytime operation is full color while night time operation is black & white only, which is normal for any infrared type camera system. Video is a standard MPEG4 with embedded audio capability if desired. This model can be used either CAT-5 wired or wireless operation using 802.11g with all current encryption methods. It is NOT "n" capable but obviously will work on an "n" router if the router is set to allow such connections. Can be a pain to set up initially but once set up it works great. One thing I've notice about both camera's is they reset at random times for no apparent reason. They come with a 5-volt "wall wart" style DC power supply that usually requires the use of an extension cord because the power supply cable is rather short. Some have suggested the use of an extension cable causes random reboots because of a drop in the 5-volts required for proper operation. However, only one of my two camera's use an extension cord, yet both have this random reboot issue just the same. Have never figured out why they do this so I just live with it, as a full reboot takes about 45 seconds before the camera returns to the predefined position you set up in advance. For me it's not a major issue but for some it might be, as it could occur just when you need video evidence the most!Recently there was a newer model (FI9820W) that came out which offers 720p HD video, H.264 compression and an incorporated SD slot (not sure if it's standard SD, mini or micro) for on-board storage if desired and I believe 802.11n wireless capable instead of g-only wireless. I'm thinking about upgrading to this model but I understand through that particular model's reviews it has it's own set of issues as well. I guess "we'll see" :)If I had to buy this camera over again I'd do it again I think because for what it is it's still a decent camera for the price, and now it's even cheaper than it was a year ago when I purchased mine so they're an even better deal now :)Please comment if you've got any questions about this camera and I'll be happy to get back to you, as I'll receive an email anytime someone comments here.

Reviews.Title: Sound feature not Mac compatible
Reviews.Author: crazyk
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for use as a baby monitor. There are several apps that work pretty well with this camera for the iPhone and iPad. But, I bought this so that I would have the flexibility of using my Mac or an iOS device to view and listen to the camera. So I was rather disappointed to find out that If you want to use the audio features of the camera, you must use IE as your browser. This is not made clear in the description of the product. And seriously, who still uses IE?!I understand that the Foscam 720p IP cam (Foscam FI9821W Indoor Pan/Tilt H.264 720p Wireless IP Camera, 1/5" Color CMOS Sensor, F: 3.6mm F:2.4 (IR Lens), IEEE 802.11b/g/n Wireless Connectivity, Black) is compatible with browsers other than IE. It would just be nice if they brought this 'feature' to this camera.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Pan & Tilt
Reviews.Author: Gail Martin
Reviews.Content: Am enjoying this camera.  We bought this to be able to view the house in our absence.  So far, working well.  I had to call for installation assistance.  I am glad I did.  I missed something in the set-up instructions, which was my bad, but the tech had to change some settings for my Ooma phone to make the camera work properly, which is something I would not have been able to do.  The tech gave me instructions for remoting in from my phone.  I am not sure if I misunderstood, but I was given the wrong IP address.  Once I changed it, I was able to connect without a problem.  I did not get the camera with the SD card for storing pictures.  Not sure if that was necessary for my needs.  Also, am not using the microphone capabilities at this time.

Reviews.Title: Love it!
Reviews.Author: eli
Reviews.Content: I really like my Foscam, I hooked it up myself, and than it stopped working remotely,I called the customer service number. and was not expecting much help from them since I had read many negative reviews on here, but i was pleasantly surprised when a women named Sandra answered.  I allowed her to take  control of my computer, she made my ip address static, and it fixed the problem. All in all it took her about 15 minutes, it works great now. I use the camera as a doggie cam to keep an eye on my puppy while I'm at work.  I would recommend purchasing this camera. If you are not a very technical person just call customer service and they can help to hook it up. I plan on purchasing another :)

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera's
Reviews.Author: Gman
Reviews.Content: After installing my Foscam Fi8916W, I was unsable to get port forwarding to work properly for outside the home viewing. After a few minutes on hold for tech support, I was put in contact with Mr. Harry Foster.Mr. Foster with Foscam tech service found my mistake remotely and wizzed me through a fix.  He had me off the phone in less than 10 minutes and all of my camera's up and running!Thanks for the great customer service,George G

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Lauren
Reviews.Content: I just installed 2 of these cameras. Never did get them to work with Internet Explorer, I have 64 bit apparently will only work with 32 bit. Works great with Chrome.Kate in tech support was great. I called about the issue with internet explorer, she was very helpful in completing the setup of camera 1. Then I was able to setup camera 2 with ease.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: C. Cianciola "Chuck"
Reviews.Content: Camera works great so far.  Only have had it for 2days.works great and great costumer service. Need longer customer service hours.

Reviews.Title: Expensive features...affordable cam...peace of mind.
Reviews.Author: J. Burbano
Reviews.Content: I bought the cameras almost 2 years ago, when they just came out.  I moved from my parent's home more than a year ago and before I did I knew I wanted home surveillance over POE (the only thing this camera lacks that upsets me but I can read the specs so it's not like a surprise hit). I bought the cams early and left them in storage, a netgear POE switch, TPLink POE injectors and lotsa cat5e cables.  I tested it when it just got delivered and it worked beautifully. I have had it installed, not via wifi, bringing data from cable modem, to linksys router to netgear POE switch to TP Link injector to camera.  I did not want visible lines so I run the CAT5 through some paintable j-tunnels by the roof/wall joints and through 1/2 grommeted holes through walls.  I felt it's not home security if someone can run up to the camera and just unplug it. I have the vids/pics sent to FTP, email and record locally, can never have enough backups to the backups. The settings were easy to follow and those that weren't were resolved by their forums page on foscam.us. For well over a year now i have used it for about 11 months turning it on only when there isn't at least one person awake in the apartment, ie if everyone is sleeping, it is on as well.  I have it set that when it turns on it resets to the preset "home" position. Having gone through hundreds, maybe thousands, of reboots, it is sturdy.  Recently I have just left it on non-stop for over 2 months.  Video quality is not WOW, but it is not an HD model so it's not like it was unexpected.  In a house the quality is good enough to make out details in people's faces and clothes.  For outdoors I would not recommend anything other than 720p or even 1080p, but indoors in even a larger living room, which I have, the quality is good for what it is used for.  I used dyndns for remote capabilities and I use tinycam pro on my android for viewing the cams remotely or even when at home. Because I know my text message email address (for verizon it is cellphonenumber@vxtext.com) I send alerts also to my cell phone. There are a ton of good settings and you can program when to alert and when not to, if you have a set schedule. It allows alerts on movement, but my tinycam app also enables alert on sound threshold, which is weird since it is not available on the actual GUI on the cam itself.  In essence...great baby monitor as well. I have a bro-law that recently got a mobicam that says that you can remotely via the feed, which he liked so should my sister take a nap he could monitor the baby remotely as well as her.  Little did he know that it required you to have a pc, no mac, always connected via usb to the wireless monitor (lcd screen) and was only accessible via the mobicam website with 2 free hours a month or unlimited for $10/month.  Well a baby monitor is not an ipcam. The sound alert lets you select a threshold, so when noise gets above it, ALERT. Do only drawback I can find is that the GUI loses features on anything other than IE, like sound and multicam viewing.  The other drawback is that FTP saving only works for pics, to save video you need a pc connected as the cam doesn't, can't?, save itself so you need to be running the GUI and it saves on the laptop or network device.  With the number of usb android devices coming out, the tiny ones that fit on usb drives, I can see this not being to much of an issue, but it would have been nice to include ftp or dropbox. Other than that, price and quality are unbeatable.

Reviews.Title: 5 stars... oooh so close.
Reviews.Author: Benjamin D Sodos
Reviews.Content: I can go through this thing forever.Point is why. It is an IP cam very easy to setup, lots of awesome features, Has a website free for just your cam.tons of uses, love the motion detection and FTP uploading... love love love it...So, why not the 5 star rating you would ask... simple. It dies one me. Every other week or so i try and log in and nothing.I have to remote into my home network and open the camera locally and force a power cycle which works 99% of the time.a 5 star product you wouldn't need to reset all the time.

Reviews.Title: It works. My observations...
Reviews.Author: Sydney
Reviews.Content: There's already 1800+ reviews on this but I wanted to write my observations anyway in case anyone is thinking about doing a similar setup. I put this behind my front window next to the front door pointing outside. Since I'm not on the ground floor, the front door and window is the only easy entrance to my condo.The setupI can see this is not the easiest gadget to set up for non-techy folks. They come with just okay instructions, but the great thing is this thing is so popular, there are TONS of videos online on how to set this up and configure different options. Just Youtube the Foscam and you can find many step by step videos on how to set this up, configure wireless, motion sensor, and remote view.Motion sensorThis is what I mainly use my Foscam for. I want to be alerted if anyone is coming close to my condo. The Foscam only sends pictures and not video, and it takes about a minute to get it in my email inbox. Not great if you want instantaneous alert, but the pictures overall works decently well. I've caught delivery people, people coming with ads, friends coming, and someone loitering (she looked right into my Foscam and left, guess it worked?). It's also great that you can set your schedule to turn on/off the motion sensor at specific times (half hour intervals). Some observations though:- The motion sensor only works when objects are relatively close by. This works well for me since I have two of my neighbors' doors in my Foscam view but them going in and out never triggers the motion sensor. It only gets triggered when people are closer.- The motion sensor is very reliable during the day, but not so much at night. I have night lights outside, but still the Foscam motion sensor only catches me coming back at night about half the time.- The Infrared on/off triggers the motion sensor which can be extremely annoying. It took me awhile to figure out what was going on, but I found that with infrared on at night, turning on and off lights in the condo would turn the infrared on or off. Every time this happens the motion sensor would trigger and I'd get an email with useless images. I ended up turning infrared off because all I see with it was the reflection of my sheer curtains anyway.Remote accessNot the most straight forward to set up but again plenty of videos online with step by step instructions. Lots of apps out there also you can use (free or paid) to view the camera on your mobile devices. I have Foscam Pro ($6). Pretty clear view from my iPhone and have all the options to pan and tilt.SoundsHaven't tried this yet.Overall the Foscam works and does the basics very well.

Reviews.Title: Good, but you must update firmware!
Reviews.Author: dan
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera, but at least as of writing the white cameras where shipping with buggy firmware. Mine got stuck in a constant reboot cycle when plugged into one specific router, but was fine when plugged into a different one. Once I found a router it was stable on I updated the firmware and all was wonderful.  Do not attempt to update the firmware while it stuck in a rebooting cycle.I have two of these, and once the firmware is updated I think they are great cameras. Follow the setup instructions in the reviews for the black version of this camera and you will be good to go.

Reviews.Title: Blurry Pictures
Reviews.Author: M. Jones
Reviews.Content: I purchased the Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera to monitor a sliding glass window in our basement den. This window has been the source of two burglaries and we want to have evidence if we get another break-in. The pluses for the FI8910W is a good feature set, easy to set-up, a nice alarm feature that sends emails when motion is detected.Unfortunately, there are two negatives that result in our rating of two starts. The biggest issue is the photo's are too blurry to recognize anyone. For the motion it has detected so far, its been my daughter who uses the den a lot. While I know it is her, there is no way from the photo's the FI8910W sends to us that we could recognize her. The faces in the photo are way to blurry. We have the unit set to the maximum 640X480 mode and to be fair, perhaps at this resolution any camera will not allow faces to be displayed. But we did expect more out of the unit,The seond negative is once a day, the unit changes position and points at the ceiling. This makes the motion detection and photo's useless. We can log in to the unit and go to a preset to get it positioned correctly, but not something we want to do daily.If you are lookign for a security camera, would suggest you look elsewhere. Find one with a better camera resolution which will allow for positive identification.

Reviews.Title: As advertised
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Setup OK until getting to the web connect feature.  But, easy to find instruction on line for Mac setup via Airport Extreme.  Picture quality acceptable for the $$$ paid.

Reviews.Title: Excellent IP camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Shoper "Amazon Shopper"
Reviews.Content: // To view this video download Flash Player (version 9.0.115 or higher)'); } } catch(err) { fp_resizePlayerSpace('cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9C', 0, 0); } return false; } function _cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9CloadSwf(movieID, playerVersion) { var swfLocation = "http://g-ecx.images-amazon.com/images/G/01/am3/20120510035744301/AMPlayer._V148501545_.swf"; } // ]]> var cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9CRollOverImg = new Image(); cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9CRollOverImg.src = "http://ecx.images-amazon.com/images/I/812yqaTZhyS._SX320_PHcustomer-video-vignette_PIvideo-reviews-bottom,BottomLeft,0,43_OU01_PIcustomer-video-play-active,BottomLeft,130,-12_CR0,0,0,0_.png"; logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9CcurrentClick) { return cv_mo3JEM1RX5RD9CcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 1:50 MinsPros:* The Foscam FI8910W wireless IP camera has some great features for a low price* The picture quality of the Foscam FI8910W is crisp and clear and the IR cut filter makes it even better where it doesn't have to be adjusted manually in the dark.* good pan and tilt with wide coverage* Works great with mobile app (IP Cam Soft app for Android and iOS)Cons:* Setting up port forwarding is a bit tricky

Reviews.Title: Good camera great price
Reviews.Author: T. Wallin
Reviews.Content: My 16 year old son installed this camera on our home wifi network in a couple of hours  --opening the router port was the only challenge for him.  The picture quality is very good and the overall feature set for the money is outstanding.  The pan and tilt functionality is really cool and IR works well at night.  I downloaded the Foscam Pro app for my iPhone which gives me flawless control of the camera from anywhere.  I'm very pleased and have already ordered a Fosam outdoor camera to complement my setup.

Reviews.Title: What a pain in the ___ to set up!
Reviews.Author: Mandy L
Reviews.Content: This camera might be useful if it didn't require having a PhD in engineering to set it up. I got it to work and I could view it on the computer... on the SAME WIFI as my house! Whats the point? I want to view it from my iphone and computer at work. Yeah, that was like trying to part the red sea! I am rather computer saavy yet I could not figure it out. The instructions were awful. Thanksfully Amazon is so amazing and getting a refund and returning it was the easiest part. And the customer service for this stupid camera was awful. They pretty much kept telling me the same thing. I am no idiot, but this thing is impossible to setup.Oh, and don't waste your $6 on the iphone app. Its pointless.

Reviews.Title: I wanted to love it but....
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to love this product because the price is right and the picture quality is at pair with the price.  The feature set for the software is also great but...The WiFi radio is bad.  It worked for about 2 days and then stopped working.  I had to spend a lot of time trying to configure it and nothing worked. It would connect to my network sporadically then it stopped connecting all together.  Their service department was unable to help me.There is a big delay between the time it detects motion and the time it takes the picture.  I had the camera pointing at the entrance door in a fairly standard sized living room and each time somebody would enter, the camera would send me an email with meaningless pictures.  The person managed to enter and get out of the frame almost each time.The browser viewing page regularly display a dialog saying that it lost the connection to the camera and stopping the picture both when the camera was wired and wireless.  Dismissing the dialog would start the streaming just fine but it does require user input and, if you don't realize the dialog is up, you are basically not listening/viewing the area.  This makes it useless as a baby monitor because if you keep it on the background waiting to ear noise you will be missing the action.Sadly I had to return the camera.  I would not recommend this one but I look forward to upgrades.

Reviews.Title: Two-Way Audio did not work on Mac
Reviews.Author: nebguy
Reviews.Content: I tried multiple times to download the plug-in needed to run the audio from a Mac, all to find out from multiple blogs that the software does not support the new Safari.  We did finally get it to work on our PC, but the camera kept freezing and the video was not very clear.  Since I was going to use this on my mac and iphone we sent it back because we wanted the audio.

Reviews.Title: Technical support review
Reviews.Author: lorimerlot
Reviews.Content: Foscam camera has excellent definition.  Set up has a few hitches but Technical Support can help you through the process easily.Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: Awesome Product!
Reviews.Author: Pete S.
Reviews.Content: I gave it 5 stars because this camera really delivers top quality for it's price.  The camera's clarity is great & the Pan & Tilt operation is a bonus feature over the competitors that offer only fixed units.  Even the audio works as advertised!  I purchased this camera for security reasons as I travel a lot for business.  It's motion detector coupled with email push notification works flawlessly.  I purchased their app so it would work with my phone.  And that's where this system shines.  I can instantly see what's happening in my home from anywhere in the world.  But a word of warning.  Unless your an IT pro or Al Gore, your going to suffer miserably getting this camera set-up.  It's manual is horrid & brief.  And there are so many variables (port forwarding, IP address issues depending on your router set-up & so on) to getting this camera up & running.  But fortunately Foscam has a very nice & knowledgeable tech staff that will walk you patiently through the set-up process.  I'm obviously kinda slow because I had to call them seven times.  But in the end....  success!  So what are you waiting for?  Buy this camera.....  you'll love it!

Reviews.Title: Nice Camera for the price!
Reviews.Author: M. Barnett
Reviews.Content: I recommend the Foscam FI8910W ip camera to anyone who wants to set up a remote monitoring webcam. We put it at our cottage to check the weather and see any people or traffic going by. Since it rotates 300 degrees we can scan inside as well. We placed it in the front window.You don't need a PC after initial setup. Only a wireless router that the camera can use.Setup took about two hours but that includes everything to the point I could view it and control it from my iphone over the internet. Setup is not for a novice. But if you've ever set up a router and a wireless network at home you can handle this task. There are some excellent videos on YouTube that made the setup process easy. From box to viewing on my LAN took 10 minutes. Setting up wireless operation another 10. Getting it to work on the internet and then my phone took about a half hour of configuring and playing.....all with the help of the YouTube videos. Last I set up email motion settings which emails you one or a series of photos if motion is detected. This took about an hour of playing with the settings. Motion sensitivity is adjustable 1 to 10 from a leaf blowing across the snow on setting 2 to where it takes a delivery truck driving by on setting 9 to set it off.The infrared is nice. Our cottage is black dark at night but we can see the whole room fine even the objects 25-30 feet away. However if the camera is rotated toward the window with the IR lights on, you just see glare reflected back so the IR must be turned off to view the street at night.
