Simple toggle on/off switch.Notes on internet use:1. You must have a host domain setup through a domain service. There are free ones. I used DynDns. This is the "website" that your camera resides on. Again, refer to the YouTube videos. They talked me through it.2. The settings can be changed from hundreds of miles away over the internet once setup is complete. You can assign multiple usernames and passwords, at least 6, for administrators (full control and change settings), operators (view, pan and tilt control) or visitors who can only view without control. Very Nice feature.3. Only Internet Explorer supports multiple cameras. If you use Firefox or Safari you can only view one camera. Two or more cameras on your system would simply require opening Firefox twice, no big deal. I like Firefox better.Summary: High quality and excellent functionality! I am buying a second camera for my cottage rear window so we can watch the deer and wildlife while not there. And to see if anyone is snooping around. The camera will email me photos. The FI8910W is highly recommended.Update April 14, 2013. Loved it so much I added a second identical unit. After 6 weeks they are both running flawless. I can see what's going on at my cottage 200 miles away. I have them in the windows so I can pan and tilt to see inside or out. Daytime color and contrast is very nice. Night vision works great too. I take a peek every morning. I still love and recommend this camera! I really like the motion detection alarm that emails me snapshots of people and vehicles going by. Sensitivity is adjustable so I don't get everything that moves, just people on the front yard or porch. Also I highly recommend checking the setting "email ip address". Should your dynamic ip change, you can't access your camera. But the camera will email you the new ip address within a few minutes and you can redirect your URL to view remotely. My ip has changes twice already and this saved the day!

Reviews.Title: Great for the function, set-up on a MAC was ok.
Reviews.Author: DP "DP"
Reviews.Content: To everyone his own, I set these cameras (2) up on a Mac air with a mac airpots router and ATT uverse internet service with a 3wire gateway.  My steps to getting access outside of the house was:-Get the camera connected to your wifi network-Set the camera's IP and port you want to forward.-Enter this information into the airport (utube vids however with the new airports the menu's are a little different)-Allow the port open on the 3wire uverse gateway (this was the part i was always missing, google and you will find what to do)

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Ralph Roithner
Reviews.Content: Since setting up is not as easy as it sounds, I needed help setting up, once I finally got hold of tech support, they were courteous. Got me going in no time!! I did not particularly like that they immediately asked for remote access to change the settings. I would have preferred me doing the work with their instructions over the phone. I do like the fact that I can access and manipulate the camera from anywhere. I would recommend this as a good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Value IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Yogi Bear
Reviews.Content: I just got this yesterday and configured it. The step by step instructions from a previous reviewer "R. Tickle" were extremely helpful. I did have a few issues that I needed to sort out however. I use a Linksys WRT54G wireless router with HyperWRT firmware. Setting the static IP for the camera was tricky. I tried using the Gateway and DNS that was being reported in my router configuration screen and that gave me an "illegal parameter" error message in the camera configuration. Turns out I needed to use the typical http address I use to log into my router i.e. [...] for the gateway and DNS server. Changing the port from 80 (which is a public port that everyone uses) to one of the ports that Foscam recommends caused me to lose connection with the camera. Initially, I thought I did something wrong in the configuration and I kept resetting the camera. In fact, if you lose connection, you did it correctly. You are no longer connecting to the camera through port 80 (duh). I reconnected to the camera by typing in the static IP address I assigned to the camera followed by the port i.e. [...]=new port number you assigned to the camera. I also had a small issue with wireless connectivity. I use a MAC filter on my router. The camera had two stickers on the bottom with two different MAC addresses. I used the one I thought to be the correct one. Turns out it was the other one. Port forwarding on a Linksys is pretty straightforward so there were no issues there. Once configured, the camera works great. I use a web browser to connect to the camera from my work computer or iPhone. The picture quality is really good. The IR works well. Sound quality is OK but not great. There's a bit of lag when talking into a mic and hearing it on the other end. Not a show stopper though. Overall, I'm very pleased with this camera. I'm tempted to get a few more to put around the house.

Reviews.Title: 2 Foscam Web Cams Ordered and Both Had Issues
Reviews.Author: Melissa E.
Reviews.Content: The first Foscam F18910W Wireless Camera I ordered the wireless feature/component did not work. When wired it  was fine. I returned the camera and had Amazon send another one... The second one came in and kept rebooting/resetting itself. Could have been an issue with the power supply. None the less, I have hassled with 2 Foscam cameras and will not be attempting to order a third one.  Really disappointed.

Reviews.Title: Works
Reviews.Author: Oldguy
Reviews.Content: First of all, I do not know where all the 5 star ratings come from. Apparently these reviewer simply put the Camera up and let it run. If you start to customize the device, soon you'll notice that the WebUI (Web User Interface the camera has a built in Website for viewing the cam image and configuration) seems to update your changed settings, but in reality did absolutely nothing that would make me think that it did. The alarm motion trigger setup is a nightmare, aside the fact that it doesn't update to the new settings, but you think it did. (meaning no error feedback)A friend of mine owns the same model and one night we been ripping our hair (what hair?) out trying to set his up so it would only send a text message to his phone. Bad luck, whatever he configured, it would rapidly send 6 images along, even though it unchecked that option. This is bad, bad, bad since his Phone provider would bounce it back to the sender. The result, absolutely nothing. Well, sometimes at the pleasing of the Camera it would sneak through, but very unreliably. In my own case I don't need to have an alarm sent to a cell phone. So I went to check out how my motion trigger would perform. I am still working on figuring out what the heck happened. I would trigger the motion sensor, stand there for about 60 seconds and then go back to see if e-mail was sent properly. If the e-mail makes it, I see a series of images, but none has me in the picture.I have a relatively fancy home network with public access to my web servers and e-mail server. This works fine for my everyday use and I have visitor coming from all over the world, although not millions but hundreds every week. I believe I know a little bit about the principle of networking.The Camera / Web UI / Firmware has tough me otherwise because I have no idea what it does and what not. To make things a little worse, it may do it at random. Whoever programmed the Firmware / WebUI should go back to doing something easier.Edit:The review above is primarily about the build in web UI and not about the camera itself. The Camera is now working for a month and does produce exceptional images, even at night. If they only could get the User Interface right, I would give em 5 Stars.

Reviews.Title: Decent performance for low price
Reviews.Author: Desert Golfer
Reviews.Content: I had no unusual problems setting up the camera. I did NOT install the Foscam software from the DVD.  Rather, I simply booted the camera to my LAN via an ethernet cable, logged into my router (Linksys E4200) and obtained the IP address that was assigned by DHCP to the camera by my router.  I then logged into the camera with IE and configured it with a static IP address, assigned an HTTP port, new user name and password and entered the security credentials for the wireless router. I set up port forwarding on the router and removed the ethernet cable from the camera, rebooted the camera to the wireless network, logged in and completed the configuration.  I use WPA2 encryption and my network has a fixed IP address provided by my ISP. Also, I unchecked "Network Lamp" which disables the flashing LED network signal lights on the back of the camera.I am quite satisfied with the Foscam, especially considering the low price. The pan/tilt function works well, motion detection performs as expected and the e-mail alert works reliably.  I have not used the audio, consequently, I can't comment on that function.  Nor can I comment on wireless range, because the camera is only 15 feet from the router. The image quality is quite mediocre, but I didn't expect much considering the price of the product.I access the camera with Robert Chou's IP Cam Viewer Basic (Android version) on a Galaxy Note II, which works very well. Overall the Foscam offers decent performance at low cost for my particular application.Finally, I can see how some customers who lack experience setting up routers and IP devices might run into trouble configuring this product, especially port forwarding.  However, it is no more complicated than the Linksys WVC80N wireless camera.

Reviews.Title: For the price, you can't go wrong
Reviews.Author: Tim  Isenhour "Timbo"
Reviews.Content: Foscams get a lot of bad rep for several things like constant rebooting and the such.  I have four and while this particular one was a gift to a family member, I can attest that for the bang, this is the best camera on the market. Pan and tilt more than make up for the 640x480 picture resolution they provide. Plus, if you plan to monitor via a remote device like a cell phone, you don't want an HD video feed.I have also found that a lot of the complaints about these cameras are mostly "user" caused.  Improper set up and use of the router are the number one causes of complaints.  How do I know this?  Because I was one of them that constantly complained about the camera.  Then, I decided to do some schooling on networking and found that most of my woes were self-inflicted because I wasn't "doing it right!".While these are Wi-Fi cameras, I strongly recommend wiring them if they are going to be used for serious surveillance.  Main reason being is that there are so many things that can interfere with Wi-Fi and cause it to either fail or become very week.  The use of a microwave oven that is between the camera and your router is one of the main causes for camera "loss of signal". Again the camera gets blamed when in actuality, it's physics to blame.  Florescent lights also interfere with Wi-Fi.  Many homes use these now to save on power.These are also indoor cameras but I am using two of them outside. So far, no problems.  I do have them in a place where they are not exposed to direct moisture. They are under an eave and in a carport.  This winter, so far, they have seen temps in the teens and still functioned properly.  Do not use them outdoors without risking damaging them as my results may not be the same as yours. :)

Reviews.Title: EASY, i don't see why people are so -
Reviews.Author: Cammo
Reviews.Content: Okay, First I will start with my opinion that I really dislike when people give a tech product a negative review and call it things like worthless, or broken simply because they don't have simple know how on setting up the tech, even something easy as a wifi network at home.Here are the facts:IT WORKS!!: I used the set up manual, followed directions, and I was up online; first with a wired connection via ethernet cable, secondly with wireless through my wifi network.IT'S EASY!!: Following the straight forward directions I was able to be up and running in minutes!Here is the twist, which in no way is the products fault.. I needed to have a port forwarding service, which you know of if you've been reading these reviews. Without this service I could only observe my camera's feed through my home network and only on my home network.Do you need to pay for a subscription service? no! "NO/IP" has a free basic service with no special features that let me accomplish my requirements for a home IP camera. At first my connection wasn't working after the simple DDNS setup on NO/IP but that was my internet service provider blocking the connection through a firewall. I found online a PDF with instructions from my ISP giving me exact directions on how to allow the camera to operate freely on the network. I then typed the info from the instructions, rebooted the camera, and I WAS UP AND RUNNING.If connected to wifi, the new forwarding adress would not work, if not connected to wifi and running on 3G, the forwarding address WOULD work.BOTTOM LINE, MORAL OF THE STORY, I had everything I needed completed in less then a few hours!. The initial camera set up, IN MINUTES!I was also able to set up my gmail account to send me an alert email if motion is detected on my camera, and was able to program which days and times to send out these alerts.The IR feature works great, and the pan and tilt works great too, only downside is no zoom feature which would have been a perfect addition. The software is barebones and does the job, and I also installed an easy set up Iphone app for remote monitoring called "IP Cam Viewer" which only cost a few bucks, no subscription fee.Four stars to start, will be five after getting some use time in.WHO CARES ABOUT THE AUDIO? Not me

Reviews.Title: Great Cam For The Price
Reviews.Author: Bhuerta
Reviews.Content: Decided to pick up one of these cams after my car was hit in front of my house. For those of you giving this cam a low rating because you failed to set it up wireless, DO SOME RESEARCH. While i am a computer tech, the overall setup was NOT hard for those who will take the time to READ the manual and/or RESEARCH on the internet. The manual, google & youtube are your friends.Also, someone mentioned you have to pay for services to be able to view your wireless cam externally (away from your home network, at work/mobile phone) this is NOT accurate. Once setup wirelessly, if done correctly you can view externally without paying as everything is handled through your wireless router...not sure what others are claiming about this.I've only had the cam for a few days, but i am very impressed with the overall quality...for less than $100 you can't beat it. I will most likely be picking up another for the other side of my house. If anyone has questions and/or would like to see the one i have setup live (which took all of 20minutes if that) let me know...

Reviews.Title: Not So Hard To Set Up
Reviews.Author: Paul Ramone
Reviews.Content: These cameras are amazing! Until I started doing some research, I had no idea these cameras each encompassed a tiny computer and web server!  My mind was still back in the day when analog video went down a wire.I studied the reviews of this camera here on Amazon for a couple of hours, trying to figure out where most of the snags and pitfalls were, in advance of ordering.  For example, here is a handy tip from another user: "If you want to use the preset camera positions you MUST first uncheck the "disable preset" box in the PTZ menu under Administrator."  You could spend hours trying to figure out the 'presets' without that little tiny tip.  Thank you!  Once I compiled a list of things like that that were likely to go wrong, and fixes for them, I ordered two cameras.It took me a couple of hours to get two of these set up, with my bare-bones knowledge of IP's, routers, and networking.You have to take the setup step-by-step, and test between steps!  Don't try to do it all at once! Once you get one function working, proceed to the next level.  There is a lot of useful information written in straight English on the Foscam site, so I hardly looked at the manual.The little program they supply called 'IP Camera Tool' is incredibly useful in getting things set up.I did NOT use the CD.  I just downloaded the latest firmware from Foscam, and updated that on the cameras once they were hooked up (one at a time) thru the ethernet cable.  There are two parts to the firmware, a "System Firmware" and a "Web UI" firmware. Update both. My cameras were one version behind.I was able to get video through the ethernet cable in a couple of minutes.  I set mine up as fixed IP's so their IP addresses would be a different numerical series than computers, but you don't have to do that if you don't know how.  Wireless setup was easy; once you set the IP, enable wireless, and reboot (the camera), you should pull the ethernet (NOT the power) cable.  The cam should then communicate by wireless after a minute or so.  Once the wireless was working, it was easy to set the motion alarm.  Once I got the motion alarm going, I had the system start emailing images to me (had the camera trained on a busy suburban street).  In order to test the email settings, you have to hit SUBMIT before you hit TEST, another little tip.  And when you see the mysterious words "Network Lamp," that particular function turns the blinking green network light on the back of the camera on and off.Pretty soon I was getting more email messages than I could stand, so I set up a FTP service to a website I own where I can store the pictures.If you use Internet Explorer you are home free, you can view an array of cameras with one login, and monitor sound, too.  I don't like Internet Explorer, I use Firefox, so right now I have to login to each camera for live viewing.  There are plenty of free or cheap monitoring solutions out there.  Last night I tested out iSpy which seems to do the job of monitoring multiple cameras for not so much dinero.  Once I get it all figured out, I will settle down on a permanent monitoring solution.  But at first, you will just monitor through your Internet Browser.Setting up port-forwarding for worldwide-internet-viewing was pretty darn easy considering how much jabber there is in these reviews about it (You need to use a proxy, or go to the coffee shop, to test port-forwarding...I couldn't get it to work until I logged in with a proxy...found that tip on Amazon, too!).Everything is crystal-clear, with no noise.  The night-vision will light up a large room.Seriously, if you have no concept of what an IP address is, or you don't know how to access your router (and you don't want to learn), you should avoid messing with these cameras.  If you just want to run these on your own local network, and you know a little, the complaints about difficult setup are way overstated.These cameras are an outstanding value, but research carefully to understand the limitations before you buy one.

Reviews.Title: Good cam, easy setup - (Using AT&T; Ewire)
Reviews.Author: Gameplayusa "Gamer"
Reviews.Content: The Foscam is quite a decent little camera for the price. If you're looking for something to monitor your home or business while you are away, this is a good option.Pros:- Price- Ease of Set up- Smart phone and tablet support- Great night vision- Capable of panning (looking left, right, up, down)Cons:- No zoomIt's essentially plug and play so it's very easy to set up. I had a live camera feed on my home network within minutes. Getting access to the camera from the outside (like from your work PC or iPhone) is a little more challenging but not too difficult. The Camera feeds are hosted through myfoscam.org and they give you a 3 year account with purchase.I'll add that I was very surprised by the quality of the infrared night vision. My kitchen was pitch black at night but the feed was crystal clear.AT&T; Uverse EWIRE SET UP:I have AT&T; Universe at home so I had to figure out how to access my router and forward the port assigned to the camera so I could view the feed remotely via the internet or my iPhone. The controls for AT&T; routers can be accessed by typing 192.168.1.254 into your browser when you're using the network (this means you have to do this while at home, it won't work if you try doing it from work).From there you need to find the FIREWALL option and then click "pinholes and DMZ". Step 1 says to select a computer and shows you a list of devices on the network. Find the ipcam and click it. On step 2, click "add a new user defined application".  For an app name, just type "Foscam". For protocol, make sure TCP is selected, and where it says "Port(or range)", type 80 in both the "from" and "to" fields. Leave the other fields blank and click "add to list" then click "back".The name "Foscam" should now be viewable in the Application list. Select "Foscam" and click the "add" button. That should associate port 80 with the camera and allow access to the camera feed from outside of your home or business. Now click "Save".To test, just type your_cameras_name.[...] into a browser and you should get the login screen asking you to type the cameras user name and password.One quick note, if you changed the port number for the camera, say to port 88, then your camera's address will become your_cameras_name.[...]SMART PHONE ACCESS:There are quite a few apps to choose from for viewing your camera feed on your smartphone but the best free one I manged to find was CamViewer. It was easy to set up and works great. It's comletely free, but if you want to enable sound, it costs $3 to do so.

Reviews.Title: Doesn't store videos automatically
Reviews.Author: Jorge Ignacio Sánchez Echevarría
Reviews.Content: In security aspect it's very important logging the actions that took place. Specially the videosThis videocam offered "FTP" and "Streams & records live video & audio".That's tricky, It only record videos when you are watching the place at that moment and by using Internet Explorer (WTF!)And FTP only stores pictures (yes pictures, in JPG format)So be very aware of that.The only way to store videos is using Internet explorer running on Windows.Unless you want to spend all your time watching your place in live mode, there is no way to consider this a useful surveillance cameraThe other browsers only allow to watch live videos and move the camera.Very tricky, and I lost my money.Too bad.

Reviews.Title: This camera is amazing!
Reviews.Author: Mike
Reviews.Content: Let me just say that I was looking specifically for a night-vision camera so that my wife and I could monitor our newborn daughter as she slept in her room.  I did a lot of research and decided that a standalone unit would work the best for us.  While it only uses red light for the night vision, it works amazingly well!  I can use my PC to browse to the cam via a local IP, or install a IP cam app on any of my tablets and it works just great.  I've even gone as far as installing an IP cam monitor on my smartphone and it also works flawlessly.  I will certainly recommend this to friends and family and when I move I'll be picking up more for my overall home monitoring needs.  Amazon does it again.  Thanks!

Reviews.Title: Very solid value and surprising quality for the price
Reviews.Author: Chumley
Reviews.Content: This is a great little camera as long as you are realistic about what it is.  I got one a few weeks back on special for around $70 and even at regular price it is very surprising how well this works.  It took a few hours of fighting with my airport extreme router to properly forward the ports, but getting this forced me to learn how to do it and and fixed my Synology Diskstation's remote access at the same time.  People who fault this product because of difficulty in remote viewing are just wrong!  ANY device attempting to do this WILL have the same issues.  It's not a Foscam issue.The quality is adequate in absolute terms and outstanding if judged in the context of what this unit costs.  I have it setup on an Android phone, iPad and mac.  I use tinycam Monitor Pro for Android and Foscam's app on the iPad.  Tinycam is better.  The camera pans quickly and has a huge range of movement. There is no optical zoom, but both the Android and iPad apps lets you pinch to zoom.  The 2-way audio does work but is not great.  Think bad-webcam audio.  Probably ok for monitoring but it would be torture to have a lengthy conversation.Look - If I owned a business I wouldn't buy a bunch of these and expect hi-def, facial recognizing security, but for putting a few of these up around the house while you're out to give you peace of mind or to monitor pets, I think they're perfect.  They do make a higher def version as well and if I see one of those on special I may spring for it.  A little crisper image would be nice and optical zoom would make this perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with NO support for https (encrypted) password
Reviews.Author: J. Bernal "The Matrix"
Reviews.Content: The camera is Fantastic!! works great, good quality, night vision, etc... a bunch of great features packed in this fairly small camera, but it doesn't make sense to not be able to access it from outside your home network using https, instead one has to use http which can make it pretty easy for someone to gain access to your user and password

Reviews.Title: Installation Very Easy
Reviews.Author: MW "Computer Builder"
Reviews.Content: Installed two cameras on Mac Os and Airport Router.Took only a few minutes, manual very well written.All instructions step by step, easy to follow.Will buy more cameras as needed.Quality of images on camera better than expected.

Reviews.Title: Nice but the Camera is Buggy
Reviews.Author: Marc
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to remotely monitor my condo.  I have an app for my iPhone/iPad that allows me to log in and check anytime of day.  Plus the  camera is setup to turn on when motion is detected and send a series of email pictures to me.  It's a nice feature but BEWARE since the camera has a tendency to false alarm when light levels change.  Despite sensitivity adjustments in the software I have yet to be able to resolve this issue.  It's a common complaint on the Foscam support forum.

Reviews.Title: Great for baby monitoring via iPhone.
Reviews.Author: Jamboa
Reviews.Content: Bought this to monitor for our newborn while she naps in her nursery.I would have given this camera 5 stars if the software had been simpler/easier to setup.I wish more tech companies spent as much time with their software as their hardware.Also wish the power cable had a 90 degree kink. The power cable sticks out way too much from the base.Best combo for this camera?- Camviewer for iPhone(free)- a dynamic DNS account with dyn.com for a simpler URL as opposed to remembering your ever changing IP address from your ISP- VideoSecu Wall Ceiling Mount BracketBaby room done!*other reviewers mentioned that there is a blinking light that shows through the white.. I dont have this issue..there is a subtle redlight eminating from the back next to the ethernet port... a little blacktape to cover it. fixed.

Reviews.Title: You get what you pay for. But be technical to set it up
Reviews.Author: Jeremy M
Reviews.Content: I always read reviews with a grain of salt. I don't know whether to trust people's opinions or if their frustration unfairly influence their ratings. I don't understand everybody's complaint with these cameras. I love the ones that I received.  I'm disappointed that you cannot disable included DyDNS service. I'm also frustrated that it doesn't support SSL. But for 60 bucks apiece I think they're great.I agree the setup wasn't simple but only because users don't have the proper skill sets to complete the process successfully. Don't blame the product for your inabilities.  They're definitely not for a novice user. An amateur could figure it out if they were so inclined but they do take a technical skill set (or) patience & willingness to configured properly.And people who complain that you have to connect the cable or the configure the wireless have no clue what they're talking about. I'm a network engineer and I can't think of a single wireless product that doesn't require a wired connection for initial configuration.  You can't expect the wireless camera to guess which wireless network and password it's supposed to use.  Again don't blame the product.Great for the value. Don't expect miracles for $60 but I was impressed compared to other ip based cameras I've used for the money.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I bought this foscam as a test for monitoring my kids at home when I'm not and ended up purchasing 5 more after I used the first for a week.  The setup is simple.  The picture is good.  The audio is so so, but for the price of this camera, I am happy.  I wasn't expecting top quality surveillance and this meets the need I have.Just a note on the setup, I had quite a bit of problems with getting to the camera over the internet, but not because of the instructions.  I have a VoIP device between the modem and router that was blocking all inbound traffic.  After I finally figured that out, setting up the camera for remote viewing was simple.

Reviews.Title: Poor Set Up Instructions Foscam F18910W
Reviews.Author: Dwain
Reviews.Content: Set up did not point out:1. Had to be in Internet explorer 36 bit (Not 64 bit) and set as your default browser to open Servo Push mode... Same Google/Chrome had to be set as Default 36 Bit to open Active X Mode.2.HAVE TO UNPLUG THE CAMERA FROM POWER TO TURN IT OFF.3. Could not get email on alert movement to work in any mode, Had to use DDNS site to get emails to work but only in the Active X Mode.  Great camera if they could explain setup so you could use all the functions

Reviews.Title: overall good
Reviews.Author: Caressa Brandenburg "C"
Reviews.Content: I personally love my camera but I can see how there would be some complaints. The camera works very well. Picture and video and the different android phone apps both free and paid work great. I love checking on my animals during the day. Motion detection works great. As does the IR. Hearing the audio also works great but using it to talk through it does not. It either feedsback horribly or is too low for anyone to hear.Zoom would be nice.Setup was easy using the manual. I also like that you don't have to have a domain to see it over the internet. Fpscam provides you with a built in subdomain using their domain. And it works like a charm.I am very pleased though the audio would be nice as would the zoom.Update April 2013Still very happy with the camera. The two way audio does not work without plugging in external speakers AND an external microphone. Otherwise it works very well picture is great and controls are handy. The coverage is fantastic.

Reviews.Title: Worked great for a bit
Reviews.Author: Techjunkie101
Reviews.Content: Once set up the camera worked great for a about a week. The speaker in the unit I received must have been defective, the sound was clear for a short time then became indistinct garble. Other than the two way audio problem, it is a great device for the price. Returned for a replacement.

Reviews.Title: Very Cool!!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera and was delivered in two days. LAN set up was easy, Remote access took me a couple hours to figure out. There were some great blogs out there on this if you get confused. The camera quality is really decent and night vision is cool too.

Reviews.Title: Wireless is terrible
Reviews.Author: Mr. TKK
Reviews.Content: I purchased 3 different cameras and the wireless would not work properly more than 10' away from the wireless router. Tried all 11 channels on my D-Link wirless router, updated firmware but would not work wirelessly without either dropping packets or not working at all. Quite disappointed and wasted a lot of time.

Reviews.Title: Potentially nice product, but there are problems ...
Reviews.Author: James C. Westland
Reviews.Content: I had this for two days before sending it back.  It appears to be a decent product at the price point -- a very good deal.  And many of the other reviews seem to indicate that once connected, it works well.  I unfortunately was unable to ever get my router or computer to recognize the camera on the network.  Not a setup problem, but it just didn't show up under any set of network tools.  Other reviews have cited similar problems.  It may be inconsistent production standards, or problems with the software, or something else.  For now, the Foscam F1890W is too problem prone to recommend.

Reviews.Title: Returned it - after wasting hours and hours of my life
Reviews.Author: Frank J. Licitra
Reviews.Content: Let me start by saying, I'm a software engineering with extensive networking experience.  I could not get this thing to see any WIFI access points; not mine, nor any of the 20 others within range of the room I had this camera in.  The video looked ok when "wired" --- but I simply could not get the "wireless" to work.  I even used a wireless packet sniffer to see if anything was coming out of this device....  and nope, nothing.  Perhaps it was just the unit I had - but the wireless just wouldn't work.  I found dozens of other reviewers who had the same problem.Also, the web interface is terrible.Because of my experience, I am avoiding FOSCAM entirely.  I'm gonna try the D-Link 5222 instead.

Reviews.Title: Stopped working after a week
Reviews.Author: chinesedave
Reviews.Content: Cool product when it works.  I had it perfectly setup via wireless and even bought an app to watch the feed while at work.  Then, after one week, the camera stops transmitting.  I plug it back in to the ethernet cable and try to re-establish a connection of some sort, and it's not even recognized by the IP Camera tool.  Forget it; time is limited and I'm not going to waste any more time trying to figure out how to get it working again when the probability is that the product is broken (given how many stories I've heard of it being sent back).So, buy if:- you have time to waste- want something cheap that will work *maybe*- want to gamble that you have one of the 5% of non-problematic ones

Reviews.Title: This company sucks
Reviews.Author: marselis renner
Reviews.Content: I tried to call their tech support before i buy their product just to see if they can answer  any questions i have. No one picks up the phone. This company is a scam

Reviews.Title: better support than expected
Reviews.Author: Mitch
Reviews.Content: After reading other reviews, I totally disagree with the other reviews on bad support.  After a remote log-on they took over for me and set everything up...all is good. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: Outstanding Camera For The Price
Reviews.Author: Joseph S. Gilman
Reviews.Content: I have had wireless webcams for around 10 years now.  The only cameras I have been satisfied with up to this point are the Panasonic line of cameras, such as the BL-C30 and BL-C131A.  Those cameras are priced over $200 in most instances.For under $100, the Foscam exceeds the Panasonic cameras I currently own.  The pan/tilt range is great, the night vision works great, the two-way audio is great.This camera is great.  Enough said.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Cmooney
Reviews.Content: Works great. You need to know a little bit about how to setup your router but once thats done it works great.I,ve setup alot of IP cameras in my days and this has to be the easiest one so far. The two way audio also works well.The Iphone paid app is worth it as well.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Roland T Walker
Reviews.Content: I already had one Foscam in our garage and wanted another for inside the house when we are away on trips.  I purchased this from Amazon.  It had slightly newer firmware which has a much improved web interface.  Camera performs just like the older one except for one thing.  The camera on the one I received will not switch to night vision.  I see the LEDs on but the image is almost black.  I can make out items a few inches away but that's it.  I have gone through the Foscam troubleshooting but it still won't work correctly.  I have emailed Foscam but after 4 days no response.  Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: need to improve after sales support
Reviews.Author: dc
Reviews.Content: Hardware seems to be fine. All functions explained in the manual also but foscam needs to improve after sales support.Pros:silent motorCons:the firmware update took out browser support on phoneno sensible phone apps

Reviews.Title: Do NOT Buy if you have a Mac
Reviews.Author: uvalawtina
Reviews.Content: This camera seemed great and easy to set up, but I couldn't get any sound.  I researched online and then finally called Foscam technical support and they told me "you won't get audio with a Mac".  I think that is probably something they should have advertised!  If you have a Mac and you need audio, do not buy this.

Reviews.Title: Mediocre
Reviews.Author: Drew Morgan
Reviews.Content: Had to apply 4 firmware updates before it would work, image quality is just ok. It's worth $75, but not much more. Ended up returning it.

Reviews.Title: Good hardware, weaker software and some concerns about security
Reviews.Author: Newbian
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera for its hardware features and it delivers on that score -- genuine remote control, pretty good image quality in a variety of lighting conditions, and servos that provide a wider range of movement than I had expected.Where it has problems is in the setup process (Windows) and Web access controls.Setup: This is specifically regarding the setup process on 64-bit Windows. If you check out the manufacturer's forum, you'll see that many consumers, like myself, spent time troubleshooting the connection to the device. One reason appears to be that the remote viewing/control application doesn't recognize when it's been installed on a 64-bit operating system. You can fix the problem manually by adjusting a Shortcut and/or file locations and/or setting the app to run in compatability mode for an earlier version of Windows. But you should just be aware that installation generally is not fire-and-forget. Foscam could have invested a sheckle or two in software development, considering that the majority of new PCs sold come in a 64-bit flavor.Another issue is port forwarding. The device requires you create a port-fowarding rule for the device's IP address. That's not a deal-breaker for geeks, but most people probably don't know how to change the default password on their router, much less set up port forwarding. Just something to be aware of.Lastly, giving a device that's inside my private network exposure to being controled from the Web without the ability to disable that feature seems more like an anti-security feature than a security feature. Some users have reported that the camera automatically and periodocially seeks a connection to the manufacturer. This may simply be a method of insuring the device has the latest firmware, or a method for managing Web access for the customer. Since I don't intend to access to device from outside my home, though, I would have appreciated a way to turn off this feature.

Reviews.Title: technical support
Reviews.Author: Darren
Reviews.Content: I was facing difficulty in accessing the camera from remote location i.e could not have remote acess so contacted Foscam technical support spoke to Felix he took remote access of my computer and fixed the issue for me. I like the camera!! I do recommend the camera to others.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera with Amazing Features
Reviews.Author: Donivan Marshall
Reviews.Content: I bought one for $88 shipped and its well worth every penny. It is the best security device you can buy. Free smart phone apps to watch your camera from any location. Free Included software for you pc. The pan/tilt is also a very nice feature and there are settings to change the pan/tilt speed. The night vision works great for quit a distance and is pretty clear. It isn't the highest of quality but it will do. I recommend this camera to anyone looking for security or just a third eye.

Reviews.Title: techincal support
Reviews.Author: Nana
Reviews.Content: The tech support was very helpful. He was very patient and helful in a timely manner,  i am pleased with the product and quality of the device.

Reviews.Title: Pleasantly surprised - Great value for the money
Reviews.Author: EC
Reviews.Content: I was prepared for the worst when buying this IP cam. Some people complained that there may be many fake reviews of this camera posted by the manufacturer, so that made me a bit reluctant to buy this camera, but at the same time, there were so many reviews and it is pretty high on Amazon's popular sales list, surely some of these positive reviews were happy customers. It seemed people who liked it really liked it and those who disliked it, absolutely hated it and considered it as a worthless piece - o - crap. After unboxing the unit and going through a few help videos on Foscam's website (which by the way borders on looking unprofessional), the camera was up and running with full audio. It works as advertised for me with the exception of the camera preset locations, that feature doesn't seem to be working for me. I did have to pay close attention to setting up the port forwarding in order to view the cam on the internet but it was quite easy if you follow the video instructions on their website. The video quality is decent and audio is adequate. If there were a higher resolution model at a slightly higher price, I would pay the difference since these cameras are pretty cheap at $80.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech support
Reviews.Author: Mark
Reviews.Content: Simon assisted me in re connecting my cameras, patiently. Reset cameras and changing password. Second call into this company, second time i received good service. Thank You.

Reviews.Title: Technical support
Reviews.Author: Eddie
Reviews.Content: Contacted Tech Support for help setting up my foscam.  Great Service from Ralph Mendez!!!! On a scale from 1 to 10 i'd rate the product and the support a 10.  I'd recommend this product to my friends and family.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Eric J Olson
Reviews.Content: Love the camera, a little tricky to get set up if you're not a tech person but do-able.Great price for what you get.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910
Reviews.Author: Paul G. Devlin
Reviews.Content: I was able to connect the camera to my home computer with no problems but when I tried to connect it to the web I couldn't get it to work. I watched U tube how to videos and tried numerous time before calling Foscam.I spent 2 hours on the phone with their tech support in India. They were unable to get the camera to link to my other computers over the internet, which is why I bought the camera in the first place.  They told me to return the camera for a new one and that might solve the problem.Tech support was very polite and patient, but I don't have another two hours to devote to a web camera so I'll have to find one that doesn't require an IT specialist to set up.

Reviews.Title: good baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Joe Lee
Reviews.Content: I was a little suspect at first given the myriad of what looked like fake reviews.  I was pleasantly surprised at the product.  I ordered 3 knowing I could return it if I wasn't happy.Setup wasn't nearly as hard as I thought given all of the reviews I read.  To prepare for the installation, I watched some of the videos on the Foscam website and I also read the manual.  It was sometimes hard to follow but I got the general idea.I'm not an IT expert or engineer but I am slightly familiar with a router and adept with computers.  I googled any term I didn't understand.  Overall, I had everything up and running in about 45 min without calling anybody for help.  The only hiccup was getting the audio to work.  you have to download some plugin (apparently it doesn't work on mac laptop).  I have PC so the audio worked after I downloaded the plugin.  the audio also works on the ipad and iphone apps (Foscam Pro is the one i bought for $4.99).  i should clarify that it is 1 way audio that worked.  I couldn't get the 2 way audio to work but I don't really use it so I didn't care.  I only need 1 way audio to hear my baby cry.  a lot of the installation was trial and error.  everything seemed to work for me which was a surprise.  I expected the worst given all of the bad reviews on installation problems.I am going to buy a 4th camera now.  you can't beat the price and I love having 4 cameras in my house to watch my kid when I'm not around.  the app for the ipad rocks.  you have like 4 mini screens and you can do a close up on each of the 4 screens.

Reviews.Title: Cannot Manually Control IR
Reviews.Author: Relax Preppy
Reviews.Content: The image quality is great in full light, and when the IR is on; however, during dusk and dawn when it is still dark indoors but there is just enough light to keep the IR from cutting on you cant see anything!! After some googling it doesnt appear that a firmware fix is possible either as this is a hardware issue. If you could manually turn the IR on and off or change the sensitivity then I would give this camera 4 stars

Reviews.Title: Fantastic PT Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Preece
Reviews.Content: With the number of bad reviews for this product I was nervous about buying it, but I'm really glad I did.  For the price this camera simply rocks!  Loaded with features it really could be priced much higher and still be a good buy.  I found setup very simple if you just follow the instructions.  It took almost no-time to get it setup, but yes, you MUST install the software on your computer first so that you can "find" the camera on your network.  After that, boom, you are in!One enormously great feature is the wide-angle lens.  You have a great view through it and it's very clear.  The automatic infrared lamps come on in the dark so even in a pitch black room you can see everything perfectly.  I put my camera looking out the front window of the house and I can see when packages are delivered or when the mail came.  And with the included ability to email or FTP on motion detect, I get emails with still-image attachments when someone comes to the door.This camera is simple awesome.  Can't recommend it enough!!

Reviews.Title: Good camera, hard to set up
Reviews.Author: Nicole Serle "Nicole"
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera, it is a little larger than I expected but but otherwise appears to be good quality. The setup is very difficult and am not computer illiterate. I called customer support and waited on hold for about 45 minutes. When someone picked up they told me a technician would call me back in under an hour, it took about an hour and a half but she did call. She was able to set up the camera in about 20 minutes by accessing my computer and taking over the setup. So far it has been working great but it's only day one. While on the phone I had the technician set up the camera so I could view it on my iPhone and ipad. This cost $5.99 for the foscam app but it works nicely and I have had no trouble remotely watching my home.  My only concern is that I was hoping to set up about 4 of the cameras and wondering if I will have to wait on hold each time to get them set up. But for the price it was worth it.I do want to address all the reviews that some are saying are fake reviews, which in a way they are, but they are for tech support, not the device itself.  At the end of the conversation she asked if she solved the problem and if I would review her performance. After I agreed, she went to the amazon site while still accessed to my computer and asked me to write "tech support" in the subject line of the review and say that she solved the problem. It's true but my hand was forced in the writing of the review, so I deleted it after we hung up. Don't let this turn you off though, the camera is good, pans easily and without making a sound, the images are clear, and overall it was worth it.

Reviews.Title: Difficult to set up but worth it
Reviews.Author: Joe P
Reviews.Content: I had a hard time setting this up, particularly because there was an error in the printed instruction book that came with it.  After a frustrated hour, I went on their website for help, and it quickly pointed out the typo in the booklet.  A paper inset into the box telling me about this would have been nice.  Once set up, it has worked great.  The only issue is that it has to be reconfigured (new IP address) every time my power has gone out.  There are several great iPhone apps out there to go along with this camera.  My wife and I love being able to check on our baby from anywhere in the house.

Reviews.Title: Good alternative to traditional, dedicated baby monitors.
Reviews.Author: Charles Chen "Keyboard Jockey"
Reviews.Content: Previously we had a Levana baby monitor which died 1.5 years into service.The wife and I debated for a while on whether we should get this camera or a dedicated baby monitor like the Samsung SEW-3037W or Motorola MBP36.After the Levana failed, we were both hesitant on plunking down a large amount of money on a dedicated monitor.  But at the same time, we like the VOX feature which turned the monitor on automatically based on sound.So why did we decide to get this?First, we figured that if it didn't work out for us, we could still use it as a general security camera but if it did, we could save over $100 so we took the plunge and got this one.Second, with this camera, we can have many, many more monitors instead of a single monitor.  We even have retired Android smartphones sitting around that we've re-purposed as a dedicated monitor.  With our laptops, tablets, and smartphones, we have 6 monitor-capable devices.After sifting through the many, many reviews, I did have some concerns about the setup, but I have to say that for anyone that has any inkling of basic network setup, this thing is a snap to set up and install.  A *snap*.  If you have basic experience with networking, you're likely not going to need the manual, watch any tutorials, log into any forums, or call tech support for basic setup.That said, I'm docking 1 star for three shortcomings:1) The first issue is that the web interface looks terrible and unprofessional.  Mostly cosmetic, but it's not that hard to write some decent CSS.2) The second issue is that there's no way (at least that I've seen) that I can turn off the network activity lights.  This is very annoying in a baby's bedroom and requires some duct tape to fix.3) The mounting bracket requires you to drill into the wall.  If it had a flat, plastic back, it would allow the usage of the included screws OR the usage of something like a 3M command strip (in fact, if the manufacturer is reading this, I would recommend revising the mounting bracket and including a 3M command strip).A good piece of hardware and I would definitely recommend to other parents and will definitely consider purchasing additional units.

Reviews.Title: Quick and easy set up with amazing tecnical support NOT TRUE
Reviews.Author: dahlia howe
Reviews.Content: I spent countless hours trying to set up this camera it works fine locally but I could not get it to work remotely.  I called tech support and left 2 voice mails I emailed tech support and I waited on hold for over an hour twice.  I never got to speak to tech support they never called me back or anwswered my e mails.

Reviews.Title: Sadly disappointed
Reviews.Author: Wesley Smith
Reviews.Content: I really wanted this to work, so much so that I gave it too many chances. I thought I could chalk it up to user error, but I have IT experience and ultimately had to return it. Amazon should take this item off the site, because from personal experience and reading from other reviews it clearly has issues.What makes this unusable:The wifi on it is terrible. (I have a $200 wireless router, not it's fault)Ethernet doesn't help. It needs to be reset every time.The software that comes with it is a hindrance, and altogether best avoided.Setup is excruciating. Why you can't just plug it in and use it is baffling.It's frustrating because, albeit the wifi, the camera's hardware is perfect. The camera is silent, and works well. The infrared is good too. Foscam needs to get their stuff together.

Reviews.Title: The camera is OK, the wireless is not
Reviews.Author: ram
Reviews.Content: I started out really liking it, but that was when I had a direct connect to my PC. Since the point of a wireless camera is to be wireless, I relocated the camera after intial setup (I won't go into the problems with setting it up since so many others have done so). As long as the camera is in direct line of sight with my PC, it works fine. But if ANYTHING is in between the camera and the wireless router, then forget it (including my dog walking in front of it). No signal at all. It doesn't really matter how close the camera is. I have it right now in the next room at most 20 feet away. No signal. I even bought the extra big antenna...no difference. It is true that set up requires some work, but that only needs to be done once. Signal strength is forever and this unit fails on that particular front. To be fair, I have had other cameras also fail on the signal strength front (e.g. Linksys). If you want a wireless solution, make sure the reviews say wireless is good.

Reviews.Title: Zero for two
Reviews.Author: CP buyer
Reviews.Content: Received the first one.  Configured it according the to instructions.  The unit kept restarting on it's own.  Sent it in for a replacement.  New unit acted in a similar fashion.  I spent a little more time with the second one.  After reading the forums and tech support, did a firmware upgrade.  Same issues.  After spending two hours on it,  I decided I didn't want to deal with the issues and sent it back to Amazon.A co-worker purchased one.  Had the same issues.  He spent about four hours and tried several different firmware revisions to get it work properly.  I think it would've been a perfect product if it worked properly out of the box.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but...
Reviews.Author: A. R.
Reviews.Content: I'm soooooooooooooooooo frustrated over how to properly set up the remote access!!! I am not tech savvy at all so the jargon that is included in the setup guide is like being dropped off in a whole new world.  I have spent several hours trying to read and comprehend what is in the booklet and after eeking my way past step 4 (wireless connection setting), I am ready to throw the thing out the window.  I've had it...it shouldn't be this tough!  Foscam should rework the booklet instead of having customers have to go online and research terminology.  I will ask my tekkie friend if he can hook it up for me but if he can't, this thing is going back!

Reviews.Title: Problems (Don't Buy)
Reviews.Author: Robert B. Harrell
Reviews.Content: Despite searching the maufacturer forums, and other resources I cannot resolve major problems:  Camera won't connect wirelessly.  IR cut filter sticks rendering poor color images and no night vision.I am an experienced IT system administrator and I am frustrated by the lack of customer support.Avoid purchasing this unit.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Scott
Reviews.Content: So i first posted a review claiming i was satisfied after a phone call with tech support. While on the phone, he was able to link my camera, so therefore while on the phone i was pleased. As soon as the phone call ended, my camera shut off. Done.So with that, after writing multiple e mails and calling plenty of times only to be on hold for thirty minutes evey call with my camera still inop, i am completely unsatisfied with the camera, service,and this company.My review, STAY AWAY FROM THIS COMPANY!!!

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Tiffany
Reviews.Content: Was facing problem with remote access contacted Foscam technical support and had my problem fixed. I like the camera and do recomend the camera to others. However the customer service is not as great as the ratings suggest. I've been on the phone multiple times since the installation of my cameras and the service didn't get better with each call. The lady seemed to be exasperated with me because I couldn't understand her. As did one of the gentleman. The icing on the cake was when my support person basically filled out my review himself. Good product but not the best service.

Reviews.Title: Not for us Ludites.....
Reviews.Author: Dum-Dum
Reviews.Content: Worked fine tethered to computer.  Could not get it to work remote to save my soul !!!!  Sold it for half what I paid to friend who already had two of them, they got it to work.Yes..... I was too stupid to get it working, even after calling customer service as they were no help at all.All the vudoo that was required by my friend to get their cameras working remote seems just stupid!!!!  If it cannot be made simple and straight forward... its not for me.

Reviews.Title: It could be better
Reviews.Author: bkbidder
Reviews.Content: I had Foscam FI8910W installed and working fine for about 4 months via wifi on my 3rd bedroom.  The cam was purchase to monitor a newborn.  The cam from time to time throughout the day would reset itself. So if you're using it to monitor a newborn with audio, you'll need to enable it again after cam reset itself. (very annoying).One day it stopped connecting to wifi.  I powered it off and on a few times it started working again.  A few weeks later it happened again.  Powered on and off multiple time without any luck.  I then tried pluggin in the wired connection then power on the cam, all of the sudden the wifi connected fine.  I was happy the wifi got connected so I took it back up to the 3rd floor.  The cam still doesn't connect on wifi.  Bought it back down to connect to wired ethernet, perform a factory reset and then on with the multiple power on and off.  It finally was able to connected to wifi again.  Took it back up to the 3rd floor and it was connected on wifi.  After being away from the house for 2 weeks with the cam running. It stopped working again.  I hope I can return this piece of junk.  Don't buy this cam if you need a reliable wifi connected cam.

Reviews.Title: Great product for what it is - a very cheap, easy-to-use camera
Reviews.Author: ForceTrainer
Reviews.Content: I was wary buying the FI8910W after reading some of the reviews.  There seemed to be a few common complaints that I saw in the reviews.  First, the camera was difficult to setup.  Second, some users reported sound problems (too low, humming from interference, two-way audio not working).  Finally, there were a lot of complaints over the picture quality.  Please note: I am a Mac user, so all of my testing has been with OSX Lion, Safari, and a few third-party apps.Let me start with the first issue.  If you include hunting around for a place to plug in the camera I had this up and running and was logged into the built-in web server in about 5 minutes.  My major disclaimer is that I am a tech nerd with a networking background, so there's nothing in the setup that I found daunting.  To be fair to the average user, I followed the quick start guide that was supplied in the box and found that it worked perfectly.  The camera utility on the disk worked as advertised, and it got me right to the camera's web server without a hitch.  Normally when I hear complaints about things not working I always ask, "did you read the manual?"  Usually the answer is no.  So at least for the Mac setup, the manual is good and will get you up and running in no time.Second, the sound problems.  This is where I docked the FI8910W a star, but it's actually a software issue, not a hardware issue.  The built-in web server requires the VLC web plug-in for sound to work, but the VLC web plug-in for Safari does not work with 64-bit versions (the version a good number of people will have).  The VLC web plug-in for Safari has not been updated for several years, and it's unlikely that it will be actively developed in the future.  Basically that means sound from the built-in web server will not work for Mac users on 64-bit Safari.  I understand why Foscam went with VLC (it's free).  However, they screwed up big time when they didn't check to see if the VLC plug-in worked on current Macs.To test the sound I had to go to third-party apps.  I've tested the camera with EvoCam and SecuritySpy on the Mac, and FoscamPro on iOS.  For all three the sound worked perfectly, and FoscamPro's 2-way audio worked as well.  One of the complaints was interference in the audio feed, but I didn't notice any.  The gain on the camera's mic is turned up pretty high, so you do get a little bit of an audible hiss, but that's to be expected.  Any sound the camera did pick up was clear, and I could hear the TV show my wife was watching perfectly through all three of the apps.  The two-way audio via the IOS app also worked very well.  I had no issues with the sound being too soft as some users reported.Finally, the picture quality.  Here's where I stand firm and say, "you get what you pay for, so stop complaining."  This is a sub-$100 camera, and considering all the features Foscam put into this product it makes sense that you don't have a 2- or 3-megapixel sensor in there.  It just wouldn't be economically viable.  The other side is that most people don't need that kind of resolution.  If resolution is really that important then you should be willing to spend more money on a higher end camera that meets your needs.  This camera is an entry-level camera, so don't expect it to compete with a $900 Mobotix M12.I was also pleasantly surprised at how well this camera worked with third-party apps.  The previously mentioned EvoCam, SecuritySpy, and Foscam Pro programs connected to the camera within a few seconds, and they were all able to control the PTZ and monitor audio.  I also setup the camera with Sensr.net's free trial, and that also worked flawlessly.Overall, this is a great camera for the price, and if you're looking for a starting point to dabble in IP cameras, or you're looking for a cheap monitoring solution in a non-mission critical environment, this is definitely the camera for you.  In only a few minutes I had the camera up and running, and over the next few hours I mucked around with a bunch of different programs until I came up with the perfect (at least for me) security monitoring system that includes motion detection, online backup, local recording, and automatic notifications.  Not bad for a night's work!

Reviews.Title: Great Product, easy to install
Reviews.Author: vrdumbos
Reviews.Content: Works as promised, manual could have been better, but works if you follow the instructions. If your network setup is complicated then it might be a little difficult to get it to work from outside the network. My VOIP adapter was blocking external communication, I had to redesign the network. Setup was easy and straight forward, just follow the instruction found on the website (Videos) as the manual is not so good. I had to contact the customer service, they have a remote tool that they use to connect to my desktop and make the necessary changes themselves. Overall I am very happy with the product.

Reviews.Title: Really good surveillance IP camera
Reviews.Author: AV
Reviews.Content: I've had the Foscam FI8910W camera for only a few days now, and I didn't get to explore all its features yet, but here is my feedback on the features which I tried so far:Pros:- Really reach feature set:  > pan/tilt motion remotely controlled - works nicely from both computers and iPhone/iPad, although continuous scanning (both vertical and horizontal) works more reliably than moving stet-by-step.  > infrared LEDs for surveillance in the dark work beautifully  > two-way sound is also nice- Connectivity to my home wireless network worked flawlessly.- Doing port forwarding and connecting to the camera from the internet (mostly from my iPhone when I'm away) worked very well. It was the first time I did such a thing, but I do consider myself reasonably technically savy, and I learned a good deal doing it.- Besides using the free dynamic DNS host service provided by Foscam themselves (which is very nice of them to provide) to deal with the ever-changing IP address from my Internet Service Provider, I also signed up with [...] for a similar service, but this one allows me to automatically include the IP port on which I set up the camera (different from the default 80), so I don't have to type :XXXX at the end. It also allows me to have an easier to remember host name for the camera.- I liked that you actually don't have to install any software to connect to the camera remotely: once you have it set up, you can use a browser from any computer or mobile device, which is very cool.- The camera looks really good: nice texture and shape, looks like good quality, very silent when it moves.- Amazingly good price (<$80) for the features and  quality.Cons:- The printed manual that came in the box is quite sketchy. The full User Guide on the CD has a lot of good information, but it's written in very approximate English. Mind you, English is not my mother tongue either, but I tend to become suspicious of a product when it comes with a badly written (or translated) manual. Having said that, I've read some totally useless manuals in the past, and this is NOT one of them: you can actually follow the instructions despite its language shortcomings.- There is one feature which seems somewhat important and it hasn't worked for me so far: you are supposed to be able to define 8 predefined directions of view, and then just click one to have the camera pan/tilt to look in than preset direction. It just didn't happen for me, so I'm going to contact their tech support to see how to make it work. UPDATE: I got this feature to work! It turns out that it is disabled by default, and you need to turn it on in PT settings. The manual doesn't mention it, but if you go through the options in the web UI you can find it.- I went to the Foscam website looking for firmware upgrades (hoping that they might fix the problem above), but the link they give doesn't allow you to download anything: instead they ask you for your email address to send you upgrades, and they graciously warn you that they are going to spam you with future product offers at that email - no way to opt out of that. Searching the web for firmware upgrades, I just found a bunch of complaints from people who applied an upgrade only to have their cameras stop working, so now I am not that eager to upgrade anything now.Features not yet tried:- Setting up email alerts and motion/sound alarm. Will try it soon and update the review. UPDATE: I just tried it, and it was really easy setting it up to send motion alarm emails to my gmail account, following the snapshot from the manual. For some reason the first 3 tests failed, but then it started working. The manual doesn't explain this, but the alert emails are actually very nice: they contain 5 or 6 snapshot frames taken a few seconds apart, so you actually get an idea what is going on even before you connect to the camera. The email also contains a clickable link to the camera, so it's very easy to get the live video and audio feed. Pretty cool!- Setting up multiple cameras. If the alarm works, I am going to buy at least one more camera. UPDATE: given that the alarm works, I guess I have no choice but to buy another camera now :-)Bottom line: this is a really good product, with very few (and minor, imho) shortcomings. I would definitely recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Reliability
Reviews.Author: overbybr
Reviews.Content: When this camera worked, it was awesome, but it didn't work very well at all. It would frequently reset, and after about 3 weeks it wouldn't allow access even via hardwire. I'm tech savvy and can figure out most gadgets, this thing is not worth the money.

Reviews.Title: Best to use as Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Raag
Reviews.Content: I got to use it as baby monitor. Two way audio works find from my iPhone. Audio sometime jitters because it connected via WiFi. But it gives really good Audio quality over wired connection. Setup was straight forward. Night vision is much better than other cameras in the markets in this price range. Only thing I have noticed that it produce clicking sound whenever it turns on/off IR filter but did not bother me that much. Next time I will go with the black color per one of other reviews that red lights are not that visible in black color camera. Very happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: good so far
Reviews.Author: livingaboard
Reviews.Content: I did not purchase this item from Amazon. I purchased the white version of this item, same model number, from a different source on sale.  I actually got two.  I put one in each baby and toddlers room.It took a couple hours going through their online videos at the foscam website to get this going.  I am running a Mac computer so I believe it is a little more difficult but I could set one up again in about ten minutes.You have to hook these cameras up hard wire ethernet to the computer first, which they provide, to initialize them or something and then you can do the wireless thing.  The picture is very decent and I have them hooked up using the small antennas.  Mine came with both small, about 4 inche or so long antennas and some that are like a foot long.  Both cameras are within 12 feet of my router.I didn't have much success using my apple time capsule because the last update got rid of some things that the instructional videos go over.  An updated instructional video would be nice.  I ended up using the main FIOS routerAnyway, there are plenty of mount options.  I mounted mine upside down and then checked the settings for flip and horizontal or something so that the picture is normal looking on my computer.I am happy with these and the pan/tilt feature.  I would have preferred a zoom feature as well but I did not look closely enough at the description.  They are kind of large in a bedroom if you are worried about looks.Here are the bad things.  If you have a mac, you can't put more than one camera in one browser window at a time.  It is not a supported feature. If you run windows, you can have multiple cameras tiled in one browser window.  It isn't a deal breaker for me but it is annoying.  The other annoying thing is that the Windows system has more options and has the listening function and speaking function from the computer and Mac does not.  There is a claimed work around for two way audio with Mac but I have been unable to get it to function.  The way I get around it is that when I am using chrome, I just have a tab at the top for the baby's room and one for the toddler. I click it and it opens a window and I press another option and the video pops right up.Either way, the infrared lights are more than bright enough in total darkness to see everything.  There are presets in the software that allow you to pick a spot and then just go back to it by selecting the number of the preprogrammed spot. You can move the camera all around and then just press the number and it zooms back to your spot.  The speed at which it can go vertical, horizontal, etc is all individually adjustable.The microphone is extremely sensitive. I can hear the baby breathing from about six feet away maybe 7.It is normally a color camera until it gets too dark and then it becomes black and white.  the infrared Leds can be turned on or off from the computer or phone appMy favorite function I believe is the operation from my android phone.  I am using Ip Cam Viewer basic (actually upgraded to pro for $4, I forget what extra features there are) and I can pull up both windows on my huge galaxy note 2, 5.5 inch screen at one time.  There are many camera apps out there.  All you have to do is put in the correct IP address and port.  Pick your favorite app.  You have to select one window though if you wish to hear that particular camera microphone or do any panning, scanning, tilt, etc.  This application allows full control over the camera and has preset locations as well.  Both the computer and the android app allows automatic up/down constant scanning, or left right or kind of a zig zag pattern.My wife and I don't go out much due to the kids.  The last few times we have gone out we put both kids down to sleep at night, and have the 15 year old babysit. He really only has to be there in case they wake up or there is a fire.  So while I am at the restaurant that most likely has free wifi, I have my phone with its kickstand open an I am able to view my children live to see what is going on.  If the toddler starts to get up and take his diaper off to pee all over  I can call my son and have him intervene.  Or perhaps the baby is crying too much and I am able to hear this.  I can easily operate the cameras to move wherever.  I mention free wifi because I believe this live camera feed with chew up your data pretty quick on your phone planIt is great piece of mind so that we don't have to open the bedroom door to check on the kids and risk waking them up.As far as the cameras go, they do seem kind of flimsy.  They are definitely not outdoor cameras and I have no idea how long the motors will last.I would look for something smaller and maybe a little more rugged next time along with something that has a zoom feature.FYI, one of my cameras does work with the two way audio and one can only be used to listen to  the baby's room: it will not amplify sound from my android phone when I select that option.  I don't know why and it isn't terribly important at this point.

Reviews.Title: Works  great
Reviews.Author: ThomasB
Reviews.Content: Anybody that complains about this camera just doesn't understand how to set it up. I have been watching my home for the past seven days while on vacation and not one iota of trouble. There's plenty of complainers out there, but they're just not versed on the set-up procedure.

Reviews.Title: TERRIBLE Non-existant customer service
Reviews.Author: T. Meadows "TM"
Reviews.Content: I have 8 of these cameras and thought everything was great until I needed customer service from Foscam. BE AWARE that if you purchase directly through Foscam that you run the very real risk of losing your money.  I paid for my last camera on 12/07/12 and it is now 12/26/12 and I still have not received it.  The package was lost in shipment and now Foscam is ignoring my requests for a replacement.The cameras work well enough but if you need support you are out of luck.  Foscam is a very dishonest seller.

Reviews.Title: works great as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: JayR
Reviews.Content: Great camera for use as a baby monitor. I can see perfectly in both light and dark, and the audio was just fine once I found out online I needed to have the wi-fi antenna going straight back. I really wish Foscam made an Android app for it. There are paid apps that will work and interact with it, but some can be buggy because they're made as "universal" apps rather than just for this model. Great piece of hardware though and we've been using it over a year now. I'd recommend doing what we did and buying a really cheap old Android phone for $10-15 somewhere and using it as a dedicated baby monitor with the app (condition and speed of the phone doesn't matter if you just need wi-fi and to run one app). I wish we'd thought of this combo from the start.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, excellent customer service
Reviews.Author: Ryan M. Patterson
Reviews.Content: Great deal for this camera, which works perfectly.  Had one small issue connecting to web view, called customer service, got somebody right away.  Sandra at Foscam was extremely knowledgeable and helpful getting it working.  Highly recommend this camera so far, we are using it to monitor our baby's room.

Reviews.Title: Amazing value for the price!
Reviews.Author: Amazon User
Reviews.Content: I read a good number of reviews for this camera and knew well what the major complaints were before I bought it. I would like to address a few....Installation. Installing the camera took less than 30 minutes for me after unboxing. I really don't understand why people were having so many issues. On the Foscam website they have step-by-step instructions on how to set up the camera. Also, there are many YouTube videos with actual users providing tutorials (look up awkwardhamster's videos).Paying for no-ip?  You don't have to pay for no-ip. The free service works fine. Don't buy into their marketing and just got with the free service. I'm not sure about dysdsn though.Audio quality. I'll admit that the microphone on this camera is crap. Trying to hear anything not close to the camera is pretty much impossible. However, the speaker on the camera is not as bad as people say. I can hear and understand when people talk through it.Interfaces. So far I've tried the web interface for Chrome, the android web interface, tinyCam pro for both my phone and nexus, and the blackberry browser. All interfaces allowed me to view the stream And adjust the camera. It works great over 4G and 3G and of course wifi.Overall, you have to remember that this camera is only $90. For that price, it did most everything I expected it to do, as well as I anticipated. I would definitely consider another one in the future.

Reviews.Title: Couldn't connect to Wireless Network and no Audio on my Wired Network, plus not Mac/Apple friendly.
Reviews.Author: Virginia Patriot
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed.  The directions were simple enough, this is not my first wireless network camera, but still I was unable to get this camera to connect to my wireless network.  It could find it with it's "scan" and the router could even find the camera using the automated setup option, but it always failed in the end.  I updated the firmware, still no luck.  Was able to used it via a ethernet connection, however, there was no Audio.  Pan/tilt worked well, pretty quiet.  Not all functionality is available to Mac users.  Some require IE in Windows.

Reviews.Title: Once again you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Snowlion
Reviews.Content: This is my review after playing with it for about 2 days.First impressions - it's bigger than advertised or expected. The unit is about 5" high and the base is 4" diameter.Second impression - it's made of cheap looking plastic. I paid $75 for this camera so don't expect much - just stating the facts. If it's dropped - I have no doubt the case will crack. Easy fix - don't drop it right?As per previous reviewers comments, I set it up via the browser and not the included software.The setup was relatively easy - but if you're not tech savvy - it would be difficult. In fairness, the included software might be recommended for those folks.Though a fair about of knowledge is required to set it up, there are certain things that could be made easier. For example, the setup for emails. Easier setup and help there would make it easier.Now on to the camera itself...the resolution is 640x480 is not great. There's a lag between what's happening in front of the camera and what's shown on the browser. This is locally. If using a remote software over the net, the lag will be more.
