It's functional, but don't expect to pan it left/right to follow someone around in real-time - not happening.The browser interface is ok - but as written before, certain features could be made easier. You can use this interface on your mobile browser and see the camera. It works but not usable because the page resets every time you do a pan/tilt action. So most probably will need to buy an app.The unit came with the network cable (to connect to router) - very helpful! Also, a wall stand.I bought this as a test device to see how I could implement a security system with a few units. Unfortunately I'll have to keep looking.

Reviews.Title: The best DAY and NIGHT network camera
Reviews.Author: R. Fung
Reviews.Content: Quick Summary:* Excellent night vision mode.  Superior to most baby monitors and many security monitors on the market* Full pan/tilt/zoom!* Viewable in the home (via wired/wireless network) OR outside the home (via Internet/smartphone apps)* Many compatible smartphone apps available (netcamviewer free on iPhone)* Basic in home setup is simple, but outside viewing more complex.  But resources/instructions available* Tech support via email or phone.  Email is more effectiveDetailed Review:Like many, I researched many models before deciding that the Foscam was right for me.While the setup is slightly more complex than some solutions out there, you are more than paid back with a network camera that has clearly superior night vision and daytime picture.  You also have full pan/tilt ability and the option to set this up wirelessly or wired.There are very few network cameras that offer these features and, in this price category, probably none.Since I've shared my experiences, friends have bought this camera and used it effectively for baby camera, pet cameras, and home security.Customer service is solid and when one camera stopped working, it was immediately replaced with an RMA unit since I was in the 2 year warranty.  There are also great instructions on how to set this up so you can view it from your smartphone and outside your home network.  The customer support is also more than happy to give you tips via email.  I consider myself fairly computer savvy and was able to set the first one up after about 1 hour.  I've since bought two more.Note: Certain packages contain a super long antenna for increased signal that is included free.  While I was able to get a solid signal with the shorter, standard antenna, I did get noticeably quicker image and smoother video with the Foscam Wireless Range 9dbi Antenna Expander for Foscam IP Camera.  It's a great add-on if you can find the right package.  There are also bundle packs with more than one camera if you know you want to buy bulk.  Price is about the same or slightly cheaper. Eg:Foscam FI8910W Black 2-pack Pan & Tilt Wireless IP Camera with 9dbi AntennasUpdate: The camera does make a clicking noise as it switches from daytime to nighttime mode.  Occasionally, if the lighting is just right and between twilight and dusk, it can get momentarily stuck and click multiple times as it decides which mode is best to use.  Brightening or dimming the lights stops this is issue but it can be annoying if you want absolute silence.

Reviews.Title: Remote access function
Reviews.Author: kt
Reviews.Content: If you're trying to test the remote access (Internet access) feature of the camera, keep in mind that you can't use the public IP address or a DDNS service to connect to the camera from within the local network. You can only do this from a computer (or phone) that is connected to the Internet through a different network.This may seem like common sense to someone with experience, but I wasted a lot of time trying to troubleshoot a problem that did not exist.My local router is the standard AT&T; combination DSL modem/router, the 2Wire Gateway 2701HG-B.By the way, for support, you can go to foscam.us rather than to the Chinese site.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup, great customer service
Reviews.Author: O. Rodrigues
Reviews.Content: I got the camera to catch someone that is letting his dog take a crap on my lawn and not picking up after it.Wired setup is very easy, I was hooked up in minutes. Trying to go wireless, I got stuck at the portforward section when I could not see my camera in IP Cam. I called Foscam, was on hold for about 10 minutes when a friendly lady informed me that all their agents were very busy and that they would call me back in an hour's time. An hour later they called but I was busy and asked them to call in another hour. Another hour later, they called back. Jees Jose, the rep on the phone, was VERY knowledgable. Made my life easy. Set everything up in a jiffy and answered all my questions.My next purchase will probably be an outdoor Foscam.The image quality in this is better than I expected for a camera of this price. The night vision is quite impressive to a newbie like me. I really wasn't expecting much from this camera, it certainly exceeded my expectations.Those looking to purchase this, please be aware that it has Pan and Tilt only. There is no Zoom to this camera.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Images - Zoom with Foscam iPhone App
Reviews.Author: Wheaten Mama
Reviews.Content: SET UP - Although I consider myself computer  and router literate, I couldn't get the camera ($62.99 on lightening deal from Amazon) to set up to wireless.  After trying to read their poor-grammar "quick set up" instructions for an hour, I gave up and called an expert.  I did not try to call the company.  It took my friend who is an IT manager 15 minutes to set the camera up to wireless and another 5 minutes to help me set up the Foscam App that I downloaded from itunes for $5.99.  (There are tons of other IP camera apps out there for free but I just thought I should go with a product specific app.)If you don't plan on using this product wirelessly, you will need to purchase a longer CAT5 cable.  The one in the package is about 2 feet long and intended just for initial set up use.  They make a version without the antenna if you don't want to go wireless.THE CAMERA - it is very quiet, responds fairly quickly to remote commands (pan and tilt) and, so far, has never lost its wireless signal. I cannot find anywhere in the packaging that this product can be used outside.  The power cord is very short (about three feet).IMAGES - Infra Red - Can't shoot through a window at night, it just reflects the IR lights in the window, so I would suggest getting an infrared light and placing that outside your window if you want to monitor at night.  This camera has the capability of turning the IR lights off manually.  We have a street light in front of our house and you can see the light at night with the camera but you wouldn't be able to make out faces or car colors without the addition of an extra IR light outside.Daylight images - Great and are better resolution than I expected.  It has a built in adjustment for outside photographs and self-adjusts the contrast.  From the monitor on your computer screen, you can only pan an tilt.  But you can zoom with the ITunes Foscam app, and take pictures and video straight to your phone.MICROPHONE AND MONITOR - Wow!  I did not expect this feature.  With the Foscam iPhone app, I can talk from my phone through the camera.  I can also listen to the room through the monitor. I LOVE both of these features and did not see them listed when I purchased the camera.***** I was originally going to rate this product four stars because it is so difficult to set up but after using the camera for a week, I just love it and I'm rating the camera, not the set up.  The set up is difficult so if you don't know an IT person or can't figure out how to set up a static setting through your router after determining the camera's IP address, you're going to need to call technical support and I can't speak to that experience because I did not try it.  One reviewer suggests skipping the included disk when setting up the camera, I tried that, it didn't work.  Also, using the WSP feature will not work either because you have to make manual changes to your router.

Reviews.Title: Impressive Camera
Reviews.Author: Marty E.
Reviews.Content: Despite reading numerous reviews I was quite skeptical that a wireless pan/tilt camera at this price point would be much of a quality product.  I'm skeptical no more.The camera installation and setup was pretty smooth and easy.  I would consider myself highly technical and would suspect that non-techy people will struggle with the configuration.  My advice would be to make appropriate arrangements with either Foscam support or a trusted resource to help walk you through the setup/configuration.I primarily use the camera to keep an eye on our dogs when traveling.  I use both iOS and Android devices which both work very well on 3G and 802.11 networks.  I highly recommend the IP Cam Viewer app from Robert Chou.The camera software appears to work fine in both Internet Explorer and Google Chrome.  Although with Chrome I find that I typically have to login to the device a second time before I'm redirected to the management console.I'm very impressed with how clear and sharp the night vision images are.  The pan and tilt functions are easy to control.  I haven't tried experimenting with the two way audio and have only played around with the intrusion detection functionality.My biggest legitimate complaint is that the pan/tilt motor seems awfully noisy.  So if you're looking for whisper quiet surveillance, this probably won't fit the bill.

Reviews.Title: Works great, very easy to use with cell phones.
Reviews.Author: C. Krull
Reviews.Content: I had zero experience setting up networks.  If you do your research on reviews left by others, and use google, you will be able to find everything you need to set it up.  I now have it running wireless to two cell phones (IP cam viewer)  local network, and through dyndns (costs $20/year) so I can easily access it from anywhere with the internet.There is no warranty if you purchase the camera from anyone except Foscam directly.  Groupon has offered these cameras for the same price as online, and you can purchase them directly from Foscam so you would get the warranty.  Worth looking into.

Reviews.Title: Exactly what I needed
Reviews.Author: Noodlenoodle
Reviews.Content: I set this camera up to use as a baby monitor. I didn't want to spend $200+ on an actual video monitor, and this camera does exactly what I need. I downloaded the Foscam pro app so I can see the nursery right from my iPhone. Setup was very easy, although if you want to watch it outside of your wireless network you need to use DDNS and port forwarding. That's what I did anyway. The audio is great, and I am using the camera to watch my dogs when I'm not home since my baby hasn't been born yet. I love it.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera for the price... If it works
Reviews.Author: JG3 "JG3"
Reviews.Content: I picked up 3 of these on sale. 2 for me and 1 for a gift. One of the 2 for myself was defective. The nightvision mode did not always work properly. Apparently many other people have had an issue with the Infra Red filter not disengaging when the camera goes into night vision mode. That means that the camera cant see the IR light that gives you your night vision. The other camera works great. Amazon has a great return policy for replacements, so a new one is already on the way.These cameras have a nice feature list and are very cheap compared to other comparable cameras.  The wireless networking is a bit of a pain to set up, but it works. The instructions are surprisingly good. If you don't know how to forward ports on your router, you might want to get a tech-savvy friend to give you a hand.For the price, hard to beat. And on sale for $20 off... impossible to beat.

Reviews.Title: Nice price and does a good job
Reviews.Author: Tom
Reviews.Content: For entrance level home security this camera is great.  I can monitor my home while away and keep an eye on my office.  It sends me e-mails when it notices movement in the house which I can adjust nicely.  The photo quality is very good and I am happy with it.  I have it set up wireless and it works fine.  The networking was a bit tough but they have demo videos that make it a lot easier to understand.  Over all I am very pleased with this camera.  I wish it had the zoom feature but I am not complaining at all.  The web site has great tech support answers too.  I never had to call as I was able to find all the answers I needed from their FAQ's and tech manuals.  I would certainly buy another one.Tom

Reviews.Title: Lots of features for the buck..
Reviews.Author: Elmus "elmus"
Reviews.Content: Bought this to check up on the house while away. I placed it in a position to view my main interior and pan to look out the window. Setup was relatively easy. Did have to port forward my wireless router for access by browser from anywhere on the Internet. But there are instruction for that found easily by googling.Takes snaps of movement and emails them to my phone. Great picture, adjusts to outside light so I can even look out onto my driveway through a window. Can be placed anywhere your wireless signal reaches. Very cool.Make sure you password protect it.

Reviews.Title: It's not plugin and use
Reviews.Author: H. TSAI "on-line shopper"
Reviews.Content: If you were a person doesn't like to deal with all the computer software settings, don't buy it.  I bought it during Amazon's deal of the day to serve as a pet cam to watch and interact with our cat during vacation. It took my hubby 2 nights to figure out how to use the 2 way audio and recording, due to the unfriendly software. You have to go to the maker's website to dig into the forum to see how people like you solve their problems.After two nights work(by hubby) on the settings, it's serving great as a surveillance camera-movement detect, alarm, auto-record and photo shots and email you the clips. Now I can look at my cat and hear her and talk to her when I am away (only watching live cam with downloaded free app from my 1st gen KindleFire). cheap yet good quality camera. But again, It's not for dummies (both menu and software)

Reviews.Title: Not a fake reviewer!
Reviews.Author: S. Ellis
Reviews.Content: I was super nervous about buying these cameras with all the claims of "fake reviews".  Not knowing whether or not that was true... I took a leap of faith and bought two of these cameras.  I absolutely love them.  No, they aren't HD.  No, they aren't top of the line.  YES, if you want to set up remote viewing, you have to be somewhat knowledgeable about router settings and DNS. (If you don't know what a router, IP, or DNS settings are.. don't expect to have remote viewing, just in-home viewing via the provided application)  The IR only REALLY works for about 3-4 feet, so don't expect them to see in the dark.  Given all that, show me a better camera for <100.00 that has a 300 degree pan/viewing angle!  I don't regret this purchase for even a minute and plan to buy additional cameras including outdoor models.  That "static" interference that some people have mentioned on the audio out is true.  You have to keep the volume to a minimum effective range on the connected speakers to prevent a loud buzz.  I imagine this is a grounding or interference problem with the wireless and there might be a work around.All in all.... I love these!*****Update:  In the original review, I mentioned that the IR only worked for 3-4 feet.  That is incorrect.  When it's working correctly it illuminates the entire room! The trick is getting it to work correctly. One of the two cameras I have works fine all the time. The second one needs a little coaxing. When it turns on correctly, it makes an audible, distinctive, "click", presumably from the IR filter. When it doesn't fully engage, the click is a quieter, incomplete, click. I read on a forum that if you hold a relatively strong magnetic (speaker magnet, hard drive magnet) just above the camera, you will hear the click complete and the IR works great. I spent some time turning it off and on, coaxing with the magnet when needed, and it appears to have improved.  Almost as if it just needed to wear in a bit.  Regardless of the price, only shoes should need to be worn it! As such, I'll probably move the rating to a 4 for this. Still love the camera and don't regret the purchase!

Reviews.Title: Foscam Edit and Reverse
Reviews.Author: C. Vincent Shortt "Vincent"
Reviews.Content: I purchased this indoor pan/tilt wireless camera with a few reservations....and at first I found foscam tech to be encouraging....I have sense given up on this product and returned it....The "Dropcam" does work....and very simply. I have purchased my second Dropcam and I give it 3 Thumbs Up! Sorry for my original comments on Foscam....my bad...Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (Black)Dropcam HD Wi-Fi Wireless Video Monitoring Camera

Reviews.Title: Despite the "fake" reviews...
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera despite all of the negative reviews claiming that there were "fake" 5-star reviews, and I'm glad I did.When the camera arrived, it took about ten minutes to set up the camera completely (including my router).  I got an app for my phone (tinyCam Monitor Pro) that lets me completely control the camera (two-way audio, Pan & Tilt, etc.).  It's pretty awesome what this thing can do, and for the price, it beats buying another baby monitor.I highly recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: Exceeds expectations
Reviews.Author: gordon "gordon"
Reviews.Content: I've been studying on getting some network cameras for a while.  Amazon offered this one for ~45% off this past week.  That got it down in a range I was OK with gambling on so I bought two of them.First impression was very impressive.  Packaging was good and the aux stuff was first class.  The provide a short network cable for initial setup.  Rather than sending a simple and inexpensive LAN cable, they sent a very nice retractable cable.  Very classy.Also, Foscam provides a dynamic IP resolver.  When your camera boots up, it contacts the Foscam server with its IP.  Actually, the NAT address of your router.  Foscam then provides a static URL for your camera which you can use to access the camera.  i.e. abcdef.myfoscam.orgSpent a couple of hours playing with it.  Documentation is pretty good.Net result? I can access the camera from the internet using any of the PC based browsers that I use as well as from my iPhone.  Incidentally, access includes control to pan the camera and turn the IR on/off.Additionally, I set the schedule for the camera to alarm on motion (will alarm on sound also).  When alarmed, the camera emails the alarm information and photos to my work and personal emails, sends an MMS message with photos to my iPhone, and uploads the photos to my ftp site.These are just some of the features that I've setup.  There are still some things I haven't setup.  It can start recording the video stream to your PC or other recording device when alarmed.  I typically don't leave my PCs on all day so I didn't set that one up.When I am ready for some additional units I will have no reservations at paying Amazon's low, regular price.This is money well spent.

Reviews.Title: Defective software; returned
Reviews.Author: TVo
Reviews.Content: I ignored the poor reviews and went ahead with the purchase when it's sold on special, assuming my background in security software would make it okay. In short, I could not make it work and decided to return the 2 FI8910W. Details follow:1. Packaging: Very well packaged. Even the foam was good quality. Box was nice. No complain.2. Hardware: Look great, not cheap looking. When plugged in, span quietly. No complain.3. Software installation: Installed okay, but could give some options during installation.4. Running software:- When selecting IE/ActiveX combo on Windows 7, the system hung requiring a reboot. A second time did the same, with the third requiring a Windows Repair.- Switching to use Chrome browser instead, I was able to log in to the camera and saw the video stream on my PC. But when I tried to position the camera via IPCamera, the system went dark and the camera went through a reboot sequence. I assumed I made some user error and repeated the sequence several times with the same result.- Documentation was poor. it took a while to figure out how to install wireless, but I did get it to work.After half a day trying various network configurations (as I have a more sophisticated network config) to rule out anomalies, I gave up mostly due to the hung video stream - when using a surveillance camera for security, I expect it to be reliable. I should have heeded the advice from unbiased reviews. It's ashamed since I liked the hardware!

Reviews.Title: OK IP Camera, Sound is Poor
Reviews.Author: Jon Gray
Reviews.Content: Purchased (2) FI8910W.  One with new (11.37.2.47) firmware and one with an older version (11.37.2.46)Firmware 11.37.2.47 works like it should, previous versions have the problems others describe with the wireless setup etc. You can't download the new (.47) from the website as of 12/8/12.  It's coming 'soon' from some other posts I found.  I suggest you wait until you can get the new firmware (11.37.2.47) from the website before you buy this camera just in case you get one with an older version like I did.Just about everything else the other posts have said is true.  Sound quality is poor, tech support non-existent and software interface kind of clumsy.  No exposure auto-gain, no zoom and you can indeed see the network activity light through the white case BUT a surprisingly good picture via Wireless-N on a variety of devices, even the night vision picture is pretty good.

Reviews.Title: For the price, it's hard to beat...setup is not too bad.
Reviews.Author: N. Krumpe
Reviews.Content: I've been watching the price on this kind of camera for a while, and was shocked to see this one priced so low.  I find that it lives up to its strong reviews.I'm writing to give a few details about setup, since that seems to be the main issue that people are having.  Some say that you need a PhD in order to set it up.  I'd like to say that I'm PhD-free, and the setup went smoothly.  BUT...I also consider myself fairly comfortable with adding a variety of network devices to my wi-fi network.  Here's what you should know:1) If you just want to be able to access the camera from elsewhere on the same network (say, for example, you want to set the camera up in one end of the house, and monitor it from the other end), then setup is pretty straightforward.  The directions, though written in somewhat choppy English, walk you through the steps.  First, you connect the camera to your router using a wired connection, install some software for managing it, and then just follow the steps.2) ON THE OTHER HAND...if you want to be able to access the camera from outside of your network (say, you're away on vacation and want to monitor your house), the setup gets a little more technical.  If you've never been in the "aministration area" of your router, and if you are not familiar with what "port triggering" is, then you might want to find a friend or family member who knows that side of things.  The directions DO walk you through the process, but the process will vary depending on the router you have.  I'd like to say that patience will prevail, but I'm quite certain I know some people who would NOT be able to get this set up on their own, simply because they are used to devices that just plug in and work.3) One other point, for those who care about this: Most internet providers give most of their customers a "dynamic" IP address.  Or, put another way, most of us have an IP address that changes periodically.  This could make it tricky to access a device like this when you are away from home.  To Foscam's credit, they give you what is needed to work around this limitation.  My camera came with a 3-year unique domain that will allow me to access my camera, even though I have a regularly changing IP address.  Basically, they give me an address of the form xxxxxxxx.myfoscam.org.  The "xxxxxxxx" gets filled in with a domain identifier that is unique to my camera, and is stamped on the bottom of the camera.  There are other workarounds when faced with a dynamic IP address, and I will change to one of those once the three years are up.4) With the camera up and running (which took me about 15 minutes), I like how easy it is to access it.  From anywhere I want, I can monitor the camera, move the camera around, and configure the camera's settings.  The interface is a bit quirky sometimes (sometimes the controls don't work as expected, but mostly they do).  But all in all, I really like it.Be cautious about getting this camera if you are not comfortable learning to work with your router (unless you don't plan to access the camera when you are away from its network).  However, if you don't mind a little network configuration, this is really a great deal.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money.  Odd manual.
Reviews.Author: jamescroak
Reviews.Content: My first Foscam, hooked it up in 30 minutes using only average computer knowledge.  20 minutes was sorting through the odd-English instructions written by a non-native speaker.  A menu driven installation would have been appreciated, but I figured out what for me and what was not quickly enough.  Camera works great, decent resolution even in complete darkness.  I operate it remotely through my iPad and an app called Foscam Pro available through itunes.  That was a two minute set up and bingo, there I am on my iPad.  Best feature:  it eliminates the joystick movement controller and lets you scan the room by dragging your finger over the iPad screen, what could be more intuitive?  Have yet to try the many other alert features, but love it as it is.  I simulated "power outage" by unplugging it several times and each time it re-synched with my airport extreme.  Foscam Pro gives the two way audio that seems to be missing in the included software.  Definitely recommend both together.

Reviews.Title: Good all round camera
Reviews.Author: Tex
Reviews.Content: Great price, inexpensive.Requires a little technical knowledge, or one of your kids help, to set up.The black has a nice rubberized finish to it.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: G. Griffes
Reviews.Content: I've been looking for a camera to monitor my backyard and this one works great. It's an indoor camera but in southern California it should be okay under the eves. Very easy to setup and install. Instructions are fantastic and lead you through the steps to open a port for access from anywhere on the web. I have a strong security firewall (ESET) and Verizon Fios router and it went very smoothly (compared to that Dlink camera which I never could get to work). The wireless reception is strong and I can operate the camera from my Samsung Nexus Android phone. I love the ability to pan, I wish it had some ability for optical zoom - I'd be willing to pay more for that. The image resolution is pretty good, but I wish it were better so that I could digitally zoom in on the bird house or a license plate. Best thing of all is that the motion detection sensitivity works very good (blowing leaves do not set it off) and it emails the snapshots to my Gmail account nicely. Setup for all of this did take about two hours because it is complicated to make all of this work. If you are not computer savvy, you might want some help, but the instruction manual is very detailed.

Reviews.Title: Worked less than a month - No support
Reviews.Author: J. Pierce
Reviews.Content: When the camera worked, it did a fine job.  But it stopped working after about 1 month, and there is NO support.  The warranty states that all resellers are responsible to honor the warranty.  Do not buy.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: Ryan M
Reviews.Content: I bought this mainly as a baby(small child monitor). For the 69 dollar price i paid it is the best baby monitor i could ever imagine. Very easy to set up although the viewing away from home setup seems somewhat intimidating. But in its current setup the picture is clear even in the dark and while i think pc  viewing is somewhat clunky on ios devices its amazing. It can be viewed fullscreen on ipods, ipads, and phones and it works great on my wifes galaxy 3 as well. It even allows us to talk to our daughter thru our devices although with about a 1 to 2 sec delay which is totally acceptable. If you need a camera for your home for monitoring purposes there is no need to look for another ip camera.

Reviews.Title: Buggy security risk. Not a good product.
Reviews.Author: Aaron Nelson
Reviews.Content: I bought this product because it had the best reviews. Sadly, it also had a lot of bad reviews I should have heeded.Out of the box, everything seemed to work pretty well, except the wifi did not get a valid DHCP lease. Wired, it got a lease, no problem, so I just set up the wireless with a static IP address. (BTW, I am using SonicWall pro appliances and Cisco, *not linksys, WAPs)---Strike 1: no DHCP on wirelessOK - time to set it up and check night vision. OOPS! Guess what - these models suffer from sticky IR cut filters; just do a web search and you'll see what I mean. The "fix" is to either power cycle the unit a few times or to flash a light at the sensor repeatedly until the filter solenoid un-sticks. Great... So basically I need to post a sign:"Hello potential burglar, this bouse is monitored by a security camera, but it's a bit crummy- could you please flash a flashlight 20 or so times at the light sensor until the solenoid clicks so we can make sure we are in night vision mode and can get a good picture of your face? Thanks, we really appreciate it."---Strike 2: night vision doesn't work reliablyFinally: Security. Oohhhh boy... This camera is not adequately securable. On an android phone (maybe other browsers, as well), connect to the camera, hit "cancel" twice, and voila! you can now see information about the camera such as mac address, camera name, etc. Why would I EVER want to broadcast to the world any of this information???---Strike 3: Oops! out of strikes, guess it's going back to Amazon.The ONLY reason I'm giving it 2 stars is because the other features do work reasonably well. So yeah, if you can live with an unsecured camera with buggy wireless and a sticky IR cut filter, go for it, you'll be otherwise happy with it.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Gofast
Reviews.Content: Installation instructions are very poor.  Search youtube for better examples.Wireless function did not work on my Camera.  Make sure it works as soon as you get the Camera.  You only have 14 days to return or file a claim.I took 2 weeks of trying to get it set-up before hiring Geek Squad for help.  Wireless card did not work and I can not return Camera now.A to Z claim is denied since past 14 day mark.  Seller is non responsive and Foscam will not take return or repair without seller iniating RMA process.  No support from Amazon to resolve issue with seller or Foscam.Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Good averall for a low res camera
Reviews.Author: lunker "lunker"
Reviews.Content: Nice features, was easy to setup, low light was acceptable. But, I have found that these 640x480 cameras aren't clear enough for my use. I want to be able to identify an intruder,  this resolution is a little blurry, not as sharp as desired.

Reviews.Title: Quality cam for the price, set up may vex some
Reviews.Author: West Side Jeff
Reviews.Content: This is really a great quality cam for the price. I use it to keep an eye on the house when I'm not around and I couldn't be more pleased with the features and ease of use.I have a decent level of knowledge regarding networking and so forth, so I had everything up and running within 20 minutes or so. However, I can see how the technical jargon may throw some people. So, if you don't know much about configuring a network or port forwarding, and you don't have someone who can help you, you may want to think twice about getting this.As far as functionality goes, everything works as described, and in fact, the video quality is very good! Night vision in particular was a pleasant surprise, as the camera delivers remarkable quality footage in total darkness.If there's any downside for me, it's that there's no Foscam app included in the purchase price. You basically have to pay for an app if you want to control the camera via your cell phone. Not a big deal really, since it's just a few bucks, and you're buying a $100 camera...just figure it into the price.

Reviews.Title: Best wireless camera in market for less than $100
Reviews.Author: Chase "New to reviews"
Reviews.Content: Most of the bad reviews i read were for camera setup and I didn't want to base my purchase based on setup. So I plunged on purchase of this camera. Its been a month i had this camera, I can say the initial setup for "in-home" use took less than 10 min.The second part is setting up for "remote use", this part took me one hour to setup. Most of the time was spend on creating a Remote host and configuring the "port forwarding" of the camera in wireless router. There are several videos in youtube,(to configure the foscam camera, creating a remote host and port forwarding) so watch videos before you proceed with remote installation.I believe for less than $100, this camera has more pros than cons. I am buying 2 more camera's to monitor my kid.

Reviews.Title: Best investment ever
Reviews.Author: pedrodogg69
Reviews.Content: I am currently using it for the nursery for our first baby. As soon as I pulled it out of the box I was impressed with the overall look. Assembly was very quick (30sec. tops). Now for those who do not have any computer experience it might be a little difficult to setup the port fowarding but its SOOOOO worth it. It took me an hour for the install and wireless set up. The port fowarding took a littel bit of research but I youtube'ed it and got it working very quickly. Now my father-in-law and mother in Oklahoma, and sister in Cali can see him all day if they would like. The online part is awesome! The admin can set up visitor accounts so that way you can restrict their capabilities, you can change the way you view the video, adjust sound and voice, and many many more things. The camera is very quiet when moving, my wife was right next to it holding the baby and she had no idea that I pointed it at her. The IR is amazing, we can see the picture perfectlly and I also love how it automatically swaps from regular to IR when the light reduces past a certain point in the room.

Reviews.Title: Same as the $50 cameras for twice the price
Reviews.Author: iEspresso
Reviews.Content: Ok, so this camera actually deserves a 5-star rating for operation, but I just couldn't rate it that high because the $50 WANSVIEW camera I purchased after buying two of these works just as well and for half the price. So, other than price this thing is pretty much perfect and does exactly what it's advertised to do. One small advantage it has over the $50 unit is that the audio is quite a bit better, so if you're planning to use that feature a lot it might be worth springing for the FOSCAM, otherwise, I'd go with the WANSVIEW for half as much.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: MrOvada
Reviews.Content: I have been using at home and at the office, so far it works great, could not be happier with the purchase. using as security camera's at the office and a baby/security monitor at home

Reviews.Title: Very pleased with this camera.
Reviews.Author: Angelo Lautazi
Reviews.Content: I read many of the reviews here before I purchased and some were very helpful. So I had an idea of what was involved in the setup and I was familiar with how to set port forwarding on my router. I was able to install and configure the camera without any problems. I purchased the Foscam app for my iphone and it works great.  Everything is working as described,even the audio function although it is weak on volume. Overall, I am very pleased with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great performance at a great price
Reviews.Author: Benjamin D Kreider
Reviews.Content: After checking the boxed video monitoring solutions at Babies R' Us and not wanting to pay $300+ for limited functionality, I decided to go the ip cam route. From unboxing to full installation and Internet availability of the feed, it took approximately 30 minutes. The level of technical skill required is moderate, but if you are at all comfortable with port forwarding and DDNS, you will have no problem here. If you are not familiar with either of those areas, spend an hour researching them online and you will probably be able to muddle through fairly well.The video quality is excellent and I was pleasantly surprised by the night vision using the infrared LEDs. Probably a bit of overkill for a nursery monitor but the price is so much better than boxed solutions. Foscam also offers an iOS app that fully supports two way audio as well, which is nice for calming a fussy baby. Overall, a great product!

Reviews.Title: Great, except no audio for Mac
Reviews.Author: Frederick Tranfield
Reviews.Content: Pros:Clear video, easy to setup, using the online interface.Good wireless signalPan/tilt range is really nice.Cons:No audio on Mac, unless you are willing to jump through endless hoops and install outdated software.Audio does not work with my security software - SecuritySpyBuild quality is mediocre (light plastic)I don't know about night vision, as I put the thing back in the box once I'd realized that I couldn't get audio.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Cranberry22
Reviews.Content: We loved our first Foscam camera so much that we decided to buy a second.  We had a hard time installing it because we are not tech-savvy, but their customer service person Judy Rose was extremely helpful over the phone and set up both cameras wirelessly and so that we can access them remotely.

Reviews.Title: No Video
Reviews.Author: Kevin "KD"
Reviews.Content: Received camera 2 weeks ago, setup and installed software.  I was able to login to the camera no problem.  The web interface seemed to work well and seemed simple to use but I could not see any video from the camera. I tried the troubleshooting tips from the Foscam forum and other places.  The camera came defective.  I returned, will probably buy something else.

Reviews.Title: Good babycam
Reviews.Author: Russell Tavares
Reviews.Content: When we were trying to pick a baby monitor with video, we found this exact model camera for $159.99, until we did our research.  After price-checking, I went home with this camera for $75, and free shipping.  It's the best bang for the buck.  It took a while to set up, since I had to call tech support over the missing Mac version of the setup manual, and incompatibility with the VLC plugin.  The camera can be seen directly IN VLC, however.  Be sure to write down your home IP address, and the port you're using.The support line was very quick, almost no time before I was talking to a human being (albeit with a pronounced indian accent).

Reviews.Title: Solid indoor cam
Reviews.Author: BS
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived without issue, and I think I found it cheaper here than other outlets.  The camera documentation is a little confusing at first, but I was surprised to see how much setup is on the embedded software.  It also lets you control access by username and password.  I also never opened the CD, and instead went to Foscam support and got the latest drivers, etc.  It supports port forwarding, static IP, and has some motion detection built in.  Foscam sells a software to integrate several cameras together, and put motion detection into record / DVR, but I found free, open-sourced, software to do this called 'iSpy".  This cam has good picture, good rapid capture, good night vision, and good position controls built into the software.  It came with a bracket, and screws for mounting, so don't order the extra mounting kit until you see what comes in this package.The documentation states that you shouldn't use Mac Address list security for this camera, but it's possible.  The key is to know that there are 2x different Mac Addresses for this camera - one for the wired mode, and one for the wireless mode.  Finding the wired one is easy if you go through the setups and watch your router for "Connected devices", also, there is a menu location on the embedded software to list it.  Finding the wireless one was more difficult because nowhere in the Foscam software does it list the wireless Mac Address.  I had to remove security for a short time, then connect wirelessly, then watch the router for "Connected devices" and grab it from there.

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Solar Oscura
Reviews.Content: Got this via an Amazon Deal of the Day.  I'm a bit of a techy, so set up wasn't too hard, particularly following R. Tickle's instructions (note the correction about plugging the camera into your ROUTER during the first steps, not your computer).  Also, I spent about 10 minutes trying to figure out why the camera wouldn't take my router's IP address in the Gateway/DNS fields.  Finally realized it needs your router's local network address (one that usually starts with  192.x.x.x.) not your router's internet IP address.Other than that the camera works as advertised.  I've accessed it via a web browser and my Android phone using the previously mentioned IP Cam Viewer app by Robert Chou. With that I can remotely control the camera and hear audio as well as speak through the camera.  Infrared works well, and makes the image appear like it's in daylight.All and all, better than I expected.

Reviews.Title: Needed Assistance But Happy With the Camera So Far
Reviews.Author: JohnT
Reviews.Content: Before I ordered the camera I read as much documentation and reviews that I could find.  Even with all the reviews claiming installation assistance was required, I was convinced that I would be among the few that could get all the way through the installation without resorting to tech assistance.  Not to be.I should have called the Tech Support number right after failing on my own, but decided to read-and-read, check-and-triple-check, install and re-install several times before throwing up my hands and calling for assistance.  Sort of embarrassing for a guy who others think to be fairly technically adept.The first person I spoke with at Foscam Technical Support was unable to help me but promised a call back from a more qualified tech person within an hour.  They delivered.  "Michael Douglas" (not the Hollywood Michael) called me and within ten minutes had the camera up and running with remote access.  He was so fast that I had a difficult time following what he was doing as he started from the beginning and went through the entire installation process.  But in the end, Michael informed me that I had all but one parameter (it only take ONE!) set correctly.  "Michael" gets ***** for superb support, Amazon gets ***** for fulfillment and price, Foscam gets **** for a good product with flawed installation procedures.  I know: you've read the same thing in other reviews.The camera has been up and running with remote access for a day. So far I am pleased with video (especially night vision--amazing), audio (very clear sound; not as some others have reported), and access (excellent with a PC; good with Android).Now if the camera will keep operating as it is for the next thousand days . . .  We will see.

Reviews.Title: Best IPCam for the money!!
Reviews.Author: HaiHai
Reviews.Content: This is my first IP cam purchase and I have to say I'm more than satisfied. I initially had a problem setting it up but after carefully reading the instructions from a reviewer on here I was able to set it up the camera for wireless operation. The email setup was slightly harder. A quick google search and I was able to find some info from the foscam user community. If you have comcast and the outlook email program then you can get emails directly to your phone if you choose to activate the motion detection. It is an awesome feature! When it detects something moving it will take pictures in intervals of zero through whatever seconds you want it to and send them to your phone. I can now say that I have a sense of security and no longer have to worry when I'm just going to run a few errands during the day. Thank you Amazon and Foscam.P.S. I would also like to add that if you wanted to view it outside of your wireless network that you would need to set up a ddns account. no-ip.com(you will need to update your firmware/webui) or dlinkddns.com are the best options since they're free. The only other thing to do is make your camera's ip a static one that's is outside the range of your DHCP server then forward the ports to that camera.

Reviews.Title: Peace of mind !!!
Reviews.Author: Houdiniboi
Reviews.Content: I have this camera in a small condo on top of my frig (it seems like a weird spot but its perfect for my space) I use the Android apps on my tablet and PC and have 5 programed views. 1 is my Front Door from the inside. 2 is my Dining Room 3. is my kitchen 4. is my Living Room and 5 Looks at my Wine rack atop my frig. This camera works great. Two-way Audio, Pan, Tilt, Zoom. I can even hook it into a larger audio system using the headphone port to "bitch" at my roommate while I am 10 miles away on campus or at the cigar shop. It's a great way to keep a constant eye on things. I love it. I am trying to get my condo to put them everywhere on the property where any Condo owner can PTZ control the camera to check on the pool, the mailbox, the dumpster, and entryway. Quality Construction. I previously had a Logitech Alert Master Alarm System with a couple cameras but I took them back and replaced both of those fixed angle cameras for this and I get even more coverage. My only con on this is the picture quality is Standard Definition, I knew this before I switch and I am fine with it but it is a major difference to go from High Definition cameras to SD. This probably helps me be able to quickly view and control the camera on the slowest internet connections while out and about. Buy It!! You should really enjoy it!!!

Reviews.Title: Camera Set Up
Reviews.Author: scott
Reviews.Content: Thanks Sandra for the tech support you provided. Was having trouble setting up the camera and it is resolved and the camera is wireless and it is working on i phone.

Reviews.Title: Best Home Surveillance Camera!!
Reviews.Author: Hector Garza
Reviews.Content: Could not be more satisfied about this product. I view my house from my iPad or anywhere on the internet. Setup is SOoooo Easy! If you are still sitting on the fence thinking of which camera to buy, then you need to jump into the Foscam side!I bought 3 of these! 1 in the front, 1 in the back and 1 in the living room. I can literally monitor my whole house. And because you do not need a DVR, I have these cameras sending me emails when motion is detected. This is even compatible with my Diskstation NAS. you can FTP pictures to anywhere and give anyone access to view or even remote control the camera.I drilled holes into the attic and bought 50 foot extention cords, since it's the best and cheapest solution, to connect all the cameras to the attic power outlet.

Reviews.Title: Works just as we'd hoped after some very great tech support
Reviews.Author: DavidG
Reviews.Content: I was able to set everything up except for wireless viewing from a different network. The tech support , specifically ralph mendez, helped me through my troubles in less than 15 minutes. Now everything is working perfectly. I am now very satisfied and would recommend this camera for security or for a baby monitor to anyone. When I need another camera it will definitely be a foscam.

Reviews.Title: works great. PITA to set up
Reviews.Author: shannon a curry
Reviews.Content: I was able to follow the directions by other users easier than i was the actual printed directions. All in all , for the price, i think the quality of video and ease of use is great. I still, after countless message board discussions and rereading the directions am unable to view this camera from outside my home's network. But for just using to check on the baby and make sure she's still sleeping, from the other room, its great.

Reviews.Title: Foscam tech support
Reviews.Author: Dattaram S. Nadkarni "HANISH22"
Reviews.Content: i was facing the problm in getting the camera work remotly .  i spoke with harry foster he was able to do the port forwarding and was able to view the camera remotly .. Excellent support from Harry.....A+++++...was resolved in jiffy........I have 4 of these and will be buying another one soon.....easy access on the smart phone.....can be remotely controlled....good reception in home network as well as remotely....happy with FOSCAM....willdefinetly recommend....

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: average brad "average brad"
Reviews.Content: Using this as a baby monitor for our newborn.  The product works as described.  Picture quality is great, automatically switches between normal light and infrared for the dark.  iOS applications work as expected and make it easy to pan around the room.  Web User Interface was a breeze to setup and configure.

Reviews.Title: Love 'em
Reviews.Author: x3d33x
Reviews.Content: After reading all the reviews, I was very skeptical about getting these. In fact I looked around for a few months before finally deciding to give these a try.All of the people saying they work in IT and still can't figure these cameras out.. get a new job, or don't lie (I really do work in IT). I went the wired route, but I don't think I'd have any more trouble with the wireless.To set these up, I do recommend knowing about router and port forwarding (if you plan on viewing these on the go.) To get the basics up.. just plug the camera into your router (or I used a switch.) The cd foscam package's with the camera comes with a tool that will detect the IP address of the camera. Or, like I did, went to my router to find it.  Then simply type the address into your browser (I will warn IE often is finicky about typing in IP addresses, so try chrome if you have problems.)  The camera has a built-in web-server, once you type in the address and install the active x plugin (for IE, but you can use other browsers) everything you need is there.I bought two of these to use in the kids' room.  They work perfectly for this. Night vision works well.In regards to using this from outside your network.. the instructions come with a so-so guide on how to use port forwarding.  Its really not all that difficult, my router has instructions on the port forwarding page as well. As for dynamic IP addresses, well for that you do need no-ip or some other service. However, I have cable internet.. and I can't tell you the last time my IP changed so for me it isn't an issue. But don't be too afraid of those services, there are reputable companies out there that have no relations with foscam and don't care to spy on your cameras.Edit:  For the people claiming the 5 star reviews are fake,  I can assure you this one is not. Unless these cameras suddenly die, I am very happy with them. I think a lot of people get frustrated because they can not set them up and unfairly rate this product down and assume all the good reviews are fake.UPDATE: 1-29-13  Dropped rating from 5 star to 1 :(I bought two more of these cameras a couple days ago because I loved the first two so much.  Well the two new ones came with new firmware YAY! (NOT!).  While the cameras still seem to work just fine, Foscam has included a new "feature". They have their own DDNS service built into the camera now.  Which, this would be fine and dandy except its very difficult to disable. There is no option to do this ANYWHERE in the admin panel. The only way is to issue a cgi command via the browser (there is a post how to do this on the foscam forums.)  However, if you don't disable this before connecting it to your network.. too late because foscam already has your ip and has the DDNS service set-up. You can change the port and then the myfoscam url won't be able to access it directly, but if someone wanted to try and guess your port, presto.  Why? Because UPnP is turned on by default now, which forwards the port automatically.I'm not feeding into the conspiracy theories about Foscam wanting to spy on you, rather, I think they made these changes to make things easier to set-up and manage.  But for me, I knew how to set-up and use these so it creates an unnecessary security risk.Foscam: MAKE IT POSSIBLE TO DISABLE THE DDNS SERVICE AND TO REMOVE MY IP FROM YOUR SERVICE AND I'LL CHANGE MY RATING BACK TO FIVE STARS.Edit: 5-1-13  Back to 4 starsFoscam has made it possible to disable their DDNS service.  I decided not to change my review back to 5 stars because of the hassle this has caused.  Plus, I think their DDNS service is still enabled by default, which I don't like.All 4 cameras are still going strong.

Reviews.Title: Good for the the price
Reviews.Author: Nitkad
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera which I got to check on my dog ;) I can talk to him through it.It also has alert features which are useful too. Good video quality in total darkness using infrared. Setup can take time for someone who is not hands on on these kind of things. Otherwise should not take more than 10 minutes to get it running.

Reviews.Title: Easy to install and a great baby monitor
Reviews.Author: K. Kon
Reviews.Content: The installation was easy. I didn't have to use any of the software that came with the CD. Plugged the camera into my Verizon FiOS router and went into the router menu to see what IP was given to the IP camera.  Logged into the IP camera with the IP address and then proceeded to configure the wireless settings.  I had to click the scan button 3 times before it picked up all the SSIDs available to me.  When I selected my router, everything self populated the wireless settings.  All I had to do was add the pass-phrase.As a baby monitor, I like this better than the Hootoo I got last year.  The Hootoo camera is now not working.  The Foscam doesn't strobe in the dark like the Hootoo.  Night vision is great.  Able to connect using my uCamPro iPhone app as well.  If this lasts a couple of years, it would have been worth it.

Reviews.Title: Great Support
Reviews.Author: MGS
Reviews.Content: Great Customer Support!!!Called in with an issue about trying to set my camera to view remote(not on the network).  Called the Foscam helpline and was immediately helped by Ralph Mendez.  He took his time explaining everything and helped to correct the work that I had already started.  Although it took sometime he stayed patient and committed to get the job done.  Very happy with the service and camera is working great.  Going to purchase another camera soon!!

Reviews.Title: Great camera.....difficult initial setup
Reviews.Author: Blabbyb
Reviews.Content: The camera arrived quickly and was easy to set up on the wireless network, but getting it working for remote viewing over the internet took me 2 days! I am pretty good with computers, but the instructions aren't great. Once I figured out the port forwarding I was able to get it to work.I liked it enough to order another and the setup went much better. Only problem I have now is that when trying to view in multi-device it says it can't connect to the 2nd camera. It has worked before, so I don't know what the problem is now.The camera's defintely serve their purpose. I wanted to be able to check on the house, kids and dogs when at work. It's obvoiously not very discreet looking, but that's ok for me.I like the motion sensor features so that I don't have to stare at the cameras all the time. I get an email notification when it detects movement.One disappointment is that I can't view through the front windows with the camera, it just looks all white and washed out from the sun. I suppose that's an issue with most cameras. I tried the outdoor settings, but it didn't help.For the price, these cameras are great. Great quality, clear pictures, motion detection, night viewing and internet remote viewing all make this camera a great buy for the price.I may buy more. I don't think you can go wrong with these. But Good luck with the initial setup!

Reviews.Title: Can be tricky to set up remote viewing
Reviews.Author: Bigg
Reviews.Content: This camera is fantastic.  It is easy to set up for viewing within the network.  However, remote viewing can be tricky.  I wish it were more straightforward,  However, the method Foscam has come up with is free, so it's worth a bit of haggling.  We use this in our infant daughter's nursery and it produces clear images, even in darkness.  We love it.

Reviews.Title: Extremely Poor Documentation
Reviews.Author: dissatisfied
Reviews.Content: This is not a review about the product-but rather about the documentation.  A tech savvy friend and I spent several hours trying to make sense of the installation guide which is clearly one of those guides written by non native English speakers.  We did consult tech support-and they were helpful. Some may enjoy this challenge.  For me I simply cannot be supportive of installation this complex in 2012.Here is a sample from the installation guide.  "If you have no concept of port forwarding please open the webpage (link) to learn some knowledge of port forwarding" On top of that the package came with a CD-and as a macbook pro and ipad owner in 2012 I would argue this is simply no longer the norm.  I compare this installation to that of my NEST thermostat-which simply read my network as soon as it was plugged in and installed itself-and the two are in entirely different galaxies.Seriously folks, take this product off the market until you can get your installation up to date and give your overworked tech staff some needed rest.

Reviews.Title: great ip camera for the price
Reviews.Author: pnr
Reviews.Content: For the price, I think it's a great-value camera. I was able to successfully setup the camera wired and wireless without any problems. I don't have any background with networking configuration at all but I do admit, the instructions included need to be a little bit more detailed. I assigned a permanent ip through my router (I have AT&T; U-verse/2wire) and had to reboot my router after connecting the camera through ethernet for setting up wireless since the wireless ip address did not show automatically in my devices list-the foscam camera has two different ip addresses for the wired and wireless, important to note that). And I was able to remotely access the camera in my ipad and iphone through the $5 app as well as hosting it through No-ip for free after updating the firmware to the latest. To access outside of my local network like when I'm at work, all I need to do is type my external ip address with the opened port on the browser to access the camera. I'm thinking of upgrading my no-ip membership to the $9.95 a year one for a more-hassle free dynamic dns.For port-forwarding, I created a rule to host port 8090 through my router and so far no problems. I created usernames and password for family members who are overseas  and assigned them as "visitors" in the user settings and they were able to access the camera using my external ip address and port just fine.Quality of the image is alright for the price. Two-way audio needs improvement. We had to be close to the camera to hear the sound coming from the speaker.Over-all, it's a really good ip camera for the price.

Reviews.Title: great baby monitor for iphone
Reviews.Author: Laura Furlong
Reviews.Content: The video quality is very good. The night vision is amazing. The microphone is very sensitive - maybe too much so, as I have to turn the volume down a click or two on my iphone so I don't hear the background noise. We're using a foscam app on the iphone and we use it as the monitor. You can pan the camera, speak through the camera and record video through it. You can also set it up to run in the background like a phone call, so you can use it as an audio monitor (and it doesn't suck the battery life of the phone as quickly). You can still receive a phone call (it just kills the app). So far it looks like just under an hour of constant audio and video up on the iphone screen used about 25% of my battery. When I put it in the background so I just heard the audio constantly (the screen was off) for over an hour and a half it used about about 15% of my battery. You can use your browser to monitor the video, as well, but on the mac, there is an issue of the audio not working in the browser. When on the computer I use the application VLC to monitor the audio and video. It works well, but of course, you can't use the camera controls (move the camera) or speak through the camera.So, it has its flaws, but for what we're using it for, it is pretty awesome and much cheaper than a lot of the better video baby monitors.

Reviews.Title: High Quality Good Price
Reviews.Author: AverageJoe
Reviews.Content: I had only used Axis cameras before purchasing this item.  Although the reviews here are very positive, the comments led me to believe this was a cheaply made product, albeit at a good price point.  My take is a bit different...  I am very impressed with the build quality and the performance of this camera.  Just for reference, an Axis PTZ camera will set you back about $1200 dollars (12 times the price).  While the Foscam camera lacks a zoom feature, it has self contained invisible night illumination and the Axis does not.If you are using the camera for home or office where the distances are reasonable (as opposed to a warehouse or big box store where you need to zoom in on a shoplifters hands), this is your camera.  The 24 hour ir illumination will cover a room or hallway nicely at night when the room lights are out.The product came nicely protected and included a CD with mac and pc instructions, a paper easy start guide, a sturdy adjustable bracket for wall ceiling or tabletop mounting, and a neat retractable spool ethernet cable.  The camera body has a nice matte finish.  The instructions are clear and thorough, although setting up any wireless network camera with internet access could throw a newbie into a tailspin.  Very impressed.I have the camera hooked up to a Synology network server for motion recording on a wireless LAN, and VPN in for mobile and mac-based access.  I have no use for the two-way audio and have not tested it.  I have already ordered more cameras.

Reviews.Title: Real genuine review of FOSCAM
Reviews.Author: Andy
Reviews.Content: Okay, I bit the bullet and got this camera. I only had this cameras for a couple of hours, and I have pretty much setup everything that I need to do.  Btw, nobody forced me to write this review, and I do not work for Foscam, so this is a serious review. However, there are caveats...I am an IT professional, so even though I had to tinker with that a bit, it's not that bad to setup if you have some tech knowledge, here are some pointers that you should know before buying and setting this camera up:1)  If you have a dynamic public IP address (which what most home internet users have)  you will definitely needs a dynamic DNS (DDNS) service. Good thing is that you can use a free third party one.  Forget what people say about dyndns and how crappy/not free it is, the new version has "no-ip" support out of the box, and it's free it's great. That way you don't need to run the no-ip DUC (desktop client on your PC) all day.2)  Yes, you will need IT experience, or pay a friend who knows his stuff or buy him a case of beer so he can set it up for you.  This is not some "plug and play" device at all, but for me it was fun to tinker with.  This is a standalone "web server" camera not some silly (paid) cloud service that someone can guide you through ever step of the way.  To setup, It's best to plug in the ethernet cable into the camera, find out what dynamic private IP it grabs from your DHCP server on the LAN, and configure via a web browser from there, and setup that IP as static.  Skip the software, I didn't even touch it.  Then, you will need to setup the wireless, then the port forwarding on your router/firewall so that you can access this (or a domain name mapped to a dynamic IP service in #1 above). Good thing is that the camera will forward the public IP to your email.  be sure to setup a non-standard port (not port 80) for this camera.3) sound is terrible...but I don't really need it that much.  the volume is too soft, and the audio support in the software sucks on the web GUI. However, I will deduct a point for this in my review4) The case is cheap glossy plastic (non ABS), and it feels flimsy.  Definitely do not drop it. However, this is only the aesthetic complaint of this camera5)  The ipad/iphone support is not included...you can get a paid version, but it's a few bucks. A lot of cheapskates complained that Foscam should've included this, but oh well. But, if they had looked harder there are plenty of free Foscam software in the app store written by others that you can use to access the camera. I went and got the foscam pro app for a couple of bucks. It works without errors. I was impressed and how easily it sets up.  I was able to guide my wife through this over the phone on her ipad, and I didn't have to hold her hands. Super.6) Some menu descriptions (or lack there of) made the configuration hard to understand.  But, a few google searches answered my questions.  I would deduct half a star for that lack of clear documentation.7) the motion detection works...just needed to make sure the file upload is unchecked (ftp), or else the email portion doesn't work.So, overall, I feel for the price it's a pretty decent IP cam.  The app didn't crash on the web gui or the iphone/ipad which is a big plus. I have had an IP camera in the past (Sony), and I was not happy at the glitchy interface.  This worked right out of the box without problems.  I recommend this for any techie who is interested at a decent IP camera.  I give it 3.5 stars  (rounded up to 4 stars)

Reviews.Title: Good hardware, poor software
Reviews.Author: Will
Reviews.Content: The camera hardware is pretty good and gives surprisingly good quality video, including night vision mode. I have tried it in a virtually dark room and it is possible to make out people moving in detail. Any decent light gives good color and smooth motion that is better than the average youtube video.The cons have all to do with software, which has a school project feel to it at best. The video monitoring requires signing up for third party websites and leaves me wondering about the privacy and security of the feed. The documentation is written in poor english and requires the user to have a pretty solid technical background. Novices should stay away. There are a few iOS apps which make accessing the feed from an iphone much easier (I tried the free "baby monitor for ip camera" and so far I would recommend it, although it has some issues in controlling the camera movement/panning).Overall, this is an ok solution if you are tech savvy but it clearly is a fail in user experience.

Reviews.Title: Very cool - watch YouTube installation first
Reviews.Author: E. Jones
Reviews.Content: Got this up and running and viewable via my iPad and iPhone in about an hour or so.VERY helpful to watch YouTube video from "Awkward Hamster" who has a couple of step-by-step videos. The small installation booklet they send is very minimal and makes more sense once you watch someone else do it and explain it.NOTE:  the dyndns.org Dynamic IP address forwarding that is specified in the installation is NOT FREE. (or at least I couldn't find a way to not give it my credit card)The YouTube video shows how to set this up using no-ip.com for free.  It is working well for me.I'm ready to buy my outdoor model now.  I love being able to watch my stay-at-home dog-cam during the day.Great product and price.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Chris Blount
Reviews.Content: I've had the Foscam (white version) up and running for a few days now and it seems to be working great. Picture quality is clearer than the other cameras in my house (Panasonics and Airlinks). The night vision is VERY good and will light up an entire room easily.Setup was what I expected and not all that hard if you understand port forwarding (I've done it with the other cameras in my house so it went pretty quick).The iPad and iPhone app are very good and have just about everything you need to monitor and record images along with listening and talking through the camera. You can even setup your position presets right inside the app.I hooked up a couple of non-powered speakers to the audio output and when talking through the camera using the iPhone app, the sound was loud and clear. The people in the room had no trouble hearing me.My only advice is when setting up e-mail alarms (the camera will e-mail you when there is motion). Enter all of the data first (SMTP info, port, username, password etc), be sure to hit the "Submit" button BEFORE pushing the "Test" button. If you don't, you will get a wrong parameter error.I have been buying these types of IP cameras for years and using different brands. I must say that this camera is a fantastic value for the price. Much cheaper then other cameras with the same features. Recommeded highly!

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Kevin Hudak
Reviews.Content: Issue: Setup the camera:I purchased the Fos Cam as a baby monitor, which was $200 cheaper then any video monitor at Babies R Us. The camera quality is great. I had heard set up was some what difficult to the average person so I purchased the set up option through Fos Cam's website for $40.  Worth every penny. Do not waste your time calling the 800 number to pay for the set up.  Go directly to their website and purchase it as if it were a product you would drop in your shopping cart.  Once purchased email tech support you need an appointment to get it set up. Ricky was my tech.  He remotely logged in and set up the camera in 15 minutes.  Left me detailed notes on how to access the camera from outside locations and provided me with the correct app to down load so I can view my beautiful girl from my Iphone and Ipad.

Reviews.Title: WORKS GREAT!!
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera with the anticipation that the picture quality was going to be so so and the software set-up wasn't going to go easily.  WAS I WRONG!! After getting so far with the software installation, I hit a brick wall, as the expression goes. So I called technical support and spoke to Sean. Within a few minutes after he got into my computer, everything was working GREAT!! The IPhone app works in 3G seamlessly (I use my PC to view over my LAN) and the clarity and vibrant colors of the picture are beyond what I expected! Sean was great to deal with to the point that I would ask him a question (which even I didn't understand what the heck I was trying to say) and immediately he made it happen!!  I would have given the product & support 10 stars if I could have!!

Reviews.Title: The BEST!!!!
Reviews.Author: C. BULLARD "Charlene"
Reviews.Content: Amazon - Speedy Service.  I ordered two cameras on Saturday, 8/25 and received them today 8/28.  3 days, free delivery, FAST. THANKSWhen I opened my packaging, I immediately decided to install the cameras myself, proving everyone who made a review and claimed that this was difficult to install was wrong.  However, that didn't work, I did not place the cord in the correct place and it could not find the ip adress, so I called FOSCAM Customer service and "Smith" helped me.  I must give him a 10 out of 10 for customer service.  He displayed patience and helped me to navigate through the system to install two cameras.  After 30-45 minutes, he installed both cameras, set it up to be viewed from a DDNS (free one), and made my cameras email me when it detects a motion.  His help was worth the aggrevation.  So if you are not good at computer software installation, call customer service.  You will save yourself a headache, becaue I could not have done all that he did.I am so thankful to "Smith" for helping me, as I would have been lost installing it by myself.I am continuing to learn how to navigate my new "security system", which is a better option for me than paying an alarm company hundred of dollars for their cameras and system equipment.For all the people who are looking to by this product, I believe that this was a great purchase and you will be pleased and happy as I am.

Reviews.Title: exellent product
Reviews.Author: onecares
Reviews.Content: I initially had some problem with setting up the browsing function from external web. I considered myself tech savvy and was annoyed by the setup issue. Before I returned the IP cam, my wife convinced me to call their tech support. I called Foscam tech support and Sean patiently helped me with that. Then everything works great. Thanks, Sean.I have 2 routers, one from at&t; connecting to the external web and the other one bridging between the at&t; router and local machines and adding extra WIFI. The problem is that I forgot to set up the at&t; router for letting the port through the firewall. Once Sean helped me with that, then set up the port forwarding in my 2nd router, then no problem.So if you encounter any issue in setting up the cam, I suggest you call their tech support.

Reviews.Title: Great service after sales
Reviews.Author: Tom Viren "Cost Cutter"
Reviews.Content: Sandra did an excellent job of assisting me through the maze of setup.  The camera works great and I can now see it on the web thanks to Sandra

Reviews.Title: Worth the Investment
Reviews.Author: Y. Velazco "flip phinoi"
Reviews.Content: First, I didn't buy the product here as I found it cheaper somewhere else, but I do want to write a review to help others who are thinking of buying the camera.  My initial impression was that the camera seems cheap, perhaps because of the material used (mainly plastic).  As long as it's not dropped, I think it will be fine.Pros:- Great picture clarity- IR cutoff is great of accurate colors in day and night- Pan/Tilt is great for viewing different angles- Wireless signal is exceptionally great- Good beginner software- Easy setupCons:- Made of plastic (feels cheap at first)- Bad firmware causing wireless function to fail (easy fix)I am not a PRO installing and configuring security camera, but after burglaries/vandalism in my neighborhood started happening, I decided that this would be a great investment.  The setup was extremely easy.  It is set to acquire DHCP, just connect the ethernet cord to your router, and power it up.  Check your router for the assigned IP address and then access the admin console of the camera.  You can also install the IP Camera Tool that is on the  CD.  The interface is good.  Simple.  I say this because I only changed a few things here: mainly to enable and configure wireless so it connect to the proper SSID of my network.  Be warned, if the wireless isn't picking up any SSID/Wireless network, you might have a bad firmware.  It took me a couple of hours to figure this out (I was almost about to give up on it).  The firmware you will need is 11.37.2.46 and Web UI: 2.4.10.2.  This is the best UI/Firmware I can find that is worth keeping for this device.  As mentioned, the interface is acceptable and thsi goes for the actual IP Camera Software you can install that will allow you to connect to your camera remotely and configure and setup alerts, etc.I do not use the software as I have other cameras in my property.  I use an Open-Source program call I-Spy.  This software allows me to define specific actions and trigger areas of the camera.  Meaning if I have the camera pointing outside in my drive, I can have an area to be monitored for movement.  Even if the wind makes the trees beside my driveway sway like crazy, it will not trigger an alarm as it is not within the trigger area I have defined.  In addition, I can also setup the software to trigger another camera in case one of the other cameras is triggered.  I have a DLink DCS-920 and I have two of these Foscams and I use one application to record videos/capture photos and audio.  Additionally, I only have the application set to record and when movement/alarms are triggered.  The application can also force the camera to track movements which means, if someone is walking, it will automatically pan and tilt the camera to follow the direction of the movement.I will update this review after a month of using the Foscam, but for now, I'm extremely happy with the purchase.

Reviews.Title: Lots of features for a great price
Reviews.Author: Tech Buyer
Reviews.Content: I was a little bit skeptical to but these cameras, they were too cheap, but buying through amazon is most of the times a good experience. I have owned some wireless trendnet cameras and I was expecting to get a nice upgrade, so I found the opportunity. Sp this is my experience:The good:1. The cameras look solid, nice package and the material looks pretty decent and sturdy2. Good image quality, 2 way sound which works great. The movement is good.3. Lots of additional features, like motion detection, email notification, etc.4. Easy to setup. I just changed the name, time zone and enabled wireless mode.5. PC and iphone/ipad applications. They work great. You can move the camera, talk 2 ways, record video and pictures, configure motion detection, etc.6. Night vision works pretty goodThe bad1. iOS app is not free, but not that expensive. It is worth it.2. Changing some configuration settings requires to reboot the camera, not a big deal, but took me around 1 hr to configure 4 cameras.3. Bulky. It is hard to keep them out of sight4. Short power cables.  They also have a green light, which is kind of useless5. Configuration issues with IE active X6. PC application is not very intuitive7. Mic picks some noiseConfiguration was easy, but it may require some technical knowledge. Some people complain about configuration issues. Visit the web site for technical support. I was able to solve my issue with the active X in internet explorer. Configuring the cameras for internet access is a router configuration, so don't complain about the cameras configurationSo far I love these cameras. They are way better than the trednet and they were less expensive. I have only a few days of ownership, so durability is a big IF, but that's a risk with most electronics.I highly recommend these cameras

Reviews.Title: TOTALLY AWESOME IP CAMERA!!
Reviews.Author: UFO
Reviews.Content: First off, I want to say this is the best IP camera I have own. I also own a D-Link DCS--942L for a year now and from specification wise on both cameras, I personally find that foscam has an upper hand on picture quality, user control, and more setting options.Built quality wise between the Dlink-dsc 942l and foscam 8910w, I personally prefer the Dlink over the foscam. Dlink use a hard plastic body that feels very durable and solid. Foscam has a plastic matte body that feels very nice, but does not feel sturdy and solid as the Dlink. As for security surveillance camera, I feel that the foscam is very big and can not be hidden easily.
