This is a con for me because let's said that if there was an intruder in my house or someone who is robbing my house they can unplug the camera and it be all over because of the camera large footprint. Dlink body is about 2/3 smaller than the foscam. I did not have any trouble getting the foscam 9810w camera to work. Setting up the wifi was also a breeze for me also as long you read the manual that came along with the camera. The hardest part was getting the camera to work over the Internet. It took me no more than five hours to get everything to work including getting it to work on my iPhone and my laptop over the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Camera once you get it to work ;-)
Reviews.Author: Roman Schwab "Roam"
Reviews.Content: I like this Wireless Camera once I got it up and working.The first issue I had was installing the program from the CD. It would not properly install on my Win7 64bit PC and only leave an icon to uninstall. Since I'm very technical I setup the camera without the little app. Getting the Camera up and running in wired mode was no problem but switching from wired to wireless was one annoying. I tried for about an hour and after about 25 tries of plugging in the network cord, rebooting, waiting 10 seconds and then removing the network cord finally the camera connected to the wireless network and showed up on my ip scanner. Last issue I had was the sound on the camera. There was a lot of static sound that made the audio unusable. I went to the Foscam Forum and someone was talking about wrapping the antenna in Aluminum foil. I tried that and it did the trick. Now after about 2 hours of installing and troubleshooting the thing I'm pretty happy with our new baby/security camera. And by the way the Infra Red at night works great.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: J. M.
Reviews.Content: I'm very satisfied with the camera. Just followed the easy to follow instructions to first set up the camera using a wired configuration and then switched it over to wireless and it worked like a charm.  Picture quality is very good, night vision quality is excellent, pan and tilt controls work well, overall I am extremely satisfied with the camera.  I originally bought 1 camera to try first  and was so happy with it that I wound up buying 3 more and all 4 of them are working perfectly.  Setting up the remote viewing capability was a little more involved, especially for me since I had never done port forwarding on a router before and had never even heard of a DYNDNS service,, but after watching several tutorials on YouTube and doing some online research on the subject I proceeded to tackle setting up the remote viewing capability and really didn't have any problems.  Now when I'm away from home I can view my cameras from either my laptop or my Android and it works fantastic.  Gives me great peace of mind when I'm away from home to be able to check on my house and my pets whenever I'm away from home, whether I'm out to dinner with friends or away from home on vacation.  The last thing I did was set up the cameras to send an email to my AOL email when I have the motion detection alarm feature turned on and the email system works great. If the alarm is triggered the cameras will take a series of snapshots and email them to me along with the notification that the motion alarm was set off.  For the price of these cameras I think  you get one heck of a bang for your buck.  I plan on buying a couple more of these and then I'll have every room in my home covered.

Reviews.Title: Great price; works well; a little complicated
Reviews.Author: Patrick J. Rogers
Reviews.Content: As an IT enthusiat, I found this camera to be packed with features for the money, along with a great warranty and quality build.  Since I wanted to be able to view the camera remotely, I opted for the dynamic DNS hosting service (dyndns.com).  That was a little complex for me, so novice users may need some help from a techy friend.  Overall, this a a nice product for the price!

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: marc
Reviews.Content: sean did a great job with setting up the "port forwarding" for my business cameras... i recommend Foscam to anyone looking for a hassle free camera system...

Reviews.Title: Good for baby monitor
Reviews.Author: TheRealJoeB
Reviews.Content: The FI8910 is a pretty good IP camera that is useful as a baby monitor or for remote security. It has infrared lights and the only wire you need is for power. The resolution is ok, but newer models do look better. I also noticed that there is about a 5-7 second delay in the picture which is important to know if you are watching a sleeping infant. The sound quality is great! It can pick up very slight sounds in the room and you hear it clearly. I haven't been able to get the 2 way sound to work yet but just monitoring works fine. A great alternative to an expensive monitoring system

Reviews.Title: Works great!
Reviews.Author: Momof2
Reviews.Content: The initial set up of the camera was very simple.  I was able to log in at home and see the live stream.  Because I have a IP phone router, THEN I have an Airport Extreme (2 routers), the remote set up was more that I could handle.  But I knew someone who helped with that - it took him about 5 minutes. The camera works great.  I am able to log in and see that my kids are home from school.  The picture quality is excellent - better than I expected.  LOVE IT!

Reviews.Title: I have 4 of these in my house
Reviews.Author: JD
Reviews.Content: I'm an IT professional, and these were a little confusing to get working at first. You'll need to create an account at a site like dyndns.org to be able to access these away from home (assuming you don't have static IPs). You create a hostname like amazonuser.homeip.net and tell each camera to point to that and to a specific port number. Each cam can point to the same hostname but must use a different port. Four cams would use, for example, port 80, 81, 82, and 83. I look at the cams with a free android app called tinyCam Monitor. With that, I can see all 4 cam views simultaneously on my cell phone screen. You double-click on a view to see that one full screen, and you can control the cam movement with touch or physical controls on your phone. I've been using 3G, and the video feed/controls sometimes crap out a little bit (black screen or unresponsive controls), but 4G works a lot better from what I've seen. These things have great night vision too. I'd buy more if I had a bigger house.

Reviews.Title: Foscam tech support
Reviews.Author: Luis Camacho
Reviews.Content: Harry Foster - He was my technician for a support call I just made.  We bought our first camera and it was missing an antenna.  Amazon shipped a second camera, and it arrived the same week as the first.I had trouble getting it up and running and had to call tech support.That's when Harry stepped in.  He did a great job.  I just sat and watched, as he took control and made it all work.

Reviews.Title: Foscam customer support
Reviews.Author: Betty N
Reviews.Content: issue was camera feed not available on my android phone and inability to use the camera tool for Foscam.I spoke with Harry Foster and he helped me go through the issues and very professionally used his knowledge to change the issue to solved.I would recommend that if you purchase an IP Camera you purchase Foscam and allow the Professionals to help in technical service. I am a satisfied customer.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Clark
Reviews.Content: I liked this product quite a bit and bought 2 more in black. It has a standard camera mounting screw hole so I can mount it in various ways. I can connect it via wired or wireless connection. I like the black units because they are a matt black and not shiny.

Reviews.Title: Awesome camera and easy to set up
Reviews.Author: Susan
Reviews.Content: We got this one as baby cam and has been working very well. The IR works great and we can see very sharp and clear images. Also like that there are many aps out there to support this device and most are pretty intuitive. The whole set up process (though can't take any credit) seems to be quite straightforward. We love this buy and will turn this into a surveillance camera when the kids outgrows it or he realize the purpose of the camera, which ever comes first.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with outstanding technical support!
Reviews.Author: GH
Reviews.Content: I was able to set this up in about 20 minutes to confirm that it was working. I needed a little help from technical support and after a short 5 minute wait they were able to remotely get the camera working wireless. I asked for an app to work with either an Ipad/Iphone or Android device and the tech (Jees) suggested the appropriate app for each product (IPcam Viewer)and i was up and running. The technical support rep was knowledgeable and patient. This is a good option for people on budget. Also the audio from the Chrome and Firefox browser was excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great nursery/nanny cam.  Needs advanced setup.
Reviews.Author: C. Weaver "PsychoDoc"
Reviews.Content: Here's a review for the fellow non-tech types:  First, you should know what this is not.  It is NOT a plug-n-play camera.  It requires fairly advanced setup.  Here is what I had to do, some of which was because my wifi hardware was REALLY old (an early wireless-g).First, I tried to get the camera on my old network, and ended up replacing my cable modem and my wireless router because the camera wouldn't even sync on to the network (it worked immediately on hard-wire).  Once I had the new network up, you have to follow the directions to get in to the setup software via a web browser, similar to any other wifi device.  Then it worked on wifi.  I can unplug and move around and it works fine.  Then, because I want to see the cam from outside my home network (e.g. when I'm at work), I had to sign up for a free outside service to host an address for my camera.  I had to sync all of the settings on my new wifi router to that outside host provider, which includes a procedure called "Port Forwarding," not complicated, but not something you do every day.  Then, I had to find an app for my iPad and iPhones that will sync with Foscam cameras.  The one called FoscamPro is working brilliantly for me, but there are others, all in the $5-7 range.  That particular app will sign in to the cameras via that outside provider service when I'm away from home.  If I'm at home, it will find my camera within my wifi network IF I have what's called a "static IP" address assigned to my camera.  By default, all of my wifi devices actually run on "dynamic IP" addresses, meaning that my wifi router assigns a different "address" to them every time they sign on.  I had to "Reserve" my IP address for my camera, again a setting in my router.  Then, I could tell my app to go to that local address if I was at home and save the bandwidth from going to and from outer space to see my nursery.  I've never done any of this stuff before having to for this camera.Now, what I have is an incredibly clear view of the babies (twins, so a static camera is worthless), including presets that let me push buttons to zoom right to their faces.  The iPhone/iPad app also functions as a zoom for the camera, so you can see in very clear detail what is going on.  And, the camera can be moved all over the house with no problems whatsoever.  The audio from the camera is very static-laden and essentially worthless, but we have a regular baby monitor for when we want audio monitoring.  Everything works as seamlessly when I'm out on 3G as when I'm at home on my home network. Definitely go to the Foscam site and look through several of their much more detailed manuals for pretty good instructions that got me through everything.  Bottom line:  It's pretty complicated to set up, but probably far better than any other video option for a baby monitor, and it'll make a killer nanny-cam and security cam later down the road.  I'm ordering more.  :)

Reviews.Title: Wireless operation is easier said than done
Reviews.Author: Pegasus
Reviews.Content: We bought 2 of these cameras, one for use in the US and one for use in the UK.  We have tried for many hours, 4 of us, to get these cameras to work wirelessly, as they are supposed to.  Our 2, mid-twenties sons are computer geeks and they cannot get it to work wirelessly, in either location.The only way it will work is using the small wire from the modem to the camera, and we can't put the modem next to the window as well as the camera, as we want it to be as invisible as possible.  It seems to work OK wired up, but when my husband tried to log in to it from his computer abroad, he was not able to. Very frustrating indeed.The instructions do not help, either.  True we haven't rung the company yet, which is our only other option, but we shouldn't have to do that in order to get it to work, if the instructions are no help.Very disappointing.

Reviews.Title: Product broke after 4 days of using it
Reviews.Author: SB2008R2
Reviews.Content: This product's night vision only lasted 4 days. I tried everything from resetting the camera to upgrading the firmware. I even followed Foscam's instructions on how to reset the IR sensor if it goes out but to no avail. You can tell that the IR led's are on because you can see them when it is dark but they don't work for distances over a foot. Camera is great overall except for the fact that the night vision went out after a few days of use. Hopefully the replacement will last longer than this.

Reviews.Title: The most for the least
Reviews.Author: GearHead48
Reviews.Content: I will assure you, that you could not spend your money more wisely on a "remote" camera; for whatever purpose you have in mind, this camera will suffice, hands down.I've spent thousands of $$ on remote camera systems for various purposes and paid the bucks to have them installed and configured... I'm embarrassed. I'm not a techie, yet I was able to get up and operating with just a little help from Foscam's tech support (from India.)Essentially, if there is light enough for the human eye to see, this camera will see it too. If the there is not enough light to see it, then the IR on this camera will make it visible. With a little ingenuity, one can create all the peace of mind necessary for most security needs.I will not reiterate what others have said about the unique values that this camera provides. Plainly put, it is worth very cent.UPDATE: 8/25/12: I have two of these cameras now, they are 1200 miles apart and I can view and control them simultaneously on my android phone with  IP Cam Viewer Lite from the Android app store. The cameras have been working flawless so far; as well as remotely from my computer and smartphone. I bought my cameras directly from Foscam.us to make sure that I would get free support; however, I now understand they will give free support for Amazon purchases too.Tech Support is there! You may be on hold for awhile, but you will get it..... and yes, it will probably be from India, but I assure you, that it will probably be much better support than you can get from AT&T; now a days. I needed Foscam support twice; and you will probably need them sooner or later if you are not tech savvy, so just be patient.I am 100% satisfied that I got my monies worth.

Reviews.Title: Great wireless camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jerry Shenk
Reviews.Content: UPS dropped this thing off a few hours ago.  I finished up some yard word, chatted with my wife about her job and opened the box.  I had it up and running in about 5 minutes.  I've seen some complaints in reviews about the setup being complicated, needing tech support, etc. so I connected an ethernet cable, noted the IP address from the DHCP server and then logged in and set it up.  I should add that I am a "computer tech" for a living so, perhaps that helped but, in any event, it worked perfectly.It works on both my PC and my MAC.  On the PC, the Active-X plug-in for IE causes a complaint about a security setting - that may be because I have IE locked down a bit more than normal.  I used Chrome on my PC and Safari on my MAC.

Reviews.Title: Much improved over previous version
Reviews.Author: ryanvito "Ryanvito"
Reviews.Content: The software with this works much better in multiple browsers. They incorporate the VLC plug-in for the audio which should make it work better on any Mac or PC. We use this for a baby monitor and it does the job well. I only have a few very minor gripes.1. Audible click when night vision is engaged/disengaged.2. The blinking wifi led on the back is very bright and makes the room strobe. I covered the light but the white case shows the light through the inside.3. We have had the video stream get a little stuck a few times. We find it easier to unplug it and plug it back in about once a week.4. We had to disable to automatic-recenter where it tries to center the camera after every power cycle. That is really annoying when you have to constantly correct where it is pointing and it is on by default (gripe is more that it is on by default, I always like more options).

Reviews.Title: Overall a good camera, particularly for the price
Reviews.Author: Becca B
Reviews.Content: I tired several different cameras before this one (dlink d-cam being one)  I was a bit hesitant to order but, in the end i'm so glad i did!  I started out by just buying this Foscam & one Dlink Camera.  I actually thought I was going to like the Dlink much more at first when I set them up given the ease at which the Dlink camera started up & synced.  Although the Foscam did require a bit more knowledge on networking (of which I might add.. i have none!) I did manage to figure it out after a successful tech-support call. If you want to access these cameras ( I actually ended up returning the Dlink and buying a second Foscam) outside of your network, you must learn how to forward an IP address. It really isn't as scary as it sounds for those of you who haven't done it before.  Don't shy away from this camera if you don't have a clue how to set up a forwarding of an IP address.  There are plenty of sites online to walk you through it, as well as the tech-support for Foscam does a direct link to your computer and can set it up for you remotely.The reasons I chose this camera over the others are #1, the remote movement.  I don't have to have it pointed in only one small location all the time. I can move it at any time I wish remotely, from anywhere I am.#2, it had a wider angle lens than the Dlink cameras which allows me to see more at one time#3, it has a much higher quality image (even when set at a lower resolution) than the other cameras.  Even at a lower resolution, the image it's self is clearer, and has MUCH better nighttime vision than some others i've tried.#4, it works nicely with 3rd party software for recording and uploading, no glitches, just works... "it plays nice with others"in conclusion.. i give it a 4 instead of a 5, just do to the complication of getting it set up.. but.. in the process i've learned how to do something that turns out wasn't hard at all!.. just something I hadn't learned how to do for fear that it would actually be hard.. and it wasn't .. just time consuming right at first... now all is wonderful and I couldn't be happier with my choice.  I've had them outside (simi-covered) for 6 months now & still working great!

Reviews.Title: Beautiful
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: Anzen(tech support) helped me install the camera viewer on all my computers and phones. Everything was great!! No complaints here. AND pan/tilt worx for me.

Reviews.Title: You Need to Read this Review !
Reviews.Author: JetLag
Reviews.Content: I just purchased 2 of the Black Foscam FI8910W.PLEASE NOTE: These INDOOR CAMS WORK ON BOTH PC & MAC. They can be viewed on your LOCAL network or REMOTELY!When I first opened the packages both included CD's were not recognized by my mac - BUT - I called the Telephone Support Number on the back page of the included quick installation guide and got a tech support person almost immediately ! He needed me to download app so he could control my computer. (BTW this app to control my computer can be deleted once the session is over, just check your download folder.) Anyways this guy was super knowledgeable about my mac, so I'm sure he is super super knowlegeable about your PC. The Clarity of the pics are quite good. The pan and tilt are the best I've seen. The price is amazing ($100 each), seeing as how I also own 2 sharx outdoor cams (that don't pan or tilt that I paid at least $250 for.) I will continue my review after I get to know these cameras good or bad.

Reviews.Title: My second camera
Reviews.Author: Uri Boneh
Reviews.Content: Good camera, I already use one.Supply voltage is 100 to 240 so you can use everywhere in the world, you just need a plug adapter.Easy to order.Fast delivery.

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: httrg3
Reviews.Content: Just bought this camera on Amazon.  So far looks pretty good. Had some problems with hooking it up on wifi (it did work over the cable), called tech support and spoke with Calvin Harris.  He was able to get it working.  Now they do require you to install a remote access tool in order to access your settings.  Up to you if you want to do that, much quicker this way.

Reviews.Title: Great Support
Reviews.Author: Katieb0203
Reviews.Content: I just purchased the Foscam F18918W and I had trouble getting it set up on my own. Sean with Foscam support really helped me out this morning. He remotely set up my camera and he got it working in 30 min. I think this is a great company and so far I have been very satisfied!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FT8910W
Reviews.Author: Customer Feedback
Reviews.Content: Calvin Harris helped me today setting up my camera. He was very helpful. It's great to be able to access the camera remotely and the quality of the image is good.It took over a week to get through to tech support, but once I was able to speak with Calvin he helped me with all my set up issues.

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910W - Awesome product AND Awesome Service!!
Reviews.Author: xlhig
Reviews.Content: I have purchased many items from Amazon over the years, but this is the first review that I've ever written. I felt the need to review because both the product and the support from Foscom are FIRST RATE! I purchased this item on 6/5/12 from Amazon and received it on 6/11/12. After reading reviews on different camera's, I knew that this one would meet my needs. I set it up by myself so that it worked on my home network. But I had difficulty setting up to be able to use on my android app (IP Cam Viewer) and also from viewing from outside of my network. So I called tech support and I was fortunate to talk to "Jees." (I hope I spelled his name correctly.) He sent me an email with a link to click on so that he could remote in to my PC. He finished setting everything up perfectly in about 10 minutes. It's not often that you can find and awesome product with awesome technical support, but that's exactly what I got with this camera. I would HIGHLY RECOMMEND this camera to anyone and I also recommend Foscam support.

Reviews.Title: Great for a baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: cardgenius
Reviews.Content: Great customer service.  Couldnt get the camera set up by myself so I called in. I worked with Smith and he was very patient with us and got the camera set up on our iMac.  The 1st camera we got was defective however they sent a new one that worked great.  Highly recommended even if your not an IT person. I do wish they had an installation CD that works for OS X.This a great alternative to the standard options for a baby monitor.  Its cheaper but works better than the ones you buy from Babies r us.  And you can even use it with your iPhone or Android anywhere!

Reviews.Title: Integrates well with home security on Mac/EvoCam/Indigo
Reviews.Author: Rickh3255
Reviews.Content: I received 2 of these cameras to replace old TrentNet wireless cameras in my home security system.  Set up was a breeze.EvoCam controls and records the cameras and Indigo provides the interface to home security.  When motion is detected by wireless sensors, Indigo instructs EvoCam to point all cameras to the affected area.I've ordered 2 more cameras to complete the coverage.

Reviews.Title: Foscam 8910 IP camera
Reviews.Author: J. F. Kuklis
Reviews.Content: The technical support guy (Ricky) was very helpful in getting my camera to work wired, wirelessly and through the internet remotely.  The callback from tech support came in about 5 minutes from when I called for help AAA+++.  Ricky showed me how to view multiple cameras, fullscreen etc.  I can't remember what else he did for me but the bottom line is that he did everything I asked for and made sure that I was happy and that everything worked to my satisfaction.THANKS RICKY AND THANKS FOSCAM !!!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: acm05
Reviews.Content: Recommend the camera.  I am using it for a child monitor and so far it works great.  Had trouble setting it up at first but called tech support and spoke with Anzen and he was able to fix it with in a few minutes.  I recomend the camera.

Reviews.Title: Happy Customer - for the most part
Reviews.Author: Paws2Live
Reviews.Content: I was thrilled to bits when I finally got this working. It wasn't very easy to setup. For me, it wasn't immediately apparent that there were two mac addresses for the one item. One MAC address was for the wired nic and the other was for the wireless nic. The MAC address for the wireless nic was in tiny print and my old eyes had trouble reading it!I ordered two more of these so that should speak to whether or not I'm satisfied!In order to make the camera work, I had to replace my old router. I had a friend disagree thatit could be the router until I replaced it and things started working just fine. Apparently oldrouters (5+ years old) don't support newer technology very well.I can view my pups while I am away from home on my Android phone which is awesome.The provided documentation isn't the greatest. I got a lot of good advice right herein the reviews section and also on the Foscam website itself.Pros:I amazed at the quality of the IR outputEverything works great once you get it setup (for the most part)Cons:Not easy for the "average" person to setup. Fortunately, my degree is in computer scienceso I'm not average from a technical stand point.Worked great until I put the camera on the provided mount and tilted it so I couldsee the area better. Now the camera horizontal control occasionally jams.The delivered 3 levels of security are a bit limited. I'd love to see asecurity level that allowed for pan/tilt control without also allowing forchanges to the camera settings.The sound is not great, but I can live with that. I didn't buy the camera forits sound quality.

Reviews.Title: Great little solo cam...
Reviews.Author: ResilientRN6640
Reviews.Content: Works well with iPhone4, pretty easy to setup, works reliably. Made for indoors, but I use it as a pet cam right now.Great short range night view with IR LEDs. My Wife monitors it from work! I know I can add more as need and budget allow, and can record to a dvr/hdd. Great price for DIY'ers.

Reviews.Title: Very good IP Camera
Reviews.Author: StrayKatJJL
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these cameras now. They have a perfect video angle for an average size room. Its really cool to click an icon on my smart phone and see my entire house in live view. That is worth $400 to me.(Foscam has an app for these) I have caught and sent to prison two boys robbing my house while I was at work. They were thought to be responsible for over 30 break-ins before they had the misfortune to try and ripp me off. You have zero argument with the judge when video playback shows you in the act. The infrared is perfect for night time viewing. I simply could not imagine not having these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Camera
Reviews.Author: DOC HOLIDAY "DOC"
Reviews.Content: It's a bit to get through the set up, but once you do, it's great. It's a lot of fun.

Reviews.Title: Easy to use and set up
Reviews.Author: L. Wood
Reviews.Content: Purchased as webcam for my mountain cabin and working great.  Easy in-network set up and not too difficult to set up for viewing over the web.  The picture is very good, especially for the price.  The unit has a very nice appearance about it.  The IR works well, though I have it indoors behind glass so only get reflection as currently installed.  I have played with it in other locations and IR works pretty well.  Also, lots of on-line assistance for the Foscam products, if needed.

Reviews.Title: Calvin Harris
Reviews.Author: Harvey from Shaklee
Reviews.Content: Extremely helpful support.  Got the system up and running in a few minutes.I will be buying a few more cameras.

Reviews.Title: useful product, but not for the technical novice
Reviews.Author: Shawn
Reviews.Content: Purchased the Foscam with the expectation that setup would be challenging.  Documentation doesn't indicate that passwords are limited to 12 characters-- made for a bit of a scare when I couldn't login after changing the admin password.  Great product, but not for the technically challenged.  Basic network skills are a big help.

Reviews.Title: Not terribly impressive but works reasonably well
Reviews.Author: James H
Reviews.Content: I have tried several IP cameras including the previous, similar model from Foscam.  These work reasonably well with decent image quality given that its only 640x480.  The web interface is pretty typical and resembles that of all other IP cameras I've used.  PTZ controls are ok, but really wish you could adjust the movement speed on the view page itself without having to go into separate configuration pages.  It can be difficult to make fine position adjustments (such as for setting the position memories) except in lower speeds but can be annoying waiting for a lower speed to pan a great distance.  The camera resets itself occasionally but seems to always come back up within a few seconds and has been fairly reliable for 24x7 usage.  This Foscam FI8910W is extremely similar to the Foscam FI8918W.  Other than the slightly nicer external housing with matte finish I don't see any real difference between the two except that this one is quite a bit more expensive.  Wish I had bought two of the others instead.

Reviews.Title: you get what you pay for
Reviews.Author: Dr. Leibnitz
Reviews.Content: Audio is busted. IE plugin keeps crashing. Audio does work via a TinyCam on my Kindle Fire but does not work in IE. It works sometimes in Chrome.

Reviews.Title: Works good
Reviews.Author: Lord Belch
Reviews.Content: Setup not too difficult, but like many say the documentation is lousy both in the box and online.  Also, the documentation states you can sign up for a free website to view the camera online, but when you go to it, they only give a 14day trial...then an annual fee.Haven't figured out how to record to hard drive yet.

Reviews.Title: Execellent option
Reviews.Author: Eduardo Prada A. Duarte
Reviews.Content: I use this camera everyday to see my baby. I live in Brazil and travel a lot. I have the program in my Samsung Galaxy SII and watch my baby from everywhere, clearly with a good image even totally dark

Reviews.Title: Good value
Reviews.Author: Chi Phil
Reviews.Content: Amazing for the price, and extremely useful. Set-up is straight forward, and the picture quality is good. It comes with audio in and out, but also has a integrated mic and speaker which are great, but there are no problems communicating with someone at the other end.  All in all, exactly what I was looking for and surpassed expectations for the price - (I haven't tried this on the wireless).

Reviews.Title: Look no further
Reviews.Author: J. Rose
Reviews.Content: If you are searching for a reliable network cam look no further. I have tried all the x10 products and 4 other network cams and this is by far the best. It is relativly easy to set up and they just work. The iphone software and computer interface is clean and easy to understand. I finally did get them viewable on the interent after some help from tech support. It actually was not that hard... you just have to pay attention to what you are doing.  Ill give you some advice. When they tell you to do "port forwarding", do not use the "range" option...... do each one indiviudaly. so in your router you will put in the ip address of the cam, then assign a port number. 8090 is a good place to start. So your cam will then be something like this if you are within network. 192.168.1.125:8090.  If outside, you need to get your router ip addess then the port number. So something like this. [...]Besides all that tech geek stuff, you will like the cameras. You can change the scan speed to very slow to surprisingly FAST or anywhere inbetween. and the range pan and tilt range is incredible. You will never feel like "i wish it could go a little farther".  You can also have the ir lights come on automatically when it gets dark or you can control them manually. Visability is great at night. May be more than 7 meters which is too far to see much detail anyway. Pic is clear day and night although the color is a little weak, however it does have auto iris control which is great cuz it adjusts instantly to bright light or shade. I have had mine outside under eaves for over 6 months with 0 problems.  Oh and i almost forgot. You can talk through them and listen to feedback which is great. No extra speakers or anything required. This is priceless... especially when the kids are outside doing something they shouldnt be!!!  SIgn up at Foscams website because they occasionally (like every month) have sales which *can* be a discount sometimes.

Reviews.Title: Colors are really good
Reviews.Author: Auggie
Reviews.Content: I bought previous versions of the Foscam cameras and this is by far the best one I've gotten from them. The IR cutoff filter does make a huge difference in the color quality. The wide angle lens makes it a lot easier to monitor objects from a closer distance and full room views.Awesome camera update.

Reviews.Title: Great wired, forget wireless option.
Reviews.Author: dvincy1 "dvincy"
Reviews.Content: Bought this F18910W camera for wireless use.  Overlooked the numerous online feedback on wifi issues.  Found out the hard way that wifi is very problematic.  Initially connected the camera via wifi but after disconnecting it for relocation, the camera refuses to connect via wifi.  A very tech savvy person with solid network background, I have tried every single option both on the camera and via multiple routers and my experience is the same as most others online.  After 4 days of trying to connect via wifi, I gave up and ran a wire to the camera instead.  The wired connection works and despite my woes with wifi, this camera, once it holds up, is a good buy compared to many other options out there.  I'm not a fan of CMOS cameras but this one looks just as great as my CCD ones.  Downloaded FoscamPro for iphone and everything works generally well except for an occasional audio distortion.  Overall, I'm happy with this camera for the build, features, and functionality at such a low cost despite the wifi issues.  If you are looking for a wifi camera, forget this one, otherwise it is a great deal as a wired camera.  One last note, there are many imitation cameras looking the same but mine was from Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Our First Security Camera
Reviews.Author: Ball P. Penn
Reviews.Content: I would rate this camera as medium to somewhat difficult to install. This from someone who has been a computer tech for close to 30 years.The first thing I figured out was that I needed to print out the manual that comes on the CD. The quick install pamphlet is good, but limited. You do need both to install the camera.One thing that they tell you to do is go to [...] and get a free domain name to use when you connect remotely. The problem is that company doesn't provide free domain names. The other options for domain names given in a list they provide in the software seem to be non-existent. At least I think that's what they're telling me... It's confusing and poorly explained.I'm currently connecting with the IP address, and it has worked from a location outside my internal network. I'm going to try using our domain supplied by Microsoft for our Windows Home Server. [...]. If it works, I'm set. If not, I'm looking for a place to get one. I'm not overly interested in purchasing a domain name just for the cameras. Of course if the IP address works consistently I don't have to.Their port forwarding screen and explanation are confusing, but it's port forwarding so what would anyone expect? I still don't understand why every explanation I find regarding this task confuses it more than necessary.As for the camera itself, I am very impressed. The pan and tilt range is excellent, the resolution is clear at 640x480, the color is crisp, and you can adjust the brightness and contrast. I think it has the ability to save settings based on what you choose, but I haven't tested that yet. Infrared is automatic when the light level gets low and is a clear image.It will email alerts (it can be turned on and off easily) and I have set up and tested this feature. It works well within limits, but I can't get it to successfully send a message to my wife's Gmail account even though it sends one to mine. This feature needs a better explanation in the documentation. It attaches six snapshots to the email, and you can get a bunch of emails with constant movement! I know this because I forgot to turn it off once after testing. Oops! The picture quality in the email is excellent.I have set up our smart phones (Android) access the camera and it works fairly well. The biggest negative is the speed of the connection, but that's the cell phone service. Picture quality is pretty good and you can control the pan, tilt etc from the phone. An app download is required. This is the one I use: IP Cam Viewer Free. There is a full version with quite a few features that are not in the free. I may be buying that one once things settle down on the PC side. $4.00I downloaded a plugin:[...] that captures the audio and it works, but is a bit noisy. I've read that static can be caused by the wireless antenna and the power cord among other things and that experimentation should resolve the issues. I did notice that it really picked up the the tick-tock from our mantel clock.The lack of the ability to get a domain name as explained, along with the apparent lack of concern about this on the part of Foscam, as well as the problems with sending email are the reasons for four stars instead of five.I will be purchasing more of these cameras in spite of these problems.Edit: I figured out the email for Gmail. There is this choice in the mail settings:"Gmail only support TLS at port 465 and support STARTTLS at port 25/587."I initially used STARTTLS at port 25 and it wouldn't work. Changing it to TLS at port 465 resolved the problem.

Reviews.Title: Can't beat this deal!
Reviews.Author: MNJayW
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera to use as a baby monitor.  I thought it would be perfect for my situation.  I travel pretty frequently and wanted something that I could access from the internet or from my local network via my iDevices.  Setup was actually really easy for me, but I do have a above average knowledge of networking.  It took me less than an hour to get it set up.  This includes the remote access via my iDevice.  Great product for my needs, and less expensive than an off the shelf video baby monitor.

Reviews.Title: Outstanding techical and customer support
Reviews.Author: Ralph Shoemaker
Reviews.Content: I've been in IT and dealt with tech companies large and small for over 40 years. My experience with the FOSCAM team both in technical support and customer service is the best I've ever experienced.The technical staff have the online remote tools and knowledge to fix problems quickly and they do. Alice was very knowlegable and a pleasure to work with.  Can't say I've experienced that before in tech support even having been one myself.When a camera return and replacement was needed Mona in customer support made an extra effort to ensure the camera sent out was working perfectly.Don't have any complaints with the FOSCAM team and that's rare.Needless to say I'll be buying additional cameras here.

Reviews.Title: Fabulous!
Reviews.Author: Amanda R. Morris "Amanda R. Morris"
Reviews.Content: Best purchase of the year so far! I moved home to Iowa after getting out of the Army to give birth to my son, but his father is still stationed in New York, so with this in the baby's room he can peek in any time he wants. :) Great quality, even at night. If I had more money, I'd buy more to put up through the house for when baby isn't sleeping in his bed. I HIGHLY recommend this product!

Reviews.Title: 100% Satisfied. Go out and buy this!
Reviews.Author: Anthony B.
Reviews.Content: OK, I read about 50 reviews before buying this and finally decided to buy it. First off, the shipping was super fast. After I received the camera I began to set it up. I initial had a problem getting the first step done and was using internet explorer, then I switched over to mozilla and got it to work. But, I soon learned that internet exploroer worked after I set it up and there are more feature on the internet explorer interface. I would rate myself a 6/10 with computer skill and I watched a youtube video on how to setup the wifi and mobile viewing. After about 2 hours of setup I download the foscam app for my iphone and everything was setup. Guys, go out and buy this thing. This is better than $500 security camera setups that I'v seen.

Reviews.Title: worth every penny and struggle!
Reviews.Author: UW Fan "go dawgs!"
Reviews.Content: I know people have been suspicious of the overwhelming positive feedbacks and maybe perhaps some were from the manufacture itself but I'm just an ordinary guy who is expecting a newborn and was throwing the idea around of using this as a baby monitor.  I finally decided to give it a try and made the purchase last week.  Now, I'm no network guru nor am I totally new to logging in to my router and making some adjustments.  I also played with my network and got it to where I can share and view all of my 4 laptops and 1 HTPC in the house and that's the extent of my network knowledge.I started my adventure at 7pm by hooking up the camera to the router and immediately found the IP address using my router login (I have uVerse all in one).  The CD software simply acquires cam IP address for you so it's definitely not needed if you know how to look around your router.  The issue I had was that I don't know if it was my network or my macbook or dell laptop but it was extremely slow.  I had to play around the adjustments, rebooting this and that and couldn't get anything.  But eventually, after taking a break and trying a different port, it finally came up!  I was then able to enter my wireless information and port forwarding.  I was able to view this camera using my home IP address, which is very cool!  Now another issue came when I unplugged the camera - for whatever reason, it would not work just on my wireless network!  Very frustrating.  This is where I am right now, trying to troubleshoot this issue.  Even with all this issue, I think this camera is definitely worth it.  Night vision is simply mind blowing.  Having said that, I'll probably get two more and place them around the house.  I'm probably going to build a home surveillance system using few of these cameras and two USB web cams that I have which will make it a very effective at a minimal cost.**EDIT** **10/26/2012**The reason why I had such difficult time to get this camera connected wifi was because I have MAC filtering on my network and the Foscam cameras come with two MAC addresses of which both are on the bottom of the device.  Make sure you get those two MAC addresses entered if you have MAC filtering.  This setup would have taken me minutes if it wasn't for that.  Also, I'm using iCam and ipCam viwer and have it set up on no-ip.org.  I simply love this camera, I'm going to have another one to use as my baby monitor.  I also have two USB cameras (Logitech and Microsoft) connected to my HTPC and they work pretty well when there's light but the Foscam works especially well when even it's pitch dark with the IR.

Reviews.Title: Returning due to clicking noise
Reviews.Author: SNC "Aviator"
Reviews.Content: Bought twin pack Foscam FI8910W (White) Wireless N IP Cameras for just monitoring around home. Easy to setup and with the high gain antennas wireless connection is great even over the internet...if you are using these cameras for security, they are not the best because even though you an detect motion etc, resolution is not where you can detect faces or much details.Pros:does the job what it claims...Cons:Audio does not work if you use Apple computers...you have to download plugin which is not explained well anywhere!!Cameras  make clicking noise - somewhat lout and it is very random. Not sure what causes that.Technical support has "Press the RESET BUTTON" as their solutions to everything...If you try to return the product because it is faulty (i.e. making clicking noise) then company still charges you 20% restocking fee....even within the first 14 days!!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera
Reviews.Author: Lonnie W. Roberts "DrBill"
Reviews.Content: Easy Setup for wifi. Need to understand port forwarding for use outside wifi area. Port forwarding is a simple setup as well. In your browser type 192.168.1.1 to address your router. enter user name and pasword. Go to advanced or gaming menu. Enter router Ip which you can find by going to browser and enetering whatsmyip.org. followed by  the local ip address that begins with 192.168.1.XX that you obtain from camera app. Check the box to turn on the port. Save. Works like a charm on the Iphone/Ipad. I now have four cameras in different locations in operation.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Content: I bought two Foscam FI8910W for security and a baby cam. I am very pleased with them on my home network. Everything was very easy to set up except for the fact that I'm a Mac user and much of the software isn't expressly compatible for the lay-user. This prompted me to call the Foscam technical support when trying to set up port forwarding to view the streams from outside my home network and for getting the audio to work. I spoke with Ricky and he was very helpful. Unfortunately I had some trouble understanding him because of his accent. But he was able to set up both cameras using port forwarding, and get the audio to work on the iMac. I look forward to Foscam making the audio more user friendly and for the ability to see multiple cameras using virtually any other browser than Internet Explorer. I have no problems with the audio using the Foscam Pro App on my iPhone or on the iPad. I wish there were an application or program I could install to my computer so that I could view and hear everything as easily at home. As it is now, I have to open a different program all together in order to hear the audio and I am not able to have both open at the same time.

Reviews.Title: Good Hardware, Bad Software
Reviews.Author: rugbygame
Reviews.Content: I was disappointed with this camera.  The hardware is not bad and appears to be reasonably well made.  The device is relatively large and difficult to conceal because of the silver bezel around the lens and the IR illuminator.  The software is the real problem.  The software is primarily written for Internet Exlporer and does not work well with Chrome or other browsers.  For remote access you need to set up port forwarding and run software that will convert your dynamic Internet address into a static address. If you want to record, you need to have a FTP server available.  What a pain! The Foscam F18910W camera requires a really difficult software setup, and even after it is setup you can never be 100% certain that you will be able access it remotely.  If you are only interested in real time viewing and local access, the Foscam may be good a choice.  I was interested in a concealable camera with remote access and both real time and recorded viewing.  Accordingly, I returned the Foscam and ordered a Dropcam which I really like.

Reviews.Title: Wireless connection is very flaky
Reviews.Author: Jingyu Hu
Reviews.Content: Very disappointed with the product; the wireless connection is flaky, you never know if it will work or not, and I've had to constantly check the router to find out if it's connected or not;

Reviews.Title: Not at all "user friendly"
Reviews.Author: Ashley Trailrunner
Reviews.Content: We purchased two of these cameras to use as "dog monitors" when we're away from the house. After about half a day of hard work, we managed to get one of the two cameras running, but without any audio. The picture was good, but the access to the camera inconsistent:--Sometimes we could only view the camera from a computer that is logged into our home network (which defeats the purpose of why we bought it). The two-way audio also only worked when we were accessing the camera from our home network.--Sometimes we could only view the camera when we were NOT logged into our home network (which made it tough to make any adjustments to our settings.) The audio never worked from outside our home network.--Did I mention that these changes in where we could (or couldn't) view the camera would change unexpectedly, without our adjusting anything on our system? Yes. That's what made it SO frustrating.So, we returned the cameras to Amazon today. We're disappointed, mainly because we spent the better part of several frustrating days trying to get these to work, and sadly, we will never get those hours back. If you have lots of spare time to tinker with your network, maybe these cameras will work well for you, but their unpredictability (suddenly becoming inaccessible without any changes on our part) made them a poor choice for what we needed.

Reviews.Title: Baby Monitor Killer
Reviews.Author: Zoltomar Starfire
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were this -><- close to pulling the plug on a baby monitor at a local store.  I really didn't like what was offered, anything under $180 is junk and even then you're stuck with camera + THEIR viewing monitor (TINY TINY TINY unless you shell out big bucks for a 3.5" screen...I'm using an iPad with this sucker).Setting up the camera was easy until I got to the part where you unplug the ethernet cable so you can use it wireless.  They had a clear enough help guide on their website for the port forwarding setup so that was only a minor hitch, it took 1 min to go through the guide.CD comes with windows and mac software as well as an app for your phone...iphone/ipad will require an itunes download.Picture quality = awesome.Nighttime picture quality = awesomely creepy how clear it is.Audio = well...you'll sound like a tiny person trying to escape from a tiny camera.  There are 1/8" in/out jacks on the back of the camera if you really wanted to go the full route, we just wanted the visual features.Look at the features this camera offers and find a "baby monitor" that offers the same...now compare the prices.  See how easy that was?

Reviews.Title: Camera iffy and Foscam sucks and doesn't honor warantees
Reviews.Author: FrankLee
Reviews.Content: Bought 2 of these in August. both worked until Dec. Now one doesn't go into IR mode and moves on it's own. The box says 2 year warantee but Foscam said one year and it's up to the reseller to honor. Knowing that wasn't true I still contacted reseller who confirmed it's Foscam's problem. After 2 more days of runaround I finally gave up. STAY AWAY FROM THIS SUCKASS CHINESE COMPANY.

Reviews.Title: Meh...
Reviews.Author: T. Debrew
Reviews.Content: Set up is VERY nerve racking, especially when proper instructions/set up cd are not sent along with the product! Once I got the picture ready for view, the camera offers a decent pan range of the area being observed. This is the big downside: it is supposed to record movement and it doesn't, I'm supposed to be able to view camera images away from home and I can't. It is supposed to save images into a file folder on my computer and it doesn't. And I'm guessing it doesn't because there wasn't an instruction manual sent and a set up CD to go along with it. It is a waste of $60. I can only view AT HOME, which is sort of pointless because I can just get up and look out of the window. I'm really not happy with this product.

Reviews.Title: Lousy camera
Reviews.Author: rayman
Reviews.Content: Set up the camera and it worked for one or two days. I've read a lot of poor reviews on this product and wouldn't recommend it to anyone. Support is poor and we can't get it working anymore. I've reset the camera and it still doesn't work. DO NOT BUY THIS CAMERA!If you need security you expect dependable products or why would you buy it in the first place.

Reviews.Title: Great value overall
Reviews.Author: dhinmn
Reviews.Content: I currently have 4 of these (3 white and 1 black) around my house. Overall I am very pleased with these cameras. As others have mentioned for the price you get a lot of features. Full web based control and smartphone control that works great. I can monitor all of my cameras (and sound from them) live and I can set up alarms to have emails sent to me when motion and/or sound alarms are detected. I can also FTP images on alarm too.Positives+ Contrary to some other reviews, I thought setup was easy. And I DID use the included CD and software and I thought that software made it simple to install. I followed the directions to the letter and checked off each step as I completed them. No issues at all. You first connect them to your network with ethernet cable (one is included) to do the initial setup. Then you disconnect the network cable and do the wireless setup if you plan to use them wirelessly (all 4 of mine are running wirelessly). You then enable port forwarding on your router if it isn't already, and enable UPnP on the device using the devices web setup page. You just have to rename the port you plan to use (easy to do using the instruction provided). My setup was easier than most since I have a static IP. If you do not have static IP, you have to do extra steps for the port forwarding part.+ Image quality was better than I expected+ The night vision actually works great, I really like this feature when I use it+ Sound quality is not bad - you can monitor it remotely and hear what is going on, but the 2-way is crude (though does work)+ Mounting bracket and hardware are included+ Smartphone control works great. I currently use Surveillance PRO. Very simple to setup and use, and I like the mosaic view and you can turn on and off alarms and emails forwarding remotely with it. There are many other smartphone apps to choose from, I had trouble deciding which one to use and may someday try another one that has more features.+ I think these are a very good value for the money+ Long power cord (well with 3 of the 4 I ordered, more on that below)Negatives- There appears to be different versions of the same product. Of the 4 I bought, there are 3 different version of the web UI, and two different version of camera software (UPDATE: I have since learned that it is easy to update the software (both the camera and the UI) on the cams by following the instruction on Foscam's website). And 1 of the white cameras came with a much shorter power cord and the other 3 cameras all came with much longer cords. Weird. 1 of the 4 I bought appears to be an earlier hardware version of this model, but still the same model #. I bought them all through Amazon making sure Amazon Prime was listed as the seller.- 1 of the 4 cameras (the one that appears to be an older hardware version) keeps resetting itself. I plan to return that one and get another one.- I don't like the desktop monitoring software that came with very much so I think I will eventually buy a more sophisticated version. But actually the smartphone app works well enough for me, along with remote web browser viewing. I may just stick with those.Other Thoughts* The white ones are more glossy/shiny while the black ones are more matte/textured* The black ones seem to 'hide' better, while the white ones stick out more I think* I bought this version instead of the newer higher resolution version since the newer version seems to have a lot of really bad reviews. In hindsight, I think the video quality is good enough on this version so I'm happy with this oneThanks for reading.UPDATE (7/20/13): I switched to the LiveCams Pro paid iPhone app ($3.99 when I bought it) since it also works on the iPad. The previous app I was using (Surveillance Pro) was not iPad compatible. LiveCams Pro has some more features like it allows recording video and some other things that the previous app I was using did not support. I'm happy with LiveCams Pro and will be sticking with that for remote monitoring. LiveCams Pro is like two apps in one, it has a personal section for your own cams, and a public section where you can view public cams. I just use the personal cams part and that is working well.

Reviews.Title: Nice product, but hard to install on iPad and smartphones, and 2-way voice does NOT work!
Reviews.Author: Alejandro
Reviews.Content: The camera itself seems to be well made.  Once you get it installed and configured correctly, it works pretty well.  The video is very clear on my Windows 7 PC, MacBook Pro, iPad, my wife's iPhone 4S and my Galaxy Note 2.  The audio (one-way) is also very good.  You can remotely control the camera to pan left, right, up and down.  The night vision is not bad at all.There are three main concerns:(1) The manual and online website support will help you install it so that you can get it up and running on your desktop or laptop for inside your home network.  But, the installation for remote access (outside of your home wifi network) is very difficult!  The manual offers some guidance, but it's not easy if you are not computer savvy.In order to make it work outside of your home, you need to enable port forwarding.  Unless you are a computer geek, you will have to learn what this is, because there is no simple plug and click option.  I finally got it to work after a few hours, including calling Foscam's tech support.  To their credit, the support guy was helpful.(2) Even after you get the port forwarding set up correctly, it's not clear how you can use it on your iPhone/iPad/Android phones.  I have all three of them, but there is no mention in the manual which apps you need to download.  I was told by the Foscam tech rep that they don't have an official app, so he recommended certain 3rd party appps.  At any rate, I found the following apps that mostly works well: For Galaxy Note 2, there are"Foscam IPC" (which may or may not be an official Foscam app) and "IP Cam Viwer Lite" apps.  Both are free and work fine as long as you are just monitoring and listening in.  Don't bother paying for IP Cam Viewer Pro since it only adds 2-way voice (more on the 2-way voice problems below).  For iPad and iPhone, I have the "Foscam IP Cam Viewer" app, which is free and works well.  "IP Cam Viewer Lite" also has an iPad/iPhone app.  But all of them have issues with 2-way voice.Because all (or most) of these apps are 3rd party apps, Foscam does not provide support for them.  So, once you figure out how to set up the port forwarding, and you have also figured out which app to use, you now have to configure the apps correctly.  Again, there is no guidance by Foscam on this, so you'll have to figure it out yourself through trial and error.  For me, the easiest method was to set up the apps using the DDNS supplied by Foscam.  (I didn't know what DDNS was before this experience.)(3) The 2-way voice feature does NOT work well.  On the laptops (I have both a Windows and a MacBook Pro), as well as the IP Cam Viewer Pro and Foscam IP Cam Viewer apps (iPhone/iPad and Android apps), you have to toggle the 2-way voice on and off , otherwise, you'll get a lot of feedback.  The feedback noise is very loud and makes it very difficult to have a conversation at all.  In fact, the Foscam IPC app for Android crashes if you try to use the 2-way voice.  I think this is a known-problem, but Foscam has not been able to correct this in a satisfactory manner.  I now just use the one-way audio feature to listen in and avoid using the 2-way feature.Overall, this is a nice IP camera.  It works really well provided that you can get it set up on your mobile device and don't need the 2-way voice feature.  If you are computer savvy or are willing to invest a little time to learn the tech, this is not a bad product at all.

Reviews.Title: Good Camera but the Setup was a Hassle!
Reviews.Author: MRK
Reviews.Content: The installation guide was not clear so I ended up watching some Youtube videos and researching on google to find answers to my problems. My biggest problem was I could not get the camera remotely accessed because I had my AirAve (a wireless product to boost cell phone signal strength inside the house) installed before the wireless router and that caused a firewall issue accessing the camera on the web as I could not get port forwarding to work. Putting the AirAve after the router resolved the issue!The customer Service was good based on the email exchanges I had with them. Their user interface for controlling your camera is not very user friendly but you can learn about how to get things to work out by watching videos on Youtube.Two main flaws I noticed, and the customer service confirmed those as well:1) The way audio really does not work. There is too much echo. You need to use either your microphone or your speaker at a time but not both.2) Every time a motion or sound is detected the system beeps about 8 times ... there is no way to stop the beeping while it is beeping.Overall, the image quality is OK and I have managed to get the functionality I needed but for sure that was not easy. Be ready for a bumpy ride to get this camera set up if you buy this product.

Reviews.Title: Can't get it to work
Reviews.Author: flgirl
Reviews.Content: I set this up to use as a remote camera. It worked fine while I was in the same location as the camera, but did not work remotely. The instructions are not easy for the tech challenged and I am unwilling to allow a remote control of my computer by the company to see what I need to change. The company was unwilling to help me over the phone without remote control of my computer.

Reviews.Title: focam cam great but tech support even better
Reviews.Author: Robyn Hosking
Reviews.Content: very happy with this camera. best part was tech support helped with 1 call. if your look'ing for a n ipcam this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Nightmare to install.  Be aware of all the positive reviews
Reviews.Author: Gainesville, FL reviewer
Reviews.Content: We bought two of these to use as a nanny camera and installation was a nightmare.  Husband spent hours, couldn't figure it out. Called customer service. Had to wait 45 minutes inline to get anyone on the phone.  Then customer service agent spoke very poor english.  Fpreign nationality.  Kept insisting problem was on our end....on our wifi..... So....Really?  We bought a dropcam instead and it was installed with wifi in 5 minutes!!Do not buy this product!!  Get the dropcam. A little more but worth it!

Reviews.Title: Horrid customer service and not a great product
Reviews.Author: Julius Besser
Reviews.Content: We bought this to use as a baby monitor and at first we really liked it.  But then the camera would only work some of the time and the sound quality was always horrid and then the camera started showing a green line blocking most of the screen.  We contacted foscam as it was still under warranty and less than a year old.  First they instructed us to take apart the camera and try to fix it ourselves.  Fail.  Then they said send it back and they would look at it.  They did NOT pay for the shipping.  Once they fixed it they contacted us and told us to pay for return shipping as well!!  Their product was faulty and we had to pay shipping to replace it?!  That is not right! When we brought this up with them they told us they don't care about us and we  could either pay the shipping to get it back or they just wouldn't send it back.  The worst customer service ever.  BEWARE!!!!  Don't give these jerks your money!!

Reviews.Title: Great product for the patient user, but read the reviews!
Reviews.Author: J. Lo "(No, not that J. Lo)"
Reviews.Content: There are already many very detailed reviews, so let me just cut to the chase and try to address some myths/FAQs.Yes, this product is the real thing. It's not a fake. Buy it from Amazon and you'll be fine.No, it's not as easy or "plug and play" like a Fisher Price baby monitor. This remote-control camera has a built-in computer that is capable of motion detection and communicating with the world via its own web/email/FTP server! Now don't panic, you don't need to be a geek to figure it all out. You just need to read the instructions, or better yet, read any of the detailed reviews from fellow users that spell out exactly how to get it working. There are a few extra steps if you need to access the cam from outside your local network. Once you figure it out, you'll realize that the setup was not much worse than, say, adding an email account on a smartphone. (On the other hand, if you're the type who just turns your smartphone over to the help desk to do all the yucky technical setup stuff, then perhaps this cam isn't for you.)Yes, a small but vocal minority of people have claimed it doesn't work. I've read dozens of their reviews, and often you can actually see where they went wrong. For example, during the initial setup, they didn't read the directions and failed to plug the device into the router with the provided ethernet cable, and just tried to do it all wirelessly.Yes, the customer service is real. Seems like that small minority of people couldn't figure things out, and they were too cynical to believe anybody else could. So they claim that "all" the 5 star reviews (over 1000!) are faked by the company. If you take the time to read a lot of reviews (like I did),  you'll see plenty of Amazon-verified purchases like mine. Those complainers even scoffed when reviewers cited the real name of a helpful service rep. Well, those names are mentioned repeatedly in Amazon-verified purchaser reviews, so obviously they are real. Guess what, sounds like this is that rare company that actually employs really helpful people. Go figure!Yes, you can access the camera from multiple browsers/platforms, but *NO* they don't all work equally well. With IE on Windows, you have all the functionalities, but you're tied to a desktop computer. On Macs, Safari works so-so well with *no* audio and just lower video resolution (regardless of whether you choose high or low resolution).Yes, there is free dynamic DNS provided for 2 years via myfoscam.org. So for most people, there is no need to go set up a third party service, at least not right away. For some paranoid people who worry that evil hackers want to peek in on their babies/cats/whatever, RTFM to disable the service easily.Yes, the audio is very noisy. Two-way audio is even worse, as there is a 1-2 second lag, so it's a bit like international long distance calling from decades ago. To me this is not a deal breaker, as I turn on audio only now and then to get the gist of what's going on. If my kid is screaming, I am running up the stairs to take care of him in person, not trying to have a cogent 2-way conversation through the camera.No, the "official" smartphone app isn't even worth the free price. Yes, there are dozens of third party apps, just search for "Foscam" on your smartphone's app store. All the free apps get you the same decent video, but for audio you always have to pay a few bucks more. To me $5 or so is a very reasonable price for the amazing convenience of being able to monitor my home from my iPhone anywhere I go. (Seriously, when did we become so cheap?!? Before Amazon Prime, just the S&H; would have cost more than that.) Again, read the app reviews before you buy. I like CamViewer for IP Webcams and Foscam Surveillance Pro so far. Beware of similar-sounding app names. Foscam Pro used to be the old favorite with the most positive reviews, but it looks like they only released 2 versions in 2012 and nothing since, so the latest Foscam models and/or phones may not be compatible any more.I hope this helps others make up their minds. For me, this has been an amazing device. At $85 it has replaced our baby monitor that cost 3x as much. The video quality is way nicer. I can check in on my kid from the office or halfway across the world, right from my phone. We have 1 Foscam so far, and will likely be setting up several more around the house to watch not just the kid but also the cats, the finch nest on the front door, etc. :)

Reviews.Title: Poor Video and No support unless you buy direct
Reviews.Author: TommieT
Reviews.Content: Foscam will not support their cameras under warranty unless you buy directly from them. You can read this on their website. I needed service for a 8 month old Foscam ipcamera and when I asked for an RMA, I was told to talk to my re-seller. I cannot get in contact with the seller anymore and Foscan will not honor the warranty.BUYER BEWARE.....EMAIL FROM FOSCAMDear TomPlease contact the re-seller you purchased from. They will be able to issue the RMA.Best Regards,YusufFoscam Digital Technologies LLCRMA DepartmentDirect: (+1) 713 893 78691-800-930-0949returns@foscam.us[...]UPDATE 03/27/2013Again asked for warranty work... See Foscam's responseDear TomPlease contact the re-seller, they will take care of your RMA. If you are still having trouble please contact the manufacturer in China at aftersales@foscam,.comBest Regards,YusufFoscam Digital Technologies LLCRMA DepartmentDirect: (+1) 713 893 78691-800-930-0949BUY AT YOUR OWN RISK!!!!!! FOSCAM USA will not support their products.BBB Rated @ "C"

Reviews.Title: 2.5 hours of frustration, Sent it back
Reviews.Author: andyswan
Reviews.Content: Spent 2.5 hours trying to configure for wireless.  Impossible setup.  I have networked our entire home and never run across anything as impossible to setup as this.Seriously....I don't sent stuff back but this was just a horrible experience.I tried their instructions, Amazon review instructions, Google instructions...... it seems like either your network gets it or it doesn't.  Mine doesn't.Don't buy if you're on a Mac and Linksys router.  Look for simpler alternatives.

Reviews.Title: HORRIBLE audio. Horrible setup.
Reviews.Author: C. Hoyer "Cher Bear"
Reviews.Content: At first the price looked too good to be true. I found the price to be tripled of what I would actually pay for this cheap, plastic poorly built camera.After installing, which took awhile as you can read on the other, true reviews, I had a hard time finding a free app, for iphone, that would do 2 way audio, since that is one of the main features.I had to pay, which I did for my Kindle Fire and my iPhone, sadly.First off: installing is not "fast" by any stretch of the imagination. Nor was it easy.Second: The web gui to view this, on the iphone is horrible. VERY limited on functions (sound and scrolling)Thirdly: The video was chopping and jittery, at best and would just cut out and restart.I really could go on and on. but I've spent enough time on this piece of crap.Oh and I couldn't contact customer service. Go figure..

Reviews.Title: Works well with Android phones
Reviews.Author: Bubba
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up. Like a previous reviewer, I just used a browser to open the camera's config screens and did not use the install disk. This camera is used primarily to monitor a contruction site with an Android phone. Although Foscan does not have it's own Android app, there are plenty to choose from. I tried 2 free ones available on the Google Play store: tinycam and mobicam. Both apps streamed smooth, fast video and allowed basic controls like ptz, alarm on/off, etc.The features I like the most are IR nightvision, good pan/tilt range, compatibility with Android. The only feature I miss is ability to control an I/O port to remotely turn lights on. But for the price and features I have to give it 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Not sure why people have issues with the setup
Reviews.Author: Thomas Runds
Reviews.Content: Dear all, I saw all the BAD reviews of the camera (granted most of it is about service and support), but I cannot say a bad thing about the camera or the instructions how to set it up. I was initially thrown off by the comments but decided to buy two of these cameras. The arrived ASAP (thanks Amazon) and the setup was a breeze. I have a router a few switches and a multi private and guest wireless network. I am Microsoft based, but I have Apple and Android in the mix as well.The stup too me about 30 min for the first webcam (just because I read the manuall and watched the video, because I was expecting to go bad). The second webcam took me maybe, just maybe 10 minutes.I set the device name, the alarm, the mail delivery ... all, oh yes and multi camera view. I installed an app on my Android based HP touchpad.I will buy more of the cameras if the positive experiance continous. I just got them yesterday evening!

Reviews.Title: Terrific!
Reviews.Author: QualityFirst
Reviews.Content: This is a great product.  However, before you buy this thing, make sure that you have someone who has enough computer knowledge to tackle setting up port forwarding and to know what an IP is.  Most homeowners do not have static IP and will need an account on no-ip.com to track the dynamic ip addressing.  The Foscam website has very good step-by-step videos.  However, these videos are not updated to the latest version of your browser or wifi router.  So for a real amateur one can get thrown off track.Well, owning a Foscam forced me to really learn about port forwarding and dynamic ip addressing.  I am now savvier with computer network, and I have three great surveillance cameras that take pictures and sends them to my email account.  I can also use my iphone to "see".  I can track my cat, check what delivery has been made when, and even see how many cars have been passing in front of my house.There is one "con":  The camera sees more than what is displayed on the camera's field of view.  So unwanted movement beyond the field of view on the camera can also trigger a set of photos.I do not bother to use any video recording.  That seems to be way too much memory storage to deal with.

Reviews.Title: Works Great Outside!
Reviews.Author: Jay
Reviews.Content: When I was first researching to buy this camera I didn't see any mention of mounting it outdoors.  I tried mounting this camera inside a window but the glare was just too much and you could not see anything at night so I decided to try mounting it outside.  I read the faq's on foscams site and it mentioned you can mount it outside but under an overhang and preferably upside down (you can reverse the image in the settings to get the video to show right side up). I decided to give it a try and I have had this camera mounted outside under an overhang for a few months and it has been working great.The only problem with mounting it outside is the power plug will not reach and extending the power adapter will not work because DC voltage drops significantly even at just a few feet.  Initially I tried just extending the wire and the camera indicator lights would turn on but no video.  I tested the voltage and it was only 4 volts and the camera needs about 5 volts to run.  At that point you can either run really thick wire to combat DC voltage drop or you can run a higher voltage and regulate it at the camera. The solution for me was to get a voltage regulator and a 12 volt power adapter.Just in case anyone wants to try it here is a list of parts I used:From Amazon.comSeagate WA-18G12U AC power adapter -12V 1.5A ~120-240v USPremium 16/2 Awg 100 Feet CL2 Speaker Wire Cable - Oxygen Free CopperFrom another site (Do a search):DC Plug 3.5X1.35mm 90° Right Angle Cord / Cable Navigation / Mobile Power Jack Note: You can also just cut off the jack from the original adapterAX3022 Based Switching Regulator Adapter Step-Down40mm Black Heat Shrink Tube Sleeving RoHSI cut the power adapter wire and connected it to the speaker wire and then ran the speaker wire to where I wanted the camera.  Make sure to be aware of polarity(positive and negative wire) and I would recommend soldering your connections.  Next, I connected the speaker wire to the voltage regulator and dialed it down to 5.2 volts(this was the voltage that was coming out of the original foscam adapter).  Next I connected the 3.5X1.35mm DC plug to the voltage regulator output and plugged it into the camera. After checking everything worked, I heat shrink wrapped the regulator and taped it onto the camera. You must have some knowledge of electrical work to complete this project and I would not recommend it if you have not done this type of work before.It has been working perfectly for the last 3 months with no problems and hopefully this helps someone looking to do the same thing.UPDATE 5/2/2014 - Everything is still working great after almost 2 years.

Reviews.Title: Bad Power Supply :-(
Reviews.Author: Just Joe
Reviews.Content: DOA :(  Wouldn't do anything until I tried replacing the power supply.  Works fine with a 5V power supply I had on hand though.  I may change this review after contacting the manufacturer; if they'll replace the power supply without having me ship the whole unit back.I have one of their earlier cameras (FI8918W).  That power supply also died after about a year.

Reviews.Title: One works, the other does not
Reviews.Author: Cubbie Blue
Reviews.Content: I ordered two Foscam FI8910W IP cameras two months ago.  One of the cameras works fine, but the other one will only work when wired.  As soon as I pull the ethernet cable, the camera no longer works regardless of how close it is to the wireless router.02/06/2013 update: The problem camera no longer works at all.  Foscam's website acknowledges a 1-year warranty, but an RMA must be obtained from Amazon before a replacement is authorized.  Amazon's return policy for this item does not allow returns after 1 month, so a 1-year warranty means nothing.  Not happy with either company at this point.

Reviews.Title: After reading other had to write one...
Reviews.Author: electroguru
Reviews.Content: Ok so I have this model foscam and have been using it for about 2 months. I read all of these peoples complaints on here and these are my thoughts. First let me say for -100. dollars you cant go wrong with this camera. As far as people stating that foscam has no support, im sure they dont because they are nothing more than some chinese teenagers making really cheap cameras and selling them on the internet. Dont expect support. Also people complain they are to hard to set up. This is true if you have no knowledge of routers, ip addresses, or port forwarding.
