My only complaint is viewing the camera remotely with my MAC and getting the audio and mic to work.  It works great on our IOS devices, but does not function (audio and mic, video works fine on the MAC - to be clear) on the MAX OS X Mavericks (lots of internet chatter about this failure of the product on the Web).

Reviews.Title: Foscam 8910W PT IP camera. NO zoom
Reviews.Author: jayfmfl
Reviews.Content: received through my prime account on time. Got it out of the box and installed immediately.Just followed steps according to manual, very easy set up.Got confused when doing Foscam app on my smartphone, finally decided to call their tech support and bingo they guided me through. They went remotely into software and got all done.Their techs know what to do. Tech's name was " Geese ".Very satisfied. Can't go wrong for the price for a indoor IP camera like this one.I will purchase 2 more soon.

Reviews.Title: Not Bad
Reviews.Author: v
Reviews.Content: Good camera for the price. setup takes a little work but worth it and it will work when done properly.

Reviews.Title: Christmas gift
Reviews.Author: vicki dixon
Reviews.Content: This was a Christmas gift for my son and has come in handy already to watch the activities of his 2 greyhounds while he is at work. I think I need one now. Happy New Year!

Reviews.Title: Won't connect to wi-fi; freezes PC
Reviews.Author: Billadelphia
Reviews.Content: I would have rated this item 0 stars if possible.  Based on some other reviews there are obviously certain situations where this camera works, but not mine.  I bought 2 units and neither would connect to my Cisco/Linksys E4200 wireless router despite several tries.  While connected directly both units eventually froze a fairly new, high-end HP laptop requiring reboots each time.  I am very tech-savvy and this is my first failure to connect anything to just about any basic home set-up.  So I am returning both units and looking for a different brand.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Remote Wi-Fi Camera, Easy Set-up, and Cheap
Reviews.Author: Chuck Roberts
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic camera! It is cheap, easy to set up, very cool. Has Wireless N, built in DDNS, easy set up. Very cool. I should have bought this a while ago. I don't know why other people bash this camera in some reviews. My new one works great and is awesome. My father also has several to keep an eye on his dog when out of town for brief stays and it works great for him. I love mine and am very happy with it!

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Herbert
Reviews.Content: The only downside to this camera is that the audio is really lagged.  A purpose built baby monitor will do a better job at monitoring a baby but this is great if you want to monitor your house.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera, but tough to set up
Reviews.Author: Jay Man
Reviews.Content: Even with advanced IT knowledge this camera was not easy to setup, but it has been working fine and I have it mounted in our garage which is the main entrance into the house. The two way audio works great and I have it on wireless about 20 feet from a access point which is on the other side of the wall. I used a hotmail account for the motion alarm and it works pretty good! It takes several pictures when motion is detected and sends you a email. I am amazed by the night vision, works in pitch black. For the $64 Amazon price you can't go wrong!My only advice is if you are not familiar with networking, IP addresses and mail servers, I would highly recommend contacting someone with that knowledge to help you set it up.

Reviews.Title: Technical setup, but good instructions
Reviews.Author: Daniel O. Niemela
Reviews.Content: the instructions were easy to follow, but are rather technical. If you aren't comfortable messing around with your router settings, you'll need help to use this product

Reviews.Title: Great, but for a few more dollars get the HD version
Reviews.Author: Cameraperson
Reviews.Content: I love this one. It can be daunting to set up.  But dont worry, you can do it.I can now watch the cat, and my house, from anywhere in the world.

Reviews.Title: Great security camera!
Reviews.Author: baste boy "pinoy"
Reviews.Content: This camera is wonderful, I've been looking for a security camera for my home so I can look from my iphone anywhere I go for free and this fits my budget.  There are many security cameras out there but you have to pay a monthly fee to access your camera on the go, this one once set up it's amazing.pros-no monthly fee for access-pan tilt-clear image-wide coverage-can use wirelesslycons-must research for installation-must update firmware to work I would definitely recommend to any one.

Reviews.Title: it is very complicated installing this thing!
Reviews.Author: perfectionist
Reviews.Content: spent 5 hours to no avail trying to install itit keeps asking user name and password back to back, back to back non stop! so frustrating I had a big headache trying to install it, called the customer support twice but they could not help me fix it so I returned it!

Reviews.Title: Camera works great following Foscam tech support
Reviews.Author: Pete
Reviews.Content: I had some difficulty connecting the camera to my network and spoke with John at the Foscam tech support desk.  John was able to resolve my issues and I was up and running (Thanks John!).  The camera is now in position and running well.  The camera movement is easily controlled and the picture quality is beyond what I would have expected for the price.  I have yet to get the audio working using my Firefox browser, but feel I can tackle getting the add-in on my own.  Overall, I recommend this product as a good value.  One word of caution, it does require some computer skill to access a home modem/router to configure, but I assume all cameras would have this similar issue.

Reviews.Title: Great camera and delivery
Reviews.Author: raul
Reviews.Content: I selected the purchase and asked for a rapid delivery. It was great. The camera is working right now and the instal proces is very easy

Reviews.Title: Very good IP camera
Reviews.Author: Haibin Zhang
Reviews.Content: Just bought it one week ago. Works great and very easy to set up. Good image and a lot of fun. The only problem I had was setting up the Fort Forwarding. I am using the U-verse. Called AT-T and they do not provide free support. Called Foscam tech support and was connected after waited for about only 10 minutes. A very nice gentleman Mr.Marshall Erikson helped me solved the problem easily by using remote control. Give it 5 starts for both the camera and support. BTW, I set the Fort to 1010 and Marshall changed it to 8090. Not sure if that was my only problem.

Reviews.Title: Good Buy, Great Customer Support!!!!
Reviews.Author: Elizabeth
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera just to keep an eye on the house she we are away. In response to all of the reviews stating the set up difficulty, do not worry!!!! When you buy from a Foscam authorized dealer, you get free support. I called and the customer service rep Andrew was most helpful, remoted into my PC and within 1/2 hour I was connected, had wifi working and was able to view on my phone and tablet!!! The support offered was wonderful and I took full advantage of it.Camera picture quality is about what I expected, good not great. Very easy to pan and see an entire room. The buttons are very self explanatory for operating the camera on your pc or tablet. I am pleased with my purchase and if the only thing holding you back from buying is the fear of set up, don't worry....just call the tech support and they will do it for you!!!! I did attempt on my own but had some issues with one part that prevented me from seeing anything on my pc.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM TECHNICAL SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Mikhail Knis
Reviews.Content: This camera is a great addition to the home with two babies needing to be watched during sleep at night. Calvin, one of the Foscam technical support people, was excellent and helped easily set up my cameras. Good product.

Reviews.Title: Quality Camera; Good Price
Reviews.Author: dubkat "Mooptard"
Reviews.Content: This camera is great.  The price was very reasonable for the features this has.  The only issues I've had with it are the audio feature.  I haven't been able to get it to work with my Mac.  The program keeps telling me I'm missing a plug-in which I've downloaded several times with no luck.  It's probably just a setting issue that I need to research further but I wouldn't say that part is plug n play.  I do love that I can check on my house from my phone.  It does work with IOS and Android.  Overall I'm very happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Great For The Price
Reviews.Author: Luis O. Dasta "lando786"
Reviews.Content: Awesome little cameras here. You can set them up to send pictures of what's going on to your email or an FTP server. Since they have motion detection, you will only receive them when something moves on screen.I'd like to comment on an annoying little problem with this feature though. The motion detection is very, very sensitive. Even moving light across the screen, like when a cloud passes by, triggers the motion detection, so if you have it set up for email, you will be swamped with these emails in no time.I set it up to send pics to an ftp folder on a Raspberry pi, there are methods to record video/audio using one but I haven't had time to fiddle with that yet.There are Android apps and I'm assuming iOS apps as well, which you can use to see and move the cameras remotely. They have support for dynamic dns services like no-ip, so make sure to read a little about that and basic networking before diving head first into setting up these cameras for remote access.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Camera system
Reviews.Author: Adam Perry
Reviews.Content: I've owned my two Foscam cameras for over a year now. I absolutely love them. They are the most affordable cameras with pan/tilt technology you will find. My best advice if you're trying to set one up is simply call the toll free 24/7 help line and they will walk you through each step of the process. It took 5 minutes to do and I've not had any problems since. I can check the house at work or on vacation...any time day or night and I don't have to pay a monthly monitoring service. And the sound and motion sensors just add to the product value. I highly recommend this camera system!

Reviews.Title: Good price
Reviews.Author: Ben Liri
Reviews.Content: Bought 1 then bought another 2 and thinking of buying 2 more. Yeah, for that price one can not go wrong. The set-up, LAN and WAN, is very easy. It's hard to make a mistake and I'm not a techie guy. The email alarm service I think is the best feature of this camera. Very good camera for 70$...

Reviews.Title: Love it.. works great
Reviews.Author: Jayakumar R. Nair
Reviews.Content: I used this to provide surveillance of my house.  Works great, streams flawlessly to my windows phone, android phone and to every device in my house.  I can also talk to my wife when I am away through the inbuilt speaker and hear her voice as well.  It is great.

Reviews.Title: Great product for the price
Reviews.Author: Wade G.
Reviews.Content: setup is a bit tricky if you're not IT savey and have never interfaced with your router or a DDNS before. But YouTube videos walk you through everything you need to know. Setup took me about 30 minutes and it works great. Take some time and adjust the sensitivity of the motion sensor alarm or you will get about 100 emails an hour if you don't schedule your away time on the device management page. Overall very satisfied. Will be purchasing another for my apartment out of state.

Reviews.Title: FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Michael Chen
Reviews.Content: Features on this camera work great. Excellent support services to get camera working. Would refer this camera for security supposes or whenever you need to view something remotely.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Home Security Camera
Reviews.Author: rewday "rewday"
Reviews.Content: This is a phenomenal camera for the price. I was expecting far less quality and more difficulty in set up. I was very pleased to find that the quality of this camera is great and it was a breeze to set up. I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for a reliable home security camera.

Reviews.Title: works perfectly
Reviews.Author: A. Casavant
Reviews.Content: A++ genuine foscam product and works as expected -- update your firmware if you buy this cam because the one that comes on it has a few security holes

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera, great customer support!
Reviews.Author: David S.
Reviews.Content: Purchased 3 of these along with Blue Iris to monitor my home.  While I was not able to personally set everything up for wireless use, I called Foscam up and an employee named Judy Rose was able to set everything up.This is a *real* review and not something purported by Foscam, I can assure you.  I am able to check these cameras on my phone whenever I'd like (via 3G), very happy with the purchase

Reviews.Title: Good camera but difficult to setup.
Reviews.Author: Jenny Gomillion
Reviews.Content: I really like the camera and the ability to keep an eye on my housekeeper. It was difficult for me to setup but after about an hour on the phone with technical support they were able to get everything working correctly. Good product overall for a great price.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Blake B
Reviews.Content: Product works great and wish I had bought more. and I will do so in the future. If any issues there are videos on youtube. BUY

Reviews.Title: This is good, but ....
Reviews.Author: pgddog "pgddog"
Reviews.Content: I bought a Levana recently and compared to that, this camera has limited functionalityCons:The audio quality is poor to non-existentBright LEDsPros:Less expensive than LevanaCan be used as security camera and accessed from anywhere via the internet (Levana is limited to their monitor)

Reviews.Title: Price & Product excellent value
Reviews.Author: The Torpid Echidnas "TTE"
Reviews.Content: Works well as an IP camera or baby monitor.  Some of the reviews talked about this camera being complicated in setup, but it's really just that IP video/audio is complicated in general, not that this specific camera is complicated.  The camera software provides all of the necessary services.  Highly recommend if you want an IP camera that you need to access via WiFi or a 3G connection. There are free IP camera apps for cell phones, but the best one is the Foscam app. We shopped at other major chains, and found similar capability in the $150-250.  So, overall, a good purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good range on audio recording, good video quality!
Reviews.Author: Ana M. Pino
Reviews.Content: Good range on audio recording, good video quality, easy to set up and operate.I will recommend this to a friend.

Reviews.Title: Awesome IP camera
Reviews.Author: Cyclone Drew
Reviews.Content: This is a really slick little camera for the price and easy to work with. In under 30 minutes I had it connected to my wireless network, a static IP assigned, and was controlling it from my Android phone. The night vision is pretty amazing, much better than I expected. My ISP (Mediacom) assigns routable public IP's so I was able to setup port forwarding on my router and connect to the camera remotely. The built-in web UI is ok but there are some good free apps out there that offer better interfaces. My favorite is called IP Cam Remote, it's easy to setup and allows you to view and control multiple cameras. We'll using this to check on our baby as well as a little home security while were gone.

Reviews.Title: Perfect Nursery Cam!
Reviews.Author: Daniel P Miller
Reviews.Content: Using this as a nursery cam.  Easy to set up.  The image quality is great.  It has two way audio which is great!  The grandparents and aunts and uncles are excited about being able to check in.

Reviews.Title: able to view on Firefox and viewing away from home on mobile device
Reviews.Author: sammi
Reviews.Content: took me 2 days to figure out and set up and config my first camera. if you dont have any experience with tech its going to be difficult without help.follow the instructions from the amazon reviewer on the front page from there its easyprimarily using the cameras to prevent theft.for those who wish to view their cameras away from home once you Port Forward (have my set on port 80) ur camera for your routergo to [...]and type that ip address into your browser and it will take you to the Foscam login page to ur camera hope this helps

Reviews.Title: Camera Software worthless
Reviews.Author: John C DiBello
Reviews.Content: Foscam tech support spent over an hour trying to connect my PC with the F18910W camera without any success. Even after they performed firmware upgrades the camera was still un-accessible. They eventually gave up and recommended I return the camera for a refund.  I have spent hours trying to make their inadequate software work under windows and wasted a significant amount of time. If  you do not have strong technical network and IE skills look for another product.  This product is very difficult to setup and require many changes to network and browsers.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for the money
Reviews.Author: JoCo
Reviews.Content: This camera was exactly as advertised.  Very good camera for the money.  It took a little assistance from their tech support group--which was great--but it's been working fine for several months.  Great way to check on your premises while your away--in this country or some other one.

Reviews.Title: Works beautifully - see instructions in other reviews
Reviews.Author: Shanee Osher
Reviews.Content: Using the step by step instructions posted by previous reviewers, with a little trial and error on port forwarding, I set this up in about 2 hours (only slightly techy). So far, we're using it to watch our sweet, adopted pup acclimate to the home when we're at work...eventually we'll move it to the new nursery and try it out as a baby monitor.I've had no fewer than 4 colleagues see my pup up on screen or on my phone and inquire about this camera - its benefits sell itself!

Reviews.Title: Foscam F18910w IP Camera
Reviews.Author: Milpitas Man
Reviews.Content: It is cheap but works fine.  I rather choose the white color to camouflage into the wall color.  I probably will buy at least one more of this.

Reviews.Title: Fun toy difficult to connect
Reviews.Author: R. Wolfe "book maven"
Reviews.Content: The installation process defeated the usefulness of the camera. I was forced to spend $75.00 for an IT person to get it working. Buyers need to understand this before purchasing the camera. Foscam recognizes the problem. They market a camera with simpler set-up for $129.00.

Reviews.Title: We have eight of these.
Reviews.Author: J. Tew "Dog Lover"
Reviews.Content: For the price you cannot beat the quality!  After you set up the first one, to include port forwarding it gets easy.  My vet bought one on my recommendation to watch some cats who were peeing inappropriately.  She needed help from Foscam for the setup and got it.

Reviews.Title: Nice Unit
Reviews.Author: Campboss
Reviews.Content: I haven't been able to get the thing working with my Frontier Internet service, but it works very well on LAN which was my primary reason for buying it.  As for monitoring via the Internet, Frontier Communications customer service has no knowledge of how to get this thing working over the Internet and I've tried everything in the Foscam manual.  I have a static IP account and still can't get it to work.  If you have Frontier Communications for a provider, plan on using an online service for monitoring via the Internet.

Reviews.Title: Perfect for spying on your family pets!!!
Reviews.Author: Marcy C.
Reviews.Content: We recently discovered one of our two cats were peeing in our house. We used this nanny can to catch the culprit! It was a success.

Reviews.Title: Great Cam!!
Reviews.Author: S Reese
Reviews.Content: The picture quality is excellent!! I absolutely love this thing!!  I have a video camera associated with my Alarm.com system that has poor video quality in low light.(and its a $200 camera!!)  The Infra red lights a dark room to where it is almost NVG(Night vision goggle) quality!!  (for you non-military/law enforcement types..LOL)  My only complaint is that getting this thing set up to view over the internet is difficult.  For some reason port forwarding is tough to set up for these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup!!!
Reviews.Author: RedNeckTech
Reviews.Content: Had this Camera set up and on the internet so I could access it in about 30min.  They have all the router setup help guides on the web site.

Reviews.Title: perfect dog cam
Reviews.Author: craig  smith
Reviews.Content: easy setupgreat pictureuser with surveillance pro app on iphonegreat valueTech support is always available and human on the phone

Reviews.Title: Great buy!!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "cceasar"
Reviews.Content: Was easy to set up.  Just had to work with my ISP to get things rolling.  Overall...Awesome!!  Not a bad price either.CCC

Reviews.Title: great camera
Reviews.Author: urbanremodeldiva
Reviews.Content: The security company gives a camera with the package that is total crap so i bought this one and while it required tech support to set up because I use a Mac, it was worth it .. it gives a crystal clear picture day and night with excellent sound and you can control directionality with ease  Love it!!!

Reviews.Title: Don't get frustrated - call customer service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "jjfenton"
Reviews.Content: This camera gave me everything I was looking for at a very reasonable rate. Like the other reviewers, I agree that the set up was challenging. I am not sure how to make it easier without a lot of documentation on Foscam's part. Maybe a wiki? I read that the customer service was good so after about an hour of me trying to redirect a dynamic ip to a static one and after many web searches, I gave Foscam's customer service a call. They remoted into my system and had me all set in a matter of a few minutes. Now that I have the camera set up, I am very happy! Great price and a great value.

Reviews.Title: Great bang for your buck!
Reviews.Author: Powanian Cleebolt
Reviews.Content: this camera is an awesome deal for the money! If you have any problems with setup go to the manufacturer website and watch the how to videos. They are very detailed and helpful! Without the videos I would have been lost. Lots of people complaining about the setup but if they watch the videos they'll see how easy it is. The videos are set up for Google accounts so if you use Google and Gmail it is even easier.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Baby Video Monitor
Reviews.Author: Megan P. White
Reviews.Content: We use this as a baby video monitor, along with some software on our iPhones, and it works wonderfully! Easy to see day or night, and there's even audio! Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: work well but quality easy just ok
Reviews.Author: Aragorn
Reviews.Content: The product is easy to connect to internet and work well but the quality of the picture is just not good enough. If some body moves fast you will not be able to recognize him

Reviews.Title: Great first IP camera!
Reviews.Author: Galen
Reviews.Content: Purchased this as a baby camera.  Sadly did not get to use it for this but in testing I feel like it would have worked perfectly.  We will repurpose this as a security camera and expect equally good results.I knew nothing about IP cameras before going into this but felt fairly confident due to reading the reviews and tips posted by you guys.Don't get discouraged and give it a break if you get overwhelmed as I did.  A lot of networking things that I have never done or realized was possible.  I will definitely be using some of the things I learned in future home networking and office projects.Camera quality is good, speaker is ehhh, microphone is good.  I ended up using "ucampro" for iPhone and I would recommend it for remote viewing.Have fun setting it up and learning!

Reviews.Title: Could be great, hardware issues
Reviews.Author: Marsha H.
Reviews.Content: I was amazed by this camera, bought three and they all worked great at our school (love Blue Iris even more). Except now a BIG issue. After a power outage, not a surge, two of the three have failed. They just constantly reboot no matter what is done to them (resets, power outlet changes, etc). This can be seen on Foscam forums all over, I just hope return can go well (they are less than 3 months old).

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and...
Reviews.Author: Average Guy
Reviews.Content: Really great camera for your home or anywhere!  This product is awesome and really happy about this purchase.  Thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: No good for me.
Reviews.Author: Larry Hankey
Reviews.Content: I thought I would be able to use it to connect wireless and see over the intenet but procedures are to complicated,  so all I can do is connect it to my  modem with a cable and use it wifi  to my laptop.  Not much help that way.  It has an antenna and I should be able to place it almost anywhere but I can't.  Got use a cable.

Reviews.Title: Not what it looks like
Reviews.Author: Stroke Patient
Reviews.Content: The details of this product need major improvement. If you want to be able to talk/listen from a non-admin account through a web browser, you can't. The apps for this camera are very poorly designed. Foscam doesn't have a polished app they designed themselves. They recommend one that costs 6 bucks. Apps do not offer all the features this camera has, so there's really no point in having them if you can't use them. Also, difficult to install. Takes forever, and instructions are unclear. I will either go without an IP camera or wait until the dropcam becomes more affordable.

Reviews.Title: Absolutely a fantastic camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Javaman
Reviews.Content: Absolutely a fantastic camera for the price.  This camera is great in total darkness. Using it to monitor my elderly parents.

Reviews.Title: It works good, much better than I expected. Good price too.
Reviews.Author: Bernard Chang
Reviews.Content: Took a couple of hours to set it up. Most of the time was spent on reading and understanding the concept of these network IP address, going to the router, setting up the port forwarding ...etc. It works pretty good when view from computers on the same local network. Also able to get it on the go by viewing from my iPhone. However, I think it is due to the bandwidth, the image through the web is much slower. Bottom line, a good product.

Reviews.Title: Night Vision quality was better than expected.  Recording the video is rather fun.
Reviews.Author: jake
Reviews.Content: This camera is so much fun.  We have recorded several funny videos from our child being restless before bed.  We even have a video of how the escape from the crib was accomplished.  Installation was easy and I customized the port numbers etc just so I felt like I was more secure than everyone else.  I was impressed with the night vision quality.  There is a brief lag in the video which might be caused by how far the device is from my router.  I would like to try it over Ethernet but that is not feasible at the moment.  I use this with the Foscam Pro app from the iTunes store which works with both iPad's and iPhones for $5.99 [...]

Reviews.Title: This camera is awesome!
Reviews.Author: S. Formoso
Reviews.Content: This camera is awesome!  Using the included manual, setup was pretty easy and very well detailed.  I bought the camera to keep an eye on the cats while we are out of the house or on vacation.  When we're on vacation I miss not seeing them for weeks at a time.After connecting the camera to our wireless network, I used the included mounting bracket to mount the camera by where the cats eat and hang out most of the day.  All of our TVs are wireless and connected to the wireless network and we are able to watch the camera's video  from any TV in the house using any web browser.  The pan and tilt feature works seamlessly and the infrared night vision works great as well.It worked flawlessly while we were in France last month.  I was able to see perfectly fine streaming video on my TMobile Samsung Galaxy S4 using the Foscam app while we were traveling all over France.  It sure helps that TMobile has free international 3G data!  Even while on the TGV from Paris to Rennes at 200MPH I could see the kitties on my smartphone.  That, in itself, says a lot for the Foscam app and this camera!The camera also e-mailed still images of movement, such as when the pet sitter would come over or the cats playing in view of the camera.  The two way audio feature is a great addition and works very well; although I could do without it.  The image quality is not high definition but hey, this is a $70 camera and for that price you most certainly are getting quite a bargain.

Reviews.Title: USELESS
Reviews.Author: Thomas Scimone
Reviews.Content: Complicated to set up. If your not computer/IT savy... skip it! I have spent days trying to figure it out and I surely cant acess the video feed remotely... especially using my smart phone. The only place I can use this camera is in my own home sitting in the same room watching myself. The help/tutorial is useless. Save your money and just get a DOBERMAN PINCHER!

Reviews.Title: good camera
Reviews.Author: Andrea Craig
Reviews.Content: Irish great service....logged into my computer and installed the application for me without any hassles.pictures quality is great so far.  camera is being used for security purposes

Reviews.Title: Look, Ma, No Wires!
Reviews.Author: Hondo
Reviews.Content: This cam is awesome for the price. Crisp and clear and well-made. I got about half-way through the set-up and got stuck. I called Foscam support and got Kate. She was great and remotely took control of my computer and completed the setup, explaining what she was doing along the way. Looking forward to really dialing the remote system in so I can leave my home and feel safe while monitoring it.

Reviews.Title: Almost five starts but not quite
Reviews.Author: Dorrie B
Reviews.Content: Overall this is a great camera and we use it in the baby's nursery. Definitely need to download the app to make it worth it, plus then it's easier to move the camera on a touch screen device from remote location. Would give five stars, except we seem to have to reboot the camera once every other week.

Reviews.Title: Happy with my Foscam
Reviews.Author: GandalfWhite
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for indoor usage, and couldn't be happier with its performance. Installation was a breeze, and I was able to connect to it using a browser and the android app.

Reviews.Title: Fairly solid home security cam
Reviews.Author: Calcomaxer
Reviews.Content: Pros:1. Does everything promised! Great addition to my home security setup. Easy to setup, HD quality recordings2. Sound detection is useful where motion may fail3. 2-way audio is usefulCons:1. Motion detection is pretty weak. I have my lights on a timer and it goes off when lights switch (which is anticipated, I guess)But playing around with the sensitivity settings doesn't do much here.2. Would be great to get a video clip around detections rather than just pictures3. Better iOS app needed

Reviews.Title: So far So Good!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: So far so good!! As expected! For the price, it is great. Does not zoom, but that is OK. Was thinking it did.

Reviews.Title: impressive
Reviews.Author: Paul P.
Reviews.Content: Amazing for the price. Quality is way above X10 stuff that a friend has. The setup is easy and the video ig quite good. The infared is amazing in total darkness.

Reviews.Title: Great home camera
Reviews.Author: MCW
Reviews.Content: This is a nice camera to have in the home to take a look when you are not home.  I can access it via my PC or my smart phone.  I love the ability to move the camera around though there is no zoom.  Plus it has excellent night vision.  It was a little hassle to set up the connection with my computer but afterwards it was easy to use.

Reviews.Title: Run your camera through its pases before exchange deadline.
Reviews.Author: Keven "Rama"
Reviews.Content: Camera seemed to work well at first. But after I bought the Blue Iris software and started using some of it's features, in this case... panning and tilting. I found that every time the camera would pan left it would shut down and reset. Something is wrong inside it. Sadly I found this out too late for an exchange. so it is an expensive "stationary" version.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Works well.  It's easy to set up and you can view from anywhere.  Love the ability to control the camera remotely.

Reviews.Title: For use for home and office are fantastic
Reviews.Author: Jorge Castillo Marin
Reviews.Content: They work very well, they are very easy to install and to manipulate, have a good image. For use for home and office are fantastic

Reviews.Title: Very Good at Times, Came with CD cracked, Audio not working yet at all
Reviews.Author: H. Carlin "howardc in va"
Reviews.Content: I have mixed feelings about this product, which I just received today.  First of all, the install CD came cracked, so I had to call the Help Desk....the very patient helper took over an hour to set things up.  The video alternates from black and white to color depending on backlight conditions, apparently.  The live streaming on my computer is pretty good, on my phone it ranges from decent to very lagging.  I bought this because one of the features promoted is 2 way audio...but to get this on my phone, you have to upgrade the app!  Not a lot of money ($3.99) but misleading, IMO.  The audio can ONLY be set up on the computer using IE...apparently, they have never heard of Firefox or Chrome...I don't use IE, so had to download it.  The audio, however, is  not working either on my computer or my phone, even after upgrading the app.  If they fix this promptly I might upgrade the star rating, but right now it's intermittently good, at best, and no audio.  Oh...the Help Desk person says "lots of people complain about cracked CDs!"...I guess the "listening mode" is not working for FOSCAM management either.

Reviews.Title: Baby monitor - Foscam and Dropcam comparison
Reviews.Author: KW Cho
Reviews.Content: Foscam and Dropcam are both great cameras but have different uses.Foscam's resolution and frame rate isn't as high or quick as Dropcam but Foscam pan & tilts, which Dropcam cannot do! So if you're looking for a baby monitor and you place your baby in different areas of the room AND occasionally need to use it as a security cam then Foscam is the winner. This tilt and pan comes really handy because if you hear your baby crying but can't find your spouse or nanny then you can move the camera around to see where the they are.But if your camera is stationary and need a 1-minute setup then you can't go wrong with Dropcam. Dropcam is super easy to setup and use but the fact that I can't tilt and pan is a bit frustrating at times.So for baby monitor, hats off to Foscam :)

Reviews.Title: Not impressed
Reviews.Author: CARISSA
Reviews.Content: Well, this product is a cool idea but falls short on many things. The wifi sucks on this product and I thought it would be easier to set up, but it wasn't. You think this item would be cheaper.

Reviews.Title: The best among all
Reviews.Author: tsan "San"
Reviews.Content: Love it.. Foscam customer care is awesome.. they do all the setup for you.. . . .  using is super easy

Reviews.Title: Quite apprehensive
Reviews.Author: Charles C. Serrie
Reviews.Content: Initially the setup appeared to be a bear, but once I contacted tech support (1 hr 20 minute wait) the setup went quite fast. Using it now for 2 months and works as advertised. Would recommend getting a router that has remote access as this helped with the setup. I don't use the recording or motion functions so cannot comment on them.

Reviews.Title: I intend to buy more of them.
Reviews.Author: chuck in st paul "wizardjr2"
Reviews.Content: It's a great camera with nice features like sound and the ability to swivel up/down and left/right. The motion sensor alarm/email is one reason I chose this model as a home security device.My only quibble and why four stars instead of five is that there appears no way to rotate the picture 90 degrees so you can mount it on a vertical wall jutting out as it were rather than upright. The bracket supplied is a nice design that'll get you upright and facing where you like with that exception. There's a focus ring on the lens that works nicely too.The ethernet connection and setup worked smoothly as did the WiFi setup. It's a very simple device to hook into your system.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera, great price
Reviews.Author: Andrew
Reviews.Content: I had it up and running in 15 minutes.  The instructions were very good, it walked me through setting up port forwarding and I was remote viewing with no problems.  The included DDNS is very helpful.  I did not have to go create an account.Night viewing is very clear.I would another one.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service after the sale was STELLAR
Reviews.Author: J. Hutchinson "Hutchidwa"
Reviews.Content: The product is stellar.  I am very good at techno stuff, but also know when i don't know.  Had some trouble getting the camera to view on my I phone than lost everything on my MacBook.  Called Tech Service at Foscam.  Waited only a few minutes for tech support, but a tech named Parker was no less than stellar.  He remotely accessed my computer and basically squared me away.  Even if the camera was junk, and surely it is not, the customer service means more to me.  Again, he was patient and clear with direction.  Could slow down a bit in talking with the accent though.  Simply stated...Parker, you rock!As far as the app, bought the foscam pro for $4.99 and well worth it.  Camera is crystal clear and all remote functions work with the pan and tilt.  This app will allow me to add other cameras in the future.A happy camper

Reviews.Title: Foscam tech support was great! Camera is really good!
Reviews.Author: Peter
Reviews.Content: OK. This IPCam can be a little frustrating initially, but once set up it is absolutely worth it. I read a lot of articles on Foscam's website, watched their videos, etc. but still had trouble accessing the camera away from home. I have a 3wire DSL router, an Airport Extreme, and the camera is installed by my front door and connected wirelessly. I finally decided to call Foscam, they remotely connected to my computer and fixed everything, and now it works great from anywhere in the world. Right now, I am accessing it remotely from several iPhone apps: Surveilance, uFoscam, and CamViewer. It works great in all three though I prefer Surveilance. You can tilt and pan the camera remotely on your iPhone (or even through web browser). I got a free IP address through No-ip.com. It works great outside mounted in overhand (NOT directly in rain/snow).So, some of you may be wondering: why bother with all this technical setup and trouble when you could just buy a different camera, like a D-Link? First of all, the D-links I saw at the same price lacked features (didn't have good night vision and/or didn't pan/tilt). Second, and most importantly, this camera doesn't rely upon a 3rd party website (e.g. Dlink's own site) to view your camera remotely. You directly access your camera! If you are concerned with privacy and security and no middle-man, then I really think this is the way to go. As long as you have a wired/wireless connection at home, you will always have access to your camera.So far, I've had it 1 week and it emails me when someone drops a package at my door. Then, I can SMS my neighbor and ask them to pick it up for me. I can pan the camera and see the front yard and check things out as well. Night vision works great as well. I'm absolutely going to buy a few more of these and mount them around my house. REALLY happy with this purchase!

Reviews.Title: Quick and Easy basic setup, would like encryption
Reviews.Author: A.J.
Reviews.Content: I got this setup in less than 30 minutes and then spent 30 minutes playing with it and put it straight to use to monitor my dog while I'm at work.Picture quality is very good.  The night vision is very good.  This is indoor use within 10 feet that I'm basing this opinion.I have not tried any of the advanced features yet, like motion detection with SMS alerts, or FTP upload or other recording/streaming options.  But I plan to.To set this up for remote viewing you need to be able to open a port in your router, which is very simple but may be intimidating for non-technical folks.  Rather than relying on the included manual/software, go to Foscam's website which has videos and individualized instructions for different routers.Setting up Dynamic DNS was easy if you already have an account with one of the well known service providers like No-IP.  The camera automatically uses your No-IP credentials to keep your IP address up to date.  No need to run a separate Dynamic DNS client on your computer.My only complaint is that I would prefer that the output stream could be encrypted.  Though I suspect there is a way to accomplish this with third party tools.

Reviews.Title: Didn't work out of the box. sending it back
Reviews.Author: Julie Margolis "paso finos rule"
Reviews.Content: Plugged it in and it did not pan and tilt as it was supposed to do. Very disappointed  Called customer service which I waited 20 min on hold to tell me it's not working and to return it..must be a hardware issue.

Reviews.Title: Overall A+ But a Few Minor Annoyances
Reviews.Author: geargadget
Reviews.Content: I gave this four not five stars because I've been having issues with light changes kicking off the motion alarm. No matter what I do to adjust the sensitivity I get false alarm emails all day every day because of the constant changing of brightness where the camera is.Another thing I thought was interesting is that when we set up the schedule we did it before daylight savings time. When daylight savings time hit and it was time to roll the clocks forward I've noticed that the schedule didn't adjust with it. Nothing horrible but I'll have to manually adjust.Setting up the camera was easy but I'm also in IT so I'm very familiar with setting up gadgets. For someone that isn't they may have a difficult time since the directions aren't exactly straight forward. I also don't have a CD drive in my laptop so I had to do some googling to find the IP Camera Tool/Finder. But it worked out in the end!All in all we have been using this for about 2-3 months now and it's working great. We've tested the speaking through the camera and listening to noise on the cameras side. Everything works pretty flawlessly. I use a baby monitor app to just check in on the house if I get an email alert.

Reviews.Title: Solid Basic Item
Reviews.Author: Paul G Powers
Reviews.Content: Installation instructions were a bit vague and I need a plug-in for audio.On-line instructions were very beneficial for supplemental info.

Reviews.Title: Beware of Software issues !
Reviews.Author: Sonal U.
Reviews.Content: Brand new device out-of-the-box. Device does not let me change admin password. Every time I attempt to change the admin password, it refuses to let me into the web interface. ( it is refusing connections , I am a Network Engineer and I know this ) . Tried with a non standard http port and it fails as well. This device is pretty much useless if the admin password cannot be changed. Check the Foscam forums and you will see tons of related issues. Oh , and the 24x7 support line if pretty useless as you are put on endless hold and dont actually get a person .Going to return this right away , pay a few extra bucks and go for a more renowned brand instead !

Reviews.Title: Foscam= BEST network camera on the market & inexpensive  (Netcam= WORST network camera & too EX$PEN$IVE)
Reviews.Author: Carolyn
Reviews.Content: Before I bought the Foscam (which I am very happy with), I bought the Belkin Netcam and was thoroughly disappointed.  The Netcam only worked about 10-20% of the time but the other 80-90% of the time it would send error messages and would not connect to the camera from my iPhone nor a computer.  Not only that, but the Netcam was more than double the price of the Foscam and offered less features.  For example: The Natcam is stationary, so whatever position you put it in is the position it stays in... but the Foscam is adjustable by remote control from your smart phone or from any computer, meaning that you can make the camera look right/left or up/down, remotely.I also did a lot of research on various network cameras like the Foscam and read several blogs about which cameras are the best and which are the worst.  Everyone seems to agree that the Netcam is the worst camera you can buy and has lots of glitches.  However, I read great reviews about the Foscam and after owning it myself, I agree... Foscam is the way to go!  :)

Reviews.Title: Very usuful and easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Carlos Henrique Serpa da Rocha
Reviews.Content: Very usuful and easy to install. You can have a complete control of the camera through your computer or smartPhone.

Reviews.Title: Great and affordable
Reviews.Author: Allen Brown
Reviews.Content: Works as intended. This is my 3rd camera from this company. I highly suggest these cameras over buying the $200+ baby monitoring systems seen in stores. My only suggestion, mount the camera if it's going to be anywhere near the baby crib. The first camera (FI8918W) I bought two years was casually placed on the corner of the crib to watch my baby. Over the last two years my baby has knocked the camera down numerous times. It still functions, but the speaker and video don't work anywhere near as good as it did new (picture is fuzzy/grainy and you can't hear the speaker unless you stick it in your ear). I relegated the slightly dysfunctional camera to the dog room and bought two new cameras (one for current baby and one for baby on the way). New camera is mounted to the wall above the crib and does a perfect job while being safely out of reach from baby.

Reviews.Title: Wireless issues
Reviews.Author: Max Sterling
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up but the wireless connection kept dropping out.  Even at less than 5 feet away.  I couldn't use this.  I thought maybe it was the unit but I got a replacement with the same result.  I thought it was my router, I tried another one with the same result.  I'm staying away from Foscams.

Reviews.Title: Indoor security camera
Reviews.Author: drez
Reviews.Content: I love this indoor camera.  You can zoom in/out, talk to anyone through this camera.  I would highly recommend this to anyone looking for indoor security at a reasonable price and a great product.

Reviews.Title: If you think you can unbox and use right away, good luck.
Reviews.Author: Original Texan "originaltexan.com"
Reviews.Content: Very difficult to make it work properly. I had to return it to Foscam and pay for the postage.  Now that I have it installed, it tends to rotate on its own and simply get stuck pointed at the ceiling.  If you are a techie, and have lots of time to research and mess around, this is for you. If you want to plug it in and use, good luck!

Reviews.Title: Easy to use
Reviews.Author: MH34
Reviews.Content: Using because the neighbor kids broke in the house. Works perfect. My son has these also and uses them for baby monitor. He and wife love it too!

Reviews.Title: Excellent product for the price
Reviews.Author: Nathan Green
Reviews.Content: First product came with a power cod that would not stay in the unit. Amazon replaced quickly and the 2nd unit works perfectly. Works well with a free ip wireless android software as well. The product also came with a free DNS server which I was not aware which made set up a breeze.

Reviews.Title: Great indoor camera
Reviews.Author: Everett Robinson
Reviews.Content: So far, this camera does what it's advertized to do. It comes with it's own http service: you point your browser to the right IP address on your wireless network, type in the username and password and it streams video to you. It's about as simple as it gets, but one does need a little skill to get it going. I'd give it another star if it was outdoor-safe.

Reviews.Title: Good camera - bad software/documentation
Reviews.Author: R. B. Duncan
Reviews.Content: Pros:  Camera looks nice and is well built.  Night vision works fine.  PT works fine.  Camera works good once you get it working.Cons: Both disk-provided software and built-in software sucks.  Setup is a headache.  Documentation is lame. No Zoom (I knew this when I ordered, but it is still a con).

Reviews.Title: Tricky to set wifi
Reviews.Author: Lennart Thålin
Reviews.Content: This is actually the first time a write a review of a product I bought from Amazon. First I had real problems to get the wifi working. I have a Pace 5031NV from AT&T; router. I contacted help desk in China and they replied quite fast. After trying everything, the wifi still did not work. I tried a final thing to reset the camera - and start the set up from beginning . and voila - the camera connected to wifi, but with a different ip address.I then manage to open the port in the browser setting. Got that working and now I can see the camera outside my own network.I also managed to set up the motion alert and the email alert sending.

Reviews.Title: Great buy
Reviews.Author: Scot B. Holliday
Reviews.Content: Works well in dark and light. It has high definition.  It is worth much more than its price.  We use it as safety and monitoring cam

Reviews.Title: I would say its just OK...so far.
Reviews.Author: Extechie
Reviews.Content: My experience with this camera has been generally good...so far.I originally bought it as a possible front door camera for my 80+ year old mother but set it up at my home first to see how it might work for her. I liked the idea that it has 2-way audio available, could be remotely aimed and being wireless might be an easy install.Setup was fairly easy and I found it worked on Windows, Android, and Apple products with suitable apps.  The integrated IR LEDs are bright enough to illuminate maybe 50-75' out from the camera when its dark.I pretty quickly decided that this should probably not be used outdoors unless extremely well protected from the elements so I ordered a Foscam dome enclosure for it.  One of the first problems I encountered when going into the dome with this is the IR LEDS light up the inside of the dome and wash out the field of view completely when they are on.  So I put black electrical tape over them, not wanting to do any mods like disabling them that might void the warranty.  I then needed an external IR illuminator and assumed that because I can see a small amount of visible red from the installed LEDs they were probably 850nm.  However I didnt want to buy anything until I could conform that 850 was the right choice and ther seemed to be some disagreement on forums about what was best.  So I bought a small sample of clear encased T 1/3/4 "100ma" 850nm, 890nm and 950nm IR LEDS, all rated at about the same luminosity on axis at 100ma and with roughly the same directional characteristics.  I set up a test board with one of each mounted and biased each to operate at the same luminous output as the others based on the published current versus luminosity.  I was easily able to see thru the camera that the 850nm was the best choice as it produced about twice the brightness of the 890 and that twice the 950 with this camera when it was in "IR On" mode. It was dark otherwise.  Side note - the 850 LED does produce a slight visible red glow where the 890 and 950 do not.  This is not a mystery, its just a characteristic of LEDs. They produce a primary wavelength light and bell shaped sidebands of longer and shorter and longer wavelength light.  It happens the only output we can actually see from any of these is the red which is on the shorter wavelength sideband of the 850 LED.  I bought an inexpensive 850nm illuminator to mount outside the dome and that works great.Now to my main criticism and the main reason I decided to not install this for my mother to use at her house.  The wireless connection (802.11 G)  is just too slow making the operation of the camera pan and tilt very hit and miss.  Sometimes its immediate and sometimes its....never.  And it is usually somewhere in between.  Maybe 802.11  would be fact enough.  A wired LAN connection is much better, but whats the point in the extra costs of the built-in wifi if you have to wire it up. Anyway I just couldnt see my mother bothering to deal with that.Another weak spot is the sound from the internal speaker or an external speaker/amp plugged in to the camera.  I would guess that a lot gets dropped somewhere between the mic on the smartphone/tablet/desktop (I tried all and, with Android 4.2, Win8, and IOS) and the speaker (its likely at the camera) because it is mostly not understandable.  The other way - mic on the camera to all the above is much better, at least its intelligible.So, I am hanging onto this unit and mounted at my front door in the dome. As it happens getting AC power there is easy but running a LAN cable nearly impossible.  My mother in going to get a fixed mount, no sound POE wired camera - at her house running a LAN is easy, getting AC power to it not so easy.

Reviews.Title: Great product
Reviews.Author: Bret
Reviews.Content: My FI8910W is amazing. I set up everything as much as i could. I couldn't get the wireless part, so Tech support save the day. Great company,camera and definitely support.

Reviews.Title: Execently product for the price.
Reviews.Author: JOHNNY G COLLANDER
Reviews.Content: Good quality for the price.  Easy to use and set up.  Helps to have computer hardware experience.  Pan and Tilt work great.  There are numerous apps for IP cameras for Smart Phones. This is great for keeping an eye on the pets when away and I love the audio feature.  For the price not a bad picture.  I would buy another.

Reviews.Title: very nice for the price!
Reviews.Author: S. Hejazi
Reviews.Content: For the price, its hands down the best IP Cam you can get!Don't waste your money going for high dollar glitzy name brand cams...this one will do the job just fine! I have three of them!Set up is a breeze of course if you are not network or computer savy, I'd bring in the family computer geek to have him set it up! In my family, I am just that! :)Oh, one last thing....stay away from the cheap immitation one made by some dumb Chinese company, they SUCK and the lens quality sucks even more! I had one (past tense!) :)

Reviews.Title: Almost returned it today, had the lable printed and everything...
Reviews.Author: Zestymack
Reviews.Content: Great camera...For those having problems with the reset issue, the lens adjusts, adjust the image so that it is sharper or duller depending on your application, it appears it's also an aperture of some sort.The higher/sharper the focus, the more of the on board buffer is used thus causing resets.I figured that out this morning after the camera working since day one suddenly kept rebooting.After adjusting the focus along with contrast and brightness I now get 15 fps hard wired at 640 resolution, running blue iris pro.Enjoy it.

Reviews.Title: Low cost remote surveilance or baby cam, takes some effort and tech know how to set up
Reviews.Author: BuyItOnce "Just_Slightly_Geeky"
Reviews.Content: When the baby was on the way I started looking at video baby monitors and was shocked at their prices and limited functionality. My inner geek took over and I figured there must be other solutions out there that would meet my requirements and beyond. Compared to an equivalent Motorola or other brand video monitor this comes in about 2-3 times cheaper depending on fluctuating sale prices. Granted, the dedicated models usually come with no fuss set up and a dedicated viewer monitor. But with some elbow grease, this will do that and more like remote viewing via iphone/Android apps or any PC that's connected to the internet. It also has pan and tilt so you could effectively see 270 degrees horizontally around the camera. The camera tilts upwards too but has a limited angle downwards; probably because its own base would impede visibility. I've mounted two of them upside down to alleviate as the apps and pc settings allow you to invert the image as needed. I also liked the idea that these would see a repurposed life as security cams after the initial baby years.Video QualityMax supported res is 640*480 and on my wireless N network I seem to get 10-15 fps at best. I'd consider this good enough to monitor the overall situation but you won't be seeing razor sharp detail nor fast movement; it's enough resolution and frame rate to smoothly capture someone walking across view. Night vision is excellent and I have no issues seeing over 10 feet in each room in total darkness. In other words, I can see clearly if baby is stirring, awake, and of course actively looking for us.Audio QualityThese camera's offer 2 way audio and in practical terms that means it transmits audio from the room it's in and also plays back audio out of a speaker. Yes, it's like an intercom. The catch of course is that in order to talk through the camera, your pc must have a mic built in like many modern laptops already do or your Apple/Android device has to have a mic input too of course. There are mic and speaker input/outputs on the back but I've found that I don't need them as the mic sensitivity and speaker volume are fine for both our living room and nurseries.SetupSo decent video and audio, but what is it like to setup? The Foscam.us site has improved A LOT and now they have youtube tutorials to guide you through as much or as little setup as is needed for your use. I only went through initial camera setup, wifi network setup, but left motion alarms, FTP uploads, and other advanced features alone. I just wanted to be able to watch what's going on remotely. The first camera took close to 2 hours to set up as I clumsily jumped between googled guides I found, Foscam's website, and my own Wireless Router's port forwarding settings. The 2nd and 3rd camera's were set up as quickly as 20 min once I became familiar with the process steps needed for my use. The website or cd provides a utility to identify the camera's ip address so you can navigate to the camera's web interface via a webbrowser and configure from there. That's all you need if you just want to view video within your wifi network. Remote access will require you dig into your router to set up port forwarding, and a web host like no-ip.org becomes a desired feature so you can just type in a web address instead of your public ip address when remote. There are instructions how to do these things and none of them are hard it just takes time to follow along.InstallCamera comes with power cord, plastic wall mount, lan cable, and external antenna. The mount is serviceable and with the proper screws you can mount easily on drywall. Note that the camera unit is pretty big and not easy to hide or blend in decor. it's the size of the chunkiest early generation webcam you can imagine. The one advantage of dedicated units is that you could take them with you to other people's homes and since they are locked to a particular viewing monitor you'd be set up in minutes. These camera's rely on broadcasting their signal via wifi so unless you're up for redoing setup while travelling it's probably best to consider these as permanent installations at home.AppsI view my camera's on both IOS and Android platforms. On android I use tinyCam Monitor PRO, to me it has the best layout on Android and is worth the $5 I spent on it. On Iphone, I use Foscam Pro which had the best mix of layout and functionality up until the latest update. Their app team is still trying to squash bugs but it's already on its way to become the top Foscam viewer app again. With these apps, I can remotely view and take video's and/or pictures that are saved to my mobile device.Alternatives?If all this setup sounds daunting to you, I would suggest looking into Dropcam product offerings. They offer streamlined setup, better video quality, but no pan/tilt functionality and cost about 2x.

Reviews.Title: Not bad overall
Reviews.Author: Jerry Helsing "jlhelsing"
Reviews.Content: Works fine.  Picture quality is great.  My problem is that the app on my iphone, when it was updated to iOS7, stopped allowing sound to come through or be sent and I can no longer control the pan and tilt feature from my phone.  Works great over my computer, but not my phone.  Other than that, I am happy with the camera.

Reviews.Title: Rare good buy here! Stop thinking about it and comparing. If you need an indoor security camera for your home, this is it!
Reviews.Author: cbrace
Reviews.Content: Great product! The pan and tilt work great in any browser and in my iPhone 5. The audio is surprisingly sensitive. I can knock on a wall upstairs and with about a 1-2 second delay, I can hear the audio on the downstairs camera pick up the knocking. I have three of these now! They are so good that I'm trying to figure out how I could place a 4th one and use it! :)Don't waste your money buying the suggested mounting hardware. I cannot think of any reason where you would need them. Also, the power cords are already pretty long...at least 6 feet, maybe 10..I'm not quite sure but you also most likely don't need the extended power cords either.Read the other reviews about how to setup with your WiFi in your home. I did, and it worked easily. I have a good understanding of wireless networking but I still think just about anyone can do it. I also joined all three cameras together for the web viewer so I can easily watch my entire home on one browser. I couldn't be happier that I choose these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Nice camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Jeffrey B. Phelps
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the price.  I was a little skeptical because this camera is so much cheaper than others, but I figured if I didn't like it I could just send it back.  It was very easy to setup, has a decent picture, and IR works surprisingly well.  It's a bit bigger than the other IP cameras I have (Panasonic), but it's so much cheaper I don't mind.

Reviews.Title: gets the job done
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Nice camera.  Slow to boot up, the on-alarm record fuction is spotty, and wi-fi range is ok.  The housing is great and the one in my garage has been going strong where the temperature swings have been greater.  No optical zoom.

Reviews.Title: Best IP camera for under $100.
Reviews.Author: G. Hwang
Reviews.Content: Haters gonna hate. This product does not deserve anything below a 4. I am the type of guy who researches for months before buying anything. This camera is rightfully the most popular IP camera at the moment for a valid reason.It is cheap(usually can find it $70 or below with free shipping.It is reliable.It is easy to setup, please note it is still an IP camera so it still takes time if you never done this before, but anyone can do it, you don't need to be tech savy.There are tons of free and paid apps, I recommend the paid ones, really worth the $1-$5.Haters stop hating.

Reviews.Title: Great as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Luci Blace
Reviews.Content: Nice inexpensive (compared to others) ip camera. I'm amazed that baby monitors are so expensive when you can just get something like this and it's a much better overall solution. The picture quality is great, the setup was relatively straightforward, and there are mobile apps you can get to view and control the thing.Edit:So, I've bought two, had to exchange one, and am about to exchange another. I can't tell if it's a manufacturing defect or a design flaw (ie. not sure if exchange will help) but they seem to have trouble staying online when running over WiFi. After a few days it seems like the camera will just disappear from the WiFi network. I'm running them with static IPs out of the range of the number of devices on my network. It works great for a random number of days and then it no longer responds over the network - can't ping it, and the router shows the device as disconnected. Then, I have to reboot the camera to get it back online.It seems to be related to when there are connection problems because it seems to be more stable if it's closer to the wireless router. But, it's not a very good IP security camera if it can't handle a connection interruption and I have to physically power cycle it to get it working again. Oh well, I really liked this thing but I doubt I'll be using it for security or recommending it to anyone else as the issue has affected 2/3 devices I've owned.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and works great.
Reviews.Author: will
Reviews.Content: Plugged it in. followed some directions. made some port changes to the router and it just works. Using an app on Windows Phone 8 with it and it works great. Use it primarily to check on the dog.

Reviews.Title: Good
Reviews.Author: David R. Turner "rebeldt"
Reviews.Content: So far so good. I like being able to watch what's going on at my house. Just need to figure out how to record now m

Reviews.Title: Huge improvement over the previous 8918
Reviews.Author: Richard J. Misner
Reviews.Content: I own both the previous model and this one, and the 8910 is a huge improvement, particularly in sound quality. On the 8918, audio over wireless wasn't even worth trying for the static, etc. - we have that one hard-wired to the network. This model has a very sensitive and clean sound to it on wireless, which is much appreciated - they really did some work improving this camera.Setting it up is not great for the non-tech-savvy, their little install app is not very well featured, and neither is the built-in software, for that matter. It's a great performer overall though, and it works great with IPCam Pro on the Android, with which we can pull up our cameras anywhere anytime.We did have one defective unit, the IR cut filter wouldn't lift in the dark, so you couldn't see anything past about 18 inches in the dark - you could manually pull the cut filter open with a magnet (which we did for a few nights), but sent that one back when we knew it wasn't going to just start working.

Reviews.Title: Good camera. works as advertised.
Reviews.Author: R. Shobe
Reviews.Content: Good camera. Use it to watch my parent's and their home from away. Bit tricky to set up for use from another network, but plenty of help from people who have set this up and posted their instructions.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic little cameras.
Reviews.Author: J. Beavers
Reviews.Content: Love these cameras! I have 4 set up around my house externally to monitor the property. They function great. Use the Foscam App in the AppStore and viola! You have internet enabled surveillance, motion detection, night vision, and you can even talk to your dogs.

Reviews.Title: ok but not great, software issues
Reviews.Author: Praveen K Jha
Reviews.Content: Camera is fine once you set it up. The picture is not bad. Also it moves well when it does. But the problem ate on two fronts. First the software is not the best. Not everything is clear nor everything works. Mobile software is actually terrible. I don't use foscam mobile app. I ended up using ipcamviewer. Also I use ddns because ip address doesn't work. Second, the instructions are not the best. I haven't been able to make the two way speaker work. But despite these issuesthis camera serves my basic purpose of monitoring my baby and nanny from afar. At this price range probably there aren't too many choices.

Reviews.Title: Terrible Design Flaw!
Reviews.Author: Banditdl
Reviews.Content: The camera is great but the software is terrible. Recording is only enabled when you login and stay logged into the camera interface on your computer. If you log out recording stops and it dosen't alarm.Terrible design flaw! I use an android app to monitor it when i'm out but I can't watch it 24/7.

Reviews.Title: Works as advertised
Reviews.Author: Keith A. Hurst "redlynr"
Reviews.Content: Works like advertised.  Only problem was the install as I was prompted for a username & password, but the instructions didn't indicate that this needed to be the PC's "admin" password.  After trying unsuccessfully for about 30 minutes, I called tech support and waited for about 30 minutes.  But once I was connected to a techie, he remote access my computer and completely took over the install including setting my camera up so that it could be accessed anywhere in the world over the internet.The two-way audio is not great due to a lag.  This is probably not the camera's fault, I suspect it has to do with the network speed.  But one-way audio is all we really need anyway.

Reviews.Title: Far superior to the competition in its price range, and has been very reliable!
Reviews.Author: Jamie Hamel-Smith
Reviews.Content: This is a solid IP camera. My wife and I are using it on our local network to keep an eye on our child. It has no issues with the WiFi, and produces a good frame rate. The web admin is quite configurable, and the pan and tilt feature works well.We used this to replace a less expensive D-Link camera that was always rebooting, freezing, and generally performing poorly. There's nothing that I don't like about this camera, and we're considering getting a second one for when babysitters are a factor in our life. It's nice to be able to check in and see everything normal.Note: We use tinyCam Monitor on Android to view the camera and it has excellent support for most Foscam models.

Reviews.Title: First foray into ip cameras...
Reviews.Author: Jiminbc
Reviews.Content: For a very inexpensive camera, this is working great for me for keeping an eye on my vacation home.  I have this in the living room and can see in the kitchen and surrounding areas.  Picture quality isn't super high definition but it is certainly good enough for what I need to accomplish without breaking the bank.  You have to learn about your router settings and port forwarding but really a little bit of study never hurts.  Don't forget to set the camera up to email you when there is a change in the ip address your isp assigns to you!  That way, when you are away, you can always log in to view your camera.  I know there are other ways to get around this issue but for me I'm good with just logging into the current ip address assigned to my account and adding the port onto the end that I port forwarded.  Works every time!

Reviews.Title: Everyone should have one!
Reviews.Author: MusicMan
Reviews.Content: Works as advertised and is easy to setup.  I have three of these great cameras, all setup through my wireless router.  Setup was quick, really only 5 minutes, and I was able to control the camera and move on to more advanced issues such as viewing over the Internet.  Highly recommended for keeping a watchful eye on your house or room or garage or wherever you want one.  You can set motion activation, and have images sent to your FTP site!  I plan on getting several more.

Reviews.Title: Excellent image quality and full featured web network camera.
Reviews.Author: R. Grokett "bdfrogg"
Reviews.Content: I have this mounted under the eave of a porch as a "kitty cam". Works 100% reliably. Recovers itself fine after power outage. The iphone and ipad app lets me view from anywhere I can get cell data or Wifi.  The night vision is quite good. Between the IR lights and the neighborhood's street lights, I can see all around the front yard at night.  Been using for nearly a year now, no problems.

Reviews.Title: Better than expected....
Reviews.Author: Scott D. Singer
Reviews.Content: I was nervous given other feedback I read about this camera, but will say after doing a firmware upgrade, the camera has performed flawlessly.  One word of caution: If you purchase this camera, make sure you are buying the version that supports wireless N, not just B/G. There was a mid-cycle rev on the camera that is not apparent unless you read carefully, and both are available for sale on Amazon.  I would have rated this 5 stars, but the app available for IOS is not well polished, which required a purchase of a separate app for my IOS devices, uFoscam.  I am very pleased with that application for iOS monitoring.  My primary use for this camera is to monitor my 8 week old son in his bedroom, and has been working flawlessly.  I purchased a second one for my family room, which is expected any day.

Reviews.Title: Plenty of Capabilities - Reasonable Price
Reviews.Author: Christina J
Reviews.Content: I purchased this as a frugal and more versatile camera to use for the baby room. My favorite feature is the infrared, which allows me to see what my baby is up to without turning the lights on. It also has two-way audio and an excellent range, making it great for watching the crib >and< the rest of the room while he plays. I love that I can access it both on my computer as well as my smart phone (by installing an app), and even remotely. I'm looking forward to using this even past the baby stage - as a security camera perhaps?I would (and have) recommend this camera to anyone!

Reviews.Title: Defective sample of an otherwise good camera.
Reviews.Author: El Prof
Reviews.Content: I have several of these and love them. They work well for the purpose intended. If you wish iPhone or droid video quality, this is not for you. It is your basic VHS+ ( 4 you ol' timers who remember vhs tape) camcorder video, 640x480 res.Now the reason for 3 stars is, I received a defective camera that slipped through the cracks. The speaker stopped working after 15 minutes and the right half of the image is badly out of focus (my other cameras are fine).I hope this is not typical of Foscam, I have read disturbing things about their quote lack of qc.

Reviews.Title: Great except for internal speaker.
Reviews.Author: Drew
Reviews.Content: This thing is pretty sweet except I had a problem with the internal speaker blowing out when I tried to talk through it with the 2-way audio. I got a replacement through Amazon and the same thing happened again with the replacement unit. I was able to talk for about 3 seconds before the speaker went silent. When I plug into the audio-out jack, I can hear the audio but it is extremely crackly on both units. I don't know whether to try for a 3rd through Amazon or through Foscam or to just give up and keep it.

Reviews.Title: So far...love the picture...don't love the set up
Reviews.Author: Liz D.
Reviews.Content: Love the night vision and the set up is pretty easy until you get to the remote access/port forwarding craziness. Unless you are super tech savvy, don't try to set up the remote yourself. Just call the company tech support and they'll remote in and do it. I spent the entire evening last night trying myself, because generally I'm able to figure these things out and take pride in doing so without resorting to calling for support. But, this was way beyond me...I tried to channel my inner Penelope from Criminal Minds, but it wasn't happening. But, in about 10 minutes Andrew got me hooked up. I'll update this after I have a chance to use it more, but based on the first day of use, I'm happy with my purchase.

Reviews.Title: Good IP Camera
Reviews.Author: ABS
Reviews.Content: Very nice IP Camera, for the price it gets all you need. The configuration for remote access was pretty straight forward. The internal mic is not really that great though, it captures a lot of static, I haven't tried the 2 way audio option. And for its price it does all I was looking for. I can now check the live feed of the camera on my galaxy. You will need a third party app to use it with a phone.

Reviews.Title: Best price for a baby monitor.
Reviews.Author: Colin C Sauer
Reviews.Content: Works really well, higher quality, lower price than other baby monitors. Easy to set-up once you figure out what you need to do, and as long as you set some security, no problems with "Hackers"

Reviews.Title: Works really well except for the two way audio. Easy set up and use.
Reviews.Author: Sharat Jenigiri
Reviews.Content: I really like this camera so far. It took me 20 mins to set it up, forget the installation software and follow the instructions in the review by R. Tickle on March 29, 2012.The video quality is decent, I am able to hear the audio around the camera, the only issue seems to be when I try to talk back from my phone or browser, the quality of audio from the speaker on the camera is bad.The IR feature work really well and I am able to see in almost total darkness. The other cool feature is that you can set up the camera to email you when your IP changes.Overall very pleased with the product especially at the price point.

Reviews.Title: Very good value for the money for an indoor visible/IR wireless camera
Reviews.Author: Gadget Guy
Reviews.Content: Very good value for the money. The camera works well, with good pictures, decent microphone and marginal speakers (but hey, it is a small unit). What really cinched it for me was finding the iSpy Open Source camera software, which turns this little device into a very-well priced monitoring camera (see [...] for the software).Be aware that the IR illumination will reflect off glass, so if you want to use this to look through a window, make sure you don't aim it straight at a window (i.e. perpendicular to the glass) or all you will see is glare.

Reviews.Title: Cant beat it
Reviews.Author: sly5789
Reviews.Content: For the money you can't beat it.  Does a good job easy to set up and if you have problems just contact their support staff and they will help you.  I can monitor my home away from my cell phone (galaxy note 2).  Can activate motion, just like an alarm system so that it will send me an email alert.  Better than paying for an alarm home monitoring service every month.

Reviews.Title: camera and support
Reviews.Author: Wolfgang
Reviews.Content: awesome technical support . Picture quality of the camera is good and it has a good night vision. I can remotely access the camera outside from my network using my android phone. Irish from foscam remotely connected to my system and do the settings for my camera. He is very helpful in setting up the camera.

Reviews.Title: easy to set up, impressive video quality
Reviews.Author: mecb "wyowildflower"
Reviews.Content: We purchased this to use a video monitor for our baby room.  It was much cheaper than purchasing what is specifically packaged as a baby video monitor and we can view the feed on our phones, ipad or computer.It was fairly easy to set up and I have been very happy with the quality of the video feed both in the day and with night vision. It picks up even very soft sounds quite well. I also like the microphone feature that lets me talk to baby when I'm out of the room.Depending on the app you use to view the video, it is very easy to record video or check audio history, as well. The only feature I would add is zoom, but I'm very happy with it in general.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Bob Dillard
Reviews.Content: I got this to add to my home security system, by far the best camera in its price range.
