Once the software is loaded and the camera is connected to the PC, the IP address for the camera will pop-up. Please note the IP number. I think most users get confused with the IP numbers. For a typical home with a router, there will be a Router that assigns a LAN IP number, most likely 198.168.1.1. Once the camera is connected the IP address for the camera will pop 198.168.1.3 (in my case). The last number after the dot will be different for each device connected to the LAN. Keep in mind you cannot access the camera from the outside using this IP address. For that you need to find your WAN IP address. You can use the site whatsmyip.com and search for your WAN address. In my case it was 68.199.xx.xxx. This WAN IP address is important if you want to connect to your camera from the internet. Don't be fooled when you are able to connect within your wifi using the 198.168.. IP address. You are within the network and will be able to connect easily. Typing the camera's IP address (198.168.1.3 in my case)you can access the camera's set up menu. In User setting, you can change the login name and password from the default provided by foscam. You can create administrator and visitor privileges also. Please set the image recording path. Keep in mind recording will take place only if the PC or an USB external drive is always on. In Basic Network setting, enter the IP address. For me 198.168.1.3, Subnet mask 255.255.255.0 could be the same for all (otherwise check the router administration page). Gateway & DNS server is the IP address of router 198.168.1.1. I have read lot of issues in using port 80, so enter a new port. I used 5656. If you have a Netgear router provided by Optimum online. You can enter the routers IP address on main address bar and a login page will pop up. For optimum online the login name is admin and password is optimum. Sorry for going off track. In the Wireless LAN settings, enter your wireless ID and password. If you press the scan button it will display your network also. You can skip the other menu option. If you want to access your camera with a domain name like [...] instead of[...] you will need to set a DNS host/redirect. You can get a free DNS redirect option at[...] The problem with free account is you will have to renew by email every month. I think paid option is $20 for a year. I have set up a free account. In the camera's DDNS settings menu, you will have to enter the details of your DDNS Service, user name and password used to access the service and the domain you have with the provider. In mail service the sender and receiver will be your e-mail address. For yahoo, the SMTP server will be smtp.mail.yahoo.com and port is 465. For your mail provider you can find the details of the server and port by doing an internet search. SMTP user and pasword will by e-mail address before the @ and the password. This mail service is to send you e-mail with attachment of the photos when a motion detect alarm is triggered. Please check the boxes, you don't have to test it now. in the Alarm Service settings menu, check all the boxes and keep sensitivity at 5. Duration to record as 60 secs or less. You can select the time for the motion detect to work and hit submit. Basically the camera set-up is over. Now go to your router administration page as explained earlier. Make sure your camera shows up in the devices connected menu. Remember camera is connecting wirelessly, no need to connect with ethernet cable after the initial set up is over. In the Port Forwarding menu add the camera with its IP address (198.162.1.3 for me). Enter starting and ending port at 5656. While setting up domain name in noip.org use the WAN address (68.199.xx.xxx) with port 5656 to point to the domain name. It might take a few minutes to register. Now you can access your camera either by your domain name [...]or [...] from inside and outside of your network. The[...]can only be used to access within the wifi network. I also used a free iphone app CamViewer and entered the domain name to see the camera from outside the network. You can test the app and domain name by turning off the wifi in your phone. Good Luck!

Reviews.Title: Foscam fi8910
Reviews.Author: micayla8802
Reviews.Content: So far so good... Great tech support!  Tim was patient and took his time showing me the features.  Looking forward to using the camera.

Reviews.Title: Great, reliable camera.. Once latest firmware is loaded.
Reviews.Author: PleX
Reviews.Content: I've been ordering these "used" from amazon at a steal price. You know why? The OLD firmware on these cameras is very poor, and riddled with bugs than make the camera unreliable for security use.Once the unit is loaded with the latest firmware, it runs for days, weeks + without restarting or repositioning. Oh, and after loading the new firmware, when I press "IR OFF" in the web user interface, it stays off for good.Also, I can confirm that the color and contrast is slightly more accurate than that of the FI8918 version.My Recommendation:Buy this Camera, and immediately update to the latest firmware. Make sure to download the correct firmware for the firmware version you are updating FROM. There is more information out there, just look it up.Here's the best place to get the files: [...]So.. until I can't, I'll continue buying these cameras used from the warehouse, and load to the latest firmware.-Cheers

Reviews.Title: So far so good
Reviews.Author: Jermaine Stewart "stewy_gt"
Reviews.Content: First things first. If you're planning to purchase one to see how well it works before getting additional devices, I'd suggest just getting all of them. I'll be purchasing two more along with the Blue Iris software.I got this camera to watch my dog. I have a rescue dog that's very timid and loves to pee in my house ONLY whenever I'm not looking. I never catch her in the act. So I picked up one of these cameras to give it a try.PROS:+ Image quality is acceptable. HD would be nicer but I seriously don't need it.+ Sound goes both ways. You can enable the mic and listen to audio on the camera side, plus speak in the mic on your side to project the audio to the camera side.+ Night vision works very well.+ WiFi support.+ Can be setup to be accessed from anywhere with various levels of access (admin, operator, visitor).CONS:- Enabling audio introduces a 3 seconds delay between when the event occurred and when you see it.- Setup was more difficult than it needed to be.- No DVR feature out of box.OTHER:+ I bought the iPad app and that works great.+ It supports alerts. I've used the motion detection through the iPad app, but haven't tried the face detection since I only care about motion.The setup instructions are simple... provided that you don't run into any issues. I connected the antenna, network cable, and power. The device moved and then stopped. On my Win 7 PC I installed the IP Camera Tool, launched it and saw Anonymous and a message about the subnet being different. Double clicking the name showed a dialog window where almost every label were question signs. I ended up reading further in the manual and found the similar looking dialog window with the correct labels. Matching up the position of the controls, I set a static IP address and a different port number, accepted the changes, and stop the IP Camera Tool. After a minute I launched the IP Camera Tool and saw the camera listed as expected. I then accessed my router and forward the port to the IP address for the camera, and was able to access it remotely.The things that annoyed me was the dialog window having only question signs (??????) for all of the labels. What kind of software bug was that? Was it not localized properly? The labels resolved themselves only after I figured out and entered the values. Furthermore, despite connecting the camera to my router, I still do not see the camera listed as being connected via a wired connection (all other devices are displayed). Other than that, the router configuration was simple since I've done this type of setup many times.Now that I know what to expect from this camera, I'll be getting two more.

Reviews.Title: The new ones dont work
Reviews.Author: Kent D. Bottorf
Reviews.Content: I read all the negative reviews for this camera and bought it anyway.  I have had zero problems with it.  It has a great operating system built in.  I can get it to do everything the manufacturer says it does.  I have it in with my chickens to monitor them at night.  It will ultimately be mounted in my outdoor chicken coop when I get it done.  I can get it on my phone and can access it remotely from outside my network on a pc.  I am planning on buying a few more to monitor my house and property.  Make sure to download the latest firmware when you get it.  It does work best for me with internet explorer using active x.  It is a little finicky using Firefox or Chrome in server push mode.Review and Rating revised 9/15/13I bought two more of these cameras in April of 2013 and they never seem to work like my first one.  I kept blaming myself thinking I must have done something wrong.  Then I went to the Foscam Forum and read the 32 pages of complaints about this product repeatedly crashing and rebooting and realized what other have suspected was probably true.  Around the beginning of 2013 or the end 2012 there was a change in these cameras that caused them to not function properly.  Foscam does not seem to be willing to solve the problem even though they know it exists in apparently all of the MJPEG versions of the camera they produce.  Here is a link to the thread on their forum.[...]Hey Foscam maybe you can understand this 你的产品没有工作，但愚蠢的美国人买东西

Reviews.Title: Works! great bargain
Reviews.Author: TDurden
Reviews.Content: Love this thing - super easy to setup (Windows, IE) great video quality, sound ok too. I'm able to control my cam and settings via my iphone with no problems.

Reviews.Title: Excellent
Reviews.Author: Jrs System Solutions
Reviews.Content: Pros: Easy web GUI interface (forget the included CD; you don't need it), easy web GUI monitoring, free fantastic Android and iPhone monitoring applications (I use "IP Cam Viewer" on Android), free built-in and pre-configured DDNS service, good resolution, very good pan and tilt range, very QUIET pan and tilt, very low cost.Cons: audible "click" when the monitor shifts from day to IR mode or back; IR LEDs emit visible red light when on; LAN activity light flashes annoyingly.  (I duct-taped over the LAN link light on mine.)Verdict: buy one.  Heck, buy several - they're cheap.  (I did.)

Reviews.Title: Great product, speedy delivery
Reviews.Author: Robert & Marie Gelormine
Reviews.Content: Easy to read instructions, installation and setup... performs better than I expected.  Looking to purchase additional cameras to complete my security needs.

Reviews.Title: Expensive baby monitor for half the price.
Reviews.Author: J-Rod
Reviews.Content: This camera is great. The reliability once the static Ip is set is second to none. Works flawlessly with my iphone for sound and video using the  provided software and or Cam Viewer in the app store. I think the only reason this camera has any negative marks is bc the manual is written for people with intermediate networking experience and at times hard to follow. this camera was sent to me promptly as a replacement, the first one delivered worked fine but the camera shorted out when the remote app was used, this one is flawless.  Set up was pretty easy. I am not a computer genius and I did run into a few problems other people who may have given negative feedback had. But after some careful reading and trial and error I discovered the issues myself and others were having were easily fixed, without negative remarks. I will buy many more, you should too.

Reviews.Title: Works great but had to return one of the 2 I ordered due to wireless connection problem
Reviews.Author: J. Reyes
Reviews.Content: The Foscam model might be the same but may not have same firmware version and firmware upgrade may not always work to resolve problem.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Michelle Ge
Reviews.Content: We use this camera mounted upside down in the back patio, under the overhang. everything worked as advertised. Easy to configure, either wired or wireless. The only thing to adjust is the sensitivity of the alarm triggered, need to take consideration of the spider web!

Reviews.Title: Nice Features
Reviews.Author: ebm256
Reviews.Content: This camera has a lot of nice features for the price.  I did not find the setup to be difficult but I do have a technical background.  I followed the advice of some of the other commenters and just logged into the camera and gave it a static IP.  I use it with iCam and it works well.  The video quality is a little low which is why I gave it only 4 stars.  There is an HD version of this camera that is quite a bit more expensive but it may be worth it to some. One nice feature that I wasn't expecting was the universal tripod mount.  I can put the camera almost anywhere with a portable tripod.

Reviews.Title: Performs as Promised
Reviews.Author: Casey
Reviews.Content: It's wonderful that one can have this much technology for this little money.  I've configured the camera to email me photos when it senses motion (the sensitivity is adjustable), so that I can simply forward the photos (with embedded date- and time-stamp) to the local high school's principal when the usual suspects are smoking dope in our stairs ("Have you seen me?").  :)The night vision is very good.  The camera can save video onto a hard drive on one's local network, but it It would be valuable if the camera could also email short videos, and not just photos.  The user's manual is not perfect, but I'd give it four stars out of five.  The camera has audio in and out jacks, but I haven't tried using the audio.  I've had the camera for several weeks now, and there have been some few occasions when its emails had undecipherable date- and time-stamps, but the problem corrects itself within a day or two.

Reviews.Title: Great web cam
Reviews.Author: Mark Ryan "movie watcher"
Reviews.Content: Since bought used kept getting errors on install until reset factory defaults. Important to follow directions exactly. Had trouble with mail notification on alarm set. Mail port needs to be set 587.

Reviews.Title: Decent camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: J. Shelby "Kalenth"
Reviews.Content: I started with one, then got another 3 of these. For distances up to 100 feet, they work well to see what is happening. Under 10 feet, they can show who is doing it. They don't do well tracking motion, and they are bigger than I'd like, but for the money, they were easy to setup, easy to install, and with the Blue Iris software, work very well on any computer.

Reviews.Title: Very satisfied
Reviews.Author: J. Zhang
Reviews.Content: Would give five stars if setup of remote monitor is easier. Took some time to figure out for static ip configuration.

Reviews.Title: Customer Service Review
Reviews.Author: Nonoma
Reviews.Content: So far so good!!!!  Customer service was EXCELLENT!!!  Calvin was super helpful and got everything going.  Clarity from camera is excellent.  Can't wait to spy on my husband and kids when I'm away.

Reviews.Title: Fi8910W
Reviews.Author: jjone
Reviews.Content: Works very well so far, great picture quality even in night mode.  Moves very quietly.  Had to call technical support because my computer skills are lacking, and I was having trouble accessing the camera remotely.  I called Foscam support and they were able to get the camera working in a very timely manner.

Reviews.Title: Technical Support
Reviews.Author: Renae
Reviews.Content: We had this camera at our last location and ended up giving it away.  We got it again and I didn't have time to try to install it again.  So remote installation was easier and better for me.  Felix Anderson helped me out with the install.  Recommended this camera already to other people.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Peggy Calhoun
Reviews.Content: I love this camera. It allows me to view my pets remotely while I am working. This gives me peace of mind. I had some minor problems getting the camera connected to my network. I called the customer service line and they called back within 20 mins! The rep (Leo) was fantastic! He took control of my computer remotely and fixed the issues quickly so I was up and running. I recommend this for anyone with children, pets or if you wish to have security that you home is safe while you are on vacation.

Reviews.Title: FI8910W
Reviews.Author: James J. Eden
Reviews.Content: Great camera I have 5 Foscam cameras and they all are GREAT!I had some issues with my technical abilities to access them remotely and called Foscam support. The support tech Leo was the best. He spent the time not only to fix and test the issue but to explain the process. I highly recommend Foscam.Jim

Reviews.Title: Foscam Online Tutorials Very Useful
Reviews.Author: Craig
Reviews.Content: I found the Foscam online tutorials available through their support website very informative as was the full online manual.Both gave me everything I needed to succesfully install the camera and the email and alarm  recordings.  It took me about 5  including playing with settings and making adjustments.I wanted to be sure I could install this before ordering more.  I just ordered one in white.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Terp
Reviews.Content: I just bought a Foscam FI8910W and ran into a technical problem not online or in the quick start guide, so I called tech support.  Tim picked up and had my camera up and running on the local and wireless networks pretty quickly.  I was glad that tech support used remote assistance software, "Team Viewer", so I could watch the troubleshooting steps.  Although, I did hesitate to let a remote user having access to my computer, but I guess the benefit of cool technology was worth the risk.  I think Tim could have been a little more vocal during the troubleshooting, but customer service at most companies has been trained to only provide solutions, not talk customers through the process, so I can't blame him.  I guess providing solutions is good for a significant number of customers, but I feel like I am pretty technical and like to be involved in troubleshooting.  On second thought, it is nice for a change to have someone else do the troubleshooting for me.  Otherwise, he was friendly and extremely professional, and I expect the rest of tech support would be trained in all the same manners I described above.  Overall, a likable experience.

Reviews.Title: Great for Nurseries
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: Set this up my daughter's nursery for monitoring. Image quality is good with both the infrared on and off. The motor system works great as well. There are numerous Android/iOS applications that interface well with this camera.Setup was simple. I ignored the instructions it came with and pulled the latest off Foscam's website.The web interface could be better. The image is streamed fine enough but the site is a bit difficult to navigate. The motor controls are a bit clunky if you're not using Internet Explorer.Overall I'm very happy with this product. I'm able to quickly and easily monitor my daughter in any light.

Reviews.Title: Fantastic Camera
Reviews.Author: ashley.lee
Reviews.Content: I love this camera, this is the second one I've bought. I now have one in both of my children's rooms. I also have the Foscam app on my iPhone and it's so easy to use, camera setup is simple and quick. I recommend this product to anyone who asks!

Reviews.Title: Works great after struggling for the setup
Reviews.Author: ChloeKris
Reviews.Content: pro:it works just as described. I can monitor my house during my one-month long vacation.half pro/half con:it is not that easy to setup for non-tech people. I am kind of a tech people but have limited knowledge in network. I followed the video tutorial and manual step by step and finally make it work. I actually learned some basic network stuff.I think the majority of the customers need a product that we just need to plug in the power cable and it works right away:)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for Great price
Reviews.Author: S. Osornio "Umbasa"
Reviews.Content: For all the features this has and the overall good performance, you just can't beat it for the price. Remote viewing on iPhone/iPad devices, 2 Way Sound, Night Viewing, WiFi Capability, PC Access etc, etc, etc... the list goes on. I like almost ever aspect of this camera, and even when you set it up and want to move it somewhere else, just unplug power cable and move it where you want! it does not lose any settings and the capability of preset camera angles you can program is fantastic. I would highly recommend this camera.

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: leo
Reviews.Content: good features for the price but set up is a bear if you are not computer literate. The camera is of awesome quality and the picture is great. I WOULD RECOMMEND THIS PRODUCT TO ANYONE .

Reviews.Title: Great for Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: C. Ebert
Reviews.Content: This camera is amazing!! It surpassed my expectations.  We purchased it as a baby monitor and it's better than all the "baby monitors" out there, and a better price. My husband had no issues setting it up, and I love that I can tune in from anywhere, even if I'm away from home, to watch what's going on in some of the rooms of my house. The clarity is perfect, and you can control the tilt remotely using the apps or computer program. The tilt has a great range of vision. The night vision is also good. The audio is a great feature, and I can use it to hear my baby in the other room.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Gerald Coulter
Reviews.Content: Great addition to my security system and easy to install.  Several of my friends are also going to buy one of these camera's for there homes.

Reviews.Title: Works great Lots of Apps
Reviews.Author: Chrome Legion
Reviews.Content: I love the camera and I am considering getting a second.  Great picture quality.  I really like being able to access it from both my iPad and my Android phone -- there are tons of compatible apps for it.

Reviews.Title: A pain to install, but works well
Reviews.Author: Michael
Reviews.Content: I have 4 IP cameras, none of which are Foscam, all installed okay.  This Foscam took a bit more effort that the others to get it to work wireless and externally.  Once that was accomplished (2 hours of trying over and over again), the camera works well on a 100% Apple set-up.

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: jimmy546546
Reviews.Content: camera is great, and customer service (by telephone) was super helpful!  they walked me through installation very patiently and were able to remote into my computer to help -- highly recommended!

Reviews.Title: Incredible camera for the price.
Reviews.Author: FUAROCK
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as a baby monitor in place of the SECOND Summer TV monitor that took a dump. It was relatively easy to setup, although the IP scanner tool included on the software CD doesn't seem to work with Windows 7. I had to get the IP address from my router's DHCP client list. Aside from that, setup was pretty easy and went according to the included instructions. Foscam's website has some pretty decent step by step instructions on topics such as port forwarding so you can view your camera via internet as well as on your local network.The power cord that comes with it is comically short for a device that is almost certainly going to be mounted high on a wall or from the ceiling. Thankfully, Foscam sells a 10' extension for "only" $15.I can't figure out why they decided that the ring of LEDs around the lens should emit visible light. They are supposed to be IR LEDs but they are clearly visible. That could be just some of the light filtering through from the ridiculously bright LED status light on the back of the unit. Neither is so bright as to keep my daughter up so I guess it doesn't matter but it seems poorly thought out.The camera moves very quietly. I can't hear it at all, except through the application. It does make an audible click when switching to/from night vision.The mounting hardware was present and adequate.The camera's firmware offers a great degree of control.I would strongly recommend this camera to friends.I'd also recommend the Tinycam Android ap if you want to view the camera on an Android mobile device. You can simply view it through a browser but the ap provides way more control and is more user friendly, I think.

Reviews.Title: Cannot get a better camera for the value!
Reviews.Author: Wolverine
Reviews.Content: In the past I had bought a Foscam camera and it was just an overall bad experience so I was leary when it came to getting this model.  However the low pricetag on goldbox pushed me to give them another try.  I'm glad I did.  This camera from time to time goes on sale for just under $70.  First of all, the picture is what you'd expect from an IP camera.  While not HD it's quite good.  I watch my cats on my Android phone when I'm out and about.  Robert Chou produced a great Android app called IP Cam Viewer Pro.  Buy it, it's a smooth running app.  He has added just about any camera model you can imagine to the driver list.Pros of camera:1)Nice quality video2)Pans and tilts smoothly3)Microphone actually works4)Is fairly easy to setup if you have moderate networking skills5)Wireless N (very nice feature for a low cost camera)6)Excellent night vision (the feature that made me upgrade to new camera)7)Range of motion is greatCons of camera:1)From time to time it has a couple second loss of control.  Camera just goes unresponsive then comes right back like nothing was wrong. I run mine on wireless N network.  This is really my only gripe and why I took one star off.  With all the great things this camera does it's not a deal breaker in any way.  It doesn't happen enough for me to worry about.Overall, this camera cannot be beat for features and cost.

Reviews.Title: A rock-solid IP camera at a reasonable price
Reviews.Author: Eric Borchardt
Reviews.Content: I was looking for an inexpensive camera to use as a baby monitor. There were a few key features I was looking for. I wanted the ability to watch from my Android smartphone and from a computer, and I wanted it to connect to my network via WiFi. This camera has these features and a few extras that have come in handy. This camera seems to be very well built, it has already survived a couple of toddler induced incidents. I have the black version, which has almost like a satin rubber finish to it. I think this finish will help to prevent scratches, but time will be the test there.The setup of this camera requires a computer. You can use either Mac or PC for this, I used a Mac. For the initial setup, you need to plug the camera directly into your wireless router. Then you put the included CD in your computer and run the program to locate the IP of the camera. Once you have the IP address, the rest of the setup is done in your browser. This is where you'll join the camera to your wireless network. It was pretty straight-forward for me, but I can understand where some people could get confused. The language used in the setup is very technical and does not offer any explanation of the technical terms. There is plenty of help online if you have any questions about the technical terms and what they mean. I didn't have any problems throughout the setup and I had the camera up and running in about 10 minutes.There is no included Android/iOS app with this camera, but there are hundreds of IP Camera apps that work with it. My wife has been trying the iOS apps out on her iPad and has found there are lots to choose from. Same goes with my Android smartphone, there are literally hundreds of IP camera apps. The browser interface is not flashy, but definitely gets the job done. There is very little lag when viewing on any of my devices, I'd guess less than 1/2 second. I'm pretty impressed with this aspect, I thought it would be a couple seconds behind at a minimum.The night vision feature is incredible on this camera. It is important to note that the IR leds used for night vision will glow a soft visible red light, so it is easy to spot the camera in the dark. The night vision is so good, you'd swear there is a light on in the room. I have noticed that during the daytime, the night vision has trouble deciding when to turn on. But I don't really plan on using this during the daytime, so this does not concern me.The pan/tilt feature is something I didn't think I'd use, but I have used it to track my daughter's movements in her bedroom after converting her crib into a toddler bed. The pan/tilt motor is pretty quiet, but it is audible. The range of motion is very large, much more than I need for a little bedroom.There are a few features that I do not plan on using. You can set up email alerts when motion is detected, as well as upload images so you can see what triggered the motion. You can also record video from the camera to a DVR or FTP, which can also be triggered by motion. Since I'm not using this camera for security purposes, I don't really have any intention on using them. But I can definitely see where they could be useful in other applications.I've had this camera running for about a week and have had no problems so far. I am very pleased with this camera and I'm thinking of getting another to put in my garage for security purposes. If I had to find a fault with the camera, it would be that the web-browser interface is a little clunky and looks like a website from the late 90's. I would highly recommend this camera to anyone looking for an IP camera that can be viewed on a smartphone, tablet, or computer. I can't imagine why anybody would spend more on a camera when this camera appears to have everything most people need.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech Support #1
Reviews.Author: Vern
Reviews.Content: I originally bought 4 Foscam F18910W cameras via Amazon Prime for about $80.00 each.  Itried to set them up myself and after 2 weekends of dealing with my internet provider, I gave up and sent them back.  I then called Foscam directly because i really needed these cameras to work.  I ended up re-purchasing the 4 cameras theough Foscam for about $100.00 per camera but these cameras came with unlimited tech support.  Once Foscam tech support started working on my cameras they immediately realized I had a bad router.  That information could have saved me two whole weekend of working on this.  In about 4 hours tey had all 4 cameras up and running and also helped my wife setit up on her I phone.  That was 2 years ago. Last week we moved into a new home and brought our 4 Foscam cameras with us.  I figured I would call Fascam and they would nt remember us but I was wrong. They took my name and set an appointment for Jeez to call us back at 4pm and he did (twice)!  I could not beleive how patient and how much time they spent with us.  It took them about 4 hours total to set it all up.  During the call my wife even commented "I can't beleive they are apending so much time on us" and that is when I decided to give them a great review (something I rarely do).  On a scale of 1-10 I am about a 5 when it comes to technology and I would recommend that anyone considering these cameras to seriously consider thier tech support. I would recommend the camera to anyone and the tech support excellent. Thanks Jeez for all your help.VG in Texas

Reviews.Title: PERFECT
Reviews.Author: Jill
Reviews.Content: Ok so I NEVER write reviews.. not my thing but that being said I had to say How PERFECT these monitors are!!! Wait cameras.. I use them as baby monitors in my kids rooms.... 3 to be exact! It was a huge pain to set up and figure out why I only gave 4 stars, but I YouTubed my questions and it took me about an hour to have all cams going! I use my Ipad at home and iPhone during the day! I can watch my children and my babysitter anytime I want and I can HEAR them!! I will admit the first few days I was addicted to watching them sleep. but now i just check every now and then.  I downloaded the 5$ app from foscam works PERFECT!! Make sure you figure out port forwarding.. I am a mom on a budget and wanted video monitors for multiple rooms, this was the PERFECT answer! It can do a whole bunch of stuff but I haven't figured it all out yet!! Also I only know I can listen to one room at a time, which is fine as the other rooms are close to m room. Hope this helps!!

Reviews.Title: Foscam suport.
Reviews.Author: Ricky Grady
Reviews.Content: Calvin was very professional and knowledgeable about product.  Thanks very much for a job well done.  The camera is working great.  I love It.  I would suggest to others.

Reviews.Title: Everything I could ever want to view cats at home
Reviews.Author: Dana Schwehr
Reviews.Content: We got a couple of these to see what the heck our cats do when we're not home.  I love how it has so many cool features.  It's wireless and accessible from anywhere through wireless internet connections.  I can pan it, do preset positions, it can see in the dark, it's mountable in several ways including from the ceiling upside down, can take pics, etc.

Reviews.Title: Foscom FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Candace Mundy
Reviews.Content: I purchased 4 of these cameras late in 2011 and have been using them since then. The cameras are very good quality. Foscam's service is awesome. Technical support returned my phone call within 20 minutes to help me install them! The service technician was very informative and helpful and successfully set up all 4 cameras for me to view both on my computer as well as via an app for Android on my phone.I highly recommend Foscam for all your security camera needs. I have not been disappointed in any way with the cameras or Foscam's excellent service.

Reviews.Title: great video
Reviews.Author: Janette B
Reviews.Content: I purchased this camera to be able to see my daughter while I'm at work.  I wasn't able to understand the directions (didn't have the patience?) to set up port forwarding or whatever to be able to view remotely, so I called Foscam US for help.  I have to say it was the best thing I could have done since Albert logged on to my system remotely, got everything configured correctly and saved the settings/DDNS site address to my Notepad.  I have read where some doubt the validity of customer service claims but I made this purchase on Amazon and even tried to get help from my router support (who's instructions supposedly bypassed the firewall or something yet still didn't work).The reason I'm giving the camera only 3 stars is because the tilt/pan doesn't seem to be working as it did initially (I've had it less than a week).  If I hit the left or right directional arrow more than twice it pans all the way to the opposite side with no way to stop it.  I have maneuvered the camera so that it's in a position that is functional but I dread any future adjustments.02/13/13 I'm very frustrated that a plugin is required to add audio but there's no further explanation nor any information on either the forum or user manuals.  In fact there are many similar questions asked on the forum, most without answer.

Reviews.Title: Nice petcam
Reviews.Author: S. Borland "slbwashingtondc"
Reviews.Content: This camera works very well. The picture is very clear. I use it to check on my dog. I have found out that he spends nearly all of his time sitting at the front door looking for us to come home. It's great to be able to pan the camera.

Reviews.Title: Bad product
Reviews.Author: yp
Reviews.Content: It did not work right out of box. The software did not idetify the camera. I went around to get to the camera working wired a little bit. It went dead. I suspect it killed my router too. I had to buy a new router in rush. This product is a junk. Returned it.Good thing on return was that Amazon.com issued a RMA right away and got refund in 2 days!This is why I insist buying items only sold by Amazon.com. I'm not afraid of buying from Amazon.com any time. I wonder how long it would have taken if it was purchased from a third party mercahnt.

Reviews.Title: inexpensive and works well
Reviews.Author: Sharkus
Reviews.Content: I've had this product for quite a few months with absolutely no issues,  the application they make for the Iphone is also awesome. You can't beat that for this price,  I will most definitely be purchasing more to cover other rooms.

Reviews.Title: Excellent IP Security Camera Under $100
Reviews.Author: Eyesopen
Reviews.Content: The title says it all. This is the best value on the market today for an IP Security Camera with Pan/Tilt for under $100. If one wants zoom it's at least triple the cost. The camera does what it advertises but be sure to find someone fluent in port-forwarding of your home router and "gift" them with something before going forward. The Dynamic DNS is very cool and for all these features under $100...I'm impressed. Well done Foscam.

Reviews.Title: Wonderful to have a product that works
Reviews.Author: Thomas Y. Pocock
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these webcams and I could not really be any happier with them.I just installed the most recent firmware (V11.37.2.48) and the camera responsivenesss is right on.They have cleaned up the web interface so you no longer need to enter the login information twice with Firefox.The audio now works with Firefox as well.And the firmware installation worked over wifi without incident.Now ... if they will make a version with Zoom it will be perfect.

Reviews.Title: Great IP Camera. Very easy to install.
Reviews.Author: Rolando Rivero
Reviews.Content: I bought this to be able to check on my dogs. The camera set up was very easy. I had to contact my Internet provider to allow access to the camera through the firewall on my router but was quickly able to access the camera from the Internet. I love being able to check in on my dogs with good video quality (night vision too!).

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Stuff Reviewer
Reviews.Content: Easy setup for basic functionality. Many features and options. Software available for both iOS and Android to control the camera. The ability to automatically send an email when motion is detected makes for a simple alerting\alarm system. The night vision is also nice. Not high resolution and no zoom but for the price I would not expect these features. To set the camera up for access from the Internet takes above average skills in configuring network settings. If you don't know what DDNS or Port Forwarding are then you might need some help. The only feature that I think is missing is the ability to setup SSL (encrypted) connections to the camera.  That would make for a much more secure system

Reviews.Title: If I knew it was so hard to set up out of LAN I never would have
Reviews.Author: Brett East "Prime is GOOD"
Reviews.Content: I don't know ship about port forwarding set up. (an hour of web research hasn't made me more comfortable) If this had software to sling to smart phones/tablets like Android I'd be stoked, I'm going to send it back if I don't find an easier answer by Monday. Some may need it for LAN but not me. Foscam should have a network set up like my sling box. Just download an app and you can log on.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera. Easy to Install, Pain to setup networking
Reviews.Author: SN79
Reviews.Content: This camera is really good.Pros:Easy to install (however haven't found time to explore 2 way sound and recording). Easy to use. The best way to install is to either use the included CD or in my case i saw this guy's video on youtube, profile name was Ackwardhamster. He has given a great explanation, step by step instructions to setup the camera. Clarity of the camera is great and it covers a very large area.Cons:Networking was a pain but eventually worked for me. Since I use the AT&T; 2Wire router, I looked up port forwarding and found a video by a guy with profile wiseguy775 on youtube. Just like the guy explained the ip address of the cam should be forced 192.xxx.1.60, to be outside the range of the router which was .64 to .253Then i was able to port forward, but it was not working for me. I used various ports like 777, 8060, 8070. None of these worked. Eventually one of my friend told me to use 19732 and somehow it worked for me. Didnt do anything different except a different port number and it worked great. So try this port, might work for you.I used youtube since I actually always do that first, though I have to say the CD was really easy to use, at least to get started.

Reviews.Title: Buggy, convoluted, and customer service is useless.
Reviews.Author: R. Griffin
Reviews.Content: Don't get me wrong, it works - kind of.My first problem with it is that, once the initial setup is done, if I want to modify any device settings (say, adding a user or changing recording settings) I have to do a hard reset and completely reconfigure the camera.  I get error messages or the changes don't take, otherwise.Second, once I got it set up to record when motion activates it, if the camera wasn't on a wired connection, it would freeze whenever there's motion that activates it.  Let me repeat that - motion causes my video camera to crash.  It would be bad enough if it just wasn't recording, but now that it's set to be motion activated, it won't work at all if anything is moving in front of it.I spent quite a bit of time wading through forums, digging through the manual, and talking with customer service on the phone.  Customer service pretty much just reads the manual to me, then tells me to do a hard reset - thanks for the help.I would love for this camera to work.  Maybe the one they sent me was just a lemon.  This camera has completely failed to live up to even my most basic expectations.  I genuinely regret buying it.

Reviews.Title: Tech support helped me out
Reviews.Author: Eric Babcock
Reviews.Content: The networking was difficult (too much for me).  Tech support guy Peter was helpful, had to wait about 15 minutes but he fixed it after remote controlling my PC.  Haven't had chance to use camera yet, am optimistic.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera
Reviews.Author: Edgar Benitez
Reviews.Content: I never write any reviews, but I am so impressed with this camera that it would not be fair if I didn't write a review. I love the clear picture, functionality and features. I would have given this camera a 5 stars if it had zoom in capabilities. This camera would put ADT out of business.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM f18910W
Reviews.Author: bhh1panama "bhh1panama"
Reviews.Content: Difficult to set up, GOOD CUSTOMER SUPPORT TO ASSIST WITH INSTALLATION is very hard to connect to and also understand the opperator. but  CAMERA WORKS WELL DAY AND NIGHT CURRENTLY HAVE 2 CAMERA'S IN HOUSE HOLD.  GOOD PRODUCT FOR THE PRICE FOR PEACE OF MIND.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Ray lecuyer
Reviews.Content: I called FOSCAM Tech Support to help set up my 8 cameras.  Ralph Mendez was the tech that supported me.  Ralph is an expert and got all of the cameras working perfectly.  The quality of these wireless is great.

Reviews.Title: Awesome
Reviews.Author: greendayrules
Reviews.Content: This is an amazing security camera. I use it when I go away and I check it from my smartphone. You have to be able to read the instructions to get it to work. If you do that you should be okay. :)

Reviews.Title: Amazing quality Ip camera
Reviews.Author: Athbi
Reviews.Content: Realy I love it , wow you should try onebest Ip camera , easy setup , beautiful design, good qualitythanks alot :)

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Prefl96
Reviews.Content: This camera does the job. You will need a managed dns service for the camera, as well as creating a port for the camera.It took me a while to figure everything out, but the camera works. I can view it from my phone and pc no matter where I am.

Reviews.Title: How can one not give this five stars?
Reviews.Author: Bubs
Reviews.Content: I was very reluctant to jump into the home security market via a "do it yourself" protocol. As a facilities manger that works with high end SD and HD cameras on sophisticated software, I was well aware of the potential cost factor with a home video surveillance setup. Yet I trusted Amazon reviewers, all of them from 5 star to 1 star and made my evaluation. I took the chance.  I purchased one of the FI8910W cameras bundled with the Blue Iris software to give it a shot.  Here is what resulted from that initial purchase....  I have since (within a week) purchased two more of the FI8910W cameras and three of the FI8905W outdoor cameras because I was that satisfied! Yes, they are only standard definition, but they fit my budget and give me a substantial peace of mind while in town or out of town (with the Blue Iris software for PC and the app for iphone/iPad).  All I can add is that if you have a tiny bit of tech know how, you can set this up and feel a bit more comfortable knowing that you installed a really good working, reliable, and cost effective means of monitoring your home. I cant speak for the Foscam tech suppport because I have not had a need to utilize such, but I can say that I am incredibly pleased and saving pennies to try a HD Foscam camera.  BTW, the Blue Iris software supports a multitude of cameras aside from Foscam models.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Fi8910w camera
Reviews.Author: Storne Shively
Reviews.Content: Gives a very clear picture. Good technical support after finally getting thru to them. Audio somewhat limited for speaking with someone.

Reviews.Title: Quality Control can be better
Reviews.Author: Homer
Reviews.Content: The wall mount was bad and I had to modify it a little bit with my dremel to get the camera on the wall mount.  But I love how it has 2 way audio and you can move the camera from your iphone or computer.  If you have a dynamic ip you might need to get a ip forwarding service.  Also you need to be some what tech savy ie understand how to set up routers to get all the benefits out of it.

Reviews.Title: Great value camera
Reviews.Author: H. Le
Reviews.Content: Easy to setup.  It works great with iSpy Connect.  I will buy a couple more in the near future.  Too early to tell its durability.

Reviews.Title: Very nice product... Tech Support is horrible!
Reviews.Author: Keyser Soze
Reviews.Content: I am very pleased with this purchase. After a big SNAFU on the shipping part (UPS accidentally sent my package to China), I finally got what I ordered.The camera is a nice buy for the price. The iPhone app I'm using is the CamViewer; it does a great job and best of all, its FREE!Now for the not so great part...The instructions are not that best, but will get you through the set-up. I called tech support because I'm having issues connecting from outside my LAN.My ISP only have a handful of blocked ports, so I know that the port I'm using isn't being blocked. So after a 45 minute wait on the phone, a guy answers and states that he's not technical enough to assist me. So he got my contact info and said that someone will call back in approx 30-45 mins. Someone did call me back and remoted in my PC, went through the same process I've already done and she came to the conclusion that my ISP is blocking that port (which they were not) and stated that she can't do anything until that port is open. She didn't even try and troubleshoot. It was a complete waste of my time that I'll never get back.I think you're better off using Google to find answers than calling their tech support; just my .02

Reviews.Title: Foscam-does what it says!
Reviews.Author: Mary K. Byrnes "McKab"
Reviews.Content: I purchased the camera the so I can watch my home while I'm away from work.  It is perfect for what I want.  The price is right, the controls are easy to use and the resolution is good.  I had some difficulties with setting up the remote viewing, but after contacting customer service, it was corrected in under 10 minutes.  I recommend this camera if you want an inexpensive way to watch your home while you are away.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The service in setting up the camera was the best...very helpful...very quick. I can now see the camera on mu PC and droid...thanks again

Reviews.Title: Works Well When It Works
Reviews.Author: cybersherrif
Reviews.Content: Was a "bear" to set up. Couldn't find an open port to stay open. Finally did. Then we had a power failure at the remote location where it was installed. Kept receiving alerts when the camera rebooted, but was unable to directly communicate with the camera over the internet. I suspect it's my wireless modem, but who knows.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product
Reviews.Author: Kw Gibson
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent product for the price.  It was very easy to set up as far as getting the camera to wireless mode.  However, it was quite difficult to set up remote access, but I had the excellent telephone help from Foscam where the technician took over my computer and sorted everything........well done!!!!Highly recommended product and service

Reviews.Title: FI8910W
Reviews.Author: LMD
Reviews.Content: Leo from Tech Supp was very quick and helpful to set my 3 cameras up. The cameras are great for remote watching your home - especially if you have pets. An iPhone app works wonderfully to connect with the cameras.

Reviews.Title: installation support
Reviews.Author: Henry
Reviews.Content: Albert Pearson provided excellent installation support remotely!  All six cameras now work wirelessly and can be easily accessed from locations outside my network.  Picture quality is excellent.  No more grainy faces.  Will update the review for night vision, etc. after the cameras have been installed. Again, Albert was very patient and provided excellent service. I will be recommending the camera to all who are looking for quality, affordable security cameras.

Reviews.Title: Functional and affordable
Reviews.Author: ezwriter
Reviews.Content: I am pleased with this camera. It functions as expected. The price is reasonable. It is highly configurable and easy to setup.

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Kend
Reviews.Content: calvin was great help in setting up the camera, they work great and everyone needs several. The features are great.very good price on the cameras. Features work great.

Reviews.Title: FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Romn
Reviews.Content: Very happy with technical support, very knowledgeble representative. Happy with camera but a bit complicated to install. Overall good product.

Reviews.Title: Very Good Camera
Reviews.Author: Zampano "Zampano"
Reviews.Content: This is a very good, inexpensive camera that works as advertised.  My only complaint is that as others have pointed out, the manual is poor.  If you are comfortable changing settings on your router, you probably won't have any trouble with it.The manual is written by someone who's native language is not English.  How hard can it be to hire someone to read through the manual and change the language so that it is clearer?The CD that comes with the camera contains an installation video.  That too, was made by someone who's native language was not English.  The video suggests using dyndns.com if you have a dynamic IP address.  The written manual says you can use a service provided by Foscam.  The written manual is correct, Foscam's service is all that you need.I installed this using a Mac and had no problems, but as I mentioned above, you really need to be comfortable changing network and router settings to get through the manual.  There is a Mac specific version of the manual that contains Windows screen shots and it talks about Windows 7 and Vista!I hope their technical support is good, because some people will need it!

Reviews.Title: foscam customer service
Reviews.Author: xrider
Reviews.Content: had an issueb to set up my camera . spoke with Andrew HE REMOTELY ACCESS MY COMPUTER AND HELPED TO SET UP THE CAMERA FOR ME . Did a Great job for me,I like the paning feature , the motion dection recording, the picture quality as well.

Reviews.Title: Great Service
Reviews.Author: D.Breazile
Reviews.Content: I called tech support for help with wireless and they did a wonderful job fixing me up.VERY happy with the Camera and the Tech people

Reviews.Title: Nice
Reviews.Author: Clement
Reviews.Content: Network setup is a bit complicated.I'm still not able to figure out how to do remote view from my iPhone yet.:(

Reviews.Title: Great little camera
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: Though setup for online viewing can be a tiny bit difficult, overall this has been a great camera for the price. Online and iPhone viewing, pretty good night vision, wireless..cant be beat for this price. Has good enough image quality during the day to see whats going on in a room. Have never been able to get the audio to work however.

Reviews.Title: Will order more
Reviews.Author: Jonathan Asencios
Reviews.Content: Camera was easy to setup, having network experience, made it a breeze. I can see it being difficult for those who are not network or tech savvy. But I thought the quick setup guide was pretty thorough.  After 5 minutes, we were up and running. We're using this as a puppy cam.Likes:Easy to setup for those familiar with port forwarding and advanced configsPan/TiltNightvision2-Way CommunicationPackaged well and like the CAT5 cable it comes withWorks well with Android App "IP Cam Viewer"Dislikes:Web interface looks bland, oldBox states Wireless N, clearly the device I have, does NOT support Wireless N. Luckily it's something I don't mindPresets don't seem to save for me, after reboot, have to calibrate again.All in all, I would purchase another one, or another smaller profile FOSCAM.

Reviews.Title: great value
Reviews.Author: Jonathan D. Myers
Reviews.Content: The camera works great...just installed it in my outbuilding as a security measure.  The only thing I disliked about this product was that the initial setup was pretty tricky.  The instructions were decent, but not great.  I was actually suprised when I successfully configured it because it required a lot of tinkering.  I agree with the other reviews...the IP Cam Viewer by Chou is the best...I tried 2 free ones and one that I bought and they all stunk.  The IP Cam app is far superior.  Overall, this is a great buy...I'm very pleased and would buy again.

Reviews.Title: It works.
Reviews.Author: Sparky
Reviews.Content: I bought three of these cameras and I'm about to buy a fourth.  These cameras work flawlessly and an excellent buy for the price.  For mobile monitoring I use IP Cam Viewer Pro for the Android by Robert Chou.  You can get the same app for the iPhone.  I also use the Blue Iris Pro program with a dedicated PC for motion sensing all cameras with email image alerts.

Reviews.Title: FOSCAM FI8910W REVIEW
Reviews.Author: R. E. Downs "RED"
Reviews.Content: Last week I received a dual pack FOSCAM FI8910W's that I ordered through AMASON.The Foscam FI890W is a wireless (802.11 B/G/N) network camera that is packed with features normallyfound in more expensive IP cameras.It has pan and tilt capabilities which means that instead of having a fixed view in one direction likesome of the other cameras, you can pan and tilt it so that you can see what you need within a 300 degreerange and 120 degree tilt angle.  Minor con here is there is no zoom feature, which would be nice to have,but not a necessity. One other observation is that the motor drive is extremely smooth and quiet.Next, it has night vision provided by a dozen IR LEDs that provide up to 25 feet of night vision. I triedthis and it works quite well and is much better than several other cameras I have worked with in the past.Camera placement is also a factor to consider especially if your neighbor has bright outside lights.It should be noted that the camera has a resolution of 640×480 which at first I considered a possible con.But I found the picture quality quite good even in full screen mode. The camera appears to employ goodquality optics for this price range.The FI8910W also allows for motion detection, and is very simple to use and setup. It is triggered byanything that moves in the cameras field of vision.  This could be a con for some users as some may wantto select specific areas to monitor motion or set up a higher motion range so that the family dog does nottrigger the device. This can be overcome by using other monitor software such as iSpy.The camera has two-way communication capabilities through a built in microphone and speaker. The soundquality is good from the camera speaker. Con here is when speaking using the built in microphone is very weak.You may want to add a quality microphone or speaker utilizing the built in mic/spkr jacks located on the back ofthe unit to improve sound and voice quality.You can do remote viewing via a web page or an app for your iPhone or Android phone. To test this, I used mySamsung Galaxy Note and a free app called Foscam Remote which worked well. There are many other apps out therethat work as well.For sound, motion or both you may setup the supplied software to send an e-mail alert. It supports sending ane-mail with pictures and IP address of the device which, if clicked on opens your web browser to view devicein real time even on your phone.If you need to view the camera outside your network via a web browser, you will have to setup port forwardingon your router so you can locate the camera via your WAN's IP address. If your WAN does not provide or havea static IP address, I used no-ip.org to track my dynamic IP address because it was free and dyndns.org is nolonger providing free accounts.Set up is easy for someone who has experience with this type of camera to set it up on a network and make itwork outside your network via a web browser. Novice users may find themselves at a slight disadvantage, butshould be able to get up and running by utilizing the provided software and documentation. If not, then there isplenty of documentation and videos located on their website that should be able to help. YouTube has many videos also.The best thing about this camera was the price. You get all of this for less than $200 (double pack).  That's agreat price for a two camera bundle that has so many capabilities.Take a long hard look at the Foscam FI8910W.  It is a very capable camera when compared to other cameras in its pricerange that is relatively easy to set up and use. From a cost and performance standpoint, it may well be hard to beat.I plan to buy several more in the near future to complete my system.

Reviews.Title: Very good. Just ordered 2 more.
Reviews.Author: JeffL
Reviews.Content: Setup was not bad. Very nice to be able to watch kids in basement and main tv room. Used when we went on vacation for peace of mind. Had to exchange 1 camera since speaker didn't work. But the speakers are pretty small and not sure how much i'll be using the talk feature anyway. Great night vision.

Reviews.Title: Great nite/day image, but difficult to configure
Reviews.Author: Louis Checo
Reviews.Content: This is a very good IP camera with very good picture quality.  However, for an outdoor camera, the design is kind of bulky and the plastic base kind of look like a crane lifting a capsule.  Also, you need to have some technical knowledge to be able to configure the camera properly and you must assign the camera a static IP address, instead of dynamic.  Finally, in order to continue using the email notification server and other online features, you must pay a fee, after two years.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Jess V.
Reviews.Content: We purchased this camera to use with our Android phones as a baby monitor and, while we don't yet have the baby, practicing with the camera has gone great.With the app, IP Cam Viewer, it works great, and we can move the camera as needed. The infrared works great in the dark and it picks up sound well, so we'll be able to hear baby. When I use the app, it seems slightly time delayed, but I still think it works well.My husband is good at setting up this sort of technology, and his assessment is that it's at an intermediate level of ease.

Reviews.Title: Good, but Can Be Complicated!
Reviews.Author: Robert145
Reviews.Content: This product can be quite complicated. It is NOT plug & play. There are many configuration options. The software requires extensive knowledge of settings and the language that goes with knowing Wireless Routers, HTTP, FTP Servers, WEB Servers, IP configurations. The Quick Start Guide is somewhat of a tongue-in-cheek, poorly translated-to-english, not easy to follow version of an originally Asian/China written guide. Grammar, wording & sequencing are a bit odd. I have seen this many times before, so reading between the lines is necessary.  I have written & currently support multiple company web sites & maintain a Windows 2008 R2 network for a company of 35, so Im somewhat familiar with what it takes. If you want to record activity from installed cameras, logic says you need to move or copy those recordings "off premises" to be reviewed later. Why? Because if your property is being stolen or destroyed, so are the recordings if they are only being stored locally, on premises on a computer in the house or office. Its like any good backup. So an FTP off-site or "cloud" is necessary to protect your files. If your just using the cameras to monitor rooms, or family activity, they would be fine. Read and take your time or you will find yourself being overwhelmed by technology. You will find trial & error the norm.

Reviews.Title: It works OK
Reviews.Author: Jeremy Ridge
Reviews.Content: If you are not very computer savvy this can be very difficult to install.  The directions it comes with are not good.  Fortunately I was able to find some videos on YouTube that better explained how to set it up.

Reviews.Title: Good cam
Reviews.Author: J
Reviews.Content: I have this one mounted above my front door facing down stairs, I was happy with the previous version of this camera and this one is good also, I would like it to have a few more ir lights but otherwise has been reliable. Once you get the setup done for one foscam the others are easy, it's the first one that can be technically challenging. It send me emails with pictures when motion is detected, can be setup for Internet access but I have no need for that.

Reviews.Title: Works great on Linksys router with iCam on iPhone/iPad and iServer on our MacMini
Reviews.Author: OlafVA
Reviews.Content: Foscam software worked OK, even with sound on iPhones and iPads, but only displayed 1 camera per ip adress requiring 4 remote ip windows to access our 4 Foscam cameras (very inefficient). Much better was when weswitched to the iCam App on iPads and iPhones which displays 4 cameras on one screen which enlarges and controls with a simple finger swipe (up/down, left/right, start record, alert etc) all with full sound. ICam cost wasonly $4.99 (shared by our iPads & iPhones. Suggest using the 192.168.x.x adresses rather than assigned iPadress for setup which allows you to keep the same external IP address for access anywhere in the world evenif there's a camera power loss requiring reset (no reconfiguring required). Love the iCam app that quickly bringsup the 4 cameras with one touch of the finger almost immediately without fiddling with 4 usernames and 4 passwords etc as required in the Foscam software, yet has an added level of access security over the Foscam software. All in all Foscam cameras with Macs and iCam is a great combination, hard to beat!I have 3 other black cameras just like the white one above. Here's my review of them:Excellent camera (have 4), especially using the Apple iCam app on our iPhones and iPads (one-time cost of $4.99 for all devices. sound quality great as well as all controls on iCam with just the swipe of a finger. We run iCamSource on our MacMini which has plenty of horsepower for our 4 cameras, webserver, VOIP telephones as well as pump music to wireless speakers around our home. There are some tips/tricks I discuss in my previous review.  All in all the careras are great and hard to beat and a great combination with iCam/iSource on iPhones-iPads/MacMini. Our configuration with iCam seems much more efficient (perhaps 4x less drain on CPU) than using the FosCam access software on iPhones and iPads, much easier to use (1 touch away) and control (one swipe). ICam also presents images of all 4 cameras on one screen so when you pick 1 of 4 it enlarges that camera to full screen with the sound and allowing full control with a finger swipe (LR-UD), record or alert.

Reviews.Title: happy with the camera
Reviews.Author: Paul T. Cruz
Reviews.Content: bought this camera to monitor our home when away on vacation. Happy with the view at night. only problem is I can't get the audio to work , even after downloading and installing the plugin.  wasn't able to find an answer that will fix this problem.  otherwise I would have given it a 5 stars

Reviews.Title: Works as advertized
Reviews.Author: Marshal
Reviews.Content: Very impressed with ease of installation and the quality of the picture.  I can view on PC, iPhone, iPad or any where from the internet.  I recommend a dedicated IP address installation with unique port address (88), Saves a potential loss of connection if the router resets.

Reviews.Title: Very unreliable
Reviews.Author: Megster
Reviews.Content: I thought this was the coolest camera since it could be accessed if I was out of my home. Not true. Only works on wifi- but it keeps dropping the wireless signal even when we are home. Set up is bloody painful and not as easy as described. I passed my return window on this one else it would have been returned as its very frustrating to use. I dont recommend this as a baby-cam.

Reviews.Title: Great camera...for the price!
Reviews.Author: Spoony

logTag.type = "text/javascript"; logTag.src = "/gp/customer-media/du/log.html?ie=UTF8&p=CustomerImage&s=CustomerVideoPlay"; head[0].appendChild(logTag); } if (cv_mo2KEQM3MLW1L9BcurrentClick) { return cv_mo2KEQM3MLW1L9BcurrentClick(); } } } Length:: 0:52 Minsi just got mine and set it up. it definitely is NOT a plug-n-play camera. after using the helpful videos (awesome explanations) from the companies website, setting it up was a breeze (but having just the slightest insight in how your home network functions will definitely help). over all a really good camera for the price.i have an all mac network, down to the airport extreme. which means its a plus and a minus. it was definitely a good thing when it came to the set up videos. they guy gave brief but thorough explanations and went through set up in more than one type of gateway/router. the downside to using a mac is there is no audio when viewing camera online. however if you use foscams mobile app you get full control of all functions plus the two-way audio feature. the down side to the app is that it cost $6. as a busy person if you just need to view cam through a mobile device then it is perfect and well worth the price.the only other thing, it's smaller than what i thought. which is a good surprise it sets up anywhere the power cord can reach.*UPDATE* the very next day i caught the exterminator rummaging through our pill cabinet. great quality picture and sensitive microphone. well worth the investment. comparable cameras sell for $250 and up*UPDATE* it's been a few months. and i moved to a different place. the camera has held up good. remembering what i learn about port forwarding from the initial installation, made setting up the camera fairly simple. i moved it from the ceiling to the top of the lampshade on an end table, its so out in the open people hardly ever notice it. i only have the one, but i plan on buying a few more and possibly purchasing the blue iris software to see how the whole system works. the picture is good and microphone isn't the best but for the price it's great.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, alright sound
Reviews.Author: Anthony
Reviews.Content: I'm using this as a baby monitor and it works pretty good.  Video over wi-fi is as I would expect.  Seems to be very stable.  The only thing that could be improved is the sound.  When listening it is somewhat choppy at times but gets the job done.  If you try to announce over the camera's actual speaker the volume is very low and cuts in and out.  Not useful for that.  But, overall, good cam.

Reviews.Title: I love this Foscam camera and the support is awesome as well!
Reviews.Author: Movie mom
Reviews.Content: I bought one camera, and with the help of their support, had it up and running very quickly.I loved it so much I bought another one the very same day. When it arrived, I called support again to get it installed and they were very quick and efficient once again. You don't have to have any technical background to install these with their help. This had been a big reason why I waited so long to install a security system. I wish I had known how great they were - I would have done it sooner! I read earlier reviews and saw others felt that way so I took the chance.  I HIGHLY recommend this product and their support.  I would buy more in a second!

Reviews.Title: Happy so far
Reviews.Author: Bruce P. Woodward
Reviews.Content: Works well with apps on Mac and iPhone but does not have audio in any browser except IE and this is not what the Foscam Literature says. Great when bought on sale for $70.

Reviews.Title: Great piece of equipment
Reviews.Author: Jake
Reviews.Content: I love it - for the price - quality and support you will not get a better product on the market

Reviews.Title: Dont waste your time & money!
Reviews.Author: dennis palo
Reviews.Content: Bought this cam few weeks ago. Instructions are sooo complicated & the cd that comes with it are useless!!!! I don't know how in the world they got 4 stars!

Reviews.Title: Fantastic camera for the price
Reviews.Author: John B
Reviews.Content: Plus:Item easy to setupItem works well in darkitem works as describedGood picture for size and priceCons:you really need a outside program like blue iris or similar to make it really effective..would buy more of these

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: cpdp
Reviews.Content: Just finished getting the camera setup. Like most people have said, the picture quality is very good considering the price I paid for this camera. Very solid build quality and I love that the motor is SUPER silent. I must agree that it's not the easiest camera to get fully setup but mind you, it wasn't as difficult as some other people stated either. If you want great instructions on getting it setup, look on YouTube for videos from awkwardhamster.....his videos really helped. I would definitely recommend!!

Reviews.Title: Excellent baby monitor!
Reviews.Author: Danial Clements
Reviews.Content: This is one of the best finds on Amazon.  My wife and I use this to keep an eye on our 11 month old while sleeping.  Using apps from the Apple App Store (and I'm sure they're on Android as well) we can connect flawlessly and see our son.  The camera supports full pan and tilt, tilting from 12:00 to about 4:00 and I believe it will make a full 360 turn, or close to it.The initial setup is done via ethernet to setup user accounts and network settings.  After adding it to your wifi network, it will always connect when the power is disconnected.The IR lights are powerful enough to see in complete darkness clearly and the automatic sensor will turn them off when there is enough light in the room.  The IR LEDs switching on and off can be a bit loud, especially in twilight conditions while the camera struggles to find the best lighting however this can be turned off.The software also supports user accounts and group security which is nice if you need to grant view only or operator access to someone.I do wish the power cord was a bit longer, roughly 5-6 feet or so.Overall, great security camera or baby monitor, would certainly buy again without hesitation.

Reviews.Title: Excellent camera and service
Reviews.Author: Marc G
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera for my business to oversee the operations when I'm gone.  Set up was verily easy, however I needed support to set up remote login from my other devices.  I called Foscam support and within an hour they had me up and running.  Installing the cameras in my stores has now given me peace of mind and the flexibility to leave and still oversee.I would definitely recommend for business and home!

Reviews.Title: Works perfectly - Hard to set up tho
Reviews.Author: T. Willms
Reviews.Content: This camera works perfectly. The picture quality is amazing for an inexpensive device like this. Wish there were more iPhone apps for free though. It was not easy to set up. A non tech savvy person might encounter problems.

Reviews.Title: TECHNICAL SUPPORT
Reviews.Author: Joseph Carcione
Reviews.Content: I had some difficulty with loading the software but I call Foscam support and they were very helpful in getting me set up including port forwarding. I would also point out that I am not great with technology so someone with more skills then me will probably do fine. The camera works great with a very clear picture.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Samd
Reviews.Content: I was having difficulty in setting up my port forwarding, Tech support (Ralph Mendez) was a great help in getting me in the right direction. I am very satisfied with the support and product. This is my first camera and I hope that everything will go as easy as the setup. I can always call Ralph again if I need help.Update...When the service tech Ralph, set up my camera remotely he set it up "unsecured" I called later and reached another tech. He was rude and seemed bothered to help me. He fixed the problem but it only works sporatically now.. UGH!

Reviews.Title: Great product for the money - easy to get video working
Reviews.Author: Scanman "rayscanlan"
Reviews.Content: I was hesistant to buy this camera given the difficulty some seemed to have getting it running.  I was able to get it up and running very easily, and I'm no computer expert.  I did not try to get the audio working as I don't need it.  Picture quality is great in both daylight and darkness.

Reviews.Title: Not the best resolution
Reviews.Author: Brandon R Geer
Reviews.Content: Not super HD but I can't complain for the price. It sayys it's indoor only but I mounted by my front door in the freezing temps of Colorado and it fairs fine. The picture is good enough to recognize peoples faces at night and day and keeps an eye on my front door and driveway. The night quality is amazing. If you're looking for home surveillance cameras look no further! It also has 2 way audio which is cool.

Reviews.Title: The wireless is bugged, and support doesn't get back to you.
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer "Evan Carroll"
Reviews.Content: This camera has great video quality and sound quality. Unfortunately, it has too many bugs in my opinion to be ready for prime-time.Firstly, the web interface of Foscam.com does not permit you to download the drivers for the camera. This is highly annoying. You provide your e-mail address, and then you get an e-mail from Foscam with the links to download the drivers. Go to Foscam.com and hit downloads on the right. To make matters even worse, my camera shipped with firmware version "11.37.2.48." This is disappointing to me because after giving my e-mail to them the download link they sent back was for "11.37.2.46" -- two iterations the predecessor to what the camera shipped with. That means that they don't update the download links and that the camera is effectively unsupported from the manufacture. I'm suspicious that this is part of the Foscam game: cheap disposable cameras that are primarily changed in just firmware. It doesn't seem like from the reviews there is much of a difference between the 8910W and the 8918W. And, on that note, who seriously decrements the model number when update the model?Foscam marketing, and support: 1.So, why would I care about the firmware anyway? Well, turns out Foscam models have a long standing issue with WPA2 and AES. Not sure why, or what the problem is. It's all closed-source proprietary trash from China, but the problem is there. Just search the internet for "wpa2 + aes + foscam".Q/A: 2Now onto what most people care about, if you wire the camera up to a router you'll get pretty good performance and control out of it. The colors are decent and the I/R is pretty reasonable too.Picture quality: 4Still can't recommend this camera. It comes with a bunch of features but the ones that I'd find useful it does very poorly. It's reminiscent of a first-generation LG product from 2005.

Reviews.Title: always monitoring
Reviews.Author: Robert Leach
Reviews.Content: Utilizing for my new puppies growing while I'm at work...lets me know when any movement is happening...would have rated five but overlooked the new cameras having new video formats

Reviews.Title: Works like they say - except can't get it to go wireless!
Reviews.Author: E. Solch
Reviews.Content: I bought 2 of these, use them in my garage to track critters like possums and raccoons. I configured them like described in the users manuals, and was unable to get them to go into and stay in wireless mode. So they are hard wired from the router I'm using, which is OK given my application. If I were buying them to be totally wireless I would be returning them for a refund.

Reviews.Title: Great bargain and nice functionality
Reviews.Author: Jim W. McCloud
Reviews.Content: Worked as advertised.  A bit difficult to setup, but I was able to watch a YouTube video on setting up an external IP address.  Once I got that far, all was good.

Reviews.Title: Support from Calvin
Reviews.Author: Gregory Hans
Reviews.Content: I had everything set up.  It was complicated for a simi technical geek like myself, but there are a few links online that helped with my Apple network.  I changed my network and Calvin at Foscam helped me out.  Not sure what happened, but the fix was simply letting the camera turned off for a month and then call Foscam, they remote in and everything is working.... oops for one day and then I had to call back.  We shall see what happens next.

Reviews.Title: Works well
Reviews.Author: Donald Hohman
Reviews.Content: The movement of the panning is slow at best when turning it one angle at a time.  This could be improved on. Good value for the price.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera... better service!!!
Reviews.Author: santisamurai
Reviews.Content: So I consider myself a bit of a computer geek. So when my camera was having some issues with working past 5 feet from the router I thought it was a defective product. However, before returning the camera I decided to give the people at foscam a call to see if they could fix it. If you're a techy calling a tech support line can be torture because most of the time you know more than the guy on the other side of the line. However, I was very impressed by the service I received. Not only was my tech knowledgeable he also fixed the issue in less than 10 minutes. BTW if you wanted to know how to fix the range issue or at least what worked for me try switching the port of the camera to 8090 vs something like 88 or leaving it at 80. This tech was so good I think I'm in the market for another camera! Thanks a lot foscam you guys rock!!!
