The motion detect feature is spotty, too sensitive or not enough. Camera does not remember its last position and has to be repositioned each time it is repowered.Despite these weaknesses, it does the job well.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera - Great Customer service!
Reviews.Author: Kelly
Reviews.Content: Ordered the Foscam and absolutely loved it but had problems connecting remotely.  I called Foscam's customer support and the problem was resolved quickly by Calvin Harris.  I ordered this camera because of all the great reviews and after having my issue resolved will consider buying more!Just received my second camera.  As I am technically challenged I had to call Foscam again because I was unable to connect the camera remotely.  Once again their customer service was excellent.  My call was answered immediately by Sandra Williams and she was able to get my camera remotely connected in no time.The technicians did ask if I was satisfied with their service and I was - very happy.  No waiting and quick resolution - heck yes I was! They did ask that I mention them in my review and I certainly do not have a problem doing so.Love the camera and along with my experience with their techinical support would recommend the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Impressive for the money
Reviews.Author: M. Cotten
Reviews.Content: Got a deal on Amazon, wish I had bought more at the low price. This camera works very well. Color reproduction is pretty accurate and the night vision works well too. The pan and tilt is smooth and quiet when using the audio feature. The speaker could be louder but can plug in a remote speaker to increase the volume. Be aware that you will need a static IP address if you want to view over the Internet. Was super easy to setup, took all of 5 minutes to have working in my local LAN. A bit more work to see on Internet but worth the trouble. I plan to by more.

Reviews.Title: Great customer service
Reviews.Author: Catherine Sun "csun"
Reviews.Content: It's a tricky install but a very promising product from what I've seen so far! I had a hard time figuring out port-forwarding for Apple Time Capsule with the current Airport Utility 6.x but called Foscam's Customer Service and Judy Rose did a fantastic job of getting it set-up quickly for me!Especially nice so far is the super-easy sync with the Foscam iPad app.

Reviews.Title: baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Janusz
Reviews.Content: Perfect baby monitor, visible from work, abroad etc and from most devices including i-anything, android, PCs etc.I strongly recommend the product.

Reviews.Title: Terrific for the money
Reviews.Author: fampi
Reviews.Content: Originally purchased one of these cameras which I use at home.  It operated for one week but then went out.  I thought it was the camera.  It wasn't.  It was my internet server.  Anyway, I ordered a replacement, it arrived and I ended up keeping both cameras.  The remote works like a charm which is what I need when away from home, the infrared gives me the ability to see the rooms at night in the dark and overall, the price is terrific for what you get.  I would highly recommend it.  I believe the key is to find the free application for nanny cams that would work best with this unit, at no additional fee.  Again, I would highly recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Great/Affordable Cameras
Reviews.Author: B. Leatherman
Reviews.Content: I purchased three of these camera's at a great price on Amazon. I had mediocre expectations based on the price, but after using them for several weeks I could not be happier.  I  use them on my iPhone to monitor the house when we are away, and one is setup in the baby's room as a monitor.  We just login to the web interface and leave it running for great video and audio quality while the baby is sleeping.  The IR is outstanding, and turns a completely dark room into a room that is well illuminated on video, with only the dim red glow of the LED's which is barely noticeable.I downloaded free software, Camera Viewer Pro, which will run in the background of my computer and records video (constantly or motion detected) to the hard drive.  I have it set to record for 5 days and then overwrite old footage, so I can always review what is happening at the house later.I could not be happier with the camera's and intend to order several more.  Based on my experience, I will likely also purchase a couple of Foscam's outdoor camera's.

Reviews.Title: Pretty good wireless camera, at least for now.
Reviews.Author: AC
Reviews.Content: 10/27/12To sum it up, this wireless camera is pretty clear/smooth and comes with plenty of features. The hardware is a breeze to setup but adjusting the wireless network/port forwarding and such is somewhat difficult if you do not know what port forwarding is. There are step by step video guides on foscam's main website to help ease the software setup. One problem I had was trying to view the camera through Internet Explorer. There was a problem with ActiveX not being able to download, but had that fixed from googling for troubleshoot guides online. This may not be the case for you but it can happen. Overall, I am happy with the camera for now.. So here is a list of what the camera provides, from what I can remember.Features:-Theres an android app to view your camera from anywhere-Pan/tilt from a click of your mouse (view distance is almost 360)-Record function(Voice is recordable but the mic is not that great. Based on using the cameras program, you need to leave your computer on and you can only record when you view the camera through Internet Explorer. For some reason Internet Explorer have a few more options to mess with than running the camera through Chrome/Firefox/etc)-IR bright enough-Motion detector (Theres a Email function to send you photos/videos when triggered - You can also set the amount of secs the camera will record once the motion detector is triggered. There is also another function where the camera will save the video to a specific location in your computer once the motion detector is triggered)-Horizontal/Vertical patrol (You are able to set how long the camera will pan left/right and tilt up/down throughout the whole time camera is active)-Flip/Mirror-Brightness/Contrast-Able to set multiple users to view camera-Audio (not that great though, there is an in/output on the back of the camera where you can place a better mic/speaker I am assuming, have not tried it though)-Speaker (You can speak in to your computer's mic and hear it on the camera. Only works when you run the camera program through Internet Explorer)-Third party programs to run the camera (I have not tried this but you may have to pay for some of them after a trial, the programs are listed on their main website)I am going to purchase another and add on to this another review if any problems come up.Good luck with your purchases!

Reviews.Title: A great little camera
Reviews.Author: West Coast Reviewer
Reviews.Content: I am new to the iPhone and a friend's comments about how he could monitor his house from his phone initiated my interest about this product.  I was nervous at first given some the reviewer comments about how difficult this can be to set up.  While I consider myself quite good with computers, I quickly develop a thousand yard stare when people start getting too far in to networks or router settings.  Despite the misgivings I ordered this model and it arrived in good order.  It took me about 15 minutes to be able to view it on my computer (within my own network).  Viewing it remotely on the Internet and my phone took about another 45 minutes.  Most of that time was wasted on trying to remember how to get back in to my router settings.  Once I got in to the settings, everything else was pretty much a breeze (despite having a less than desirable dynamic IP).  The two way audio didn't work right initially.  I could monitor the audio in the room but nobody could hear me on the other end.  This issue sort of just fixed itself after restarting my phone and rebooting the camera.No, I'm not a Foscam employee giving a fake 5 star review, as one previous reviewer claimed all five star raters were.  The video quality is a bit fuzzier than I expected, there's no zoom function, and the internal speaker for the two way audio stinks because the volume is so low.  If there is anyone talking in the room or a television is on, don't expect them to be able to hear you.  Despite that I'm still willing to give it a 5 star rating because it's a heck of a lot of "bang for the buck."  If I wanted something that was perfect I'd probably have had to spend a lot more money so I can't complain.  My recommendations for set up are to simply follow the instructions line by line.  That's what I did and outside of the audio problem at the beginning, it worked fine.  I definitely recommend this if you've got some decent computer proficiency.  If you've never opened your router settings before or don't understand IP settings, I can easily see someone spending hours banging their head against the wall trying to get it to work.  Best get a friend to help you out.

Reviews.Title: Tech support
Reviews.Author: cwgodfrey
Reviews.Content: The camera is more than useful, and the tech support provided is tops.It is bese used to monitor any given place from any place you may be at such as viewing your home while on vacation.The Web is always your friend.The most recent help was provided by Calvin who walked me through numerous setups and was most patient.I had the occasion to call tech support again for one more little problem.In no time the problem was solved.  Other companies should be jealous of their superior tech support.

Reviews.Title: Email settings and Alarm
Reviews.Author: sunitha reddy
Reviews.Content: I followed the instructions and the email settings worked fine within an hour of setup and i got an email alert. After that i had to move the camera to a different location and the alarm is not working. This was the same problem with the earlier one. Can someone help.Yahoo mailsmtp.mail.yahoo.com465TLSI tried testing the email settings now and it just hangs with this message "Test..."

Reviews.Title: Good until it becomes unclear
Reviews.Author: Raymond Lai
Reviews.Content: It used to be great. Quiet operations, not the cheap noisy movement like some other brands. Night vision is very good.... until recently. I didn't use it for about 2 to 3 months. When I plug it back, the screen becomes unclear. it's like a white mask or piece of very thin paper across it. I think the lens coating or lens sensor becomes badI emailed the manufacturer, see if they are willing to help..

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Chaco
Reviews.Content: I got this to monitor my koi pond because a bird was eating my fish.  Works great and I suggest installing the Vitamin D software as it records your video and tells you when things moved in the camera's viewing range.  Get product.  Easy to set up, although I did have trouble installing the wireless part.  After an hour, all it took was for me to close and reopen the camera software on my computer.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W
Reviews.Author: Psi Star
Reviews.Content: The Foscam FI8910W has both good points and bad.  The quality of the color and the night-time performace meet expectations.  The pan and tilt work reasonably well.  However, because the lens has a very wide field of view there is noticable barrel distortion in the images.The biggest disappointment is that the bi-directional audio is absolutely useless.The best part of the system, however, is that it comes with an ActiveX code module that allows me to write my own code for the camera.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Installation
Reviews.Author: Mr. Arthur Matthews
Reviews.Content: I used the Quick Installation Guide and software installation CD that came with the camera and installation videos on You Tube. I found that between the two I was able to have a painless installation. The F19910W is quite bulky and I purchased the Black one which seem to be very well made and sturdy (and weighty) in construction. This is not a web cam that you will easily hide and you need to think along the lines of disguising it's profile somehow.The cameras performance is very good and pans and tilts to the software commands very well.You can also listen to sound in it's vicinity and it has a small speaker in which you can speak through, although the level of sound is quite low.I downloaded and installed IP Cam Viewer Pro by Robert Chou both on my Ipad and also on my Android Nook. This is the icing on the cake as the software enables you to control the Web Cam very well and i highly recommend it.The price has gone up $10 since I purchased the web cam which is rather annoying as I was considering purchasing another but will wait until they are on sale.Overall a good purchase and allows us the ability to view our home when we are away and also to get email alarms if we arm the motion sensing. There is also the ability to take a snapshot and record video too. Just bear in mind this is a web cam and not a professional high quality surveillance camera. For value for money it is pretty good but it would seem they are pushing up the price.Unfortunately mine had or developed a sound problem where the sound was distorted and weak. A call to Amazon and the item was replaced. All is well with the replacement camera though it's software was not the same as that which comes with the "white model" hoping that Foscam has released the software update for the camera's UI as they said it would be available in Jan 2013. I have yet to check as yet.

Reviews.Title: Works fine for me
Reviews.Author: OZ
Reviews.Content: The setup process was straight forward if you have experience with router configuration. I didn't use their software, instead I used iSpy for Windows and IP Cam Viewer for my phone.Picture quality is good, just keep in mind it's not high def. Love the option to rotate camera in any direction and night vision is excellent.

Reviews.Title: Great, but with major flaw!
Reviews.Author: Xelloss
Reviews.Content: When I recieved the Foscam FI8910W I was excited to have found an IP camera with all these features and for such a great price. The software for the camera works great and it has all the features I needed. The only problem is the IR-CUT (the camera's ability to switch between night and day mode) is flawed. There seems to be some mechanical piece in there that changes around when things go dark to allow the camera to see in IR. My camera worked fine for about a week then stopped responding to the light in the room, permanently staying in "day" mode. I could manually switch it if I went into the software but that was about it. I went online in hopes of solving my own problem but found many people were having the same issue. It would appear this is a factory defect and not some sort of user error. I contacted Foscam's tech support and got the usual power cycle talk but that didn't fix anything. I really wish this camera fully functioned as it is a great cam except for this one flaw. If you play on keeping it in an always lit or always dark room it should work for you!

Reviews.Title: Dont buy this...erratic, unreliable and frustrating...
Reviews.Author: phil p
Reviews.Content: I have four of these cameras...each one has failed to transmit video remotely...works fine from home on wi-fi, but what's the point of that??  Their technical support used to be open 24/7 but no more...now just 8am to 8pm cst  m-f...and i am TIRED of calling (as i have had to in the past) and allow tech support to 'drive' remotely for 30 minutes at a time to fix a problem that i should supposedly be able to diagnose and fix.  Trust me, you need to be a programmer to figure out how to set this thing up properly.

Reviews.Title: Very Nice Camera for the Price
Reviews.Author: g
Reviews.Content: Motion sensor works fine, however this camera does not follow the motion.  It is a static video/camera.  The camera has to be remotely controlled to follow the action.  Resolution and picture taking are fine.  The NO-IP setup is very easy.  Solid product for the price with a two year warranty.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the value
Reviews.Author: Samblackjack
Reviews.Content: I got this camera as a video baby monitor.  It's very easy to set-up, took about 5 minutes following the included instructions.  The default web interface is easy to use, though some of the menu options are not well-explained, but easy to figure out.For night vision, keeping an eye on our sleeping baby, it works great. We use the IP Cam Viewer app and it gives us easy access to all the controls.  The red network status light and the green power adapter light are not too bright, neither are the infrared emitters around the lens, so it doesn't bother the baby.  The movements of the camera are nearly noiseless, which was something I was worrying about since our baby is very sensitive to sound.Overall, very happy with the value and performance of this camera.

Reviews.Title: Pleased with this cool camera. F8910W
Reviews.Author: Sideshow
Reviews.Content: I've had other cameras, both analog and IP for years. What sets this apart is ease of deployment. Once the setup is done, it's a breeze to unplug from the wall and carry to anywhere in the facility where you are in range of Wi-fi. Plug it back in and you are good to go. I like being able to set on a shelf or use the standard screw mount on the base. You can also mount upside down. I view using Chrome browser, IP Cam Viewer app on Android with pan/tilt controls, and via the free version of WebcamXP with recording. I'm surprised that there isn't an official Android app, but there are plenty of third party solutions. I didn't use any of the included software so I can't speak to it's quality. The hardware seems great so far. Pan and tilt are silent by the way. Only sound is a single soft click when the cam enters IR mode.

Reviews.Title: Excellent Product. Very Happy with Purchase
Reviews.Author: M. Shan
Reviews.Content: Excellent IP Camera for my need. Set it up without installing software on CD as suggested by an earlier review. Everything works perfectly. Just remember to set up a password with 12 characters or less because 12 appears to be the max length. Initially I gave a longer password without realizing it only took the first 12 chars and could not login later (the reset button at the bottom helped!). Overall, very happy with product and am considering buying a second one!

Reviews.Title: great cam for great price
Reviews.Author: Matta T. Reddy "mattr"
Reviews.Content: The goodyou can access your cam online, once installed it is very easy to use, the program that comes with it great, night vision is great too, can add multiple camaras without problem, customer service is nice, you have two way voice to talk to the people by using the camara, there are several free apps to acess your camara on i phone or android device.the badpicture quality is bad but good enough just to monitor, two way voice is good but has lot of back ground noise.you need some level of technical understanding to install it, esp when you want to access it over the internet.

Reviews.Title: Good Value - easy set-up
Reviews.Author: William
Reviews.Content: This was a hesitant purchase after reading reviews about being difficult to set-up. I have some computer literacy but am not an expert or an IT person. I set this camera up through my wireless router in less than an hour. And that includes creating a No-IP account since my IP address is not static. Maybe I was just lucky but set-up/installation was zero hassle.As for the camera, it is definitely a good value. My only real complaint is alarm/recording sensitivty. The camera is aimed at a door from a distance of maybe 10 feet. It starts recording about the time people are passing through the door, not when they first trigger motion. I tried to adjust this through alarm sensitivty but that only creates more "false" alarms and does not start recording any sooner after motion is detected.Overall, a good product and value.

Reviews.Title: it kills garage door opener, otherwise OK
Reviews.Author: daefash
Reviews.Content: Great for the price, easy to setup if you are familiar with networking, if not make sure you know someone who is. My problem is it causes interference with the garage door opener and homelink in your car, it is a common problem, google foscam and garage door interference and you will find plenty of posts.Picture is ok quality and IR works fine for like 9 feet, the problem also is Foscam charges $5 for their app, but there are free apps you can still use. Power cord is short so if you are planning to set it up more than 3 feet away from outlet get yourself an extension cord.I still haven't figured out a way to make the garage door opener work if the camera is connected to power, my camera is in the garage but not adjacent to the opener. Some posts recommend putting aluminum foil around the base of the camera, i will be trying that. I have owned it for 2 weeks now.

Reviews.Title: Great Product
Reviews.Author: Capview
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera to keep an eye on our pup while we are away.  The setup was easy, I was able to configure it on our wireless, set it up for remote viewing, and enabled the motion sensor to email me an image when triggered.  The IR feature is cool, only wish the camera had a zoom feature.  Overall a great camera for only 90 bucks.

Reviews.Title: Product and support are both great
Reviews.Author: Bill C
Reviews.Content: The wilreless camera worked great out of the box. Connecting it to the router was no problem. Although I had some problem getting it to work wirelessly. I called the Foscam support and Ralph  Mendez of their technical support team provided great assistance. It took about 15 min on call with him but now the product works well wirelessly. I'm considering purchasing another camera

Reviews.Title: Tech support
Reviews.Author: Walter
Reviews.Content: Had issue getting live video display after getting new version of IE, but Foscam Tech Support (Ralph Mendez was extremely helpful) and got me back up and working; additionally I am extremely happy with the Foscam cameras - now have four up and running and recomend these cameras to anyone interested in know what's happening around your home or business via WIFI

Reviews.Title: Good camera based on price but worst customer service
Reviews.Author: Book Keeper
Reviews.Content: Bought the camera 2 weeks ago and easy to hook up with my home nas system (Synology product).Con:- Worst customer service. Open a chat window from their web site, no one gave any reply. Just kick my chat session from customer service 3 to 1 and to 2. No single words after hello message.- Cheap camera UI (both access and config). Very non-professional interface.- When the background light in the room turns dark, the little red lights (in a circle) on the camera turns on with a switch-on sound. You are not going to hide the camera. Very noticeable.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Gary Chernega
Reviews.Content: Issue: Port Forwarding.Ricky/Foscam Support provided invaluable assistance setting up my new Foscam F18910W.  He provided the same, or better, level of support as Apple, which I consider the gold Standard of Technical Support. I will be purchasing another Foscam Camera knowing knowledgeable Support is a phone call away.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Cam
Reviews.Author: Dbibel24
Reviews.Content: Just got the camera set up and cannot wait to use it!! Sandra from Foscam Support was FANTASTIC in helping me set up the camera..even with baby crying in her ear! Thanks so much Sandra and Foscam. I am super excited about this product!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera!
Reviews.Author: Danny
Reviews.Content: This camera is what I was looking for. For the price you can't beat it. The pan/tilt  is cool and would be nicer with zoom. The night vision really impressed me it lights up everything in total darkness at a great distance. Set up wasn't to difficult, I got everything working through my computer and Android HTC EVO 4G LTE phone which is pretty cool.

Reviews.Title: Great Value for the Price
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: The camera came very quickly. I was able to set a dedicated IP address for both wired and wireless connections since it has separate MAC addresses for each function.The booklet comes with details about setting up a FREE remote viewing domain for those who wish to remotely view when you have a dynamic IP address for your router (changes every time you reconnect with your ISP).

Reviews.Title: Amazing product for the price
Reviews.Author: Benjamin Borowski "BB"
Reviews.Content: Bought this camera as a backup baby monitor and it's fab!  Piece of cake setup, lots of cool options, solid construction, great night vision, and works with many iOS (iPhone and iPad apps).  The Foscam Pro app ($5.99 in the Apple App Store) is probably the best app and worth the 6 bucks for its simplicity and seamless setup with the camera.  It allows 2-way audio (half duplex, meaning it works like a walkie-talkie -- press a button in the app to transmit, then release the button to hear regular audio.  Microphone on the camera is super sensitive and great for monitoring the baby from any room in the house.  Allowing outside access through a home firewall might be tricky for the some users, but with phone support (which I've read is good but haven't used myself) and a little practice it should be pretty easy (we configured it through an Apple Airport Extreme in about 10 minutes).

Reviews.Title: Color is way better than the previous model issues still remain
Reviews.Author: Awesome Bill from Dawsonville
Reviews.Content: Other than much better daytime color, the image resolution and audio quality seem to be the same.  Video is resolution is ok.  The audio is not reliable at least over my connections, which is a broadband internet connection for Ohio and California.  Delays and audio feedback make two way communication unreliable unless you enable and disable the mic like a walkie talkie and talk in short bursts.  Less than 10 seconds seems fine.  Beyond that  I get a feedback loop and out of sync weirdness that make me sound like Max Headroom.  I've tried external directional mics and external speakers on the cameras and PCs used to view the video and hear the audio.  And I've tried adjusting volumes and moving mics and speakers up to 10 feet apart.  What I was hoping for was to use these cameras to provide a continuous audio and video link between Cincinnati and San Francisco.  With Audio limited to short bursts it comes up short.  It does seem to work fine to leave 1 way audio enabled from one location or the other.  Maybe an adjustment for mic sensitivity in the camera would do the trick.  All in all I'm happy with these cameras.  HD video and reliable two way, always on audio would be awesome.

Reviews.Title: Terrible
Reviews.Author: Deidre
Reviews.Content: First of all, this is next to impossible to accurately setup. You shouldn't need so many third-party websites to make a good product work. Secondly, the camera itself is bulky and the quality isn't that great. I should have spent the extra $80 and gotten a DropCam immediately- which is what I will do now.

Reviews.Title: Great for the money!
Reviews.Author: John Hoang
Reviews.Content: After reading all the positive reviews, I went ahead and ordered this camera. It took about 30-45 minutes to setup and configure the camera to be able to work on the WAN. The iphone app is great too! It has so many great features such as auto email on motion detection, color and auto switch to infrared, built in speaker and mic, pan and tilt. For the price I don't think you can find a better product.

Reviews.Title: Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Ronald D. Ross
Reviews.Content: This is a first class product with outstanding tech support.  Written instruction are missing some important information such as the Share Key is the password to your router.  I had to call their support to find that out, however they answered immediately and gave me the answer.  When I asked for help setting up iPhone & iPad access, they very politely asked if another tech could call me back in less than 1 hour.  Call back was less than 5 minutes later.  If you want iPad access to the camera you will have to let them remote access your computer.  Steve Jobs could not do it on his own.  It took about 20 minutes with remote access to link my ipad and phone, plus a $6 optional app download to make it work.  It was worth the effort and a 5 star effort by Foscam. I am buying more which is the best recommendation I can give.  I  run 16 Panasonic IP cameras that are very good, but I like this Foscam 3 times better because it cost 3 times less than the Panasonics and is actually more flexable.

Reviews.Title: cool gadget that put a smile on my girlfriends face
Reviews.Author: MikE
Reviews.Content: I'm happy with my purchase. Caught a good lightning deal on it yesterday. Wired setup wasn't that difficult using advice from other reviewers. Didn't even use the cd. Have not tried wireless yet so can't report on that although I hear alot of people having problems with it. Still didn't deter me from buying. Using IP Cam viewer on android phoneto view remotely. Had to do a couple force stops but still not a concern for me. Will investigate to find cause. All in all I don't think there is anything out there that has this many features for the buck. Another plus was learning some basic networking so I don't fear it anymore. Very few and simple changes to router and camera to make it reliable i.e static lan ip, take lan ip out of pool, have camera email you new wan if it changes. Infrared shuts off when lights come on. Remote control from phone. May step up to the paid app which adds audio down the road. Cool toy for me to tinker with and learn.Update 1: Just be forewarned that the audio is distorted and pretty much unusable. Still not a show stopper for me but figured I'd pass this on for someone using it as a baby monitor. I had the same issue on a $125 cisco/linksys ip camera i tried a year or 2 ago. Heard it could be several causes which i'll investigate but even if it doesn't work i'll still keep it. Heard i may not have this issue using the android app but you have to pay for that feature. Report back if I discover a fix.Update 2:Thanks for the heads up on the audio. I just discovered the same thing this morning - "enable and disable the mic like a walkie talkie". Think it's probably software related. Maybe why they sell the blue iris software as an accessory. See if I can find some reports about if using the blue iris software eliminates the problem. You saved me some time by testing with external mics and speakers. Thank You. Have not tried the audio on my phone yet as it would require me to pay for the app - IP Cam viewer by Robert Chou. Please report back if you come up with a solution and I'll do the same.Posted the above comment to another reviewer who delved deeper. Appears all is not lost for the audio. May take this into the discussion section. I tested this morning from my pc at work. The camera is right next to my pc at home so I think that is why i have more issues at home with feedback.

Reviews.Title: Incomplete instructions, but fantastic camera once it's set up
Reviews.Author: Ed B.
Reviews.Content: I ran into the same WIFI problems that most reviewers seem to have had here. But after doing some searching online i found what was causing me the headache. The camera would show up on my LAN when being plugged in with the ethernet cable, but would not show up once i switched to wifi mode. I was using MAC id protection on my router and i enabled the MAC id that the setup tool showed me. However this is NOT the MAC id you should use in your wifi router settings. Instead look at the small sticker at the bottom of the camera. There are two stickers with each a different MAC id. Use the smallest one that differs from the one you see in the setup tool. It's actually so small that you might even need a magnifying glass... But it instantly solved my problem once i used this MAC id in my router settings. The camera showed up on my wifi LAN and worked perfectly right after that.However I can understand that people that don't have a basic knowledge of setting up a router might have a bit of a hard time getting wifi to work. I was annoyed too that i couldn't figure it out although i have plenty of experience and was convinced that i wasn't doing anything wrong. Too bad it's not made more clear that you need the second small MAC id that you can only find on the bottom of the camera. Unless i overlooked that part in the manual. It's actually so small that i didn't even notice it at first.Anyway, the camera's image is super crisp and clear. It even has a small manual focus ring on the front to adjust it if your subject might be a bit out of focus. It's great to have the audio/mic option as well, it's a bit hard to hear but at least it let's you hook up external mic or speakers if you wish to. The viewing angle of the lens is nice wide and the pan and tilt range is great as well. The default antenna has good reception. I can put the camera several rooms away or even a floor down from where my router is and still there is no drop in signal or image quality. I was expecting a lot of interference problems due to the large amount of different WIFI networks around my house, but this is not causing any problems as long you make sure you're router is broadcasting on a different channel than the other networks.I managed to set things up to work with my (Apple Mac) computer, iPad and android phone. So far i'm using the "IP Cam Viewer" app.I set up the camera for remote access through a dyndns service so i can always find the camera when i'm away from home.It's great to see a wall mount plus screws are included as well. I thought i would have to order a seperate mount kit but i was surprised that it was included although it wasn't mentioned anywhere as far as i know. the only problem was that the CD-ROM with the installation software was broken (inside a undamaged box... go figure...) But the setup tool can be downloaded from the Foscam site so that wasn't a big deal for me.Overall i must say i am really happy with this camera and the features that it offers for a really affordable price. I would recommend this product to everyone that has some basic knowledge of setting up a WIFI LAN and wireless devices. You can't beat the value of this product. I don't know if a lot of positive reviews on Amazon are fake, but i can guarantee you that i am not affiliated with Foscam in any way and i believe this is a great product! I will probably order another one soon. But first i need to dig a little bit deeper in the motion detection, email and FTP features that this camera offers. Great stuff :D

Reviews.Title: Defective Unit - No Wifi connectivity
Reviews.Author: George Baker
Reviews.Content: First product received.  Works great when connected via ethernet cable to router.  Enabled UPnP and assigned a port number (never did that before, and still not knowledgeable about it), got my external IP address from WhatIsMyIP.com, and thus able to access camera over internet from Android tablet (google nexus 7 running Chrome) and iPhone 4 (running Safari).Problem = unable to connect via Wifi.  After several tries, an email exchange with Foscam, plus an hour online with Foscam support, they determined it was likely hardware failure and suggested returning it.So...hopefully the replacement works via Wifi and I can update this review.

Reviews.Title: support
Reviews.Author: Richard
Reviews.Content: Support was great.  Ralph Mendez dida great job getting the camera  up and operational.  Picture quality after installation was very good.  Will update review after further experience with camera.

Reviews.Title: foscam customer support
Reviews.Author: Mr.Larry
Reviews.Content: was unable to view my cam remotly .. spoke with harry foster he was able to make the cam work remotly he was very quickly without any ease ...i love the pan tilt which allows me the view which i do require

Reviews.Title: Very nice camera with excellent support
Reviews.Author: R. McMahon
Reviews.Content: Had trouble setting up port forwarding on my router so I gave Foscam a call and Sandra got me a straightened out withing minutes! Great customer support and so far love the camera

Reviews.Title: Don't buy!
Reviews.Author: donteGT
Reviews.Content: I wish there was a no star rating!This is a real customer with a real review, got this item installed the CD and follow the instruction in the poorly written install manual, launched the app to get an empty window it apparently could not find the device for configuration, logged into my router, got the addressees logged in to the device an started to configure using the crappy UI. in the middle of my configuration the device rebooted and i didn't even press save! it has since gone into a reboot loop and is totally unusable. I wanted this device to work for me but it really turned out to be a total nightmare! also these guys doesn't respond to legitimate customer's emails i tried!!! I feel cheated out of my hard working money, And I am Done! I want a refund! This sucks in every way!

Reviews.Title: Great Customer support!!!
Reviews.Author: Beauski
Reviews.Content: I called Foscam to get help setting up my wifi connection. I was connected with Ralph Mendez and he was AMAZING he help me set up my wifi on my computer and my mobile device. I will be buying more items for this great company all service all the time.If you are looking for a great quality camera that is very user friendly i would highly recommend this company. THANKS Foscam!!!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W Delivers
Reviews.Author: Jack
Reviews.Content: We installed this IP camera to monitor a vacation home. We have Macbook Airs so the cd was of no use. Installation required a call to our tech friend who'd installed one for his house, with his help we were up and running. We have had to change motion sensitivity to reduce email alerts because of shadow movement. We added software to our phones and can now watch from anywhere. I paid a few dollars more to get full warranty and support, used a link from the Foscam website to place the order via Amazon. I'd like to know why warranty is an issue depending on where it's bought.I'm going to order another so I can watch the snow falling this winter while I'm enjoying warm weather at the other place.

Reviews.Title: Good cheap monitor camera
Reviews.Author: A. Koenig
Reviews.Content: The Foscam FI8910W does a good job of simple monitoring. Not for critical applications, but for monitoring a grandmother or baby - it's great! I am using two of these cameras right now.SetupNot easy to set the camera up to the WiFi and get all the settings right. Honestly I don't think ANY WiFi camera would be easy given all that you ask it, but don't think it will be easy for the novice. I wanted to access the camera from the open internet so needed to fix it's IP address and do some Port Mapping with my router - don't know what that means? Not the fault of the camera, it's just complicated and the software of the camera doesn't help. Once it is set up, it seems stable.Ease of UseThe camera has a built in web interface. Really bad and simplistic. I think another reviewer said it was made in 1989. Probably right ;) HOWEVER, I access it with an iPad app (Foscan Pro: Two Way Audio and Recording) and it is great! Has motion sensing, control, audio, etc. The app is not great, but better than the other ones I have tried. That plus the camera and I've got a system that we use 24/7 with two or more cameras. Sort of (read about stability).StabilityOne reason I don't think the Foscam is for professional monitoring is that it gets lost every-so-often. It acts like it goes through a reset and a boot up. So if you are in the room and watching or listening to the motion sensing, then you will catch it and re-aim it. If not, you come back and the camera is staring at the ceiling.I have one camera that takes it one step further and crashes. It crashes about once a day - no response at all and I need to go and unplug and replug it in to get it back to normal. The warrantee claims two years and I am going to send it back for a replacement - but when you go to the Foscam website they offer no support if you didn't buy it from them - correction, the Foscam website was also built in 1989 and by folks that don't know about customer service, so maybe you can get help - I gave up.Amazon has issues me an RMA so I will be a happy camper.All-in-all I would buy again. I like the audio monitoring that comes free. MUCH better with the iPad/iPhone app.

Reviews.Title: Excellent customer support
Reviews.Author: Dan Buhr
Reviews.Content: Contacted support about spending 6 hours of my life not getting the product fully set up properly.  Don't waste  your time, just call support and get help!!  Ralph Mendez did a great job guiding me through the process.  DBGreat product so far, just need my extended antennas that were promised in the order.DanFOSCAM continues to impress me, Felix Anderson did a super job setting up my static IP address and I will certainly purchase more of these cameras in the future!!Dan 18APR13

Reviews.Title: Excellent Baby Monitor if U have iPad or iPhone!!!
Reviews.Author: Fred'sMom
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to use as a baby monitor. All the actual "video baby monitors" I thought were way overpriced and most had poor/mixed reviews. I have had this camera for a week now and I absolutely LOVE it as a baby monitor. It was a piece of cake to set up; only took me about about 15 minutes. I'm not a computer genius but I'm no dummy either. I installed the camera program (from the included disk) on my laptop and then downloaded an app to my iPad. (In the App Store I searched "foscam" and several baby monitor apps were available.) I put the camera right above the top of my son's crib. The camera captures the entire crib space and gives a nice, clear picture. The night vision is also perfectly clear. The color quality is good. When viewing on my iPad, I can see my 5 month old son's back rising and falling as he breathes (sleeps on his tummy).I have not tried to do the remote/internet viewing but would like to try that soon. I'm afraid it will be difficult to do.The only drawback is the power cord to the camera is too short (I just use a small extension cord). There is no zoom either, but you definitely don't need it if you are using it as a baby monitor. If you could spend $10 more and get one with zoom and maybe more megapixels then I would do it.Fantastic camera for a baby monitor. I will recommend it to anyone looking for a "video baby monitor" for a fraction of the price. I was initially afraid to buy this because I thought it would be too difficult for me to figure out, but I am so happy I got it. It was so easy to set up and use.

Reviews.Title: Great camera but buy from Foscam.us to simply the RMA process
Reviews.Author: BRIAN
Reviews.Content: Received the camera as a gift to use as a baby monitor.  Works great with a multitude of different IP software applications (video and sound).  Had an issue with the motor that controls left-to-right movement so had to get an RMA.  Missed vendor/distributor's warranty (vendor on Amazon) by a few days, so had to contact Foscam direct (via email or call via international number) to redeem manufacturer's warranty.  Found out that if gift giver had used Foscam.us' store front on Amazon, the manufacturer's warranty can be processed through them for replacements and greatly simplify the process.

Reviews.Title: Great camera
Reviews.Author: Eric G.
Reviews.Content: Wow! I cannot believe I waited so long to order this. Simple setup and works perfectly... I have access to pan and tilt, view, and take snapshots from my Android!It was also easy to setup auto emailing anytime motion is detected!

Reviews.Title: Foscam
Reviews.Author: kerday
Reviews.Content: Product arrived very quickly and was failrly easy to get set up.  I contacted the tech support for Foscam and talked with Sandra who did the final configurations on the wireless setup, remote access and sound.  Using this as a pet-cam to see what the dog actually does during the day and the cost of this is great.  Good product for the price.

Reviews.Title: IP Camera for your Computer/Android/Iphone devices
Reviews.Author: Lamini
Reviews.Content: Says what it does, does what it says. What more do I need to say. I never even opened the instructions, thats how easy it was. Most devices these days use similar credentials.As long as port forwarding is already on your router, this is a breeze. Finding apps that automatically work fine with this was probably toughest part (for sharing w/ Android/Iphones). I have IP Cam Viewer for Android, and Baby Monitor for Iphones. I'd write down how to share, but its different from either app. From IP Cam Viewer you right click the app (FREE), click MORE, click Share, and enter the phone number. Youd need to give them your credentials as well.I knocked a star off as i had to FIND apps it worked with, then its GUI is far from intuitive. I should knock off another star for their horrible, err non existing support, not that I needed it. Its the way it is these days, they knock out support, while keeping their price up.  Not only that, but they justify it. Everyone cuts service out of the budget. You know what, rather than just talking about it, I knocked another star off and hope someone, or some businesses actually see this: stop justifying no service/support. Dont give me your "In Todays Economy" speel. Dont sell product if you cant support it.Besides no fully functioning apps (all demos, missing controls/sounds or the likes), and a not so good resolution (640x480 @ 20fps), thats easily minus 2 stars. But if you can make compromises (read: $99), ease of setup (with limitations), then youve got a minus sign on your face, youve neither won nor lost; you didnt pay for the best and shouldve known better, on the other hand you saved a pretty penny.

Reviews.Title: Beware.  Terrible product.
Reviews.Author: J. Rassen
Reviews.Content: This is one of the worst electronics products I've come across.  The software is downright paleolithic; it looks like it was designed by a third-grader... in 1998.  Setup is near-impossible.  Want to watch the video in a web brower?  You can, sort of.  Want to make a bookmark?  Nope.  Want to use your iPhone?  Buy their cruddy app.This item spent a total of 2 hours in my house before I printed the return authorization.  I would write a longer review, but who wants to waste any more time with this piece of garbage?

Reviews.Title: Serious Video Lag
Reviews.Author: Lulu
Reviews.Content: Poor video picture quality, when panning it lagged, and frequently froze. overall very cheap. I would suggest looking at one of the more expensive networking options offered by a major brand.

Reviews.Title: Probably not what you want
Reviews.Author: alex "alex"
Reviews.Content: I'll list the problems I've had with this camera and then go into the details:1. Low image quality.  Further than 25ft, faces can't be distinguished .  Maybe a focus problem?2. Software only allows recording with Windows Internet Explorer (viewing and controlling still work with other browsers)3. IR LEDs are visible to the naked eye as glowing red.  So this camera can't be hidden4. No option to turn the IR LEDs and keep the IR filter off.5. Software glitches, Admin password couldn't be changed and static IP address couldn't be usedIn detail:1. There is no auto focus on this camera, so maybe I have to manually screw the lens to focus on objects further than 25 feet.  But if something comes closes then it will be out of focus again, so why bother.  Or maybe the camera is low quality.  It does state .3 mega pixels on the camera lens.2. While you can't record without IE, you can set the camera to send 6 images to your email if it senses motion.3. The IR LEDs work great!!!  But they're visible and I'm trying to be sneaky and catch someone who keeps letting their dog shit on my yard at night.  IR (infrared light) is suppose to be invisible to the naked eye.4. The camera has a light sensor that turns the IR LEDs and disengages the IR filter.  For your info, IR filters need to be removed for "night vision" to work.  Cameras come with IR filters to block out IR light which ruin color photos and videos.  In fact most cameras can be turned into night vision cameras by opening them up and removing the IR filter.  If you turn the IR LEDs off, the camera thinks it's daylight and engages the IR filter, preventing from working at night. You can put tape over the LEDs, but I have my camera behind tint, and the IR LEDs still managed to "leak" and cause a reflection off the tint in recorded video (not to the naked eye though).  So I had to take the camera apart and remove the LEDs and unplug the IR filter actuator.5. When I change the Admin password, I can never log back into my camera.  I talked to some people who had this problem and some that haven't.  Random problem?  I also can't assign a static ip address in my router for this camera.  If I do, the camera never connects to my router.

Reviews.Title: Buyer beware
Reviews.Author: Curious Reader "curious reader"
Reviews.Content: I ordered this camera and paid for overnight delivery.  When I received the camera, it was not new, but rather an open box.  The CD-Rom with the software was smashed into many pieces.  When I asked to return it I was told to throw it away.  They cannot accept this as a return due to a "hazardous material" ? What!?!?Amazon is refunding my money, and I am tossing this in the trash.

Reviews.Title: Good for the price
Reviews.Author: Dwight
Reviews.Content: Good for the price.Cons I have encountered so far:I haven't gotten the sound to work (on Mac Safari -- I may have also tried Mac Firefox, but nothing else), so the features and where these features are supported could be clearer.No https (SSL) over the world wide web.  (I confirmed with Foscam).  Amazonian 2082 said, "Anyone else have a sneaky suspicion that someone in (guess where?) is looking at what I'm looking at?".  Without https, more people than you think could be looking.  The work around I have yet to try is to use additional hardware to setup a secure SSL https connection over the www to indirectly connect to the camera inside the LAN, rather than port forwarding the camera directly.No ability to turn off "infrared in use" lamps, so that could draw unwanted attention to the camera.Significant click noise when you switch to/from infrared.Pros:Pretty quiet when rotating.Another reviewer supplied a link to the SDK.Infrared picked up dust particles floating in my home which I did not see in color mode, so that prompted me to improve my home air quality.NOTE:I have not yet tested significant features such as the Mail Service, MSN, FTP, Alarm, nor Scheduler settings.

Reviews.Title: Do not count on any support
Reviews.Author: cbl541
Reviews.Content: Purchased two cameras.  Following the poorly written instructions that came with the cameras, the web instructions, and multiple YouTube videos the first camera was not able to connect wirelessly.  Following the exact same steps, the second camera connected on the first try.  Again following the poorly written instructions, the web instructions, and multiple YouTube on port-forwarding, I was unable to set up the cameras to view remotely.  I contacted technical support from my office (technical support is advertised on their website as only available 9-6 cst m-f) just to ask some basic questions (translating my routers terminology to the terminology they used in the manual/instructions).  After waiting on hold for 20+ minutes the heavy accented woman asked a few questions and said that she would need to connect me to a technician and that I would need to call back when I was in front of my computer.  I asked for any other options, because I work 7:30-6:00 every day and live 40 mins from my office.  No other option. The next day I took a long lunch, cam home and called.  Again after a 20 min wait on hold, heavily accented person ask the same questions and then he said that he needed my phone number to have the technician call me within the next two hours.  Told him that I would be boxing these cameras back up and sending them back, because this was not right.  He asked if he could schedule a call back to me first thing Saturday morning, because they are open 9-6 for support on Saturdays. I told him that would be fine.  No call as of 1pm on Saturday.  I called tech support and they are closed.  Neat product, but poor support.

Reviews.Title: Awesome Camera... more than just a toy
Reviews.Author: DansReviews
Reviews.Content: So much drama about this product so let me set the records straight. If you need an IP cam with video streaming to Android and iproducts, this is your best non-professional product. And I am not a Foscam employee, although I am a former IT/electronics engineer (some 15 years ago).It took me 30-40 minutes to set up the product through cable and wireless, including the no-ip.org hosting (which in contrary to what was said earlier, it is FREE). And that was done using Foscam guide.The only problem I had was setting-up the Port Forwarding, and that was because of my own internal network, which includes Vonage modem prior to my Linksys router. And this issue was fixed in 15 mins by Foscam technical team.Don't get biased by other comments regarding technical set-ups. Just use the guide, and you will be fine.And cut the drama regarding technical specs. READ the product specification and you will not what you get before you buy it.

Reviews.Title: AWESOME CAMER AND CUSTOMER SERVICE
Reviews.Author: steve
Reviews.Content: camera works great. sandra was amazing got my camera up n working on wireless in no time. cantwaitto use this for watching the baby when we areaway from home. buy this camera for your home or any survallience usage!!!

Reviews.Title: customer service was very excellent.
Reviews.Author: sohail
Reviews.Content: Mr. Calvin Harris in customer service was very helpful....I can recommend this camera for its price. I am satisfied with the service provided by him.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: J. Flood "save our planet & animals"
Reviews.Content: Issue: To set the camera wireless and to view it through iPhone and iPad.Ricky was my support provider and he was excellent.  He helped me through his Team Viewer Application which gave him control of my PC and he was able to set everything up for me.  A bit skeptical at first about the Team Viewer Application but very helpful since he did everything for me.  I just sat back and watched him install the camera for me.  He gave me all the information for me to log in wirelessly and now I have access.  A+++++ Service!

Reviews.Title: Great Camera for a Great price!
Reviews.Author: Josh5803
Reviews.Content: This product does exactly as it say it does! The camera it self it works great, the setup was easy but setting up to monitor outside of your home network was a bit tricky. Just go to AwkwardHamster's youtube channel, he has a great video tutorial that will walk you right through it. I use this camera every day to monitor the back yard of my house. I have it set up inside my house but pointing it out through my back sliding door. Fits perfect on any standard tri-pod.

Reviews.Title: Quick setup, at least on our end!
Reviews.Author: SarahM
Reviews.Content: We were worried after reading numerous reports about how difficult to install however it was up and running in about 25 minutes, including mounting it to the wall.  For the price we're really happy with it.  We only did internal wireless network level and will try remote but that was it's main purpose to us so it's everything we expected.

Reviews.Title: great when it works, not bad for the price
Reviews.Author: jokah
Reviews.Content: I ordered two of these, one from Amazon and another through a Groupon special, and have been using it for over 3 months (installed the other one at a different site).  Initial setup was not particularly difficult, and under normal circumstances both work great.  There are a few negatives, however, worth noting:* Both cameras exhibit the same problem where every once in a while, the camera repositions itself unpredictably.* Motion detection does not always appear to be reliable, and I have tried tweaking the settings in the Foscam software.  The camera points to a walkway that I use at least twice daily, and lately, the captured images are mailed to me only occasionally.[UPDATE 2012/12/03] The random repositioning problem has a solution apparently.  In the control panel, set preset position #1 and update the appropriate checkbox under PTZ Settings.

Reviews.Title: Great
Reviews.Author: AllSki1
Reviews.Content: Just as advertised, low light/no light mode is outstanding, good clarity, was easy enough to configure. It's currently connected to a Synology disk station and I have no issues. Video over Wifi works fine.

Reviews.Title: GREAT CAMERA AND PRICE
Reviews.Author: T$
Reviews.Content: we love this camera as a baby monitor. would definately buy another one if needed. with the app on your android you can watch up to 9 cameras at once. WE LOVE IT

Reviews.Title: Great IP web camera for the price
Reviews.Author: Kirk
Reviews.Content: I first bought this camera for indoor surveillance to try it out. The initial setup was difficult and required different steps than what the manual explained. But I reached out to Foscam support team and they e-mailed me a very helpful document that explained step by step how to properly setup the IP address to a new camera out of the box. I also viewed some YouTube videos for more detailed setup of this camera, once the setup got completed; I have been able to view this camera remotely through 3G service from anywhere on my IPHONE. The foscam camera has never lost service with my WI-FI, I was so happy with this product that I ordered 2 more for my outdoor patios. Although they do not specify they are outdoor cameras, I installed the other 2 outdoors; so far they have handled the outdoor weather very good. I strongly recommend this product to anyone looking for an affordable IP web camera. If you encounter any issues with the setup, don't get discouraged, call or e-mail the foscam tech support team and they will help you out. Now when I go on vacations, I feel relaxed knowing that I can check out my home anytime I want. The IR light works GREAT for night vision too.

Reviews.Title: Awful experience
Reviews.Author: Brian Barclay "timebombsaint"
Reviews.Content: The camera itself isn't bad, the image quality is actually pretty good. However, the set up of the camera is awful. I'm pretty decent with technology, I create user experiences for a living and have success with it, and with that said setting this camera up has taken 2 nights. Here's some examples why - 1.The manual is grammatically incorrect and often missing words making it difficult to read. 2. When you change your password from the standard "admin" they give you to set it up it doesn't remember the password requiring you to hard reset the camera just to reset the password. 3. Setting up the remote access is ridiculously long process and dosen't particularly work. After several attempts at entering my username and password that I just created I wasn't granted access, again. The app experience requires the aforementioned setting up of remote access (domain, host, and WAN number - that refuse to work for me) just to have an awful customer experience on the app.These guys did a nice job of building the camera and really flubbed the experience and interaction of operating and monitoring the camera.I'm returning this and would NOT recommend buying it to someone.

Reviews.Title: Packed with Features, Good Documentation
Reviews.Author: daniel z
Reviews.Content: This camera features good quality video, good night vision capability, and wireless is a bonus. The android app is $2.99 and is a must if you want to look at your camera through your phone. Don't even bother trying to access from your phone's browser. Setup was kind of difficult. You have to have a fair bit of knowledge with your home network if you want to set it up successfully. After some trial and error, the camera is now accessible anywhere through the internet or smartphone. Great feature!

Reviews.Title: No service
Reviews.Author: johnny lee
Reviews.Content: I had unit for about 4 or 5 weeks and it stop working. I contacted Foscam about it and was told to send it back for a replacement. Well it's been 6 weeks and no response and no more cam. They don't respond to emails , so "Buyer Beware". Think I been scammed.

Reviews.Title: Good camera, lousy instructions
Reviews.Author: D. Morrocco
Reviews.Content: The positives: resolution of the camera, ability to rotate, easy to access via the Net.  The negatives: the installation instructions are awful, so I had to spend 2 hours with a technical representative.  Also the ability to control via a Mac or iPhone is suspect.  You can view fine, but it's very difficult to get the controls to respond.

Reviews.Title: Awesome customer service!
Reviews.Author: tmcavalier
Reviews.Content: Calvin Harris was a great help at setting up my camera. Just got it set up and its working great!I would recommnend this camera to anyone who is looking for an affordable security camera.

Reviews.Title: Great IP cam for the money
Reviews.Author: Taflya
Reviews.Content: This is hands down the best IP camera on the market.It is easy to set up locally and works with macs and iphone through safari browser or apps. However it is difficult to set up to use outside you home network. You have to search though tens of different tutorials and how to's. I managed to set it up with apple extreme router but when it broke and i bought belkin router i could not do it again... So if you know how to set up port forwarding and DNS you will be fine and if you have no clue good luck!!!

Reviews.Title: Foscam is Amazing!
Reviews.Author: anthonyj
Reviews.Content: such great customer service.  Calvin Harris hooked my remote acees up in minutesI can recommend this camera for its pan/tilt

Reviews.Title: What a Disaster and Chat support is a JOKE
Reviews.Author: Raffy
Reviews.Content: I have installed several wireless devices on my router and this one is a Disaster.  The Chat support is also a JOKE.One thing I learned from this is NEVER believe the RATINGS !!!!!!!  I dont think this even deserve a One Star.Dont Buy this camera !!!!!!!  You are better off with the Dlink.RP

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: wparker33
Reviews.Content: Issue: PORT FORWARDING.Ricky assisted me in configuring my camera. Very helpful. Instructions were quick and clear. I was very pleased with the assistance I received. Quality of the camera picture is excellent.

Reviews.Title: No buyer's remorse...yet
Reviews.Author: Nit3trader
Reviews.Content: After hearing about a few burglaries in my neighborhood, I decided that some peace of mind could be obtained by keeping watch on my house while I'm away. Previously, I had considered some of the relatively pricey multi-cam DVR systems, but after reading some reviews I opted to try a single Foscam FI8910W. Although I was originally looking for a couple decent outdoor IP cams to view the front and back yard, I was able to snag this new model camera for $75+free shipping brand new directly through Foscam via online auction. For the price I paid, I'd say its definitely worth the money. Is it worth $100? I'll leave that up to you to decide.From the time I unboxed the camera, it took maybe two minutes tops to install the software and have the camera fully operational on my home network via ethernet. From that point, it took another 15 minutes to configure the camera for remote access and have it completely accesible from anywhere in the world with an internet connection. (This process included: creating an account for the host name to be associated with the IP address, configuring my router to forward the necessary port the camera would use, and setting the motion detection alarm, email notification and ftp upload settings within the cam's UI)I'm not an 'IT enthusiast' by any stretch of the imagination, but I'm not a complete moron either :) Regarding the setup, everything was a breeze. I didn't even bother looking at the instructions as the majority of reviews indicated that they were of no help anyway. If you're interested in an IP camera and intend to install it yourself, its wise to have at least a basic understanding of what IP is and how it works so that you can work your way through the setup in a logical fashion. Assuming most people will purchase this camera for its remote viewing capability, its crucial that you understand how to get it setup to take advantage of all its features.The pros:---------Easy setupIP (beats running wires everywhere)Remote accessUser-friendly UIPan/Tilt featureHorizontal/Vertical patrol featureDecent image qualityDecent IR qualityMotion detection/email notifcation/ftp image upload features2 way audioThe cons:---------Audio quality could be betterCamera firmware/UI could be a little more feature-rich and modernized(but this can be enhanced and updated at a later time)Personally, I would like to see some more alarm/alert features built into future firmware/UI updates.I would really love to have this camera mountable outside, but its not recommended as it would likely fail after a short while of being exposed to the elements. (The enclosures were a good thought, but isn't functional with the IR as it reflects off the glass and blinds the camera at night)Its a shame, the outdoor IP cams don't get as good of reviews as these indoor models :(When I'm on the go, I frequently find myself pulling up the video feed on my phone to check in on things.While I'm at work, I've got a window pulled up on my computer so I can keep watch(I frequently pan/tilt the cam just because its kinda fun) :-pThen when I'm home and in a different part of the house, I have it pulled up on myiPad and watching the doors.All in all, great little camera with some cool features for the money. We'll see how it holds up after a few months of use.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: DuBois
Reviews.Content: Issue: Wireless settings not working.Ricky was very helpful and answered all my questions and got everything working easily. I am very satisfied.Foscam FI8910W Wireless/Wired Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with IR-Cut Filter for True Color Images - 8 Meter Night Vision and 3.6mm Lens (67° Viewing Angle) - White NEWEST MODEL

Reviews.Title: Good stuff!
Reviews.Author: K. auyeung "Pro Shopper"
Reviews.Content: I have brought 3 other similar cam before I see this deal. This is the most expensive cam I have brought (70$) but this also the ONLY ONE that works as it suppose to. At review in other 3rd party camera, they said this and that. The truth is it is hit and miss. They are ok, not great when they work. One can I got works for a day. Freezes the next day, rest, the screen never come up again. I call the shop, ( online shop Dino whatever) the keep trying to get away from full refund me by provide store credit. Takes a day to reply each message. Ends up waste me over a month for the refund. Anyways, if I know. I will buy the good brand instead of the knock offs. Good luck.

Reviews.Title: Great camera for the money!
Reviews.Author: Boxcar
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera for the money.  I access the camera from my phone to see if my garage doors are open/shut.Configuring it was pretty straight forward.  Only issues will be in configuring your providers port forwarding.  I've only used it "wired" mode so can't comment on wireless config. Image quality in good light (accessed over the web) is really good,better than some far more expensive webcams.I'm getting a few more.  Great cameras!

Reviews.Title: the worst software for any device EVER created
Reviews.Author: Ordin
Reviews.Content: Look the cameras are very nice.....when they work.  THAT is the problem though.  I have spent hours upon hours on the phone, online, going through router settings, resetting passwords, calling my internet service provider and the list goes on and on and on.  Again the cameras = very nice , the software = THE BIGGEST SACK OF POOP in the world.  If you are thinking plug it in and it will work, forget it.  Be prepared to spend many MANY hours on the phone with a variety of people.IMPORTANT:  Gosh sorry, I forgot the most important part of the whole review.  When you call foscam, you will be on hold a MINIMUM of 30 minutes (hmmmm I wonder why, perhaps because the software sucks so much?!).  Just be prepared to sit on the phone for a loooooong time.  30 mins is the absolute bare minimum I have experienced.  45 mins to 1 hour seems to be the average.  Sigh, I should have listened to others :\

Reviews.Title: Cool Product - Very Usefull
Reviews.Author: Steve
Reviews.Content: I received this product as a gift for a newborn and it is awesome! There is a little trouble setting it up - very complex directions that aren't really that complete but when I called Foscam I received great support from a tech named: Anzen.I would recommend this product but you may need to contact the company for assistance in setting it up.

Reviews.Title: Easy to setup and use if you are a bit savvy
Reviews.Author: islandsound
Reviews.Content: Overall I'd say the camera is easy to use and setup if you are a bit tech savvy and know what to do with it.  There are endless options to configure and works well with no-ip.org for outside access using the DDNS service.  The instructions do not go over every configuration option so it'll take a bit of time to route through everything, most of the options are not needed for the average user.  I recommend getting [...] for the iphone, there is also an ipad app.  Overall great camera for the price and the endless options that are available with it's setup and functionality.

Reviews.Title: DC power cord is too short
Reviews.Author: NYC guy
Reviews.Content: Good value for an IP camera that works well and was easy,to set up.  One of my biggest gripes is that the dc power cord is way too short (especially if you plan to mount camera close to ceiling).  Sure I could use extension cords but it is not ideal.

Reviews.Title: Almost gave up on it
Reviews.Author: Eisengrim
Reviews.Content: I almost considered this a waste of $100. I got it set up wirelessly OK, and could see the video feed on Mac Firefox and Safari, but the quality was just terrible. Huge lags, frozen video, low framerate - I thought I had bought a piece of junk. By chance I tried an iPhone webcam viewer and found out quickly the camera is fine; it's the software that's the problem. Web browsers just don't work well with this camera. On the Mac, Vitamin D viewer shows a really good framerate. Foscam needs to include a native cam viewer with this hardware to avoid problems like this.

Reviews.Title: Best wireless cam for the price
Reviews.Author: K. Henry "KenHen"
Reviews.Content: I had a package stolen off of my porch so I set up this camera with the motion detection. It sends me an e-mail anytime there is activity on my porch. I have it setup inside a front windows so it looks through a window and screen and still picks up motion. I am able to use dynamic DNS to forward the camera out to my cell phone using and android App IP camera viewer. You cannot use the infrared light through a window. I just turn it off and turn on a porch light and the camera can still see it night.

Reviews.Title: Worked for one day.
Reviews.Author: M. Person
Reviews.Content: Camera worked both wired and wirelessly for one day, then refused to connect to the router, even after a reset.  Setup was relatively easy if you have set up an IP camera before, but disappointed that the camera died so quickly.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Shaun
Reviews.Content: Issue: Port forwarding.RickyCamera works great!!! had some problems with the set up but the customers service rep Ricky was able to trouble shoot my lack of computer knowledge and make the cameras work flawlessly.

Reviews.Title: LOVE THIS CAMERA!
Reviews.Author: ALA
Reviews.Content: I love this camera and the applicable app for my cell phone. The camera display is very clear and colors are true. Being able to see a live view of my home via my cell phone is a comfort. I bought two cams, and they are a nice compliment to my entire home security system of alarms and outside surveillance cams.The setup was easy, though you do have to have knowledge of routing through your modem and setting up email forwarding for alerts. If I can get through it successfully, anyone can because I am not that techincally savvy. The guide book was very helpful and whoever did the technical writing for the manual had us ordinary and not so technical people in mind. Great product FOSCAM!

Reviews.Title: This thing is crap
Reviews.Author: Devon
Reviews.Content: I got this camera to set up some simple, cheap security for a small business. The first one I got on had a black spec INSIDE the lense that messed up the shot, and the framerate was bad. To my dismay I couldn't settle this through amazon and had to contact the seller directly (big something or other). We got an RMA set up and I sent it in, got it back almost three weeks later after I called and asked (The lady had to look it up and find it). The framerate was even worse but I'm tired of dealing with it so I kept it and am working with a low frame rate. I decided to set up another camera so I went with the "LOFTEK Newest CXS 2200 Wireless/Wired Pan:270°&Tilt;:120° Dual Audio Alarm Ip camera,15 Meter Night vision,3.6mm Lens ,67° Viewing Angle,easy installation.White". This item, while 20 or 30 bucks less, worked right out of the box, had no issues connecting, AND has better framerate than the other camera. We have them set up on wifi and this one is FURTHER from the router and the framerate is still better. My only issue is that my security software didn't immediately support it but some quick google searching fixed it.Bottom line, this camera works but the company and the camera don't seem to be up to par. If you have to contact the company woe to you.Others seem to have better experience but I recall a review that stated that people are submitting false reviews to keep it popular, after my experience I'm not surprised.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive option for Baby Monitor
Reviews.Author: Gustavo B.
Reviews.Content: First of all, we decided to go with this less expensive option as our baby cam, mainly because it would come in handy for other uses later in time when we don't need it as a baby monitor. Mounting the holding bracket was fast (two screws) and with the vertical flip option, we chose the upper corner and did an upside down installation. This gives us much more coverage and viewing angle of the whole room, so we can even see the baby and follow him around when he's playing outside the crib.Image quality decent, it gives 320x240 and 640x480 resolution, which is enough to be used as a monitor. The management section of the Real-Time Camera Monitoring System offers many more options than what we need so I can't comment on those characteristics.The night vision capabilities and quality of IR are nothing short of AMAZING (I realized this as in the monitor the image was incredibly clear and lit, but when I stepped into the room it was completely pitch dark, I couldn't see my own hands). The IR light do make a clicking sound when they come on or off, but nothing that would be disturbing. We have the camera connected with Ethernet cable (we tried the wireless option and worked great also) but on the flip side for us, the connectivity lights behind the base unit create little distraction at night for the baby. As it's not intended to be a silent Baby monitor, we can't really complain about this, just a note.Overall, this was an excellent purchase, we even have set it to broadcast outside our LAN, so image can be shared with others through a web address. We are even considering purchasing more of this model or it's subsequent upgrades in the future, to serve as a security system for our house.

Reviews.Title: Great as a baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Johnd123
Reviews.Content: I bought this to monitor our newborn downstairs.  The picture quality is excellent and allows me to watch tv while watching my son with my ipad concurrently.  I highly recommend.  It'd be five stars but I had some trouble during the setup but it's definitely worth the cost.

Reviews.Title: Works well, great value
Reviews.Author: 9kflyer
Reviews.Content: As someone who's on the road for business 18-22 days a month, I wanted a way to keep an eye on my house while I'm gone. Until I purchased this camera, I'd simply have no idea if my house was broken into, flooded, etc. until I'd return home and find out for myself. The peace of mind is easily worth the $100 price tag. I've got it set to show the entryway, with the motion alarm armed. So far, it's worked as advertised. Initially I got a few false motion alarms, but I've enabled motion compensation and reduced the sensitivity slightly. Seems to be working fine.Yes, setup is kind of a beast if you're not familiar with networking. I didn't have to contact tech support over it, but I'm fairly tech savvy and know how my router operates. If I can offer two suggestions that may or may not work for every router:1. Change the camera's default port. It defaults to 80, which is the standard HTTP port used for websites. For some reason, no matter how much I worked at it, my router would not accept inbound connections on port 80 to the camera. I changed it to a random port, and it works fine. This can be done under the "Basic Network Settings" menu. That leads me to the next point...2. Enable UPnP in the camera settings. For me, I didn't have to set up any type of port forwarding once the router recognized the camera.My IP address is static, which reduces the complexity. No DNS issues to deal with.Overall, pretty much exactly what I expected for the cost. 4 stars only for the difficult setup.

Reviews.Title: camera
Reviews.Author: ei
Reviews.Content: good camera, two way audio terrible, audio just keep echoing,to speak you have to turn on the mike and shut off the speaker.

Reviews.Title: Poor Wireless Connectivity
Reviews.Author: piquant
Reviews.Content: The wireless camera works great as long as it remains within 20 feet of the router.  Beyond that the camera does not work.  The camera I purchased came with the 9dbi antenna.

Reviews.Title: I know lots more about networking now!
Reviews.Author: creede
Reviews.Content: I am a noephite network user and intermediate computer user. The camera works well once all hurdles have been overcome. It is not easy as it seems that the instructions were translated from chinese to maybe german and finally english. They are not crystal clear.The included software CD will install the "IP Camera Tool". This helps you locate the camera on your local network (LAN).Before double-clicking on your "discovered" camera, if you are using Internet Explorer, you will need to go into the internet tools section of IE and enable "download and run unsigned active X".
