If you are using IE, the camera has to install an unsigned active X to run correctly. This is the first real pain as there are about three locations in tools that have to be enabled before IE will allow this active X to be installed. Double click the camera location in the IP camera tool, and the camera will install the active X and then you will be looking at the camera's log in page. I made a short cut in favorites to get to this page. Log in information is actually in the instructions. At this point you will be able to use the camera on your LAN.To make it available on the world wide web, it is necessary to enable port forwarding in the router. My router and modem are all-in-one device supplied by ISP. The camera ships with port 80 enabled. Called tech support at ISP and they walked me through setting up port forwarding in the router. Once that has been accomplished, you can access the camera via the wide area network IP of your modem. Problem is this IP changes every day so I signed up with DynDNS.org to keep track of this constantly (dynamic) changing WAN IP. DynDns actually had software built into my modem/router that enabled DynDns to track the IP and link it to a web address. Now I just go to the web address and it takes me to the log in page of the camera. This is the best tutorial I found is the DNS wizard at DynDns.org.The active X thing was the most difficult to solve as there are I think three diffent boxes that have to be enabled in the security section/custom settings of Tools/Internet Options/ in XP version of IE8. Reviewing the downloaded PDF instructions from Foscam, section 4.1.3 outlines setting up IE to accept the active X. Once that was solved, everything else was accomplished with the software that resides in the router. (port forwarding) and (dynamic DNS) I have not tried the sound yet. Picture is good. Camera IR reflects off of window at night and blinds the camera. Controls take a little practice but work fine. Presets work well to. I like having three levels of access to camera so the guest have restricted control of pan/tilt. This is a lot of technology for the money and a lot of fun when finally working.

Reviews.Title: Decent low-cost option, but not perfect
Reviews.Author: H. Eng
Reviews.Content: I've had the FI8910W for one week. In that time it has lost its set position three times while hosted on iSpyConnect. I don't know why. Maybe it is resetting itself? The product came with the latest firmware so I was happy about that. Maybe the camera is supposed to be mounted with the camera in its default position pointing where you want it? Don't know. I am not going to mount it yet. One star off.The second issue I had was with the browser setup. I didn't want to connect the camera to a router and then figure out the IP so I decided to use a cross-over cable and static IPs. The Foscam software found the unit and allowed me to set the static IP without going onto the web page. This is a plus. However, the camera does not look like it will support IE9. I tried two PCs and nada. I had to install Firefox before I could log into the camera and set the wireless settings and change the user password. Another star off.Even so, the picture is great, night vision is decent, and it is supported by iSpyConnect. Although the power cable is too short (aren't we expected to mount these on the ceiling?) I won't knock another star off. I would only use this for situations that might require panning and tilting (there is no zoom). For fixed positions such as doorways and entryways, I will test out the Foscam FI8909W.As for wireless reception my maximum test distance was 20-25 feet.

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: JPS
Reviews.Content: I'm really pleased with this camera. Good quality, lots of features. FInally got everything working with my Mac. Took me a while though, which is why I'm only giving it four stars. If it had a better Mac interface, it would be 5 stars.

Reviews.Title: Only negative is I only bought one
Reviews.Author: Josh "JTL"
Reviews.Content: This is a great camera, setup was OK, directions are a little confusing if you don't have basic knowledge of networking.  Setup up statics for both the Ethernet and wireless MACs and pick a different random port than 80. Purchased IP cam viewer from the app market and it worked right away.  Wish the resolution and frame rate were a little better, but that is what the H.264 and HD models are for.  Overall great IP cam, will be picking up more when they go on sale.

Reviews.Title: Good economy IP Camera.
Reviews.Author: TracyD
Reviews.Content: This camera was easy to setup. Worked as advertised. No problems so far. Very quite pan & tilt operation. The camera has a tendency to switch to black and white too quickly while panning in low light areas, but you can disable the IR if you need to.

Reviews.Title: Easy First Time Camera
Reviews.Author: jowica
Reviews.Content: Bought 3 as an intro to wireless IP Cameras to my network. I was a bit apprehensive at first, but setup was very intuitive and quick. Nice quality all around. Linking this through a dyndns server was a bit of a pain, but I eventually figured it out. One drawback on the camera is that everytime certain parameters are re-set the camera must re-boot which takes up time and becomes a bit annoying and repetitive. An unexpected glitch occurred when I placed the camera at the front window to watch the yard and driveway. This worked beautifully during the day, but when infrared kicks on at night, the reflection of the infrared is bounced back by the glass. If you need to monitor outside, then the camera must be placed outside to avoid this. Not sure if this model is weather proof, so I may have to acquire one that is.Got online and bought the Foscam app, I highly suggest that you do the same. It's worth the $6+ as it offers full functionality through your tablet. Setting up the app is easier than the actual camera setup itself.It will be nice to travel and keep an eye on things from far away. Next challenge is having the cameras record to my network drive or to a remote cloud.

Reviews.Title: Great value!
Reviews.Author: Frustrated
Reviews.Content: Easy to set up for local viewing...slightly longer for Over the Internet viewing using DDNS.  That took about 20 minutes. Using an iPad app to view. Quality of image is pretty good and remote commands responsive.  Would love to have the ability to rotate the camera a full 360 and zero in on objects but for the price I can't complain.  I was so happy with my first 2 cameras I bought 4 more.

Reviews.Title: Works with iMac, iPad
Reviews.Author: Geoffrey Bowen
Reviews.Content: Recently purchased an iMac to replace my old Windows device and needed to replace my Linksys camera which I use as a room monitor. Set up. took about a half an hour including 20 minutes on the phone with the very helpful Anzen from Foscam support. Nice bright picture (indoors), and the Foscam Pro iPad app ($6) worked on the first try.

Reviews.Title: Good product, but somewhat fragile
Reviews.Author: Alex L.
Reviews.Content: I'm impressed with the image quality, ease of use. Not impressed with control software. Had to return the first one because the reset button broke off. Overall, a solid 4 star product.

Reviews.Title: foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Stanley "Stan"
Reviews.Content: RickyWas super helpful! He was able to help me with my setup, everything is working great! I will definitely be purchasing more foscam products.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, very slow control over the net
Reviews.Author: Michael R. Palmeter
Reviews.Content: This is a nice little camera.  It's a bit bulky to install, and the power adapter requires a power plug very near wherever it is mounted.  I found the responsiveness of the camera to be very poor - it takes 30 seconds or more for the image to reflect the positioning commands you send.  It's faster over a local network, but not real-time.  Good quality and good resolution.  Night vision is good as well.

Reviews.Title: Very pleased!
Reviews.Author: M. Harrison
Reviews.Content: (Real review from an end user!) These are shockingly good cameras for the price. I have a lot of cameras around my house and they are by far the best. We aren't paranoid and mostly use them for checking in on the pets & kids. My husband works out of town pretty often and he uses it as a fun way to stay connected to the homefront & peek in on what his family is up to. It makes him feel like he's closer to home. :)The picture is clear & pretty crisp, colors are true, and they seem to be built really well. Pan/Tilt is almost silent & very smooth. (Note: In the UI the P/T speed is faster when the number is lower.) When it's pointed to a bright window it adjusts the lighting so the picture isn't distorted by it. There is a bit more of a fisheye effect on these cameras than the other cams I have, but the quality and true color more than make up for it. The IR view is as good as any of my other cams and is acceptable.The UI is easy to use and it took me 15 minutes to have two cameras set up & viewable remotely. I am in IT support and have a pretty robust network in my home, so am used to working with webcams & remote viewing setup. If you're new to this sort of thing, plan on it taking longer and enjoy learning something new! I can't speak for the iPhone app since I use LiveCams Pro for remote viewing. I have so many different brands & types of cameras that I prefer to just use one app. I highly recommend the LiveCams app, it's loaded with features and you can adjust a lot of your camera settings directly from the app.*** As with every other webcam on the planet, you must know how to find open ports & forward them on your router (or know someone who does) if you want to view your cams remotely. Many cams get bad reviews due to this, and it's not the fault of the cam or manufacturer. You will not be able to view any cam of any brand remotely without taking this step! If your internet provider changes your IP address, you will have to make some adjustments on your remote viewer to access them again. If you can view your camera locally, then there's nothing wrong with it and something just isn't set up right for remote viewing. Think of it as needing to know the address of a house and having the correct key to unlock the door, you can't get in until you have the right combination! :) ***

Reviews.Title: Great Wireless Camera
Reviews.Author: MC "MC"
Reviews.Content: For the price a great camera. Took me a couple weeks of sporadic tries to get the access from outside my network. For Cablevision port 8090 worked. 80, 5656, 8080 & 21 would not work for me. Ordered a second one and hopeful setup will be a snap. Using IP Can Viewer Pro by Robert Chou for Android from my cell and tablet and it works great. Don't think it's available for iPhone but I may be wrong. Very easy setup once port forwarding was sorted out.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: Daniel Wade "Dano"
Reviews.Content: For the price a great camera that has what most of the more expensive cameras offer. The mobile phone interface is easier to use than others I have owned in the past.Lost one star for a busy customer service line. Had to call back several times. Once I got through Calvin Harris was my rep and provided very good support in a quick and easy manner.

Reviews.Title: Camera broke in 6 months and Foscam won't repair it
Reviews.Author: MBC
Reviews.Content: I bought this camera to be able to check in on my puppy when I'm out of the house. The camera works great. I did some of the set-up myself using the manual provided, but realized later that I should have just called Customer Service to begin with. Anzen was tremendously helpful. He connected my camera to my wireless network, answered all my annoying questions, and helped me to verify that I could access it remotely. It was one of the easiest and least painful tech support phone calls I've ever had. Anzen was a great help!Update: Unfortunately, I have to change my review about the product and customer service. The camera lasted only six months! The pin on the power cord connecting to the camera plainly just stopped fitting into the back of the camera. For a while, I tried using tape but was only minimally successful. Now, the camera doesn't work at all. I contacted customer service to ask about a repair or replacement. After about a week of back-and-forths, during which they asked for descriptions and pictures of the damage, they informed me that even though I bought it through Amazon it was through an unauthorized retailer, so they couldn't do anything.So, I spent almost $100 on a camera that lasted six months. It seems a bit sneaky and not very good business to claim that they can do nothing because I allegedly didn't buy it from an authorized retailer. I am definitely not impressed with the quality of the service -- or the quality of the product. The camera is supposed to have a two-year warranty. Mine broke in six months, and the company won't do anything about it.

Reviews.Title: Bad customers service, it is like no support at all.
Reviews.Author: AChin
Reviews.Content: The product itself might be okay. But the installation process is a headache. You can not get a real tech to help you out if you have problem to install. I have tried very hard on my own and it worked once, but then it failed next day and I can never make it work again no matter how many times I tried, how long I push and hold on to the RESET button, it just can't make it work like it is written in the user installation guide. I have no choice but to return it.

Reviews.Title: Easy setup as baby monitor
Reviews.Author: Ama
Reviews.Content: It works just as promised.  We can view my grandson's room via internet, iPad and iPhone.  The IR is great for at night.  No problems with setup at all.  Plan on getting another one for my granddaughter's room as well.  Great product, reasonably priced.  Recommend it highly.

Reviews.Title: Tech Savvy: Great Camera .. Not Savvy: Expect Frustration
Reviews.Author: Kenneth Cooper
Reviews.Content: Using my iPad, I monitor and/or record my Foscam video for surveillance wherever there's Wifi available.  Setup for remote use required router port forwarding (in my case my router is my Qwest Actiontec modem).  I bought a hostname from Dyn for $20 and I bought the FoscamPro iPad app for six bucks or so.  I then called Foscam technical assistance (a must).  The lady took me step-by-step through the setup procedure.  She was a very patient woman who seemed to have knowledge on all the various Foxcams, routers and modems on the market.  For remote use, she set me up on the LiveCams Pro app (a useful app for $2 or so). I was up and running by the time we finished that one phone call.  Setting up on FoscamPro (different company) was pretty intuitive once this other stuff was known and experienced.That said, I put a LOT of hours of research and trial-by-error leading up to the process noted above.  I've laid out what I did just in case some other equally clueless individual out there would like to bypass a lot of agony and frustration.By the way .. This is a major edit from my original posting (done in frustration) equating my cluelessness to necessary technical jargon and process.

Reviews.Title: foscam tech support
Reviews.Author: Kim
Reviews.Content: I had an issue installing the camera software and setup.I spoke with Harry Foster in reference to the issue and he resolved the issue quickly.In addition, he setup remote access.

Reviews.Title: Good for secondary audio system and primary video.
Reviews.Author: Billy Tauzin III
Reviews.Content: Pros:- Customer support (namely Calvin Harris) stay on and did everything to get me up and running.  Turns out I needed to reset my router.- Works as advertised.  Audio and video (with delay) work great on third party apps.- Easy to access in your browser and move camera remotely.Cons:- The package came busted and the instillation disk was cracked and unusable.- The Mac software download on the Foscam site is unusable.- The work around for dynamic IP using DYNDNS is no longer free.- Couldn't get the Firefox VLC plugin to work for audio on my computer.- Sound and video delay (about 5 seconds for us) using third party apps on tablets and phones.For those having issues with the U-verse router.  My solution was to reset the router and then I could see the camera wireless IP.  We will be using ours as a secondary baby monitor (because of the delay) with third party apps on our tablets and phones.  We still plan to have an audio only monitor system as our primary.

Reviews.Title: Better Than Advertised
Reviews.Author: zeke
Reviews.Content: I use this camera on a closed network (no ip access outside of the local network)as a baby monitor. I can access the feed from my phone, tablet or computer AND I can record from my mobile device. The video quality is great and sound is clear.My only two gripes are that when speaking back to the camera, the sound that comes out is quiet and there is a ~3 second delay on the video feed. Other than that, very happy.

Reviews.Title: does not work well with some netgear routers
Reviews.Author: Daniel V. Wilder
Reviews.Content: I am an experienced computer person and i still ended up calling foscam support because i could not get my netgear router to recognize this camera even when it was plugged directly into a port.  After the foscam tech worked on it for about 30 min, he told me the camera was broken and to return it.  But this was the 2nd camera i had tried and i couldn't believe that both were broken.  So i had a more techy person than me come over and after 1 1/2 hours and using a 2nd router and jumping through many hoops he finally got it working.  And by the way when we plugged it into a Linksys router it worked right away.  Once the camera is working, it is great, but if you have a netgear router be prepared for some extra work, maybe a lot of extra work.

Reviews.Title: Setup is not that hard
Reviews.Author: Chronic Mashedtater
Reviews.Content: Got this in the mail today so this is an out of box and setup type of review. I will definitely update on longevity or other issues down the road.Setup -- The instructions flat out did not get me there. My primary problem is that when you go to the device status page it is only showing the MAC address for the wired ethernet, which it is also calling the "Device ID" and that is a separate issue. I was doing wireless MAC filtering and so I had entered this into my whitelist and it was not the MAC address of the wireless card, thus it never connected. I had to shut off the filter, connect to the router wirelessly, get the wireless MAC from the router, then add that into my filter list, then turn the filter list back on. The only other setup I did was to get the email up and running. That is pretty straightforward if you've ever done it before. I use gmail and it worked a treat with no problems. I also used upnp (easy mode) for the port mapping, doing it "the hard way" is probably outside most users experience. That took me maybe 30 minutes of futzing around to get done. Not horrible but I've done better. I also have extensive networking experience, I'm a programmer, and in general a super geek so your mileage may vary.Features -- Love it. I'm coming from using an old logitech quickcam pro 4000 which is still working but I really needed the new features for the area I'm trying to cover. The picture on full resolution is nice and clear, I could easily make a facial ID from it. The ability of the cam to go through a power outage and recover while my computer remains down is a BIG plus. That removes the middleman and a point of failure. I went ahead and splurged and bought the iPhone app FoscamPro almost immediately. It's the more expensive one of the selection but its without a doubt better. It lets me stand and monitor my house with video and sound and the controls are nice on it. Plus I can make a recording and take pictures straight to my phone so no one can just steal the camera and other stuff and leave no evidence (the motion detection takes care of this immediately but I might want to just get in there and manually control the camera).Conclusion -- I had expected some mega battle due to all the bad stuff out there. I'm aware they are padding the positive reviews, either directly or by proxy. If they really are getting all those customers to come in and add good reviews then one thing is certain; they must be providing quality service after purchase. The manual needs to be rewritten, the wireless MAC needs to display on the status page, all the MAC addresses should be labeled as such instead of "Device ID". Other than that, I have no problem as of day 1 of usage.

Reviews.Title: Foscam 8910W
Reviews.Author: Melissa A. Rayburn
Reviews.Content: Got my 1st Foscam in June. Had to call tech to be able to hook up when not on home router. Sandra Williams was very patient and did a great job getting it set up.I am a little bit of a techie, but probably would have taken many hours for me to figure. Either the installation is old or not accurate. Or maybe I just could not follow??Now it works very well both at home and from the road. Does not have a zoom, but other wise is great. Don't really like the brite LED lights on the back. Makes it too easyfor intruder to notice and disable.Got my 2nd Foscam in Aug and still had to call for support to hook up. At 1st they wanted $30 to help. But after he asked his boss he got permission to help me with no charge??? Beware!!But once I got to talk to Calvin Harris he got both cameras working. Great products.

Reviews.Title: Great Customer Support
Reviews.Author: G. Hinman
Reviews.Content: I unwrapped the camera out of the box, plugged it into the wall and router and then... hmm... I looked at several websites that have good advice on how to set the camera up using various configurations.  The multiple options for configurations started to concern me, particularly since I am still learning how to pronounce the word "router" (rooter, right?).  I have an apple time capsule that I use for wireless internet access and I wanted to get the camera so it would work through the time capsule so I could move it around the house depending on where my beautiful offspring might spend her naps.  I could have spent hours trying to figure it out but instead I called customer support.  Sean at Foscam walked me through it and even went as far as setting it up remotely.  Everything seems to be working great.  I haven't used it much yet but the customer support was stellar.  Sean then remotely controlled my screen to go to this amazon review page - Now in the course of 30 minutes, he's helped me do one thing that would have taken me hours and another thing that I would have probably never gotten around to.  Thanks again, Foscam!

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI8910W:  It's okay, but it has issues.
Reviews.Author: K. M. Cowan "mrmovie"
Reviews.Content: In all fairness, I've only had this camera running for a few hours.  My impressions thus far:  - The picture is decent quality, though not excellent.  - I got the IR ON/OFF to work by hacking the app.  The javascript written for the UI is not cross-browser compliant.  - The software that installs on PC or Mac could really use a decent UI.  What is offered is pretty rough.  - The JPEG files generated by the camera do NOT play well with the PHP GD library.  I'm unable to generate thumbnail images on the fly because GD complains that the image is not a valid JPEG.  -  There really ought to be an API that would allow you to write your own applications for the camera.  There's already an unexposed API to some degree, but an exposed and published on would be cool.  - Like many other reviewers here, I find the casing light.  I have this camera outside, although it's under the roof of one of my outbuildings.  We'll see how it holds up.  - Alerts should allow for more granular control.  - Wireless works, but the wireless scan didn't pick up the LAN.  Further, wireless should support more security protocols.  - The default alert sensitivity of '10' will almost never be suitable.  I found '7' to be a more reasonable setting.  - Overall, not a bad camera for the price, but it's certainly not the finest piece of equipment.

Reviews.Title: Great camera with great support
Reviews.Author: apd1417
Reviews.Content: I've had this camera for about 8 months now.  It was a great price and does everything that I expected.  Works great on my android phone if you use IP Cam Viewer App.  I had a little trouble setting it up to work remotely, but after calling Foscam, they were able to fix the problem for me with no questions asked.  Don't waste your time trying to do network stuff if you don't have any previous hands on experience with it.  After spending countless hours thinking that I could figure it out myself, I finally had to call Foscam for assistance.  They fixed it, remotely, in a few minutes.  Wished I would have called them sooner and saved tons of time.  I had to call them a second time when I added a Sprint AirRave to my network.  For some reason, this device blocked my camera, again, from being viewed remotely.  I called Foscam again, spoke to an employee named Sean, and he, again, fixed the problem in only a few minutes.  Although the device is had to set up if you don't have networking knowledge, I am very impressed at the support by Foscam.  Good product, Good Support.  I recommend it.

Reviews.Title: Works very well, audio could be better
Reviews.Author: The real Amazon fan
Reviews.Content: Works great to monitor my garage (with expensive tools inside) when I need to step out for a minute without shutting the garage door.  I use the IP Camera Viewer app available for droid.Was very easy to setup and go.. probably only took 10-15min tops to setup.The image is clear, pan/tilt work smoothly, and nightvision image is also very clear.  It is great to check in remotely at night time.I like this product.  If there was one thing to improve, it is the audio.  When I activate speaker mode from the smartphone, the audio crackles continuously and sounds like crap.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Support
Reviews.Author: Gregory Leytes
Reviews.Content: Calvin Harris was great with his support. It was easy to set up the camera within 20 minutes. It was to the point and will buy another camera. I like that it tilts and pans.

Reviews.Title: This the best IP Camera yet!
Reviews.Author: cyber
Reviews.Content: I have 4 of these newer Foscams. They are fantastic.  Great color, great video. Setup is the same as with any IP Camera. No big deal if you can portfoward your router...YouTube has videos.....it's not hard.  Setting up the DYNDNS or NO-IP account is simple too. Piece of cake.  I just ordered  two more  for my office....now I can watch my Horses in the barn, my dog in the house, my boat in the garage, my Motorhome and my office...all from my iPhone and iPad, or Kindle Fire.Bought one for a Baby Shower gift too....Baby Cam is a good idea.

Reviews.Title: Great camera, ordered 2 more
Reviews.Author: Jason Kim
Reviews.Content: First, I am not a tech person.  I have average understanding of routers and firewalls and the such, but by reading the advice written here from other Amazon customers, I was able to get my camera up and running on our wireless network, and remotely accessible via my iPhone and computer, within an hour.  This camera is not a "plug and play" and requires a bit of tweaking, but it is relatively straight forward and I found more than plenty of information among the reviews here and on a Google search to help me.  If you know how to access your router on your home network, you should be able to set this camera up.The camera works great.  The screen resolution is pretty good.  We use this as a video monitor to see what our toddler is doing in his room after we put him down for the night.  The infrared on this camera is so good that it pretty much lights up his room, and the resolution is sufficient enough that we can see him breathing in near total darkness (camera is about 10 feet away from the bed in a 15x13 foot room.)  The ability to pan and tilt remotely is great. We're so happy with it that we're buying 2 more to use in the living room and as a security camera for the front door.It's odd that some of the commenters will give this camera a low rating just because they couldn't figure out how to set it up.  It's like proclaiming that a particular sports car is terrible just because they couldn't figure out how to use the stick shift.

Reviews.Title: Inexpensive bundle of technology but lacking intuitive setup
Reviews.Author: MikeJulieSTL "MikeJulieSTL"
Reviews.Content: First off let me say I really like my FOSCAM camera.  I am the owner of a Samsung security DVR system with 8 cameras and I have an HD webcam set up in the house to watch our puppy. Both of these systems have remote admin and viewing set up so I have lived the torture of seting up port fowarding, Wifi and firewall changes, powerline network adaptors and a slew of other technical hurdles the marketing people don't mention when you look at these things.  The FOSCAM wasn't the largest learning curve but it did provide a few WTH? moments.The FOSCAM .US website is pretty good with tutorials and the forums make up for some of the particulars of unique routers that the tutorials leave out.  I have AT&T; Uverse and it presents its own odd requirements when setting up port forwarding but I was able to find others that had already solved or at least asked the same questions.  You will need an open ethernet port to set this baby up, and you might be forced to change the Wifi security settings in order to get it to work wirelessly.  An above average understanding of networking will help (a lot) especially if you don't want to open up your wireless network completely.  One thing to mention here - the FOSCAM has a MAC address for its wired connection and another one for its wireless connection.  This alone caused me about an hour of head scratching before I found that nugget of information in the forums.The software the unit comes with does an adequate job and includes some advanced features for security such as motion detection, image capture, notification/alerts and FTP upload of stills.  If you want to see and manipulate the camera via your smart phone there are dozens of apps for both the iPhone and Android systems, even a couple free ones.  I use IPCam Viewer and have all my systems viewable from one app.  The camera has a pretty good speaker and microphone for two way communication but Ive found when using cell data the transmissions are garbled.  If Im within Wifi coverage you can make out about 75% of what is said - maybe 1 word out of 50 though with 3G cell data.Helpful hint for motion alerts: you can normally use an email address to text your phone, I have AT&T; and an iPhone so I would enter my 10 digit phone number followed by @ txt.att.net and when the system detects movement I will get a text message (not email) telling me so.The night characteristics of this camera are OUTSTANDING.  I'll upload a couple pictures with and without the IR illuminator to demonstrate.One big negative; the camera appears to freeze every so often.  Ive read from many people that it's a wifi issue with the camera itself.  It's a temporary thing, lasting maybe 3-5 seconds then the live picture comes back.  Ive begun to experiment with placement and changing wifi channels but so far nothing appears to fix it.  I might try an Apple Airport Express setup up and attach the FOSCAM to the Express via Cat5 just to see if the radio in the FOSCAM is the culprit.  If so the system might go back...  I don't want to use a $100 Apple device to fix a $95 wireless camera.I do recommend this camera.  Having purchased several other cams this is the only one that has so many desired features and a support community to help figure out your unique setup.  For under a $100 this thing is a good deal and gets the job done, just dont think you are getting a "plug and play" device when purchasing it.

Reviews.Title: awesome tech support
Reviews.Author: marvin
Reviews.Content: Calvin Harris helped and assisted in getting both cameras connected and asiste with the wireless hookup, even though it took additional time he was patient and knowledgable. The camera is clear, light and decor visible.

Reviews.Title: Nice Cam, here is the workaround if you have Vonage
Reviews.Author: Toology "Toology"
Reviews.Content: Okay, so I got the cam working pretty quickly on the local network but was racking my brains out on how to access it from the outside world.  You see Vonage VDV22-VD sits between your cable modem and my netgear router and blocks everything.  Here's the kicker, it's IP is 192.168.15.1 and my router's IP range is 192.168.1.2 - 192.168.1.254.1.  VDV22-VD only allows you to port forward in the 192.168.15.x range (I tried DMZ to the foscam IP in my router and that didn't work).  So here's what I did, I went to vonage admin page at 192.168.15.1 , user & pass are both 'router' , basic settings > local network setup in the vonage router and change the IP to from 192.168.15.1 to 192.168.1.2 (change the range from 3-254).  Now turn off everything and re-wire like this:Cable modem > Regular router > VDV22-VD, PC.  Fire everything up and it should work given the range in your router is set from .2-.254BTW the best app on android to manage foscam remotely is TinyCam IMO, haven't really looked at ios apps just yet.

Reviews.Title: Works great.  Installation is a bit of work, but do able.
Reviews.Author: Don1622
Reviews.Content: This Wireless camera works great and allows us to monitor our Condo at the Beach. Pictures are sharp enough at 640x480 and has full motion Video with sound. The basic Software in the Camera provides good functionality with remote access from any web Browser.  The Camera's internal Setup is menu driven and allows you to set the network connections, move the camera, turn on Auto-motion Detection, shoot 5 pictures and then upload them to your email automatically.I also purchased "Foscam Pro" for my iPhone for immediate accesswith full functionality. It looks great on my iPad with the larger screen.  We use the two-way audio to hear and announce something like: "Hello - This is the Security Office. Please identify yourself."  We get peace of mind with no monthly fees from a security company.The installation procedure is a bit complex as noted in other reviews. Fortunately the setup can be mastered by following the online guides. Three of them and each is pretty good. One Lesson for each of the major steps. First, you plug the Camera into your Network to run Setup.  Second, you add your wireless IP Address so you can unplug your network cable. Third, you setup the advanced features for email alerts, network settings, port forwarding, which are optional features.  Each of the 3 Segments has instructions on their US website.  They even did one better by posting separate Network install procedures for 10 of the top Routers making it easy for most computer novices to complete.  Plus, their Phone Support guys are great.  My call back time was about 30 minutes later.  They can easily help with any remote setup problems over the phone on their 1-800 number.Watch a good video introduction on YouTube from the AckwardHampster.Just search for: "Foscam 8910 Setup" or "AckwardHampster"Cheers and good luck mate.  Some of you may need it...  :-)

Reviews.Title: Works great
Reviews.Author: Travis
Reviews.Content: I just received this camera and it works great.  It took me 20 minutes to get it setup and connected to the wireless.  There are alot of negative reviews, most are because people do not know how to open up their household router/firewall to gain external access.  These complaints should not be directed toward this product as it is their firewall that is doing what it's supposed to do.  This is like not knowing how to drive and blaming a car manufacturer.  The instructions do include how to configure port forwarding in your firewall, however, there are hundreds of different router/firewall devices out there.  A 10 page "quick install" manual cannot possibly cover every scenario.  If you're looking on gaining access to your camera from the internet, learn how to do it or get some assistance on how to do it.

Reviews.Title: Great Feature Set, but NOT SECURE for Remote Viewing
Reviews.Author: Dave "yrls2"
Reviews.Content: Great set of features, but don't recommend using this as a security camera. Remote viewing requires a web client to access the camera from over the Internet over HTTP (no SSL / TLS or HTTPS option is available). This means the username and password used to authenticate over the web with the camera are clearly visible and any images sent from the camera can be snooped. Someone able to intercept these would also have access to the camera, able to control it or configure it if admin account. Wifi password is in the clear in admin account so this could be breached. Any images you access remotely over the Internet could be snooped ... could be a privacy issue depending on what you have your camera pointed at (or what some intruder points the camera at). DynDNS ([....]) service is required if you have a dynamic IP, and is not free, but costs $20 per year.

My husband said the set up was easy, but he works in IT, so it is probably unfair to say it would be easy to anyone, but from the other reviews, everyone says customer support is great! Reviews.Content: I could not set up the camera on my own. I called Tech support, and Harry with Tech Support took EXCELLENT care of me. He logged into my PC and set up EVERYTHING for me!!!! He even set up my iPad so I could view the camera remotely. The camera works great, and the tech support was even better!!!!!  A++++++++++++++

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Todd D'Aiuto
Reviews.Content: Issue: Set the camera.Feedback about the camera;Feedback about the service:RickyDon't try to do this yourself unless your very Tech savvy.  Called Foscam customer support.  They took control of my Mac and set up all three cameras for me.  Wow, have never had such a good tech support experience.  Set everything up for internet viewing.  Explained how the software and iPad software worked.  Did it all flawlessly.  Thank you Ricky!!!

Reviews.Title: Ipcamera
Reviews.Author: toby
Reviews.Content: Issue: Was having trouble in setting the alarm to detect motion and send pictures to my mail. It was set up for me and it is working great.Sandra great service issue resolved.love camera works great

Reviews.Content: excellent service.quality, I have been issues with the remote access and put it into the DMZ and it is working. Calvin Harris  had provided excellent service,,,,, I can recommend the camera for its wirelles

Reviews.Title: very easy
Reviews.Author: spook835
Reviews.Content: Sean, did a great job in helping me setup my wireless camera. Very easy to talk to and get a hold of.

Reviews.Title: IP CAMERA
Reviews.Author: MARCELO
Reviews.Content: ISSUE: I WAS HAVING TROUBLE SETTING UP THE CAMERA. THE ACTIVE X WAS THE MAIN PROBLEM. THE TECHNICIAN HELPED ME TO RESOLVE THAT PROBLEM. AND ALSO MADE THE PORT FORWARDING FOR THE CAMERA. AND NOW I CAN VIEW THE CAMERA PERFECTLY.SANDRA WAS GREAT! VERY NICE & HELPFUL...THANK YOU SANDRA :)

Reviews.Title: Ip camera

Reviews.Title: Support was 5star!!!!

Reviews.Content: Foscam was not connecting remotely.Contacted support, and Ralph Mendez fixed within a couple minutes.He did great!I am 100% satisfied and would recommend to ALL!Thanks

Reviews.Title: it was nice help
Reviews.Author: Laszlo
Reviews.Content: camera nice to use with the wireless option. great picture!Calvin Harris tech guy helped me to install. he was using software to control my camera! I recommend the camera for night vision.

Reviews.Title: very good and very helpful
Reviews.Author: D. Hamilton
Reviews.Content: I was having trouble viewing both cameras from a remote location's . Ralph Mendez was very helpful in correcting this problem and the issue was resolved. I am very happy with this product and have now purchased 9 cameras total. I would recommend this product to anyone wishing to purchase a IP wireless camera.

Reviews.Title: Assist on setting up CAMERA
Reviews.Author: Beng
Reviews.Content: Anzen was very helpful, very clear on instructions, and friendly. definitely going to buy another foscam camera great service!THUMBPS UP!!!

Reviews.Title: awsome tech help!!
Reviews.Author: Alana Dunham
Reviews.Content: I had trouble installing the program on a windows based computer. I payed for the remote installation and emailed the tech support with my phone number and they called me back in a timely manner. The women on the phone was very helpful and professional and fixed my problem. She also asked if I needed anymore instruction on using the camera. I havent yet really used the camera but the picture looks pretty clear. I would buy more of this product.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech Support
Reviews.Author: Patrick R Greeley
Reviews.Content: Active X problem.Harry Foster did a great job getting my camera running and setting up wireless and testing the camera. He also setup port forwarding and tested it and helped me setup my iphone.I am very pleased with Harry's help.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Michael Dunn
Reviews.Content: Issue: Port Forwarding.Feedback about the camera:The FI8910W is an excellent camera. The picture is very clear and controlling it from my iphone is very simple. So far the only negative I have is the 2-way audio I can hear on my phone very well, but talking back is very faint and hard to hear, but overall I would highly recommend this camera.Feedback about the service:Ricky set up port forwarding for me and was very professional and helpful in doing this for me. Again I would highly recommend this camera to everyone.UpdateI spoke to their technical support Sandra, she had the most patience of any tech support I've ever dealt with. I was having computer issues and she stuck it out with me until my cameras were operating correctly. The 2-way audio is now operating great I'm able to be heard from the cameras. I would highly recommend these cameras if yoin the market for not too expensive but very good cameras.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Camera
Reviews.Author: Jkb
Reviews.Content: Issue:Set the camera wireless.Feedback about the camera:  I was in the market for a video camera/monitor for our newborn twins.  Tried several baby monitors (including Summer Infant and Motorola) with very poor image quality especially at night.  The range on the monitor are grossly overstated as well:  "up to 500 feet means 30 feet if there are any walls nearby".  Next I tried the Samsung Smartcam - what a disaster!!  Samsung may eventually work out there kinks; however, there was virtually no customer support - "I'm not that familiar with this product...." - seriously?!!  Took this back and purchased the Foscam.  Has all the features that I was looking for - pan, tilt, night vision with 2 ways audio at nearly half the cost.  Set up looked tricky however, Foscam's support is fantastic and included if you puchase from Foscam or Amazon.  I  just called them and the technician expertly installed the program and camera -  it works great!!Feedback about the service: RickyRicky was extremely friendly and obviously expertly trained.  Had everything installed and functional  within 10 minutes.  This type of support is a huge advantage for buying this camera!!!

Reviews.Title: Miracle Worker
Reviews.Author: lunardust
Reviews.Content: To Management,Anzen Dcruz was most gracious and helpful.  I cannot express my appreciation enough for what he did in helping me configure my newly installed FI8905W camera.  Not only did he get it to finally connect to my network but configured Dual Port Forwarding (both router and modem) so I can access the camera from anywhere in the world.  That was so cool.  He's an asset and a real plus for the company.  I can't thank him enough for getting me through what I would call a near breakdown.Best Regards,Richard

Reviews.Title: baby camera use
Reviews.Author: liz burckardt
Reviews.Content: Sandra has helped me navagate to set this up on my home computer as well as my smart phone. This camera is easy to use and great for a baby monitor. THe customer support is GREAT!

Reviews.Title: Foscam tech support is excellent!
Reviews.Author: S. Doran
Reviews.Content: I had trouble setting up cameras on my own.  Harry Foster gave me great assistance, and I can now view my cameras from anywhere including my iphone.  Highly reccommend these cameras.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI89180W
Reviews.Author: Tracy Nguyen
Reviews.Content: Great camera and great service.Love the wireless and able to access via phone and other wireless device. Calvin Harris is very professional and helpful.  I can recommend this camera for baby monitoring

Reviews.Title: The foscam support was A+

Reviews.Title: Foscam Model: FI8918W
Reviews.Author: Matthew R. Wall
Reviews.Content: My questions were resolved when I spoke with a customer service representative (Eva Jane) I was sooooo happy to my three camera's fixed! There was an issue with the wireless connection. I can now view my camera's from my home and now I can view them with my iPad and iPhone. I really like the product. The model number is: FI8918W. These things look great when viewing from the internet.

Reviews.Title: Great Camera and Great Service
Reviews.Author: mommylove "dc"
Reviews.Content: Overall Foscam seems to be a great investment for me because it negates the need for multiples cameras for me as I can use it in the day time to watch my nanny and in the night to watch my kids sleep in two different rooms with my wireless connection. Great Support.Very patiently resolved all my queries in installation on my computer and also on my IPod.but i can't view from a remote publicb location like a library even with my own computer....foscam could not help me out here...so its now useless to me.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Ip Camera
Reviews.Author: James
Reviews.Content: Issue: I had problem with the port forwarding. It was set up corectly by the technical support and now the camera is working remotely.Sandra was excellent. She took care of the problem without hesitation. I would love to get help from her again. The camera works better than expected. I am planning on purchasing more in the future.I had more trouble connecting remotely.I called Foscam back and spoke with Sean. He helped greatly setting the system up. It is working correctly now. I still love this camera for a security camera and plan on purchasing more in the future.

Reviews.Title: Product Support
Reviews.Author: zackley616 "Bryan"
Reviews.Content: I was unable to connect remotely and called tech support. Their phone tech support is fantastic! Ralph was great and professional at helping me get the camera online! This camera is awesome, i recommended this camera to anyone who is looking for a quality product with fantastic tech support!

Reviews.Title: Foscam support
Reviews.Author: Orrin D. Towner
Reviews.Content: Unable to program port fordwarding.  Harry Foster, tech, was extremely helpful.  Very satisfied with foscam tech support.Love the camera.  Works better tthan I had hoped for.

Reviews.Title: Foscam camera
Reviews.Author: Jim Dollison
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed having the rep. explain everything to us. That made the setup much eaiser. The camera works great. We now feel safe knowing that we have security cameras in our home.Calvin Harris as extremely knowledgeable in helping us set things up. He was pleasent and patient in dealind with. We appreciate the service from the Foscam representatives.

Reviews.Title: Foscam FI9805W wireless camera - Technical Support was good once I got through via telephone
Reviews.Author: Sailesh
Reviews.Content: I have contacted Foscam for several issues regards FI9805W wireless camera, when I first purchased the camera I couldn't get the wireless to work, after several emails and many failed attempts to contact Foscam I ended having to use the camera via a LAN cable, as Foscam were unable to resolve the problem.More recently, the camera stopped working all together. I emailed the technical team several times with the issue. I found that respond from the technical team was very slow, Foscam took on average 2 weeks respond back each time I emailed them. Foscam do NOT have a UK technical support, and therefore I had to call the US for any support (rather expensive), when I did call the US I kept getting the message 'you are in the queue', and kept me hanging on for ages. Today (11/07/2012) I got through to the Technical team in the US via telephone and spoke to Ralph Mendez, the technical support agent, who was very good and has now got my camera working via wireless. So in summary, for technical support when I got through to Foscam the service is very good, however via email it is very poor.In terms of the camera, one of the downfall I see is that the viewing angle is very narrow and secondly, on a sunny day the images come out white, because of the infra red.

Reviews.Title: Ip camera
Reviews.Author: Eddie Molina
Reviews.Content: Issue: I was having trouble in doing the port forwarding for my camera. The technicain helped me to do the port forwarding and the camera is working perfectly on my I phone also.Sandra was great. The support was quick and great!Thank you

Reviews.Title: Great service
Reviews.Author: Houston Camera Guy
Reviews.Content: Had trouble setting up the port forwarding so I can use this camera remotely. Called Foscam support and talked to Sandra who fixed everything within 5 minutes. Working great!

Reviews.Title: Works from the other side of the world!
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: This camera works well and projects a good picture during both light and darkness.  While the advertised sound feature is overcome by a background buzzing sound, I bought this for video with audio as an afterthought and it does what I got it to do.  Remote control is good via the web interface and if you know what you're doing you can use this camera remotely over the internet.  It isn't easy and will require some time to make it work... this is NOT plug and play... but if you're looking for an excellent and relatively inexpensive web-based camera this is the one to buy.

Reviews.Title: Best customer service
Reviews.Author: Amazon Customer
Reviews.Content: I very happy with my 1st Foscam FI8910W camera that help me monitor my house while I am gone. So I purchased the second the same one. I had problem with installing 2nd camera, so I emailed Foscam tech support. The next day,a tech support named Anzen called me and offer his help to install the camera for me, but I told him to call me back next day. The next day he called me the exact time as he promised. Then he just installed the whole thing and set up internet remote with in 20 minutes. I am amazed his work and his professionalism. Thanks.

Reviews.Title: Help installing Foscam wireless cameras
Reviews.Author: bets
Reviews.Content: I just purchased a number of these cameras and could not install them with the directions that came with them since my system is complicated.  Anzen, the tech who guided me through the process was outstanding, very knowledgeable, and patient since it took almost 2 hours to get the cameras up and working.  They are very clear and work well so far.  I am very pleased with the customer service as well as the cameras.

Reviews.Title: Foscam Review
Reviews.Author: redbrooks
Reviews.Content: Like the ability to remotely access the house.  The help desk was great in helping us set this up! Calvin Harris was very patient with us!!!!!

Reviews.Title: Ip Camera
Reviews.Author: kevin
Reviews.Content: Issue: To set the camera. Made the camera wireless. Done the port forwarding. The camera is working perfectly.Sandra was wonderful and very quick. My friend recommended the product to me and i like it.Thank you

Reviews.Title: Foscam Tech Support
Reviews.Author: rrs517
Reviews.Content: Problem with getting camera working on wireless mode. Spoke with harry Foster at Foscam Tech support and within 20 min he had me up and running fully including on my smartcam (Android). Awesome video quality! and tech support!

Reviews.Title: tech review
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: I was unable to connect my camera and Foscam tech Harry Foster was very helpful in getting my camera online.  Great service!!!  He even helped me configure camera to view away from home on PC or on my iPhone.

Reviews.Title: Foscam support
Reviews.Author: kim
Reviews.Content: I was not able to set up the cameras,so I call and spoke with Harry Foster he was  a real very helpful person and patient, he helped me to set up the camera wireless and also helped to view the camera in i phone for me . i have two foscam cameras and i love them .

ProductInfo.Features:
Building on the success of the Foscam FI8918W, the FI8910W is the latest camera from Foscam Digital Technologies LLC.It features high quality video & audio, pan/tilt, remote internet viewing, motion detection, night-vision, embedded IR-Cut filter, built in network video recording system as well as free telephone technical support available from Foscam Digital Technologies LLC.
The distinguishing features of the FI8910W are the embedded IR-Cut off filter, upgraded external housing, wider horizontal panning range and 2 year Warranty.
The IR-cut filter provides true & accurately images fixing the problems related to washed out and discolored images. In addition, the cut off filter also allows the camera to properly automatically adjust to changing lighting conditions so the user does not manually have to do this.
Also includes, two-way audio monitoring, remote pan/tilt control (pan:300° & tilt:120°), freely control IR-LED on/off for night vision (up to 8 meters)
Remote viewing via local network or internet, record from anywhere anytime, motion detection alert via email or upload image to FTP, Blue Iris compatible; Supports all standard browsers, Iphone, Ipad, Ipod, Android & BlackBerry, Wi-Fi compliant (IEEE 802.11b/g), supports WEP & WPA WPA2 Encryption
ProductInfo.Name: Foscam FI8910W Pan & Tilt IP/Network Camera with Two-Way Audio and Night Vision (White)
